description:
This review is for a recent office lunch delivery of 2 Indian pizzas. Yeah, you heard me right! I was skeptical at first, but my SF colleague convinced us to have the order placed, with her glowing endorsement. 

I don't know the cost. I do know that everyone in the room devoured that pizza as if we we had been fasting for 3 days. Or sleep-deprived and hopped up on espresso, somehow trudging through my meeting with relatively good cheer. 

The crust was more like a naan bread, neither thick nor thin, and nicely complementary to the delish bits of tandoori chicken, cauliflower, and a cheese that went surprisingly well with it all!! I dipped my pizza into the provided tamarind sauce. There was also a thicker raita-looking sauce, but I didn't have a chance to try that one. 

I want to get this pizza again!! What a delightful true winner of the fusion games!

Better than bargain-basement average pizza joints, kind of boutique, yet not too 'precious', either.

 Oooohhh, my mouth was not on fire. {Sing to the tune of that KOL song.} I'm sure you could specify your heat level.
author: Chanda M.

description:
Do not order from them. They steal your credit card number is a shady website in India. They do not deliver on time--and they never pick up the phone.

Thieves. The department of labor should revoke their business license. Shut Zante's down.
author: Alex F.

description:
If you want to try a different kind of Pizza try Zante it's Pizza with an Indian flavor so it will be familiar to your taste buds just in another form.   

Fusion Pizza/Indian.   We ordered this once and we keep ordering it because there isn't anything like this that I know of.  So if you want to try something new.  Try this and then hopefully you'll be like us and be a regular.  

We always get the Pizza with Paneer and the pizza with Masala sauce enjoy.
author: Homer S.

description:
We got a small indian pizza.. I forget which one. We just asked the waiter to recommend one. 

We also got a lamb curry and a side of rice.

The curry came out pretty quick, but the pizza took awhile. Everything was really delicious, and the service was good.

Would definitely come back here again.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Bestest pizza in town. 
I simply love their pizzas.
You have it once and you'll never forget the taste ever.
author: Vani J.

description: They stole from me! I placed an order Saturday 11/3 @ 5 p.m. and called to cancel my order 1 1/2 hours later. Someone comes minutes after I call and cancel my order and they claim "free of charge". Today, 11/6 I see they stole almost $40 from me from the "free meal" they gave me for waiting so long. Do not buy from here unless you want your money taken from you!!!!
author: Denise R.

description: The pizza here is the bomb! You won't regret it. We ordered other foods which were A-OK, hence the 4 stars. I'd come back here again.
author: Esther D.

description: First time trying Indian pizza and I'm absolutely in love!! We ordered a delivery of a large half vegan-half vegetarian pizza and I could not get enough. Delivery was  quick, pizza was exactly as ordered, ingredients tasted delicious and fresh, presentation was mouth watering, and our pizza was perfectly hot and ready when delivered. The crust was so unique, soft, and yummy! Perfect night to stay in for movies and pizza after a weekend of camping. This place is definitely one of my new favorites in San Francisco!!! I don't think I'll ever go back to regular pizza again!!
author: Anna A.

description: This is one of my *favorite* pizza places. Indian flavored pizza may not be the first thing that comes to mind when you think of great pizza but this place is. The chicken tikka masala pizza is absolutely amazing and i highly recommend as it's their classic. There's a nice vibe inside the restaurant or fun as takeout as well.
author: Drew F.

description:
It was sure was yummy going in - another story on the way out.

Ordered on the Yelp app via Eat24/Grubhub; with expectations of 60-75 minute delivery time and was way over the expected time, it was closer to 100 minutes.

After calling Zante's for a status update on delivery; I received the answer "soon" when I checked after the 75 minute mark.

Finally the food arrives and it was super delicious. CTM pizza paired with Indian meat pizza; my buds and I went to town on the cilantro lime (green) sauce. The crust was like Naan and made for great use of the sauce.

Overall the pizzas were plenty tasteful; only complaint we have is the lag time on delivery and the various toilet bowl sessions we had the day after. Fire indeed!
author: Sam K.

description:
This place gets five stars for food but loses three for bad service. If you order delivery the pizza will take up to two hours to get to you. If you call, they are very short and rude with you -- and that's IF they understand you and you understand them. They show no interest in reassuring customers or show any regret for bad service. Good food can't make up for bad service forever. 

They need to stop being cheapskates and partner with a professional food delivery service that will deliver the food at a decent time. Their current method is just unacceptable.
author: Sunny S.

description: I love their vegan Indian pizza !!! I order it for delivery very frequently.
author: Nina M.

description: I just order two large chicken tiki Masala , there's no chicken and no masala sauce to dip I asked for wxtra and the guy said yeah yeah inside.  I work down the street and got this for my employee #epicfail not worth my time to walk back up and bitch at them
author: Tim C.

description:
They advertise as the Best Indian Pizza with Chicken Tikka Masala Sauce.

Gotta say it is the only Indian pizza I've had so perhaps it is the best albeit not the best pizza I've had to date. The bread was very doughy and not enough filling. I drenched it in their hot sauce and that saved it. Their green hot sauce is the bomb diggity. 

Mango lassi was a tad too sweet and it was lukewarm by the time we got it (despite me asking for it to be extra icy). 

Pizza was OK the next day too but I was super hungry.
author: Carmen P.

description:
This lovely place is located in Bernal Heights. A few friends and I decided to try some place new and heard good things of Zante's so we decided to make the drive down. It's on a busy street, but there is plenty of neighborhood parking if you're okay doing a few minutes of walking. 

The people who work at the restaurant are kind and helpful. There is pizza ready to go for those who want a quick grab, and on the other side of the restaurant are seated areas. We decided to go for the Indian style pizza since that seems to be the thing here. We did extra large pizza for 5 of us, and it was the perfect amount. And ordered half chicken masala sauce and the other half paneer masala. To be honest, it seemed like just an ordinary pizza, and couldn't differentiate much of the Indian flavor on the pizza. And there wasn't enough chicken and paneer on either half of the pizza. But the bread on the pizza was delicious! 

Cost was very affordable for the 5 of us..only $8 each (for the extra-large pizza)! Overall, I would suggest it for a one time try, but if you're a pizza snob, would probably be best to get your pizza fix elsewhere.
author: Jackie C.

description: After having a fun filled day in golden gate Park and my BF remembered seeing this Indian pizza place on a show so we looked it up and headed there. They were super welcoming and service was quick. I have to say the tikka masala pizza was sooo good. I was satisfied all around
author: Jessica G.

description:
Zante! I order from this place frequently when we have friends visiting from out of town because Indian Pizza is a pretty unique experience! Staff is super friendly and welcoming when you choose to eat in. Its a pretty aged dining room that's not fancy in any way, but the pizza is AWESOME. I'd have to say the Chicken Tikka Masala pizza is my favorite, accompanied by the garlic & chili cheese naans. If you live in SF, but haven't tried this place, you're missing out!

Note: We had some trouble with timing on deliveries from these guys in the past. They get busy and don't accurately estimate their delivery times, so skip the hassle and just eat in or pick it up. We haven't had an issue since.
author: Michael M.

description: I ordered online for a pizza and wanted it delivered later in the night @ 9pm. 9pm comes and goes and there is no pizza. I call zantes and they tell me the driver will be there in 5 mins. 5 mins come and go and no one is there. I call again and they tell me 5 more minutes and at that point I don't even want the food. The driver finally shows up at 10.30pm and gives me the pizza. I don't feel obligated to tip because of the poor service I have received YET he won't let me go into my building without forcing me to tip. I'm sorry- when did this become mandatory? Tipping is for good - excellent service which this experience was not. The pizza was cold and sub-par. A waste of my money and time.
author: Harini M.

description: Finally tried it after years of curiosity. Thought it was just pizza but there is a full Indian menu as well! We got Sami, malai kofta (my favorite) and gulab jaman as well as the tikka masala pizza. Though I would modify the pizza slightly to have no cauliflower and add garlic, it was well made and fresh. I really enjoyed the other dishes as well and would order from them again.
author: Disco B.

description:
Z . zante zana zquash zanana
A . a weekend evening
N . nomz on delivery
T . they mix italy & india
E . euro / eurasian fusion

I . ixnay on the eggiesvay
N . normal "best indian pizza"
D . dat chicken lamb shrimp doe
I . i put red sauce is sweet
A . and green sauce is spicy
N . no duh use both of them

P . puffy dough and crust
I . ingredients bright colors
Z . zimba it's to zieee for
Z . zakuna zatata zuthazuckas
A . again i'll order next time
author: Dan B.

description: I've only ever tried their Indian pizzas and they're such a treat!! The chicken on the pizza is pretty dry so I actually like the paneer version of the pizza more. It's basically delicious tikka masala sauce on a giant naan with sprinkles of roasted veggies. The pizzas are pretty pricey, with the XL (18") going for $30 but it does feed my husband and I for a few days.
author: Alice W.

description:
Very slow and rude service. I would not order here again. 
They were really rude when I called and asked, why it's taking so long for or pizza and the guy who picked up said I can either cancel or wait longer. They told us 40 minutes and it took more than 1.5 hours. 
We live 1.2 miles away. 
Bad service
author: Sbeen A.

description:
I know of 2 Indian pizza joint in the Bay Area. Between golden gate indian and Zante, I definitely prefer the former better. Reason being:

Pizza: we tried tikka masala pizza and everything Indian pizza. The dough is way too spongy and thick. Instead of a crispy crust, it was more like really thick soft naan. The ingredients are abundant and fresh, but without a crust, can you really call it pizza?
Other Indian dishes: baigain bhartha, malai kofta, and aloo Gobi: the spice and flavor is strong(its Indian food after all) but flatter(one note?) than what I usually prefer. I got big chunks of ginger that wasn't properly zested or chopped. 
Nan: too thick and spongy.
author: Tata X.

description:
I really really wanted to like this place, but alas, was a little disappointed.

I ordered delivery on a Sunday night at 8pm. (According to their website, delivery is free!) The online ordering system seemed disorganized and I did not receive a confirmation call like they said I would. But luckily, my order still made it through no problem. 

After calling the restaurant two more times to check in on the status of my order, I finally received the delivery to my place in SoMa 1.5 hours later. I got a large pizza with chicken masala sauce (~$30). It tasted ok, but left something to be desired. Pretty sad, because Indian food in pizza form has so much potential!
author: Alice S.

description:
Do you love pizza? Do you love Indian food? Then, eat here. Order from here.

I have ordered many Indian pizzas from this place for hangover days or TREAT YOSELF days. These pizzas aren't cheap! But they are damn good.

I usually go for the chicken masala pizza. Ugh, I'm going to drool as I type this. I moved back to Miami & I'm now bummed I can no longer eat Indian pizza :(

I will eat here again next time I'm in the Bay!

Oh, I've only ordered for delivery. I have no idea what the actual establishment is like, sorry!
author: Sandra N.

description: So I ordered a ''vegan pizza' to find out it not only has chicken but also has dairy cheese. When talking to these people they clearly had no idea what 'vegan' even is. So these assholes are selling 'vegan' pizzas with meat and dairy. Talk about scum. Lucky for them I'm not allergic to meat or chicken or I would be suing these bastards. Stay away from this dump these people clearly have no morals at all do not care about your health or safety, strictly in it for a quick buck.
author: David C.

description: Ordered a chicken tikka masala pizza, came on time and super delicious. The crust isn't like a normal pizza -- it's naan like and more fluffy! It goes really well with the masala sauce, cheese and toppings. Super great fusion experience in my mouth :)
author: Hana S.

description:
Zante had been on my list for a while though it wasn't the most highly rated restaurant. The idea, was unique, and I was tempted to give it a try. Didn't quite meet up to expectations though and I think it could have been better. For $30 we got the XL large paneer pizza. It promised eggplant on the menu but ... I didn't taste it at all. I think the sauce was pretty lacking and flavor-less and the paneer chunks were not substantial. 

The crust is very, very bready and dough-y in quality, so very filling. Is it a masterful pizza crust? Probably not, but it wasn't terrible either. 

It comes with tamarind and mint chutney, which was nice but I think I craved it because the pizza overall was sort of... meh. 

It's a really dimly lit spot, didn't feel that clean to be honest, and there was only one waiter running around. Efficient service but could be better.
author: Cindy W.

description: one of my most cherished and absolutely favorite places in SF. Paneer Tikka Masala Pizza is the best pizza i've ever eaten in my life. the men eho work here are super friendly and please be sure to pay in Cash Tips $$$ very hard working and beautiful lovely people. ... i miss living only a bus ride away Thank U For Everyhthinf Good You Gave In My Life Zante.. Will Cherish Foreverand Never Forget You
author: Sophie Z.

description:
Their pizza is pretty decent, the Masala chicken pizza was a little dry and could use more chutney! Their paneer masala pizza was pretty good although it could be spicier.

Customer service is a little rude and so you do need to deal with that but oh well
author: Shriya B.

description:
Their food is good, I can't lie about that. However, after my last experience with them through delivery, my opinions have changed.

We ordered in advance because their restaurant opens at 5:00 PM and my family desperately wanted their pizza. The order was confirmed to come at 5:00 PM, but it came at 5:45. I also left some instructions for them (extra sauces, onions on one side, etc). However, I ended up with no onions and no extra sauces. They said we never stated anything in our order about the sauces and said we weren't going to get any. We checked after receiving our food and it clearly says in the special instructions that we wanted extra sauce.

On top of that, they tried to make us pay again in cash. They stated that we never paid so we had to bring our laptop outside to show them. The delivery man called his manager, confirmed, and apologized. 

I've ordered many times from them through Eat24 so I am extremely upset that I had an experience like this. Usually they're great, but this time was just horrible. Perhaps eating in the actual restaurant would be better than ordering from them online, but I'll probably never come back.
author: Hannah C.

description: The chicken tikka masala pizza is truly a unique and wonderful item. I've traveled all over and have never had one as wonderful. The downside is the large is $30 so it's pricy. Also, the person who takes the orders is very short with you on the phone and does come off as rude. I'm not sure if it's a lost in translation moment but it's annoying how annoyed he seems. Also expect your order to get to you 15-20 minutes later than they say it will. I've ordered delivery from them 15-20 times. Great pizza.
author: Justin M.

description:
The best pizza in
San francisco hands down. Really good indian food as well, their chicken korma is unreal. But worth getting at least an extra large cheese, because less wont be enough.
author: Simon R.

description:
Ok - I love this place for a few reasons:

1. It has been around for something like 30 years by the same set of owners. In SF I feel like that deserves some R E S P E C T. Support more businesses like this, peeps!
2. The food is incredible and the ingredients are extraordinarily fresh. I watched the dough being hand formed and spiced to perfection one evening and it was nice to see the process.
3. Indian.Pizza. Hello holy grail of food.

Go here, don't expect some absurd hipster-y establishment, and enjoy your Indian pizza, y'all.
author: Sonia M.

description:
I ordered several entries, spinach naan and several of the sauces. They were really good. I had the food delivered and it came in about 20 minutes.
I had a pizza from somewhere else tonight and I wish I had called Zante instead.
author: Barbara T.

description: I finally got my pizza after about 2 hours since I placed the order! I called a couple times, I would have at least expected the guy on the phone to apologize for the delay. I was instead told that the restaurant was busy. It was 10:40pm, on a Sunday night with 20 minutes left before the restaurant closed, I don't believe the delay is because of a busy night! We like the taste of the pizza which is why we go back to the restaurant but you could be honest, just accept that you missed the order and will get it to me as soon as possible.
author: Adarsh K.

description: Great flavors! Really satisfying! Just need  more sauce, baby. Best Indian Pizza was dry at 10:15 pm. Need more sauce. Great flavors and shows what a pizza can do - everything!!!
author: Giovani T.

description:
VEGAN BEWARE!!!!!!!  I AM BEYOND ANGRY.  I will be reporting them to the BBB.  

Here's the story: 1st time my brother ordered a pizza, he told me that it was vegan.  I've been vegan for a few years and vegetarian before that.  I took a piece and the cheese didn't seem right.  I've tried almost every vegan cheese out there, daiya, follow my heart, kite hill etc., this looked and tasted like regular cow's milk cheese.  I was suspicious but my brother assured me that he had ordered it vegan.  I HAD HEARTBURN FOR 2 DAYS, one of the many perks of being vegan and no longer consuming animal products that upset my body, is that i do not get heartburn anymore.  
  So today 5/27/2018 my brother decided to order from them again but a different pizza flavor once again VEGAN.  We get home and I'm like what is think stuff on the pizza?  It looks like ham or chicken.  We give a piece to our non vegan brother and he tries it and says it's chicken and that taste like regular cheese.
   Okay so there can be misunderstanding right but I called them up.  I told the man that answered that we ordered a vegan pizza and received a regular pizza w/chicken.  The conversation went as follows:

Zante worker: you don't want chicken?
Me: I ordered it VEGAN
Zante worker: so you don't want chicken??
Me: sir do you know what vegan means?
Zante worker: I'll make you another pizza no chicken, no problem.
Me: what is your vegan cheese made out of?
Zante worker: you don't want cheese?
Me: OMG.  You don't know what vegan is do you???  How can you sell food to people and say it's vegan and it's not!!
Zante worker: we make it vegan/vegetarian for you, no problem
Me: do you even know that there is a difference? Of course not because you don't know what vegan is.

It continued like that until I asked to be refunded and told him that I'm reporting them to the BBB.  He became agitated.  He kept telling me he would just make me another pizza.  Why the hell would I want anything from a dishonest buisness?  What if i was vegan because of a lactose allergy?  Or a allergy to chicken?? What then you'll make me another pizza that I can take w/me to the hospital?? 

I can't believe that people would have such a disgusting business practice. Shame on them!
author: Maggie C.

description:
Not sure what I expected but I like pizza and Indian food so why not. I ordered a small best Indian, which is like the works with all the toppings. It was delicious and timely. 

Tip: be sure to get the complimentary chutneys. The mint chutney gives a nice spicy kick and freshness. 

Con: expensive. A small, Indian pizza was 20 bucks. Bay shrimp also make me sad. Just let that topping go. 

Overall: great novelty. This is not a thin crust pie. I'm glad I tried it and I will be coming back.
author: William V.

description: I didn't get a chance to try their pizza, 1 star for poor logistics management, they stopped processing orders with doordash, but still have their store and menu listed on there, and you can place orders on it. I placed my order on doordash late afternoon, 1hr later I got a call from doordash saying they hadn't even processed the order when the payment went through. Wish they handled this better. Hungry and sad customer.
author: Nishanth A.

description:
I use yelp all the time, but I rarely write reviews anymore, but this delivery experience is making me write this one.  
I ordered at 7:30PM today, Sunday, on eat24 and estimate was 60 min to 75 min.  Nope, it took 2 hours and 10 minutes! I called, When the food arrived it was cold and the chicken tika had about 4 chunks of chicken, and the container it came in was open.  Honestly, it looks like someone ate half and left us the other half. I'm sure that's not what happened, but I do wonder where the other half of the meal is. So everything was cold, the naan, everything  . . . oh wait, not everything, the mango lassi was warm. To wait 2 hours for food, the food better be worth the wait and the cost, and it wasn't.
author: Theresa C.

description: Delicious veggie pizza and the staff was so nice and accommodating. They made it half no cheese for me and my friends, and the medium was enough to feed 3 pretty hungry people. Green sauce was my favorite, plum sauce was my friends'. Mix them together!!! We ordered takeout and it was ready in 20 minutes. To everybody complaining about tummy troubles, I'm not sure what you expected - know your range.
author: Molly R.

description:
First off: if you want to avoid the verbal disconnect -yes, the owner is not the nicest or patient- order online. Also, even if, like me, you live close by be prepared to wait 45 min to an hr for delivery.

That said, as a Vegan this place takes the cake for Vegan choices. The Vegan Indian Pizza and the Veggie Samosas are staples for me and I can guarantee that even non-Vegan or Vegetarians love both items, they're that good!

They don't provide receipts so if that's an issue all the more reason to order online for your records. Very professional yet casual business, but their food is amazing so it's worth it. Trust.
author: Kristina B.

description: Most delicious pizza I've had in a very Ling time! Tikka masala veg pizza + green hot sauce followed by a Taj!
author: Karakucha P.

description: Best desi pizza in town. Whenever I visit in this neighborhood I always feed my tummy here with their Desi pizza. No matter I visit by myself or with friends, this place is gr8. And moment becomes even wonderful when they play Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan saab songs. Love them. Always recommend to my friends
author: Lakshdeep S.

description: Fave Indian tikka masala pizza  the sauce and the tamarind is so good with it... my co workers enjoyed it and even the vegetarian pizza was so good
author: Monique Q.

description:
It's not delivery, its dissapointing.

Okay, so I placed an order in. Waited the estimated delivery time (30-45 minutes).  Called when it hit the hour mark. I heard hello come up, followed by my name. Then was immediately hung up on. Called from my work line to follow up, was told food would be there in 30 minutes. 40 minutes later, I get a call from the delivery guy from 6 blocks down asking where my delivery location was and if he should go back. I had to meet him across the street from outside my building. He almost did not give me a part of my order, asking if I ordered sauce ( I ordered a frozen item, came in a small bag, which at this point was liquid). Overall, not the best thing I've eaten and definitely not worth the wait and effort.
author: Marvin J.

description:
When Indian flavors and an American staple dish have a baby, you get Zante's Pizza! This is a pizza with distinct spices and ingredients of Indian cuisine that packs a punch in your mouth like no ordinary pizza. We dined in and ordered the a Small (8 slices) for $18.99 which was the perfect size for two people. Whether you choose tikka masala or paneer, drizzle the sweet tamarind sauce and a spicy green cilantro dressing on top of your pizza and you can't go wrong! 

The stand out show to me is the pizza dough which resembles tradition naan that you can order at any Indian restaurant. Some may complain that the pizza is too doughy. However, I would have to disagree. The pizza dough was downright delicious and I thought it was perfectly baked. 

If you enjoy the flavors of Indian cuisine and are looking to eat something different, I highly recommend giving Zante a try!
author: Briana H.

description: Unfortunately the same thing happened as my previous experience. Placed an order, was promised a delivery window, but almost 2 hours later there is still no food delivered.
author: Kathy T.

description: I was handed a menu but after a couple of friends also walked in a minute later, I was told its lunchtime and our order can't be taken.
author: Sarthak B.

description: The food is excellent, reasonably priced for the portion size, and the staff is friendly and accommodating. I found the multitude of ordering mechanisms (two websites, one backed by EatStreet and another by some whitelabel solution on another domain, and phone) confusing, frustrating, and full of misinformation if they worked at all. For instance, EatStreet provides delivery information for the restaurant, but at order time, delivery is never an option. But you can actually order through EatStreet and then call the restaurant to deliver that order. Sadly, each of my three orders from the restaurant were later than the delivery commitment time, even when I scheduled it several hours in advance, and the last time was over 45 minutes late. I will likely order again, but never when my schedule demands precision, and that's usually why I would order out instead of cooking myself in the first place.
author: Arthur Z.

description:
I love this pizza place & I've generally had good experiences, but I recently called in an order for pickup & I was told 15-20 minutes. When I showed up 20 minutes later it hadn't even been put in the oven yet. I was told another 15-20 minutes & after I returned & after another 20 minutes, I started walking back home, but as hungry as I was, I tried a slice to find the pizza way undercooked. I don't know why they screwed up so much, but, I'm
Officially annoyed & I will be taking my business elsewhere.
author: Andrew C.

description: If you are a fan of authentic Indian food and pizza. This place is great for both. They serve authentic savory North Indian food. They also have Indian style pizza as well as regular pizza styles. The Best Indian pizza and the Best Indian pizza with chicken masala sauce are the best. Good tandoori grill for appetizers with drinks. They have many other options.
author: Mike L.

description:
I don't think I can go back to normal pizza again!

To be honest, I was a bit hesitant to order delivery service from Zante due to other reviews. My pizza was delivered to me in an hour (which isn't terrible in my opinion-- I'd call 45 minutes in to check up on my order). It wasn't a problem personally because I was busy sipping on champagne and watching the Grammys.

Anyway, THE PIZZA. My friends and I ordered a large pizza, half chicken tiki masala and half paneer...... plz excuse me as I clean up my drool from my desk. Both were extremely tasty and I cannot recommend one more than the other, eat them both! I was worried about how the mozzarella cheese would taste with the indian flavors... it was great! The cheese wasn't overbearing and the hints of paneer and tiki masala shined through. The crust was naan... yes, i know! The pizza came with a green and red sauce. My favorite was the red.

I will be eating Zante's again in the near future!
author: Marcie A.

description:
First time trying Indian pizza and I was blown away!

You have to order the Chicken Tikka Masala pizza, it's amazing Indian food with an Italian twist! Tangy curry-like masala sauce as the base topped with cauliflower, eggplant, and tandoori chicken. It comes with two different sauces, sweet & spicy. So good!!!
author: Brandon B.

description:
Most exceeded expectation. 
Delivery was fast n driver very friendly.  
I ordered " The Best Indian Pizza With Chicken Masala Sauce ".
It came with two sauces. A green cilantro which was a terrific compliment.  As well as a sweet tamarind sauce. 
.
For me, the best part is the dough n crust. 
Not soggy, excellent chew. Great for dipping in the sauces provided.
Sauce n flavor is good amount. Not overpowering. I've had better chicken n Cheese on the pizza but still amazing. Definitely ate more than usual.
Two Thumbs up  !
Winner.
author: Pure M.

description: I love the Indian pizza and food but this review is for the delivery. I ordered at 4:33PM and it's now 6:07. When I call, it's always the same thing.... "It's on the way." Ridiculous.
author: Sandy L.

description: Absolutely ridiculous. I don't care how good the pizza may be but the service is TERRIBLE. Over two hours for a delivery and lying the entire time....
author: Sarah S.

description: Zante's Pizza has delivered lunch to my workplace several times in the past, so my colleagues and I have had a chance to try pretty much all their different pizza varieties and appetizers. My favorites are  the Indian-inspired pizzas: chicken tikka, tandoori, and vegetarian which come on a flavored naan/pizza-type dough and side of mint chutney.  Their other pizza specials are also pretty tasty and prices are reasonable.
author: Vinh T.

description:
Let me start by saying that I ordered a Indian pizza through door dash.  The pizza got to my door really quickly and I have no complaints what's so ever. The only thing I wish is that I was able to eat it right out of the oven, however, it was still warm when it got here.

Now let's talk about the chicken pizza I ordered, I got a medium Indian chicken pizza which came out to be to $22 plus tax, sure a bit steep for pizza but I must say it was delicious.  The chicken tandoori and everything else that was on there was exquisite, the dough tasted like naan and had fennel seeds in it. 

I've read a lot of reviews and it seems that people here are upset about the experience at the restaurant.  While I can't speak upon that, what I can say is that the pizza was great.  Keep in mind I never had Indian pizza before, definitely a great 1st time experience.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description: These people are incredibly rude. I had to call to order my pizza for delivery because their website is a piece of crap and doesn't work on any browser. When I called the man couldn't be bothered to say anything more than "Zante." I asked to order a pizza for delivery and his response was "hold." I held for at least five minutes and when he came back on I asked to order a pizza and he said "ok." I told him what I wanted and he asked for my address, I gave it and then he said "45min" and before I could even give him my credit card number he hung up. So then my husband called back because I was already so displeased with how rude they were and he was greeted in the same unpleasant way. He said why he was calling and had to hold yet again. Then he finally gave our credit card number. It came 1 hour and 20min after we called. So well off the mark for the time given.
author: jen m.

description:
Came here with my gf for a nice dinner date. The food is good, the service is the worst. I would not recommend this place to anyone ever.  

Do not come to this place ever.
author: Miguel A.

description:
Love that pizza 
Service ok but when you call to order they talk to you like ......
But by the way I love the pizza
author: Medi M.

description:
Zante's offers a funky, tasty take on Indian food with their killer Indian pizzas! I have had the best vegetarian Indian pizza and Daal Makhni numerous times. I LOVE their pizza as well as the sauces that come with it--I've never had a naan crust before and it's a game changer (especially with the eggplant and cauliflower toppings, too). The Daal is tasty tasty, but be sure to order it extra mild unless you want your mouth (and tummy) to dial the fire department. 

I'd recommend Zante's to anyone looking to try something a little different, but with reliable/ traditional Indian flavors.
author: Zoe H.

description: I've been here a few times for their Indian pizza and regular entrees. While I still think their pizza is pretty good, I'm not sure what is going on with their spice level- it's gotten crazy hot, even when I order mild. My last order consisted of paneer tikka masala, palak planner, aloo gobi, and an eggplant dish-- all of them were REALLY SPICY even though I ordered all of them mild.
author: Jean L.

description: This restaurant has been here for a minute. And I've driven past it, walked past it and in every way I'm thankful that I didn't know about it before. Why, because my budget and body would suffer the ramifications of me being their religiously. It's sooo good! I ordered the half veggie and half tikka masala med pizza. They even have the tamarind and I think it's the cilantro/mint sauce to dip the pizza in. It was so good I felt like sharing with my entire office yet one can't do that so I got to my coworker who was like, "what, Indian pizza?", yes girl it's a thing and a great one! So here I am writing a review on bart because honestly it'd be disrespectful not to!
author: domenique c.

description: If you love Indian food and also love pizza you will find the perfect marriage in their special Indian pizzas. That's all I really go here for, though they have other Indian dishes that are fine too. The fusion is unique and they also deliver which is always a plus.
author: Tiffany W.

description: Their Indian pizza is good, but they are honestly the worst about delivery. It is currently 2 hours from when I ordered and it still hasn't arrived. Another issue is that they leave their phone off the hook so that you can't cancel. I've literally called every 15 sec for the last 20 min and every time the phone is busy. One star.
author: Peter H.

description: Terrible customer service! Ordered through a 3rd party, both the 3rd party and myself were unable to get a hold of the restaurant. Phone is left off the hook, which made it impossible to get an update or cancel the order. Waited over 2 hours just to cancel my order! Very unsatisfied!
author: Joshua P.

description: It's been almost 3 hours and I still haven't got my order. When calling them, it was either busy or when trying to talk to them, they would immediately hang up. I was really excited about this pizza because I had it at my friends the other day, but no pizza is worth this wait. I will definitely not order from them again.
author: Mary L.

description: This place is really hyped up but the pizza didn't live upto my expectations at all. I ordered the XL half chicken half paneer pizza and we were all hungry after eating it. The chicken and paneer were tasteless and there wasn't any real taste in the pizza overall. It is fine for a one time visit but not coming back.
author: Akshat G.

description: This would be a four star for some tasssty paneer pizza, but the delivery time is so terrible it's hard for me not to be a little grumpy. I live in the same neighborhood more or less, and it's taken more than 90 minutes for delivery the last two occasions.
author: Claire G.

description: Let me preface this by saying I heard this place had the best Indian pizza around. After having Half Tandoori/Half Paneer pizza, I was disappointed by the lack of flavor. I can honestly say I barely tasted the tandoori chicken at all. The paneer side wasn't too flavorful either.
author: Wayne C.

description:
We got a takeout pizza from Zante's recently and had a great experience!  Delicious pizza, and fast, polite service.

We got an x-large Indian Chicken Pizza - it was very flavorful, and comfortably provided about 6 individual meals.  We appreciated the fact that they were happy to accommodate our request for half cheese and half no cheese.

We called in our order, were told our pizza would be ready in 20 minutes for pickup, and were thrilled when it was ready to go when we arrived 5 minutes before the promised "ready time."

We also got samosas which were pretty tasty.

The staff was polite and efficient.

Overall, a great spot for a unique and tasty pizza!
author: Barnali D.

description: Outstanding local restaurant, delicious and affordable. Been coming here since the 90's and never had a bad experience. A true original. Grateful they're here. Rating them for a 3rd party delivery service is so petty. Grow up and rate the food and the restaurant.
author: shanestar h.

description:
I can't comment on eating in, but I would recommend that you never order delivery. I've ordered from their website three times, but will never do so again. I've had to wait between an hour and two hours for the pizza to arrive. 

Two out of three times, there has been a problem with the food that was delivered. The first time, my side order of samosas was not delivered, and I had to wait another forty-five minutes for those to show up. For my most recent order, they delivered the wrong kind of pizza! Never order delivery from this place!
author: Phil C.

description: Great Indian food! My hubby loves the pizza but I stick mostly to the traditional dishes. My favorites are the chicken tikka sag and the aloo ghobi muttar. We don't live close by, so I allow ample time to order and the delivery guy is so nice- we really love this place!
author: CAKE E.

description: This shit is terrible I been going to this place sense I was a child and my experience is been the same the food is terrible they brought me a doughy pizza and watered down masala.but the naan bread is fair tikki masala sauce wierd,tandori chicken dog fud,rice the best, and great salad but the dressing is shit you better off going to chutney on Jones really
author: Iz F.

description:
I hadn't had "Indian pizza" in years.

That should have told me something.

Last night was movie night at home, & I decided on having Zante's delivered.  

I called the restaurant directly.  A man answered & told me they don't open until 5:00.  It was 4:35.  He then hung up.

So after a few minutes I went through Eat 24.  

I ordered a large 1/2 tandoori chicken & 1/2 paneer.  No spinach & no eggplant.  

Once my order was confirmed on Eat 24, everything was smooth enough.

I asked to check my order status, & I got back "in the oven."

Then, not 2 minutes later, the pizza arrived.

Whatevs.

It was delivered in about 40 minutes.  

First off, it's a fragrant pie.  Indian curry is quite the aromatic elixir.  It reminds me of home.

They almost got the order right, w only a few flecks of spinach.  I asked for none, but what have you.

The chicken was bone dry & the paneer was absolutely tasteless.  

My man wouldn't eat the chicken, he actually picked it off.  I picked off the paneer.

The saving grace was the curry sauce.  Most notably on the paneer side; it was rich & spicy.  The flavors were pungent & the spices shined through.  Delicious.

Naan as pizza crust.  Great in theory.  And who doesn't love naan?  But overly doughy is not an adjective you want in your pizza crust.  Right?

Finally, it was an oily pie.  Much more so on the paneer side.  Curry can be oily.  It happens.  But it shouldn't be.  And it doesn't make a good pizza. 

I love Indian food.
I love pizza.

Not sure I should have them together.

I would no doubt devour roti, puri, or naan dipped in their curry sauce though.

2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I've been inside a couple of times when they first open and all the times there were no one but us. 

Words and profanity can't describe how I feel/felt

This time, we decided to order our food through the yelp website via eat24. Eat24 was very helpful. But I'll get to that in a bit. 

I placed my order around 11:20am and I received a confirmation at 11:23am. The email said I would get my food at 12:25. Also gave them instructions to call me so I know and also told them to go around since there was no parking at my work place. 

At 12:20, my coworker and I decided to be helpful by standing nearby so the delivery process will be smoother. 12:30 comes by and I call the restaurant. He tells me that the driver is on its way and another 25 min wait, before I could tell him about my email stating it would come at 12:25, he hung up on me. 

I gave it some more time and eventually my other coworkers complained that they were hungry and need to eat. I contacted eat24 about my order and they called the restaurant and he also told her that they were on the way. 

I called again to the restaurant and he put me on hold and 3 min later, he hung up on me again. So i told my coworker to go back in because we were just wasting time. 

The delivery finally called me telling me he was there, but he was at the wrong gate. 

When did I get my food? 1:30..........

Yeah. I know... you probably feel my pain and anger.

Onto the food, always order the Indian pizza, got a med lamb and shrimp one and a cheese one.. I didn't like the paneer as much as the other one. But another coworker got 2 orders of kabob and it was a whole plate of onions after he poured it out on a plate. 

We were not happy with what happened. I actually felt horrible that he had to pay 25 with tax for his kabobs that I gave him some money back. 

Smh. After this, we get indian elsewhere.
author: Eugenia W.

description: Their phone barely works, the guy who takes the delivery order doesn't know how to take an order, and their delivery guy shows up 1 hour 40 minutes later with a cold pizza. Why not just say we won't deliver?
author: Sudip S.

description: It's super yummy. Only had it once, but am reviewing to bookmark, as I will try it again, when I'm in the city next!
author: K K.

description: This place has great Indian style pizza. I was referred by a friend who has previously ordered here and it is top notch. The only negative I have of this place is when I ordered through yelp, I called and asked the estimated time of the pizza I was going to pick up. The man on the phone said ten minutes without really knowing who I was or what pizza I had ordered. So I arrived in twenty minutes knowing well I knew it wouldn't be ready in ten. I got there and there was a huge confusion telling me I didn't pay for it when I did through yelp. Again, they assumed who I was. I finally asked if they even knew what I ordered. They both looked at each other like some fools and asked what my name was. I told them and they said that my pizza would be ready in 10 min. Next time don't assume who the customer is and ask first.
author: Julio V.

description: Really nice Indian Pizza. Kind of a rare thing in San Francisco. They also Home Deliver.
author: Ramesh N.

description:
I love the pizza here and it usually arrives quickly but there have been several mishaps that makes me give them three stars. Twice I ordered a pizza with extra lamb and received no lamb on the pizza. No biggie- told Eat24 and they reimbursed me. 

I usually order the Best Indian Pizza without prawns (I'm allergic) but I got my pizza twice with prawns on it. When I called about it, they sent a new pizza but I was left with a whole pie I couldn't eat. #firstworldproblems However, one time there were tiny bits of prawns that I didn't notice until I tasted something fishy. My friend confirmed it was seafood and I ended up with hives. 

But this has been the third time that my order was over 90 minutes late. When I call in, I get the feeling that they missed my order or forgot it because suddenly I have my pizza in 20 minutes.

Again, I love Zantes and will always order here but definitely not ordering anything with prawns and will place my order way ahead of time just in case.
author: Yuri K.

description: The Indian pizza is as delicious as promised.  But if you order a medium pizza, and the waiter scoffs and insists that you need a large, you don't. Half the pizza will go uneaten and you will feel DUPED! Otherwise, awesome spot.
author: Danielle H.

description:
My girlfriend and I went out for a walk to get some pizza expecting a good, traditional pizza. The first place we stopped at was closed, and we saw the closest place was Zante's so we headed there not knowing it was an Indian style pizza place. 

The place was dead on a Sunday night, but the man who served us was extremely pleasant and personable. He urged us to try some Indian beer after we had thought about getting some Budweiser just for cheap drinks. Great choice, very happy about that suggestion. We got the Indian veggie pizza and holy crap, I have never tasted anything like that.

It was like a samosa spread out onto a pizza, but even better. The sauces alongside the pizza were great too. The pizza itself was awesome; flakey, crispy and not overly greasy. The place was also very comfortable to eat at. Nice setting and decorations.

I will definitely be back, this is one of my new favorite pizza spots. Thanks for the great food!
author: Jeremy D.

description:
What more can you honestly ask for in the world? Amazing pizza with Indian spice-infused dough, and crazy awesome toppings like curried cauliflower and Tandoori chicken. 

It's worth the price, I love the vibe, the service was super fast (in the store) and frankly I feel blessed to have stumbled upon such a gem of a place. 

Cannot speak to the delivery but you owe it to yourself to see, smell, and eat the novelty of this dish in person, anyway!
author: Salim Z.

description: Last night they charged me for a pizza, would not answer the phone, and never delivered. Today they are not helpful in resolving this issue. Need I say more?
author: Weetamoo Lily T.

description:
Dear Mr. Zante,

For starved Indian pizza wanderers everywhere, thank you for opening this restaurant.  There's nothing like this in NYC where I came from. Let me tell you how the experience replayed in my head.

I walk in on a Friday afternoon wearing my famous little red backpack, owner looking guy (I'll call him Zante uncle) looks and me and says %*+#£&@"... I look at him confused. He repeats it again and then asks,

"Are you indian?" 
"Yes I am.." 
"Where from in India?" (Note the ordering of the words hehe)
"I'm from the South.."

Zante uncle sighs and walks away without a word. In a stern tone he asks "what pizza you vant?" I say I would like I try a chicken tikka masala slice (I became white for a second y'all!) to see if I wanted to buy the whole pizza. So he prepared a slice for me. He said it was complimentary, which was very nice of him because Indian people never do that. I took the slice and sat down to eat. The place was empty. Apparently folks never sit down to eat. They might as well cut out the sit down part of their restaurant and just do pizza take out and delivery. Just sayin. Anyways I continue. I call a waiter uncle to ask him what the difference between the paneer and chicken masala pizza is... 

"Excuse me-"
"Hindi @*&#^$..."
"huh?"
"You please say it in Hindi.."
"I don't speak Hindi..."

He gave me that LOOK like "you younger generation peoples are fucked up, don't know your language, don't have indian identity, just all whitewashed!!!"

So I gave him this LOOK back like "listen uncle, Hindi is NOT my native language, never was, never will be. I am a Tamil girl and I speak MY language, Tamil. Fluently. For the record, not all brown people are indian and not all Indians speak Hindi. There's a reason why my people rebelled and rioted against this language, which is why most of us don't speak it. If you uncles come to my state with that Hindi, racist terms like "Madrasi," and bogus stereotypes from Bollywood propaganda movies like Chennai Express, y'all would get your asses kicked. Figuratively of course. We are a peaceful species :) 

If you have seen indian soap operas, you know that one LOOK and a flash of thunder and lightning can communicate quite a lot. Hehe

SO. The chicken one was not horrible except for the chicken part (had no flavor), so I asked to order the paneer one instead. Waiter uncle suggested a half and half of saag paneer based veggie and the paneer tikka masala pizza. So the pizza overall was ok but NOTHING like CanAm Indian pizza from Seattle. CanAm is in a different league. They set the bar way too high for Mr. Zante to jump over. I am giving this place 4 stars because I strongly support the concept of Indian Pizza. And I took off one star because it's always that annoying kid who gets an A++ in everything that ruins the bell curve for everyone else. And Indian pizza from India (like Chicken tikka chili cheese pizza from Pizza Hut) will crush this place like Godzilla sitting on San Francisco. But we still love you Mr. Zante ^_^
author: Bhavi A.

description: This place is dope. The owner is so nice and the food is so tasty. We got several pizzas that were all bomb. Also wine is cheap af. Definitely check it out!
author: Jason S.

description: The cuisine here is great but the environment was bizarre. While the unique chicken tikka and veggie delight pizzas certainly lived up to the hype, the musical choice of this restaurant was mindboggling. A 16-count melody was repeated over and over again for about 20 minutes to the point of insanity before switching to another equally bizarre 8-count melody that repeated for the next 20 minutes. To add to the confusion, an additional Bollywood song began playing at a lower volume that was barely audible but just loud enough to make my party and me scratch our heads. Great food, strange and slightly hilarious overall experience.
author: Aasim N.

description: Ordered through Eat24. Apparently they never received our order. Waited over an hour. Never ordering from this place again.
author: Maleia M.

description: I never even knew that Indian Pizza existed!! I'm so glad it does though because they just put my two favorite things together. First off the costumer service was great. They were very friendly and it seemed like a family owned restaurant. My boyfriend and I followed all their recommendations from their beer to the pizza and it was all good. We did a half and half of the Chicken Tikka Masala and the meat pizza. Comes with 2 different sauces that compliment the pizza very well.
author: Eileen G.

description: Went for the first time last Tuesday night and it was an overall ok experience. We ordered an extra large pizza and portions was enough for 5 people. They did provide some sauces with the pizza that were out of this world but with skimpy toppings, the pizza itself was nothing special. Service was really great with an attentive waiter and as we went in on a Tuesday, there was plenty of street parking. I do recommend Zante's but overall not much of a wow factor in a city worth so many good good options.
author: Tabita P.

description: Two of my girlfriend's favorite foods put into one! How can you not enjoy that? They're not my favorite foods but it's definitely a great combination! Chicken tikka masala with naan that poses as pizza bread is genius! This was a restaurant we had to come to because I'm not even sure if we have anything that's close to this in NY. I'd come here again if I was to go to SF.
author: Dennis K.

description: My order got messed up when I came here, and it ended up being a huge disappointment. This was our last stop in my most recent trip to San Francisco, and found out about this place from a you tube food critic. I was excited to try their chicken tikka masala pizza, and wanted to try the spinach (vegetarian) as well. I ordered over the phone for pick up, verified I wanted chicken tikka masala and vegetarian spinach pizza, half and half. When I picked up my pizza, I was shocked a large was 34 dollars, but that's San Francisco I guess. I figured I'm paying for quality. Get in the car, and find out the whole damn pizza is vegetarian, and it had BIG areas missing cheese and sauce. So, I paid 34 dollars for lightly seasoned dough. I got paneer chunks instead  of chicken on the tikka side, which was so very dry of sauce.  What the hell is going on? What a slap in the face. Bummed, I ate two pieces, one of each side on our long drive home, and regretted my decision that I should have ate somewhere else. At least the dipping sauces were good. But, I didn't pay 34+ tax for freaking naan and dip.
author: Raquel A.

description:
(This review is only for delivery)

Food:
The Best Indian Pizza with Chicken Masala Sauce: tasty, slightly spicy, and flavorful. Really different from traditional pizza. We enjoyed all the toppings and the sauce.

Service:
On this occasion, the pizza actually came, but after a very long wait. We ordered after the 1st quarter of the Super Bowl and it came at the end of the game. My friends though have experienced even worse service though where the pizza never comes. Order at your own risk!
author: Susan G.

description: I really wanted to like this place but it was disgusting. The chicken tikka masala was small proportions the yogurt was separating from the oil and I've had to run to the toilet twice now since eating the dinner. The vegetable fritters were overly crispy borderline of being burnt. The prawns Biryani rice was the best part of the meal because there was tons of veggies and herbs inside of it but it had some spice that was lacking. I will never be eating Indian food here again. Mind you I just had Indian food last night from Spicy Bite and it was so good which made me want to have another Indian dinner from a different restaurant tonight.
author: Leslie C.

description: Do NOT order from this place. Second time now over 2 hours for delivery. Rude. Call an hour in and it's clear they haven't even started making the pizza yet. They say 35 minutes, but it's more like 75 min- after waiting an hour already- from ordering. Absolutely ridiculous. I used to like this place, but something is way off with the way they are running things now. Never again.
author: Briana S.

description:
Wer have been eating here for almost 10 years.  The quality is excellent, the food is delicious and the prices are very reasonable. They even deliver. Thier Lamb Korma is classic signature dish!

You wont go wrong if you are looking for a local dive that does not have any elegance but has great food.
author: Jorge S.

description: Worst delivery service I've ever had in my life! Ordered at 8pm and got a 9pm expected delivery. It's 10:15 right now. No delivery yet. I tried calling the restaurant but they leave their phone off the hook so you'll just get a busy tone. I ended up calling grubhub to see what the hell is going on and the restaurant apparently hung up on them multiple times so I don't even know if my food is out for delivery or not. Grubhub ended up canceling my order and I got refunded. Never ordering delivery from here ever again.
author: Stefanie L.

description: You can order pizza and curry. You can dip your PIZZA in your CURRY. That's once in a lifetime. Just come for that. It'll be awesome.
author: Eugene R.

description: Literally the best pizza I've ever had. Amazing quality and freshness. Great friendly service. Old school ambiance, no fancy hipster b.s.
author: Andrea H.

description:
Review No. 2,200 is dedicated to all the Pamelas of the world and especially to the Pamela who used to live in San Francisco in the Mission District but moved to the East Coast but who still graces our ridiculous city from time to time with her lovely, calming presence.

This place can be off-putting, but as with most San Francisco and/or culinary gems, it's best to reserve your snarky judgment and hypervigilance when it comes to perceived germs and grime and general decay, and just settle in.  Relax!  The people at Zante Pizza won't bite, and although your living-room floor might look cleaner than Zante's dining-room anything, you can't make pizza like this on your living-room floor, so cut them some slack.

Indian food and pizza aren't a combination unique to San Francisco or even the Bay Area, but a few places here seem to do it particularly well, and Zante is at the top of that heap.  Order whatever you want on your pizza.  You may think this doesn't go with that, or that doesn't go with this, or this definitely doesn't go with this; but you'll be wrong.  Hopelessly and blissfully and fortunately wrong.  If you're not a teetotaler like I am--if you're more like Pam after a long flight--you might fancy a glass of wine with your tikka-whatever pizza.  Even that unlikely combination will pair up right, strange as it may seem.

My one criticism of Zante Pizza is that its chairs can be uncomfortable, especially when you're sitting in them for what seems like hours listening and contributing to reminiscences of harrowing workplace moments past and even more distant past.

I also wish it were closer to me, but it is only a longish 24-Divisadero bus ride away, and I can order delivery too, although I rarely do.  The ambiance is part of the charm, especially when you're bringing someone here for the first time.  You'll see her eyes go from bright with anticipation to dull with disappointment to bright with surprise, because good things sometimes come in shoddy-looking packages.

Colorful pizza isn't always good, but every pizza I've had at Zante has been good.  So there.

Thanks for reminding me about Zante Pizza, Pam!
author: John S.

description:
Walked in on a atypically warm San Francisco Friday evening. The place clearly does most of it's business from take-out, but they have a dine-in area as well. It was quite warm inside, and when asked if they could switch on the overhead fans, we were told no-- it would mess with the oven temperature. Overall the decorations looked liked they'd been there a looong time (which, since this place opened in the late 80's, they probably have. We are vegetarian, and came for one thing and one thing only: the Paneer tikka masala pizza. 

Years ago, when we first moved here, we went to Golden Gate Pizza in the outer sunset after a friend recommended their Indian fusion pizza. Intrigued, we rented a zipcar, drove ourselves to the edge of the city to try it out. They had a vegetarian Indian pizza, and a vegetarian masala pizza but they would not let us put paneer as a topping. This confused/enraged us beyond belief. We liked the pizza, but we knew had we only been permitted to put paneer on top, we'd have loved it. 

Back to our dining experience. We ordered the extra large Paneer tikka masala pizza for the four of us and that's it . We loved it (paneer on pizza is a slam dunk) but surprisingly, we enjoyed the crust of this pizza more than anything. The crust was perfectly bread-y but not overwhelmingly so and tasted delicious doused in the chutneys they provided. 

We could see ourselves taking out a pizza from here in the future-- this is definitely a craveable pizza. The service was fine -- a single waiter took everyone in the restaurant's order, we saw another guy flipping the dough and topping the pizza and everything ran just fine.
author: T K.

description: Best Indian pizza that I've ever had. Not the cleanest, not a lot of ambiance. Get it to-go!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
What, I haven't reviewed this place yet?  OK, let me remedy that asap.  They have paneer or chicken tikka masala. IN PIZZA FORM.  Yes, really.  Somehow I wouldn't expect this to work, but it does: they use a slightly greasy naan crust, plus just the right balance of sauce and cheese.  Oh, they also have "regular," i.e. not-a-pizza style Indian food, and the paneer (or shrimp) tikka masala and palak paneer are both awesome.  So is the pilau rice but watch out for the spices!

Also in their pizza department, they have a delicious "best Indian pizza" that is not CTM or PTM.  If you build your own, the "standard" non-Indian toppings are pretty great too, but I recommend the seasoned lamb and onions.  

If you do pick up or delivery, I suggest using the phone rather than the web - seems faster.
author: Aaron M.

description:
This place is terrible. Ordered pizza online at 8:03pm, right now it's 9:44pm. I live 1.5 miles away. I still haven't received my pizza. I've called three times. First to confirm the order as they requested if they don't confirm in 10-15 minutes. Then I called the 2nd time at 9:03pm still no pizza. Told me 5 min, now it's 9:44pm and still no pizza. 

Maybe they're slammed?

Anyone else waiting this long?

EDIT: Holy mother of god, it's been 2 hours and I finally got my pizza. THE ICING ON THE CAKE?! IT'S COLD! 

TL:DR; If you want to wait 2 hours and get a cold pizza order from this place!
author: Andrew S.

description: I read such great reviews but it was a bit disappointing. I ordered a pizza with chicken masala sauce. I could hardly see the chicken though i did get 3-4 bites in a slice. Not a fan of the crust though.
author: Vidya K.

description: Love this place. Only Indian place I go to in the city and it's excellent. I always order the chicken korma (too die for!) . They infuse the spices so well. They make the pizza with the same dough as the naan and it's so so so good! I really hope this place gets more recognition because I thoroughly enjoy it. If you don't like Indian food- the pizza here is great either way !
author: Jocelyn R.

description: Tasty food, for a good price. Ambience is ok and place could be lit more. However if you don't mind that, I would recommend at least one visit to judge for yourself. Also pickup, delivery would be a better option with this place. Our server was very nice to us, but I spoke the local language, so cannot comment otherwise. I wouldn't mind giving four stars if future visits are consistent with above review.
author: Mithilesh S.

description: The pizza is fabulous; and, the delivery service is atrocious:  discourteous on the phone; often the address is misinscribed. Definitely a roll of the dice.
author: Thomas B.

description: MY FAVORITE FOOD OF ALL TIME!!! The staff is super nice, and I'm all about that best Indian pizza! I'm so grateful that this place is around the corner from my house. I honestly eat here way too often ever since I discovered it.
author: Ellyn B.

description:
Zante's Pizza has become an SF staple - it's unique, ridiculously good, and there's nothing quite like it. I only ever order one thing; the Order of the Gods.

Order of the Gods - 1 Best Indian Pizza, 1/2 Chicken Masala, 1/2 Paneer Masala. Extra garlic. Extra side sauces. You're welcome.

Please note that that is not an actual name; it's just a custom order :)
author: Grayson K.

description:
I found out about this place through a Vice article about Indian pizza which came out last year. I had been looking forward to trying it, but didn't really have any expectations when I walked through the door. I've eaten good Indian style pizza at places all over the Bay Area, so I was not expecting to be blown away by this place, even if it is the birthplace of Indian pizza. 

I was wrong. The Indian pizza was amazing. It is definitely the best that I've had. I tried both the masala pizza and the spinach curry pizza. The owner recommended the masala pizza over the spinach, and it was indeed superior. It came with some green (mint?) chutney on the side which definitely enhanced the taste. The spinach pizza was good, but the level of spiciness drowned out some of the other flavors. Next time, I hope to try the paneer pizza. The pizza is sold by the slice but you can also order a full pie. There are only 2 of each slice in the display case at the front of the restaurant, but they have more in the back!

The decor and ambience are nothing special and just prove that you should never judge a book by its cover. This establishment has a 3.5 star average rating on Yelp at the time of this review being posted. If you base your restaurant choices entirely on 4.5- 5 star average Yelp ratings, then you'll be missing out on this spot. (I can't speak about the quality/timeliness of their delivery or their regular Indian food because I only had pizza at the restaurant) If you do go to Zante, then you're going to have some great pizza. I will definitely be coming back here next time I'm in the city.
author: Ravi M.

description: Merging favorite foods isn't always a success... But I would say they captured "indian pizza" quite well... I only gave 4 stars because they didn't follow the directions left when the order was placed... I said.. "no cilantro, no ginger." Despite this error, they were able to remedy it... I will give them a second chance... if they screw up again, I will redo this review
author: John Z.

description: The food here is okay and sometimes it's good even, but when they promised you a delivery within an hour it's always the same BS story that they are too busy. They need to get more drivers or use services like Postmates or Eat24 or ubereats Etc. As a result they deliver cold pizza after 2 hours has passed and when you call to ask where the driver is they subsequently come up with excuses saying they are very busy. This food is not worth waiting 2 hours for it to arrive cold. The main manager says he's the boss and talks down to people when you call them. He also talks over people when you call to ask where the driver is. And then he will say cancel order? I don't understand why everytime I call I need to give my phone number and address again each time. I think they must hand write everything which is not very efficient and they refused to get more drivers. They blame everything on the driver when the owner or manager guy who answers the phone obviously does not know what he's doing as a business person. They are extremely rude and the food is not that good to deal with the rudeness. The next time I receive cold pizza I'm contesting it with my credit card company. They threaten to cancel my order because I asked for the driver was more than once. They said I could cancel the order and I wouldn't be charged but they had already charged my credit card. I do not recommend this place even though the food is good sometimes especially for delivery. As many other people have said on here they give you a window of 45 minutes to an hour even when you ask them to verify that and then they show up 2 hours later if you're lucky. They won't call the driver and will tell you the driver is 10 minutes away when you can clearly hear that they're talking to the driver. All around. They are not very honest and are extremely rude. The manager blames the drivers but the drivers are always nice and a clueless that you've been calling asking where they are when they arrive.
author: Joie R.

description: Yuck! Zante's were ya'll trying to get me sick. Came here around 10 to get a slice or two of pizza. I got cheese pizza, and that turned out to be a mistake. Terrible quality, lack of freshness, and overall just a sad slice of pizza. The pizza was also under cooked!  They just throw a bunch of cheese on the bread and then throw it in the oven to warm up. Man, the pizza was terrible. Next thing that threw me off and really messed up everything for me.... Beware of the refrigerator - that thing is dirty as hell! I'm not even over exaggerating either. I got a can of soda, and the man points at the fridge. I go over and pick out a sprite, I look at it and its sticky, dirty, dirt, black stuff all over it. Then went back to switch it out and got a Pepsi. Turned out that Pepsi had the same issue. All I can think of is "what if this is rat piss" - I could die. Man. that worst. Zante's clean your fridge, before public health officials come to check out the disgusting fridge you use for soda, and other stuff.
author: J M.

description: 2nd time coming and I love it.  So yummy.  Absolutely love the nan/ pizza bread. I noticed the bread was yellow and I wonder if they put spices on it. We split the extra large pizza  between the all meat topping pizza and the chicken tiki.
author: hannah t.

description:
Please put a Zante's in New York City! Omg never had anything like this before in my life...we had to try out the Indian pizza! We got half paneer tikka masala and half best Indian meat...the crust is made of naan (aka that delicious Indian bread that you get at your typical Indian restaurant) Then they delivered the sauces on the side, a mildly spicy mint sauce and a sweet tangy tamarind sauce...just pour a little on top of your slice or dip the crust in the sauce...so much flavor my mouth feels like it's having a party...customer service is great, smiling faces, friendly and fast, water glass always full...it was a really great experience! Thank you Tony!! And the other guy too, you were really nice too, sorry I didn't get your name!
Will be back again next time we hit San Fran...MUST TRY OUT THIS INDIAN PIZZA AT LEAST ONCE IN YOUR LIFE!!! It's so different and super delicious!!!
author: Christine B.

description: Their vegetarian Indian pizza is the best. This was my favorite place to get food when I lived in the city. Moved to Los Angeles and crave this place pretty often. It's not the prettiest spot and when you first enter, you are not welcomed with the warmest welcome. However, ever time I ate in, the serving staff have always been extremely nice. Very sweet to my son.
author: Rose M.

description:
Zantes is theeeeee best Indian pizza you'll
find anywhere. Get the meat or veggie Indian pizza and smother that with the plum and cilantro sauces and you're in heaven. The decor is also amazing. And never packed! This is your spot if you want a last minute delicious dinner on a weekend. Delivery is cool too but the ambiance makes it.
author: Statler W.

description: Delivery took 3+ hours (still waiting). They reassured that the pizza is "on the way" for 2 hours. And then unapologetically claimed that the driver called me (not a single call) and blamed me for the delay. Seems like others have left similar reviews. Terrible service. Never ordering here again.
author: Aswath K.

description:
If I could only give a negative star, one star is to generous.  

First, it took over 2 hours for delivery.  

Second, I ordered two lamb kebops I got like 5 pieces of meat and a giant plate of onion.  The meat was dry, no flavor and it costs me over $24. , I also asked for super spicy and it was so blah.

So disappointing, it just left a bad taste in my mouth.
author: Juan C.

description: When we went to pay with our credit card, the waiter wanted his tip in cash. We tipped on our credit card. How, looking on our credit card statement, we saw that they increased the tip amount, which was higher than what I signed. I don't trust this place anymore.     :(
author: Danny Y.

description: I love Zante's vegan pizza, however they lack on delivery. You order a pizza through Grub Hub and you will literally wait an hour and a half for your pizza to arrive. When it arrives you have to reheat it because it is cold. This is absolutely ridiculous!!! I mean honestly if you can't deliver don't offer it!!!!
author: erica s.

description: Came from San Diego to try it and I was not disappointed. It was sooooo good. My favorite was the chicken Marsala pizza.
author: John Paul L.

description: Why is Indian food so expensive?  For $40 I got a pint of chicken Tikka Sag, a pint of chicken Tikka Masala, a mini container of basmati rice (about 1 cup of cooked rice) and one large piece of onion kulcha (naan). Oh, and a coke because i was jonesing.  What the heck man? The Sag was OK, nothing to write home about and the tikka was the most bland I have ever had.  Both dishes included 4 chunks of chicken in them.  4. If that's not bad enough - the tikka was the weirdest I have ever had.  It was super thick and really pale in color and tasted REALLY bland.  My guess is that they LOAD it with cream, but that wouldn't be cost effective, and it also didn't congeal the same way creamy sauces do when refrigerated, rather, it became the texture of peanut butter.  When I reheated it, the oil leeched out of the sauce and it was SO GROSS, in a 1/4 cup portion of sauce, HALF of that was oil!  My guess is that they are using some sort of stable oil emulsified into the sauce to give it body - maybe this helps it stand up to baking it on a pizza or something. I don't know but it was gross to know I had eaten that much straight up fat in the form of emulsified oil.  The food was not horrible and the delivery service was friendly, but I don't think I would order from them again because of the oily-ness and blandness of the tikka masala.
author: Emma H.

description:
The BEST desi pizza I've ever had had!!!
Fantastic tandoori paneer pizza and the curry vegetarian pizza, both perfectly spiced and baked. The crust was good as well and nicely soaked up the sauce

Triple thumbs up!!!
author: Shwetha R.

description: Love this food but bad experiences. The last 2 times we've ordered delivery we waited but the food never came. Each time we called they promised the driver was a few min away (starting about an hour from order time), but never showed. It would kind of be nice if they were honest about not making our food so we didn't wait so long without making alternate food plans. It'd be even nicer if we just got our food. I'm so sad to not order from here again because it always was delicious!
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Man, I love this place.

I first had their pizza and samosas at a book club event and this has redefined pizza for me.  So good!

I have ordered delivery from them since and I would only take one star away for the fact that I think the amount of chicken on my tandoori chicken pizza has lessened over time.  Maybe it was a bad night, but I feel like there was less meat.

Yummy items that are my tried and true:
- tandoori chicken pizza
- paag paneer pizza
- samosas

Their cilantro green sauce that comes with the orders is to die for.  So delicious!  I would love to explore more items on the menu, but alas we have a few go to Indian joints that are closer, so this review is mainly for their delicious pizza.
author: Christine K.

description: Pizza was delicious! We ordered The Best Indian Pizza with chicken masala sauce and the only reason I'm not giving them 5 stars is because there was hardly any tandoori chicken on the pizza. The chicken was very good so I was really hoping there would have been more of it! The crust is amazing!! Truly enjoyed my practically veggie pizza!
author: Maira S.

description: had the Keena (mince lamb), 3rd class food, service and atmosphere, no reason for anyone to go here for Indian food, just no reason at all.
author: Babar Y.

description: We ordered pizzas for a party and they didn't get delivered - it's been over 3 hours. We called multiple times, they've been saying it's just a few mins away - they're traveling at the speed of light. Order only if you have a time machine.
author: Daljit S.

description: Food took 1.5 to be delivered and it was just ok. I'm a big lover of both pizza and Indian so was excited to try their Paneer tika masala pizza but they didn't add extra sauce like I asked and it was a bit bland honestly. Bummer forsure! Next time I'll order elsewhere and just get Indian food.
author: Milan G.

description:
So the pizza is great. 5 stars just on taste and quality.
I like that they deliver all over the city.
They don't call after you order even though they say they will.
And I ordered my pizza two hours ago and still don't have it and I have to leave so I won't be able to eat it when it does arrive eventually...
author: Shira S.

description: I ordered the masala and spinach curry pizza. After reheating my slice, it was very crispy on the bottom. The crust was surprisingly very light and airy. Both slices were packed with Indian spices.
author: James S.

description: Love this place. Usually get the Indian veggie pizza by the slice but have ordered whole pies a couple of times. Have only had their pizza so can't speak on the rest of the food but the Indian pizza is a MUST TRY for San Francisco. Grab a couple slices, don't have them reheat it, and pop it in your oven at home for 7 minutes at 350 degrees. Perfect crispy pizza on demand
author: Sean S.

description:
Overall good. Great flavor, sometimes.
I thought the meat pizza would have a little more kick :/ but the flavor was there for sure.
The toppings were not well distributed so that left you with some bits full of flavor & texture & others feeling a little sad.
Not the best price value.

Just had the pizza again last night. Still good flavor but my friend ordered the pizza to be delivered but it took them double the amount of time to arrive that they told him & it was completely cold :(. They offered no discount but instead my friend had to bargain with them to get a little of the price knocked off :/.
author: Ashley G.

description:
I hadn't had Zante pizza in a while, and I was really looking forward to my recent meal.  

I remembered the pizza as flavorful and delicious, with a naan-like crust.  

I was disappointed by what I had this week: a very bland pizza with a strong rancid smell (this was the paneer pizza) and a crust that reminded me of Domino's (not a fan).  The tamarind and cilantro sauces were not only delicious, they were necessary to both add flavor and mask the rancid smell.  I can't tell if Zante changed how it makes its pizza or if my memory screwed me over, but that was it for me and I hope other places that make Indian pizza will be worth checking out.  

Two stars: kind and attentive server, food came promptly, and thank god for those sauces...
author: Susan B.

description:
I have refused to write a review for Yelp until this experience. 

I ordered off of the Yelp Eat 24 app (awful decision, never has the food arrived or arrived on time). I placed this order at around 6:30, it is now 8:04, two phone calls, and 5 messages to Eat 24 later, and still NO food has arrived. 

This store is not only unprofessional when you call them on the phone but they are also unprofessional in their timely-ness. This was my first and last time at this restaurant (if you would even like to call it that).
