My only mistake in all of this was not reading the Yelp reviews (ironic, I know) before placing my order.
author: Jassy G.

description: I have only been here once, the food was good, the staff was extremely rude. At the end of our dining experience we handed them a credit card, he threw it on the table and demanded we pay him cash. We told him we only had a credit card and he told us to go find an ATM. After an long argument he took our credit card.  Long story short he did not receive a tip. I will not be returning to this restaurant
author: Andrew P.

description: This review is about my experience with Zante's delivery service. I actually very much enjoy Zante's Indian pizza and have recommended it to friends on multiple occasions....BUT tonight I called in to order and was told the delivery time was 45 minutes. AN HOUR AND A HALF later, our pizza had not arrived. I called and was told it would be arriving any minute.  20 MINUTES LATER (after feeding my kid a sandwich for dinner) I called AGAIN to check on the order and was put on hold while someone "checked on it"....I was on hold for 10 minutes! 5 minutes into my hold, the pizza arrived; the delivery man was apologetic, and told me the people at the restaurant always tell everyone who calls for delivery that the wait time is 45 minutes, no matter the actual estimate! He told me to call the restaurant and they would probably reduce the cost of the pizza...I explained I was already on hold. I waited 5 more minutes on hold to complain, but nobody ever picked up to speak to me again, so I hung up. The pizza was no longer hot and arrived fully an hour after estimated. This was really terrible customer service.
author: Anna P.

description:
**Review based on delivery only**

I ordered through the Eat24 app at work and it took over two hours to arrive. The pizza came cold but we were too hungry to care. Plus we can nuke it. I really wanted to like it but the delivery time was horrible. Even with Eat24's assistance we were unable to get it faster.

It tasted pretty good though so my advice is go there and order in person. Or pick it up. Do not order for delivery.
author: Rosa Y.

description:
DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY FROM HERE

The food itself is okay but delivery service is TERRIBLE here. I ordered once before a couple years ago (which also came late) but today I ordered for delivery at noon and it came at 12:45pm, with the restaurant saying at 12:05 that it would be delivered "soon". 

I should have read the past few reviews on Yelp before ordering here. Just a shame that the business doesn't care to change this by adding more drivers.
author: Leily P.

description:
There was a time that this was a five-star and no questions about it. But of late, it's not been the same. It's just over the 3.5 star mark so it rounds up to 4.

I first ordered from Zante's in 2006 or 2007 while staying at the Marriott Marquis for MacWorld. Although they were in the Mission, they delivered anywhere in San Francisco. In less than an hour, I had a veggie & meat combo in my hotel room.

I took one bite and was hooked. Somehow they had managed to make a great pizza dough and incredible Indian food work together! It would not be my last order. I soon introduced this mad fusion to my local friends and they too were hooked. Some had heard of it, others had not.

Over the years I've sat down to eat or ordered in to my hotel and I've noticed the quality and flavor has really started to go a bit south. Still, it's unique and the people very nice.

I do know of one friend who had it sent to her hotel but the driver got lost and wouldn't stop texting or calling--after 90 minutes--after she said she didn't want it anymore and had ordered room service...

In any event, try Zante's-it's a unique taste and a really good pie!
author: Michael R.

description:
We ordered a pizza on a weekday at about 4:30. They said it would take an hour and a half. At 6:00 we called to see when it was coming and the owner flat out lied to us and said that they were 10 mins away. At 6:45pm we called again and the owner again lied and said the food was 5 mins away and at that point I told the owner to cancel my order at which point he hung up on me. At 7:15pm, 2 hours and 45 mins later, the food showed up. The owner never canceled the order. The owner never refunded our money. 

This was absolutely the worst service I've ever experienced. Waiting almost 3 hours for a pizza is ridiculous. I would never recommend this place and beyond that, I would discourage anyone from supporting this person. The owner was completely rude and cared not at all about customer service and beyond that was a flat out liar.
author: KC F.

description:
Great pizza! Seriously, the pizza is really good. I suggest also trying to Masala Pizza as it is unique. The curries are pretty good too. They unfortunately do not have just garlic naan but for people who don't mind spinach the garlic spinach naan is good I'm told. 

They're also very nice and good with communication. Eat24 doesn't say they deliver to my location (94112) but upon asking I found out that they do indeed deliver to my location. So if Eat24 says they don't deliver to you try calling them or using their own website. Their deliver is fast and efficient. 

This is my new go to pizza place for sure. If they start making Garlic Butter Naan it will be my go to Indian place as well.
author: Matthew P.

description: The indian pizzas are delicious. I would also strongly recommend the tandoori wings.. The curries and kebabs are not consistent and the quality varies all the time..the people who work here are really friendly..
author: Shashank D.

description: Horrible experience. Staff was rude & waited for over an hour to get food. The Bay Area has an abundance of excellent places to eat  - this is NOT one of them!
author: Dyveke B.

description:
Best Indian pizza I have ever had. Waiter was very friendly, pizza was great and the sauces made them even better. 

Chicken tikka masala pizza, tandori wings = great combo!
author: Ed S.

description:
Nothing arouses the senses like FOOD. 

The fragrant and robust spices of coriander, cumin, turmeric, and cardamom awakening my taste buds immediately comes to mind when I think about Indian food. Oh yah, and so does tandoori, curry, and tikka masala. YUMS! 

With Italian food, I think of carbolicious simplicity: crisp Neapolitan pizzas and al-dente pasta lightly dressed in mouth-watering sauces. MANGIA! MANGIA!

Combining the two? PURE. EPICUREAN. GENIUS. 

Zante's birthed this culinary genius in the late 80's calling it: The Indian Pizza. Like some babies, however, the Indian Pizza is problematic...

THE BEST INDIAN PIZZA w/ Tandoori Chicken, Lamb, Spinach, Eggplant, Cauliflower, Garlic & Ginger (requested NO prawns) 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/WIg_d_GJzk-2SDRGp4W9MQ?select=e3q0Brl99L7gKKie84OMDA
Not as pictured online, the pizza was rimmed with a monstrous pale crust. It tasted exactly as it looked: bland and excessively doughy (good for pigeon feeding though). The Indian gene wasn't as apparent as the toppings got lost in the dough. The very little tandoori chicken was dry while the lamb was mia. The bharta (eggplant), aloo palak (spinach), garlic, and ginger infused some savory spice but wasn't evenly distributed; neither awakening the taste buds nor redeeming the bland pizza. 

Like most babies, the Indian pizza left a surprise in my mouth: nice, crunchy prawn tail shells. MmMmMm, FERTILIZER! Yeup, they use prawn shells for potato fertilizer in Norway. NOW, I just gotta bag me a Mr. Potato Head!

OTHER NOTES: 
*Friendly service
*Quoted pick-up time: 20 minutes but was ready in 15 minutes 
*Wooden railing divides the divey pizza oven area and the more formal crisp white linen table dining room 
*Small parking lot (entrance on Cortland) otherwise difficult street parking
*$15 min for CC's
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
I made an order through Eat24. I actually never received my food so this is not a review for their food, more for their service. My order was supposed to arrive at 6 pm. When it was 6:10 pm, I decided to call the restaurant to check on the status. They said the driver was on his way. 

One hour later, still no food. I called again, and he said it'll get here in 5 minutes. 

Once it hit 8 pm, I decided to just cancel my order. I will not be ordering from here again. Having someone who's hungry wait 3 hours for their food?! Ridiculous.
author: Wendy L.

description: Surprisingly delicious!! The masala pizza was particularly good straight out of the oven with garlic on it. Staff couldn't have been nicer. Will definitely come back for more!
author: Laurel S.

description:
The pizza is wonderful, but the delivery sucks. I ordered at 11:30, it's now 1:12 and I'm still waiting. 

This happened last time as well, but I was so distracted I never got around to posting about it. 

Full disclosure: this is the financial district at lunchtime.
author: Amy T.

description:
Total bummer. I've eating at the restaurant before and it's very tasty. This review is for online ordering and delivery only. 

I placed my order right after they opened. Didn't get the confirmation call as the order form says you will. So I called to confirm. Called and waited while it rang for over 3 minutes each time. After the 3rd call I got a person who put me on hold for 5 minutes only to come back on the phone and and say there was something wrong with their fax machine and they didn't get the order. This is now 40 min after I placed it. He then told me, "There is also no driver here right now." He was pretty rude and I told him not to charge my card and cancel the order if it did ever come through. 

I want to like you Zante's but your being sort of an asshole. LET ME LOVE YOU.
author: Chris D.

description: Please, please, if you have the chance, try Tasty Indian Pizza and Subs in Sunnyvale for the real thing. This was weird sour ultra bland paneer tikka masala "sauce" pizza which left us too full and too sad after too little. Also tried the Beingan Bhartha which was also remarkably sour. What made the experience worse was "jaldi, jaldi uncle," who led me astray by making me order the malt beverage Hayward 5000, and chastised us South Indians for not knowing how to speak Hindi. Then guilting us with the desi tongue click to take the leftovers with us. Uf, when will they learn.
author: Archana P.

description:
So so so good!  I ordered the paneer Indian pizza an it was fantastic, delicious, and everything I wanted and more.  My favorite part--the pizza had masala sauce on it instead of tomato sauce!  I also ordered a salad which was fresh and came in a comically large box Chinese takeout box.

The delivery took about 45 minutes which is what they predicted.  I will definitely order again.
author: Jaime F.

description: My dad introduced me to this place in the 90's when he lived at 30th and Mission and I've been a loyal customer ever since. I will go out of my way to come here for a slice of any of the Indian pizza's and sometimes a couple of larges to take home and freeze if I won't be back to SF for a minute. It is always consistently delicious! In 20+ years they haven't changed a thing and that is perfect for me. The traditional Indian dishes are always outstanding as well, with their Sag Paneer being my all time favorite. There are 1000's of delicious places in SF, but this place gets me, every single time. Thanks for being my favorite SF comfort food Zantes!
author: Mitch S.

description:
The food was great.  There isn't a lot of places that I can think of with indian food on your pizza! They also have regular pizzas in case you're not very adventurous. It's a good place for #vegan and #vegetarians. 
My issue I had with the place was the owner. 

I was in the city doing a video shoot for a company when I had to make a call. I didn't have to menu, I only had my phone. (I can't search online while on call. So I was calling to ask what was on the menu and normally I am used to someone being a bit more patient. I tried to explain that I don't have the menu and I'm on a video shoot he told me to order online and hung up. So I had to take a snapshot of the menu and called back. He was rude again and kept trying to rush me when I had never ordered there and I was trying to figure out what the size differences were. 

When I had called back I finally had to tell him either he wants my business or I can order somewhere else as he was going to hang up on me again. That finally got his attention and he was more patient. I ordered and when he delivered I never got the check he said it was in the bag but it wasn't. The check which I needed so the business could comp the meal. 

Now a few weeks later I'm trying to call him back and get the check from him and I told him the date and time... What do I get again? Him telling me what I ordered... As if I remembered that... That's why I needed the check! So he hung up on me again only to try to guess what I had although I gave him the date and told him we ordered 3 pizzas. 


If you try to call in. You better be able to be patient because the owner is incredibly rude and has terrible business Etiquette. Which is really sad because I thought the food was pretty good. I don't think I'll give them any more of my money for a while...
author: Kanoa U.

description:
I have been coming here for years. It is among my favorite places to bring friends who are visiting me on their way to the airport or out of town. 
I have a pretty wide palate, and love spices on everything. Some of my friends, not as much. I generally don't get excited about regular pizza, but I think most everyone else I ever met does, so when I suggest we do pizza, they are usually all for it, not realizing I'm about to trick them into eating something they've never had before. I order The Best Indian Pizza with Paneer Masala. Everyone is always happy; even steak and potato type people, which is pretty impressive, I think. Sometimes they are even raving happy, like calling me a few months later to talk about the pizza.
author: Christopher L.

description: I've been going to this place since I was around six, so at least 15 years and I've never been disappointed. The staff is super sweet and the pizza is amazing. The thin crust is probably the best part of it.
author: Mina S.

description:
Their deliveries are consistently late and I've been patient plenty of times before, but I've had enough. Tonight it took over 2 hours and 15 mins, and we called the restaurant to be told that it was 5 minutes away, several times over the course of an hour. They did apologize, and probably should have offered to give us our pizza for free or something, but instead, they hung up on us. We were being polite, and the guy gave no shits. Eventually we cancelled our order, because we didn't want to pay after 2 and a half hours. Now its our bedtime, and we're hungry. Great. 

I've had them be 2+ hours late before, and when they did show up the pizza was cold. I didn't leave a bad review then, but I probably should have. The pizza is good when it shows up, but jesus are they slow. The delivery driver did call at one point, and was lost and asked for our address again and again. This is 2016, you have our address from our order, fucking google it. Both my Fiance and I have done deliveries for a living and that bullshit is unacceptable and would have got either of us fired.
author: Colin S.

description:
I ordered through Eat 24....I have been waiting for my order for 2 hours, thankfully the Eat 24 customer service team was awesome and kept checking on my order, got me a discount and complained to the restaurant as well. 
I'll never order take out from here again.
author: Mandy F.

description:
I really wanted to love this place, especially since I essentially moved next door. I first found out about Tikka Masala Chicken Pizza from a small unpopular spot downtown. The idea is certainly enticing, marrying two of my favourite things, and makes sense as Tikka Masala definitely has enough flavour to lend to pizza. 

That said, Zante's serves a good rendition of tpizza. They start right from the base, using the tikka masala sauce on the dough. Like many pizzerias, they make a cheese base and add ingredients based on the order and toss it in the oven. Somehow, thinking this was a place dedicated to doing things a bit different, they'd focus less on offering variety on pizza and doing their thang. 

Anyway, the result: tasty but ultimately a flat experience. Worth trying for sure, but not worth being a regular at.
author: Ben H.

description: Clean. Friendly. I took the kids and We stayed with the Indian food menu. I found the curries tasty. We had chicken Korma and chicken tikka masala and Chana masala all were great.
author: Monica T.

description: Get the chicken Makenwala!  The best version of Chicken Tikka Masala I've had in SF.  So so good!  You won't be disappointed.  I also love the mango lassi!  Yum!
author: Rachel B.

description: The pizza here is the novelty. It's the best Indian pizza of the few I've tried in SanFran. I love the waiter. Always the same guy. Amazingly he always remembers me and seats me at the same table from my first visit in 2011. He always asks you to tip in cash haha. His audacity endears him to me :-) I love the Taj and Flying Horse in the big bottles. Regarding the food, chicken tikka masala pizza is boss. I however always order the Indian food. I love the vindaloo extra spicy. Not crazy about the naan, it's a bit Costco in my opinion. But everything else I've had here are choice!
author: Stanley J.

description:
San Franciscians are spoiled with tons of restaurants. You can get whatever you want, when you crave it and delivered to your house within 30 minutes to an hour. Even Indian Pizza. Zante's Pizza has been one of my favorite neighborhood pizzerias for a long time. 

I wasn't feeling good and needed some pizza to tide over my sick stomach. Although Indian food may be too spicy for some, i find the blend of spices to be warm and savory. I didn't know if it would too much, but it was just what I needed. 

I ordered the Small Indian Pizza with Meat ( Chicken Tandoori) and Samosa appetizer. The samosas are huge and the sauces for them are so good, I never pass these up ever. 

I'm glad this place is still around, otherwise some people would never know how good the Indian Pizza is.
author: Rebekah T.

description: I was very excited for my Indian pizza based on the reviews here. I got the meat combo and it was so bland. The shrimps were teeny tiny shrimps and the chicken was super dry. The sauce was also bland. So everything was bland. Totally disappointed.
author: LeTran B.

description: First time getting vegetarian pizza and I loved it. The pizza bread was an amazing consistency. It was so good and fluffy.
author: Joshua F.

description: The only reason for the 2 stars is the pizza.  I love tandoori cooking.  Living in India for a year I have been a bit spoiled.  That being said, I just bit into the tandoori lamb(Boti Kabab (Tandoori Nazaare- Specialities from our Unique Clay Oven)).  I paid $12 for lamb jerky.  I have never, ever, in my 15+ years in the bay area eaten such disgusting and overcooked lamb from an Indian restaurant.  The pizza was awesome.  Zante, please remove the rest of your menu and just make good pizza.
author: shannon h.

description:
I just ordered $80.95 worth of food to be delivered at 12:15 pm. I called three times to see where our order is and every time, the answer is 10 to15 mins. The food arrived past 1PM. after a very late lunch, I called to ask for compensation for this out of the world service and they said they will comp me $10! That's the tip i left for the delivery! Never again. 

PS. I ordered chicken tikka masala and it's just blah.
author: Emcy G.

description: Delicious lamb curry. Mildly spiced is enough heat for me. Delivered quickly and piping hot. Happiness.
author: Andrew Y.

description: We've been ordering from Zante for years.  Their Indian pizza is terrific, as is their chicken sagwala.  But their customer service SUCKS and if you are ordering for delivery be prepared 1) for at least a 75 minute wait, 2) to be brushed off/treated rudely when you call asking about it, and 3) for the order to be magically "on its way" when you call and ask (for the 2nd or 3rd time) why it's taking so long.
author: maggie r.

description: GREAT Desi pizza, with quick delivery and responsive staff
author: Lauren M.

description: There's quite a lot to love about this place. The pizza is amazing and super flavorful. I've always like the vegetarian one. The service is also fantastic! Always making sure that we are enjoying the food and that our needs are met. It is a great change from traditional pizza, but also a good change of pace from Indian. Highly recommended!
author: Andrew K.

description:
This is a great concept - Indian pizza. I've ordered the best Indian pizza and the chicken masala pizza several times. Quite tasty and unique. 

Their website has one of the worst user interfaces I've experienced... it wasn't even state of the art in 1995. It says they have a mobile friendly menu... I've never braved looking at their site on a phone. It's already hard enough on a lap top. If you can be patient enough to deal with the clunky interface to find the section on ordering an Indian pizza its not too bad. 

Tip - after you submit the order you will get a message that says "Call us to confirm your order if we don't call you within 10-15 minutes". I've ordered from them more than 10 times, I think maybe once they actually called and confirmed the order, maybe I'm not sure. So just plan on calling them in 10 minutes and make sure they are working on your order. Also no matter what they will ALWAYS tell you that your pizza will be delivered in about 45 minutes. Sometimes it has arrived 15 minutes after I called, sometimes an hour but the one thing that is certain is they will tell you its going to be 45 minutes. 

Look, delivery generally sucks in this city, especially at any decent pizza place if you place an order during peak hours like I always do. So Zantes is like everyone else. What it gets down to is the food tastes good and it's a fair price. What more do you expect in this town? You are hungry, you type on your computer and a while later a dude shows up with tasty hot food in exchange for cash. That seems pretty damn good for thirty bucks.
author: Hope A.

description: I know what you're thinking.... Indian pizza sounds a little weird. I was skeptical but their pizza is surprisingly delicious. Their traditional Indian food is pretty mediocre but it makes a good accompaniment to the pizza.
author: Diana G.

description: This pizza is exquisite and one of a kind. We get the vegan one, and I'm not a vegan, it's just so damn good. The sauces that come with it are killer. The prices are fair and the delivery is quick.
author: Brian P.

description:
Do I want Indian food or do I want pizza?

HOW ABOUT BOTH?  Zante's Indian Pizza is fusion at its finest and one of my favorite SF finds.  

I don't mind going vegetarian for a meal and ordering a half-half pizza of best Indian pizza with paneer masala (my favorite) and best Indian vegetarian pizza.  Don't forget to ask for the extra sauce containers of chutney and tamarind - perfect for dipping your naan-like pizza crust in!

I always call-in and order for pick-up - haven't had any trouble.  Love this place!
author: Kathleen W.

description:
I had the chicken biryani, Tandoori chicken (hot), garlic naan, topped off by a Flying Horse beer.

Interesting being in a pizza restaurant that uses Indian toppings.  People seemed to enjoy the food, and there was a constant progression of people picking up pizzas to go.

The food was very good -- the chicken biryani was amazing, as was the Tandoori.

The garlic naan was just a little disappointing, but that's more me than the food itself.

Very nice people, and service.  Prices are excellent.
author: Thomas H.

description:
Dang, their Indian pizza, veg or meat, is a one-of-a-kind taste explosion. Whatever local airborne bacterium it is that spoils most SF Italian pizza crusts casts a kind eye on Zante's 'za.  I've had countless pies, and, though they regularly put my gut through the mandoline, I'll have more.  Out-of-towners taken there ask if they ship.

Please remember that EVERYfrickinBODY is ordering for delivery, so if it's primetime and you live nearby, heeltoe to the place and spare everybody the "it took an hour" whining. (Parking outside without a wheelman is very tricksie.) If you don't live nearby, order early and have a microwave oven handy. It's worth it.
author: Kenny C.

description: I had only order from Zante, it looks like most people probably order food from there because the restaurant was almost empty. The pizza was amazing and the service was great too. Love this place
author: S L.

description:
Alright, Zante's, it's over. Your food is freaking GOOD! You've been getting creative with Indian food for years, WAY before the city was gentrified to the extent it is now so you deserve cred for it. But you are FAILING at taking care of me! For the umpteenth time in a few months, I'm waiting for over 2 hours for my pizza and you practically hang up on me when I call and tell me "15 minutes more." 

So look, now I see the problem is me. I'm a pansy for continuing to try and hook up with you. I didn't think I could get better than you so, in important ways, I let myself get here. You're bad for me. You're bad for everyone. I know you're gonna treat the next dude as badly as you treated me--gonna give them the clap, warts--the whole nine. Cold pizza and what not. But you won't do it to me any more.

So, go on then. Be nasty. 

Buyer beware, Zante's is a JERK!
author: Mario T.

description:
Dropped in for a quick slice and I think I like the joint in the sunset more. Still for a nice and unique $3 snack you could do a lot worse.

I wonder how their straight up indian food is. Though I guess that's not really the point of Zante.
author: Misha T.

description:
You love Indian food? You love pizza? Boom - Zante's gives you both!

I was waiting for the bus on Cortland the other day and was starving. I had heard great things about their vegetarian pizza so decided to give it a try. It was like having indian food on your pizza. Strange, but true. You should definitely give it a try!
author: Carlos A.

description:
I typically love Zante's. I love Indian food, I love pizza so of course I love Indian pizza.

I expect about an hour wait but you know what I don't like, waiting almost 2 hours and receiving cold food.

Zante's! Get your shit together! I want people to order and enjoy your food but it's hard to convince them when your service is so terrible. 

Also, GrubHub (ordered via GH) you seriously comped me less than I tipped. F you.
author: Margaret I.

description:
Zante's Pizza is good isnt just good, It's really good, but it's definitely not worth the epic wait. I live less than a mile away and it takes 1.5hrs on average. I also live in an apartment. These guys aren't coming to the door. Hell, sometimes, these guys don't even hop out of the truck. I've literally given the guy the money through the window of his truck. 

There isn't really much else to say about this place. The food is great, the delivery is really slow. Go pick it up, I guess? To the best of my knowledge, they've got the market on Indian pizza basically cornered, so if it's what you're craving, you've only got one place to choose from. If anything, you should probably just support them because maybe they'll pony up and hire some faster drivers.
author: Shane G.

description: Terrible customer service tried to charge me an extra 6 dollars for a change of sauce saying it was an extra topping. Then continued to argue saying the sauce makes my regular pizza an Indian pizza therefore raising the price because it's in a different class somehow. I don't know any pizza hierarchy but that sounds bullshit to me.
author: Santino C.

description: Indian pizza is better than it sounds. Esp. the veggie options are great. It's a nice change from the ordinary.
author: Hema P.

description:
Sunday lunch.  Ordered a small Indian pizza with tandoori chicken and extra sauce, paid online at 12:30pm.  Was ready and waiting by the time we got there at 1:00pm.  

3 words: Breath stinkingly delicious.

Ample toppings, saucy as ordered, doughy crust with a crunch (how I like it!), paired with some vino and a sunny day at Dolores Park, end result was a fantastic lunch and am sure to return for my next Indian pizza craving!
author: Heidi L.

description: The service is pretty fast and the pizza is delicious. I had Zante's Pizza before when I was in middle school (2007ish) then I came here again to see if they're really good and yes, they're still good.
author: Hina W.

description: It's good and very unique.  A bit pricey for the pizza and the crust isn't naan as I thought from other reviews.  We got an extra large half paneer masala and half chicken tikka masala.  Very tasty but not worth over $30 for an extra large.
author: Phil D.

description: The pizza is good! 5 stars. But go in there to eat, the delivery is so bad the guy once forgot the pizza and just brought the sides. Other times they took hours. I don't think they have a tandoori oven, if they do, they don't know how to cook chicken in it. The curries are good though. It's a shame, if this place worked on the service it would be a great spot.
author: Jasper W.

description:
VEGAN INDIAN PIZZA. It may leave your stomach a mess the next day, but in the moment, it's blissful.

It may be tempting to get Zante's delivered to your house. But trust me, it's not really worth it. Delivery takes at least 45 minutes, while in house, it takes about 5-10 minutes from the time of ordering to get your pizza on the table. It's hot, it's waiting to be ingested with lots of King Fisher. Go for it.
author: Jon T.

description:
Wow talk about poor service.  I ordered from this restaurant over Eat24.  It took almost 3 hours to get my food.  Luckily, Eat24 customer service was a champ and helped me out.  But Zante's manager and drivers were rude on the phone and kept saying it would only be 5 more minutes every time they were called.  I will not be doing business with this restaurant again. It's one thing to have a delayed order, but it is another to treat your customer with disrespect about it.

DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH ZANTE'S PIZZA
author: David D.

description:
Well i just finished writing a review and now they tell me to freaking sign in and of course it's lost.
What i picked up tonight not as good as it used to be.
I don't think they used to put cheese on these and now they give you disposable containers of sauce, one of which is sweet. 
In the past their zas had plenty of flavor without having to add sauce, for God's sake.
May not be going back.
author: Aki T.

description:
When I heard about Indian pizza I had to try it! I feel like this place has so much potential to be great. When we walked in at 12pm the place empty. The decor is very "Mission" feeling, it needs a remodel. It looks like an Indian-American diner with nick-nacks all over. Most of the tables were half set, not one table was completed

The pizza had decent flavor, but needed more sauce and lamb/chicken. If I wanted to order late night pizza I would consider Zante Pizza but I would not go out of my way to return here.
author: Jenna P.

description: Love love love this place. The tikka masala was tasty and delicious with just the right seasoning. The naan was really good and the veggie samosas were spicy and filling and delicious. We also had pizza. I really like the pepperoni pizza. Will be coming back soon.
author: Peggy E.

description:
So... An hour and a half to deliver a cold and undercooked pizza. At 4pm on a Sunday, how busy can they be?

This place is a joke.
author: Guillaume R.

description: Pizza was great. Served fresh out of the oven, the half chicken masala and half paneer masala was amazing. Thanks yelper recommendation! Three of us walked in at 8:30, were seated immediately, and the service was nice. Our server was so funny! I will be back.
author: John D.

description:
Delicious pizza!!!
Hands down best pizza. 
I highly recommend coming here!
author: Pillowsblanket S.

description:
Only giving one star because it is required in order to write a review. 

2 & 1/2 HUORS LATE DELIVERY
WRONG PIZZA! THEY BROUGHT CHICKEN TO A VEGETARIAN HOUSEHOLD!

Tried to order a vegetarian pizza on Saturday night. Called in at 7, the man on the phone said it would arrive within 45 minutes to an hour. That would have been perfect timing for my family as we usually eat dinner at about 8, and the kids were hungry! Thought we would splurge and order out that night to treat ourselves after a really long week. 

At 8:10 the pizza had not arrived so I called Zante to ask if the pizza was on its' way, and the man on the phone abruptly said "ok, ok, 5-10 minutes." then hung up on me. By 8:30 the pizza still wasn't here so I called again. The same man answered and said the same thing, 5-10 minutes. At this point in time we had to make breakfast for dinner as we were all so hungry. 

Finally get a call at 9:17pm that the pizza guy was outside. So I go out to get the pizza thinking that maybe we could have it for lunch tomorrow being that we had already eaten, and the guy says, "look, my boss gave me the wrong pizza, but do you want it anyways?" Holding back tears of frustration I asked what kind of pizza it was, "chicken" the guy replied. 

Well Zante, I am a vegetarian and so is my whole family, so no, no your chicken pizza that arrived 2 hours and 17 minutes after ordering would not do, nor will it ever. I will not order from you again or eat your food after this experience.
author: Cicely H.

description: I couldn't imagine what Indian pizza would be like...it is amazing!  The turmeric-spiced crust is covered with Indian style veggies (vegetarian-friendly restaurant) that melt in your mouth.  Service was attentive and atmosphere quiet, Indian music in the background.
author: Patricia R.

description: This place is one-of-a-kind. Fresh pizza made with traditional Indian/Pakistani ingredients. I was skeptical at first (hard to imagine a "curry pizza"), but it is so tasty, far better than traditional pizza in my opinion -- It's surprising "Indian pizza" hasn't become more of a thing. I used to live in Redwood City and whenever I drove back from SF, my roomates always requested I pick up a Zantes. It's truly an SF staple.
author: Isaac N.

description:
awesomeness! simple, unique, authentic and friendly! simple review. love. just go.

they will make sure you have anything and everything you'd need. ordered 2 xl pizzas and an app for 9 of us. perfect size. they'll let you know which beer is the best. it's like family.
author: Brooks M.

description:
This is a very interesting pizza place. They have lunch and a "candlelight dinner". Although they state it is a candlelight dinner, they were any candles. Instead, there dim lights hanging from the ceiling fans. Nevertheless, they try to pull off a intimate, romantic vibe. There is no outdoor seating. There's enough room for about 40-60 people. The restrooms are small but are clean.

We decided to get two pizzas. We got a large pizza, half of it being the  Best Indian Pizza with Chicken Masala Sauce and the other half being Best Indian Pizza Vegetarian. The other pizza we got was a Medium Best Indian Pizza with Paneer Masala .The pizzas tasted pretty good. The included Masala sauces went great with the crust as well as with the rest of the pizza. 

The service here is okay. While we were deciding on what to get, I think the server tricked us into getting a larger size and even another pizza by using reverse psychology. I did not like that very much. Nevertheless, the other waiters did a good job keeping our cups filled with water and gave us our pitchers of beers in a timely fashion. Never really thought of trying Indian pizza but will definitely will try it again!
author: Jason P.

description:
Um...yes please. This is the best thing I never knew I wanted until I had it. Indian pizza, ingenious idea and perfect execution. 

5 thumbs up.
author: Steven H.

description: Pizza is on-point. I've been a customer for years and it's rarely let me down. Delivery times can be unpredictable, as other reviewers have noted (one time my pizza failed to show up entirely), but seem to have improved recently.
author: Rob A.

description:
Haven't been so mad in ordering pizza in a while. Delivery took over 2.5 hours and after several phone calls. Every phone call came with an attitude from the restauranteur and was told "5 minutes". After 2.5 hours, i called to cancel my order and get a full refund, and he asked me "what my problem was". I had to tell the delivery driver upon arrival that i had cancelled the order and was getting a full refund, afterwhich he negotiated with the manager to provide a 50% discount (which the manager never thought of and was willing to cancel his sale and get the order over with). The delivery driver was very nice and polity and offered to chat and speak to the manager and make him understand the sale and that they should offer a discount or a free order the next time instead of offering a full discount. 
The pizza was average and I would have ordered again at a later date if it wasnt for the experience with the manager and restauranteur. 
Attitude : 0 stars
Pizza : 2.5 stars
Delivery Guy : 4 stars
Delivery time : 0 stars
author: Aayush D.

description: Indian pizza is unbelievably fantastic. And delivery is free! This is my new favorite food. If you like pizza and you like Indian food, your mind will be blown. Looks like delivery complaints are bringing down this gem's ratings. Don't let that deter you - whatever the wait, it will be worth it!  Our delivery had no issues.
author: Tish M.

description:
Worst delivery service. Ordered food was told it was going to take 45 minutes max. I called a hour in and they told me 5 more minutes. Ultimately, it took nearly 2 hours to get my food.

Good pizza, but very bad service over the phone and delivery....
author: Gurjeet N.

description:
I'm trying to save my five star ratings for places where I literally dream about the food after and crave the restaurant's offerings on a weekly basis. Zante's is one of those places. I'm not sure about their standard Indian fare, because I'm not really sure why you'd get it when you can have Indian food ON A PIZZA. I guess if you have a gluten intolerance. :(

But otherwise, get their pizza! I usually get the best Indian vegetarian pizza, and it's amazing. Like so good. I don't even know how to describe it properly, but if you are like me and LOVE Indian food and always want pizza, you will love it. 

$20 delivery minimum (get a medium Indian pizza or bigger to meet the minimum) or head over and buy it by the slice to go. I will say that the delivery isn't the fastest, usually about an hour, but I'm lazy and as nice as their service is, don't like sitting in restaurants as much as I like sitting on my couch. Make sure to try both the sauces--the green one is a bit spicy and the red one is delicious and sweet.
author: Meryl S.

description: For a takeout order: I would give it a lower rating if I could. The chicken and lamb that I ordered had roughly 4 really dry pieces each in half empty containers covered with onions to hide them. Would never order from again.
author: Jay A.

description: This is a hole-in-the-wall joint serving naan-like pizzas with Indian flavors, like Tandoori chicken. Food was good and generously portioned, and the guys working there were friendly.
author: nadia o.

description:
The pizza is delicious--really unique to mix Indian flavors in a pizza, and it works. I've had both vegetarian options, and they are both very, very good. 

Delivery isn't the greatest--be aware that if you order through Yelp App (which is powered by Eat24, I believe) you may need to call to confirm they got it, because both times I've called 10 minutes later and they hadn't received yet or started the order. And once they subsequently forgot the dessert--the Kulfi. 

Again, the food is truly excellent, very delicious. The delivery service could use some work.
author: Carlton W.

description:
I used the Yelp/Eat 24 service to pre-order food from two restaurants for a get together that I was having at 6:00 PM Saturday evening.  I ordered the food at 3:00 PM.  Both restaurants immediately called to confirm.  

One restaurant was right on time!  However, Zante's food did not arrive to my house until 6:20 PM and they left an item out.  

The samosas were mediocre at best.  Although the pizza was pretty good; these folks have left a bad taste in my mouth...won't be using them again for anything important.
author: Karla F.

description:
The only place I have had indian pizza. That said, it is amazing. I've tried the vegan pizza (even though I find the concept oxymoronic), which was good for what it was. The other indian pizzas are superb. Everyone I bring to try this place falls in love with it.

Some improvements on delivery pace, and giving me more sauces would make this perfect. As it stands, still a solid 5 stars.
author: N B.

description: This review is for the Indian pizza. A friend of mine had given the pizza here rave reviews so I had my hopes up, however, I found the pizza to be only OK. The crust is kind of doughy and the mix of toppings doesn't quite convey Indian food...I was underwhelmed by the taste. Service is really friendly, though.
author: Alice H.

description:
This solely a review for the service. I ordered online at 4pm for a delivery scheduled at 730pm. After the pizza was 30 minutes late, I called to check on it. The person who picked up told me it was almost there and hung up on me right after.

After another 20 minutes of no-shows, I called again and they kept telling me that it was another few minutes and that it was on the way.

Another 20 minutes and still nothing. I called to cancel the order, but then 5 minutes later, the pizza shows up!

Besides the long wait, the pizza was stone-cold and even after heating it up it wasn't very good. They also gave us the wrong pizza, meaning they were just trying to cover up their mistake. Never ordering from here again.
author: Maggie T.

description: This Pizza is amazing!!! I thing the idea of Indian pizza was very questionable... but it's actually soooo so good! The crust is naan- so fluffy and crunchy on the outside- the chai tea is dope too! Had the Massala pizza and something else - both were awesome!
author: Danielle R.

description:
Holy smokes. People had recommended we try this, but we had ignored it till today. 

It was insanely good. My boyfriend, who loves Indian and likes pizza OK, wasn't sold until he got 3 bites in and then BAM! So goddamn good.

We will almost certainly be ordering all our pizza from Zantes. Why settle for boring old pizza with pepperoni or combination when you can have Chicken Tikki Massala pizza and be in heaven.

They put yellow curry in the pizza dough and the masala sauce and cilantro really jives with it, in combination with the pizza-cheese. 

We just finished our lunch, and we're both full... there are three slices left... we're desperately trying to not eat them because we're full...but the flavor....oh god the flavor.

I know we wont resist the siren call for long...
author: Jane H.

description: Placed order on Eat24. The owner calls me to complain that they owed the restaurant $10,000 and he wanted me to give him my credit card number over the phone so he can directly charge me. Sketchy as f*ck. Told him to cancel everything because I am never eating here again.
author: Teresa T.

description: So we ordered 3 orders of tiki masala and it was crazy spicy. We can't do spicy, so I returned 2 orders of it. They were nice enough to give me a credit for it. We just got a pizza, I was nervous,  I've never had Indian pizza and was nervous about the spiciness. It was great! Good pizza, nice of him to honor my issue and we will definitely order pizza from them again!
author: Nicole R.

description:
*this is only for the Pizza*

ONLY GET THE PIZZA!

The food is NOT its gem, people. In fact, its quite bad.

-BUT- the pizza?!! GENIUS! There are only 2 types to choose from..
meat and no meat. I ordered the meat pizza without the lamb and 
prawns and only the Tandoori Chicken. It was awesome.  Ordered 
a few other dishes that were definitely not great. The place is a total 
typical hole in the wall Indian place... so instead of dining in, I highly 
suggest ordering the pizza to go.

Service was great... very nice server.
author: S. M.

description:
did not try the food yet, but its been an hour late... they are 5 min drive away from me.. and it takes them this long.. when I called in, was placed on hold, then they hung up on me, had to call again, was placed on hold... they could not find my order! and said that will call me back, which they did saying that my order will be there in 5 min... that was 20 min from now.. I kinda have a feeling that they do not have enough staff or do not know of how to use their online ordering system...but wait - eat 24 gives you a call when there is an order form their website, but I guess they put them on hold as well...

I really hate leaving bad comments.. the other thing is that they probably do not even care, or now that yelp exists...lol

if you have a different option, order from somewhere else... I am still waiting to get my food...
author: Sofia K.

description:
The Indian pizza here is awesome!
And the other indian dishes I've had here are pretty good too!

I would recommend the
- chicken tikka masala pizza
   it is very filling, but very tasty

- saag anything
   their spinach is well seasoned, and not too soupy or solid

- raita & naan
  its decent, not the best ive ever had, but it gets the job done

Did i mention the pizza is really good?
author: Josh E.

description:
Don't say anything mean about my Zante's!  

This place has been a favorite of mine for YEARS!

Meat-adorned Indian Pizza is my absolute FAVoRITE- sometimes I find myself daydreaming about it.  I always order enough to take home leftovers- because cold Indian pizza is pretty amazing, too.

Lately I've been sitting down to enjoy my piping hot awesome pizza-fix, and I've found the restaurant as a whole to be very pleasing!  The decor is lovely, the seating is comfortable, everything is spotlessly clean- frankly, even the bathrooms are pretty nice!  And my sweetheart and I refer affectionately to the host as our "Best friend"- because he never lets my water glass go empty, and he is just absolutely wonderful overall.  I really appreciate good service at a place (Yes, I am that crazy lady who gets annoyed if I wait too long for food, or if my host or hostess is pretty terrible.  But, of course, I'm a Yelper, what did y'all expect?).

Go to Zante's next time you are in the mood for pizza and adventure.  Try the Indian pizza with a side of mango chutney.  No joke, slathering the chutney on the pizza makes it taste pretty freaking fabulous!
author: Marisa D.

description:
Pizza is expensive, but you tell me where else I can get a good Tandoori pizza in the city? I just don't like Preet's and Golden Gate Pizza is out of 90% of the city's delivery zone.

So they deliver everywhere, get me a pizza with lamb prawns chicken and cilantro, listen to my instructions for extra masala sauce, no cauliflower...and it seems they even gave me extra chicken to compensate for the lack of cauliflower!

I will buy again, but the expense means it will probably be not as frequent as I would like.
author: Stevie D.

description:
Can't say enough about how nice the people are. We typically order a plain cheese pizza. It's better than Haystack and they deliver. When you want a simple no frill pizza, this is the place to go. 

We've tried the Indian Veggie Pizza and it is also good.
author: Robin H.

description: Don't order online. It's been almost 2 hours...still waiting. Called the restaurant twice and kept getting "It's coming"...it's not coming.
author: Robert M.

description: Wow! I've got to say; I'm not a huge Indian fan, but their pizza is a revelation. It is beyond delicious.
author: Jesse L.

description:
Don't be fooled by appearance. The place looked closed, but I'm glad we tried going in. 
We were starving so ordered the appetizer sampler and a half chicken masala, half "best Indian" pizza. Ironically, the chicken masala half was much tastier. The apps were a little dry and came out the same time as our pizza, as did our drinks. The pizza was very good. I'll go back and get a full chicken masala.
author: Mary H.

description: Tried various forms of naan, tandoori chicken and veg samosas. The samosas were very salty and over fried. The Naan was whole wheat (not specified) and some type of seed in it, and was a different texture than most naan I've tried. The tandoori chicken was okay. They do have free delivery though
author: Hannah M.

description: Uh, yeah, just had their Indian pizza, instant food boner, left quickly before I bought the place ;)
author: Gabriel G.

description:
Pros:
-Definitely the most delicious Indian food in that part of town
-There's nothing quite like their Indian pizza
-They deliver 

Cons:
-Not the friendliest phone manners
-Slow and unpredictable delivery - do yourself a favor and pick it up yourself
-They had a very poor health score earlier in 2013 but recently restored it to 100.  That said, even since then, I've seen some of their questionable food prep practices still going on (such as cutting vegetables outside of their back door on cutting boards placed on a stairwell ledge).  I haven't had any health issues as a result of eating their food though.
author: Dan C.

description: A very mediocre and not so hygienic restaurant. Not sure if the pizzas were freshly made, they all look and taste stale. Twice I bought from this place in a span of 9 months, both the times I was disappointed. The curries are made with the same spices and anything daal tastes horrible. Do not recommend this place.
author: Ram A.

description: Pure awesomeness at Zante - this place is a SF gem for Delhi style indian fare and Indian pizza. Better than all of the Indian joints on valencia combined. Run don't walk, or order for delivery ... You won't be disappointed.
author: Andrew K.

description: Went here for dinner with my best friend and it was ok. Think I made the mistake of getting the meat pizza instead of the veggie pizza. Will give it another try though.
author: Minh H.

description: I'm a fan of the Indian Pizza. It is a casual place to maybe take a date or a person who likes to try new foods and bring them back once they get hooked on Indian Pizza.
author: Cristina K.

description:
I went here with a vegan and we shared a Bengan Bhartha (eggplant) pizza with no cheese.  I didn't enjoy the pizza, but the vegan loved it.  Hey, the place is really clean and the staff is super nice.

The second time I tried the place was via delivery to my house.  I ordered the chicken tikka masala sauce pizza (it's called the Best Indian Pizza with Chicken Tikka Masala sauce).  Like every beginner Indian food eater, I love chicken tikka masala.  On the pizza, the sauce was thin, the chicken was tiny (think bacon bits) and the crust could have been cooked a little longer.  It didn't satisfy the Indian food craving nor the chicken craving.  Darn!  I really wanted this to be better!

Note:  I'm a thin crust pizza lover and have not found a good one in SF (let me know).
author: Jeff H.

description:
Do not order online.   Pay cash.
Their Indian pizza really is good, I recommend it.   I have only done delivery or pick-up, and have not had anything other than pizza.  On more than one occassion, I had to call to say where's my pizza after an hour.  "It will be there in 5 minutes!"  It was(!), but still, why wait til the customer calls.
author: David B.

description: I actually really like the food, however the last 2 times I ordered from this place it taken forever to have the food delivered. I  ordered through eat24 and kept track of the timing on the app. While food is decent, not worth waiting that long to have delivered. Hopefully they'll step up their game soon.
author: Mike S.

description:
I ordered food over two hours ago.  It's not here.  After about an hour, I called and they said it'd be here in ten minutes tops.  They haven't answered a call since then.  It's Sunday night - not Friday or Saturday.  So, I've decided that this is one to AVOID FOR DELIVERY!

Update:  After 2.5 hours it's finally here.  And (drum roll) it's flavorless sludge.
author: Brian L.

description:
Yuck. Pizza delivered cold with no chicken. Seeing as it was suppose to be a Tandoori Chicken Masala Pizza, we were disappointed. I called to ask for a full refund, but they offered $5 back instead. WAIT WHAT. You ruined our dinner, and you want to give me only $5 back? No offer for a full credit either. I let him know that it was bad customer service and he reluctantly offered me $6 instead.

If you live further than a mile away, your pizza will probably be cold (if it's even the right pizza you ordered.)

No good :(
author: Kristyn G.

description:
I was desperate for Indian food so I decided to order from Zantes since it was close to my house and they delivered. Not only did they forgot party my order, but the food was just bad overall. Basically I paid 55 for food that I will have to throw in the trash. I paid ten dollars alone for the sheikh kabob got 5 tiny pieces a box full of onions. The kabob tasted like it came out of a frozen box, it was absolutely disgusting!!! The tikka masala and the biryani was just ok. I have had much better that I couldn't eat more than two bites before throwing it away. The naan was just ok. Nothing special. Overall, Indian food here is just bad! 

If your looking for authentic, edible and good tasting Indian food, don't order from here!!!!
author: frieda a.

description:
Both the Best Vegetarian and Paneer Tikka Masala pizzas are wonderful vegetarian options - so full of flavor! The crust combines the best of naan's springiness and a good pizza crust's crisp-outside-soft-inside, and it's very good when dipped in the supplied chutney. 

Holding back a star because I haven't tried dining in here, nor any of the other menu selections.
author: Cat C.

description: This is our local favorite and can even say the best Indian restaurant in the city.  Great service, reasonable price and unpretentious atmosphere. We felt we were in India once we stepped into the restaurant.  We felt very comfortable. Loved chicken tikka masala and prawn tikka masala let alone the delicious pizza.  We have yet to try all other dishes. Highly recommend to anyone who enjoys authentic Indian food. Huge plus for opening late at night.
author: kazue w.

description:
Zante's always reminds me of that Jim Collins management book, Good to Great. In it, Collins suggests that companies identify their hedgehog concept and stick to it. In other words, what is it that you can be the best at in the world? 

For Zante's, they're the best at Indian pizza. That is their hedgehog concept, their version of Walgreens as the convenient pharmacy.

Their kind of gimmicky idea is wonderfully and tastily executed. The veggie pizza is a belly filler. Goes great with drizzles of samosa (plum?) sauce. It's the most guilt free version of pizza I know, with no cheese and lots of veggies. Just let yourself go!

Fun place to eat in, though I missed the Bollywood videos last time. More fun with the TV on.
author: Shana H.

description:
We had the vegetarian pie and added tandoori chicken.  I'm glad I tried it, but probably won't be back.

Here's a tip though, those lamb samosas were mighty fine.
author: Amy W.

description:
Let's be honest. 

It's Friday night, you're drunk, pizza is easy, and you don't even have to pick up the phone (thanks to fancy cell phones you can get what you want without even asking anyone for it!) - Indian pizza? For real? YES. So, I can't speak for the other food. Or the quality of the pizza when un-intoxicated, but I DO recommend Zante's for these particular wine-induced occasions.

"The Best Indian Pizza" - I smell of curry and couldn't be happier.

They deliver all over SF so a bit of a wait is to be expected.
author: Briana F.

description: Panir Tika Masala pizza?  You bet, and it's amazing.  The standard Indian dishes are also great.
author: Paul M.

description:
If a yelp review was only concerned with the food, then this place would get a 5 star review from me. Unfortunately, food cannot always be separated from its location, and that's what brings this review down to 3 stars. 
We stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch. It was pretty dark in the restaurant because of the overcast weather outside, but there were only a couple of lights on, and the shades were drawn on the windows. There were maybe 10 people total in this restaurant, but there was only one waiter, who also appeared to be the cashier and possibly the owner? It took 15 minutes for him to come back to us and take our order, and we ordered the tikka masala pizza and lentil soup as a starter. The soup came out about 15 minutes after that, but then the pizza didn't come out for an additional 45 minutes! I find it hard to imagine it takes an hour to cook the pizza, and there weren't enough people in the restaurant to make up for the lag. 
That being said though, the lentil soup was flavorful and the tikka masala pizza was DELICIOUS. The crust was curry flavored, and the portions were very generous. 

My recommendation? Get this food to go.
author: Maddy L.

description:
Indian Pizza is F*&KIN       A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!!!!
OMG THE BEST PIZZA EVER!!!!

Nothing like Italian style pizza. The dough is a nann bread made into a large pizza with a vegetarian paneer type sauce and a sprinkle of cheese on top...

I was skeptical about the taste but Im soo addicted to this style of food.

IF YOU DONT KNOW.......THEN YOU DONT KNOW!

A hidden gem! Please let this not be over-run by hipsters and hipster prices....

I didnt give it a 5 star rating only because theyre not too friendly and they lack customer service.....

but the pizza is  so godam amazing!!!!
author: MacKenzie S.

description:
I've tried this place twice for delivery. The first time I ordered regular Indian food and it was just OK. The delivery took a long time too - about 1.5 hours.

I wasn't going to try them again but felt it just wasn't fair to write off an Indian pizza place without trying the pizza. So last night we ordered the chicken tandoori pizza and unfortunately it wasn't that good either. 

I've never eaten inside so I can't comment on the ambiance or service. But after two tries of delivery I don't think I'll be eating here in the future.
author: Jamar I.

description:
Had this pizza in-house and it was delicious! Ordered for delivery a few weeks later and ended up with a headache and cold pizza. Delivery took about 2 hours. We tried calling twice and both times were told "five minutes!" (once at 60 minutes in, the second at 90 minutes in). When the pizza finally arrives 120 minutes after ordering... it was beyond cold. 

So, I suggest making this a eat-in spot only-- never take out.
author: Hazel J.

description:
Worst restaurant ever
I just ordered their chef special thali and it turned out to be an absolute disaster.
The starters were made out of absolutely stale meat. They were raw and colored with artificial color. I will never ever order from this restaurant again and i advise people to be careful.
author: Ajinkya S.

description: Pizza here is amazing. Unlike any other pizza in the city. It's Indian food pizza. As good as it sounds. Duh.
author: Peter S.

description: We've been going to Zantes for years. However, tonight's dinner was just disgusting. The nan tasted like someone put dish soap in it. Some of the food was salty past being edible. Plus, everything was cold. Sadly, we've placed our last order.
author: Michael S.

description:
My partner was craving pizza, but it was kinda late and we didn't want to drive all over town or order in.  He remembered seeing a pizza place at Cortland and Mission and suggested we check it out.  We walked in expecting a pizza place, but it was an Indian restaurant!  We were intrigued and, honestly, not expecting much.  We tried to order a meaty pizza (don't remember what all was on it... they only have a few options really!) and the waiter said, "No!  Indian pizza!"  So we said, "OK....  We'll have a large." and he said, "No!  Large is too big!  It's for 3 or 4 people.  You get medium!"  So we said, "OK...."

Not only was the Indian pizza delicious, but it was GORGEOUS!  Very colorful!  And we had some left over to have for breakfast (yum!) the next day!  

Good thing we didn't get the large!
author: Michael H.

description:
I ordered in from Zante on a Monday night where I wanted food delivered straight to my door. Zante is great for that because they advertise free delivery anywhere citywide. I don't think I'm the best test of this policy as I live not even a mile from Zante.

I know they make food other than pizza but the great thing about Indian pizza is you can hit two cravings in one go. I ordered the Indian vegetarian which comes topped with spinach, eggplant, cauliflower, ginger, garlic, onions, & cilantro. The delivery came a little after the estimated 40 minutes (~1 hr) but I was kind of expecting as much so I was still satisfied. The aroma wafting from the box was definitely the traditional Indian spices. 

I was impressed by the pizza, I've have "Indian Pizza" before but in the past it has usually been a combination of my typical Indian fare (i.e., Saag Paneer or Tikka Masala) poured onto a pizza crust. The Indian Vegetarian plays more like what pizza would have been like if it was created in Indian. I thought the blend of veggies, sauce, and spices was excellent. It is of course different than your typical pizza or Indian food and of course hybrids never live up to the standards of either of the components. But overall I'd have to say that they executed this one about as well as one could hope for.
author: Stephen S.

description:
Oh yes oh yes! Zante Indian Pizza is finally MINE! 

After having Zante bookmarked for forever, I finally made my way over to indulge in this mysterious delicacy called Indian Pizza 

Being a spinach-hater, asked if they could make it sans the slimy spinach & was advised..... no. 

At 1st, I was heartbroken but when they quickly explained that it was b/c the spinach wasn't an actual topping but rather a part of the "pesto-like sauce" they use for the base of the pizza, the sun shone again 

Cheese pulling in strings as I take a slice off the pie, crust is thin but not too thin & has a great chewy consistency w/ a crispy outer crust.  And the veggies are cut so small, you get little nibbles of goodness in every bite (cauliflower, eggplant, ginger, garlic, green onions & cilantro)

It was fantastic hot & fresh, it was fantastic cold & left over.... Just a bit spicy & oh-so flavorful.....it must be love, LOVE, LOVE

Also indulged in the Chilli Cheese Naan - cheesy bread w/ its spicy dipping sauce & have to say that was a bit spicer than the pizza, just as cheesy & oh-so good.  Big doughy circle of goodness enveloping the ooey, gooey cheese......this was only tasty hot

So can't really recommend 1 over the other - you just gotta get them both
author: Adrienne G.

description: Walked in and ordered for takeout on a Wednesday evening. My pizza and samosas were ready in under 20 minutes and the gentlemen that helped me were very nice. I ordered the vegan pizza - which I believe is just their veggie pizza with no cheese. It was pretty good, but did need a little something (I used the sauces from the samosa to punch of the flavors a bit). All in all really interesting flavors - especially, I'd imagine, for meat-eaters. And lovely service, too!
author: Mary E.

description:
I originally wrote a not-so-favorable review of Zante's, and the knock was against the uneven quality of the pizzas.

I ended up ordering from Zante's many, many times in the subsequent two years, because I thought that Indian pizza was a fun novelty and a good San Francisco-ish dish to show visiting friends (especially on rainy nights when delivery looked appealing).

The quality of the pizza (after many, many samples) is very high.  The crust has been doughy on one or two occasions, but overall the ingredient and pizza quality is very, very good.

The "Best Indian Pizza" is awesome -- word of warning, it's extremely filling.  My brother, my girlfriend, and I split a large pizza, and we walked around for an hour damned near gut-busted afterwards.

Usually I'll end up custom ordering a pizza with tandoori chicken or eggplant and pair it with a side veggie or two.   Tasty stuff.

Delivery is usually on time, but occasionally had troubles finding my place.

I would highly recommend trying Zante's, especially if you're new to Indian food and/or the city.
author: Bill H.

description:
The Indian food slash pizza combo sounded genius. I thought "Wow, I can get both? Or I can get an actual 'Indian Pizza'? Why didn't I think of this sooner!" Mmmmmm Indian food on top of a pizza..... Like some uniquely themed porn you spot at the sex shop, thinking to yourself that you like both casual visits to the zoo AND hawt girl on girl, two passions not often related. So obviously spotting a title like "Hot Lezzies Of The Wild" would be a good fit right? I dig pizza and I very much like Indian food, I thought this was a match made in heaven.

Well, this would be one of those cases I was wrong. I got the Indian pizza and while it wasn't *bad* it certainly wasn't *good*. There was this thin eggplant paste that was pretty much the majority of the "Indian" part of the pizza, a few other sporadic veggies, and some cilantro. The flavor was bland, I was extremely let down as this was my 'stay in on a Saturday and watch movies, chill, kill zombies, and eat good food' night.

I was sad. Maybe their straight Indian food is better or their regular pizzas, but as for forcing the two together I'd label that a fail. Back to the porn I'm saying you got home, busted out "Hot Lezzies Of The Wild" just to find out it's actually sweaty fat chicks dressed up in animal costumes rolling around in mud.

Certainly not what you were hoping for in the porn, and Zante was definitely not what I was expecting in an "Indian Pizza".
author: Justin N.

description: Nom nom nom nom nom, so freaking good and worth every penny, indian pizza is so good and the dippin sauces they come with are sooo good. The crust is different from regular pizza crust but sooo flavorful.
author: Giovanie R.

description:
Indian Style Pizza O MY! 

You either Likey Alot or you hate it. No middle ground at Zantes. The oddest thing I find here, ist hat their veggie Pizza is better than their meat options, which is not usually the case. Regardless 2 Thumbs up for Indian Pizza, who would of thought right? I'm lucky I can swing by and pick me up a 3 dollar slice whenever I please oh oh oh Lucky me.
author: Lannette G.

description:
Really good pizza....old-school local pizzeria crust but the paneer masala and Indian veggie split pizza was excellent.  Strong flavors all around....fits well with the doughy crust.  

Picked up...no comment about the delivery.  People really expect delivery to work in SF?
author: Craig T.

description:
I've lived near Zante's for more than 20 years, so I order from them often. 

They do pizza the way I like it (thin crust, pesto sauce, mushrooms & garlic). 

Now and then, I order Indian food and am seldom disappointed. Their naan is great, and so's their lamb-spinach curry. I think AlHamra offers more tandoori chicken for the same price.

I've never had to wait more than around 45 minutes for either Indian food or pizza... so I'm happy with them.
author: Gretchen B.

description:
I rarely call Zante's for delivery and here's why:

Ordered online at 5:45pm. At 7pm no pizza. I called them up and am told the delivery guy is going to leave in five minutes. That's an hour and 15 minutes after the order for those not counting. The pizza showed up at 7:30 and it was cold. I called them to complain and here's where the fun starts.

The guy told me my pizza was delivered an hour ago and that the driver is standing next to him. Can you imagine the absolute balls of steel you have to have to tell someone who just opened their door to the delivery man that you've had your pizza for an hour? I can, because I witnessed it. Right now I'm seriously considering driving down to Zante's and kicking this guy in his balls to find out if I'm right.
author: Mark F.

description:
Zante is me and my BF's favorite Indian pizza restaurant. (This review is only for their Indian pizza.)

Pros:
- Great Indian pizza!
- The restaurant has never been crowded. 
- There's a small parking lot on the backside of the building.

Cons:
- The decor is pretty bad. It's old and no atmosphere. It's cold... 
- Bathrooms are pretty old and it doesn't look clean or just too old. 
- Don't expect good service. Very minimum amount of smile and communications.
- The price is little bit high.

Recommendation:
- Although the restaurant has no atmosphere, it's better to have their pizza there. Their dough tastes so good when it's just out of the oven. It gets kind of heavy when it gets cold.
author: Mariko H.

description:
This was five stellar quality. I was expecting a basically pre-coated naan with curry, but: no. It was a real pizza. With real cheese. And a special vegetarian curry mixed in with that cheese that was such a fine combo.

And the waiter was really good at singing to himself and keeping us in the best of spirits.
author: David S.

description: I like their Best Indian Pizza with Meat. You can't really taste the lamb, eggplant, cauliflower. I was surprised all that stuff was on there when I decided to pick up one myself. I've always had it at my friends' houses. I was leery, but am now a fan!
author: Freckles H.

description: We heard about this place from an article. On our recent trip to SF, we had an opportunity to try it out. After a long day of walking and sightseeing, I was not up for another bus trip during rush hour. We ordered our pizzas on line. Got the indian pizza with Chicken masala for the three of us that like that sort of thing.  Also got a ham and veggie pizza for the one who likes standard pizza. The pizzas arrived at our hotel in 45 mins, piping hot.  Would definitely get the Indian Pizza again. Spicy tamarind and mint chutneys served with it were a plus. I did not try the ham and veggie pizza, but the person who did liked it.  I want to try the paneer pizza next. Highly recommended!
author: Laura B.

description: After hearing about this place and the great Indian pizza here, I decided to try it out, and was pleasantly surprised by how great it was. It wasn't just regular pizza with Paneer and Spinach, but it had Indian spices and flavors. Even the crust was delicious, with basil. The pizza came with extra Tamarind and Avocado (?) chutney; dipped the crust into it, and it was tasty! It was quite really a very unique pizza! The only thing I didn't like was how oily and greesy it was, but I guess that was expected. Next time, I am going to try out the Pander Tikka Masala with the pizza!
author: Ravish C.

description:
I wanted Indian pizza while in SF, and this place satisfied.

I ordered the Indian paneer vege pizza last month, and it was great. I got their XL one for $30 and it feeds 6 ppl easily.

I'm surprised I just found out about it, my family has been in SF for 5+ years, and I can happily say their pizza is just as good as the Pizza and Curry place in Fremont.

When I went, there weren't many customers so we got great service.
author: Matt C.

description:
This is my secret combo that I always love putting together when I'm at Zante's.......................Indian Pizza and Chicken Tikka Masala Sauce!!!!  I order the Indian pizza, the meat version, and then I dip that heavenly slice into their tikka masala sauce.  It is pure bliss!   Again, it's only the sauce (aka, without the chicken) because the pizza is enough.  Really good stuff and would always go back to get this combo.  Add along chai tea.....yum!!!!

Note:  you may have to run several miles just to shed the pounds off after downing this wonderful combo.
author: Nerinna V.

description: Worst delivery service ever 2 hours for a large pizza and some chicken fritters never again don't order delivery from here I don't know why they offer delivery if they can't keep up with orders hire more drivers just don't support this business if they are wrong they won't even honor it chicken fritters tasted really bad
author: Wagner P.

description: THE WORST DELIVERY EVER! waited 2 hours for food to arrive. DELIVERY GUY: HAD NO SENSE OF GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE! NO ETIQUETTE WHATSOVER! when he arrived, he called demanding to meet him outside the building to get our food. came out to meet him and then he demanded a tip. it was his demanding that pissed me off! asked him if he really thinks he deserves a tip after being 2 HOURS LATE. DELIVERY GUY SAID, "SCREW YOU, NO FOOD FOR YOU!" i was appalled. he ran back to his car with the food and drove off! never had that happen before. i was such a fan of this place, ordered with them for a least 3 years. called the restaurant about the incident, didn't do anything about it (what's new?). NEVER WILL ORDER AT ZANTE'S AGAIN!  THANK GOODNESS FOR OTHER INDIAN RESTAURANTS OUT THERE.
author: Claude C.

description:
I ordered the Indian vegetarian pizza online and was told to call if I did not receive a phone call within 10-15 minutes. I called them to confirm my order 25 minutes later when I did not hear back and the rudest man answered and said he did not get an order online. When I tried to tell him my order number but he dismissed me and then I tried to verbally give my order on the phone and he was terribly upset for no reason. He even said, "ugh, oh my god" when I only wanted to order a pizza and nothing else. 

The pizza was very oniony and this coming from a girl who loves onions. Horrible pizza combined with bad service equals a bad Yelp review.
author: Lorna L.

description:
Decent local place with quick delivery but I didn't think it was anything special. 

Husband ordered a custom pizza with a few types of meat, he ate it all but the man will eat just about anything in pizza or burrito form. I didn't have any of the pizza but it looked a little under-topped for ordering something with 4 different topping items. 

I ordered the veggie pakora and it was crazy salty and overcooked, chewy and just not appealing. Thankfully I also had ordered a mango lassi to tame the saltiness. The lassi was good, creamy and a decent size... but, I was so overtaken by the pakora that I ended up not even finishing my little meal and saved the mango lassi for the following morning (yes, it was still tasty even after sitting overnight in the fridge). 

I'm not sure what those who gave Zante's 4 stars had... must have been a much better night for them.
author: Littany W.

description:
The food is absolutely delicious. The service is the WORST I have ever experienced. 2 and a half hours to get our $30 pizza after multiple calls and promises that it would be here soon. It was room temperature, also. WHAT THE FUCK. The guy that answers the phone is a complete asshole. Short, cuts you off mid sentence, etc. 

The one star here is only for the food tasting good. As a person who worked in restaurants and bars for 7 years, I tend to be understanding if shit's not perfect. But this is completely unacceptable. I HIGHLY recommend getting your Indian pizza somewhere else.
author: Cara S.

description:
I should've listened to the Yelpers but I ordered from Zante's anyway. 
It's all true -  the food is the bomb - delivery sucks. 
Disrespectful, rude, late ---- I had to cancel our order and quickly order from a not so good place for a work birthday lunch. They guaranteed a 12:30 delivery - I even called yesterday to confirm and had Eat Street confirm with them too. EatStreet once again called to confirm after I placed the order today. 
I called at 12:40 and they said they were on their way. I called at 12:54 and they said they were on the way. By that time I had to place an order elsewhere as staff had to return to work at 1:30 pm.  EatStreet gave me  a full refund. 
Zante called at 1:13 pm and said they were close -- I said we cancelled the order. 
Zante's was the first place I ever had Indian food many, many years ago. I've dined-in and done pick-up 30+ times throughout the years. 
They lost me as a customer and my recommendations (which have been aplenty) due to their utterly rude behavior today. 
The food is great but I'd rather support restaurants that provide good food and actually care about their customers.
author: Carson R.

description:
Zante's is pretty good. This is the only place i've ever had Indian pizza, so I'm not sure what to compare it to. But here's the low-down:

Location: On the corner of Mission and Cortland in Bernal. 

Vibe: Simultaneously cheap (paper placemats) and nice (white cloth napkins). Warm in the restaurant, but they don't give you ice with water. Kind of odd, overall. 

Pizza: Tasty. Got a medium meat pizza ($19), which came piled with pork, shrimp, and chicken. It was yummy, and we couldn't finish the whole thing. 

OK, we could finish the whole thing, but we were full and I'm a bit ashamed of us. 

Beer: We ordered beer because it's so cheap here. $2.50 American, $3 imports. When was the last time you had a non-happy hour $3 Heineken at a restaurant in San Francisco? I mean really?

You'll enjoy it. No fine dining experience, but overall enjoyable.
author: Tom P.

description:
I have eaten and enjoyed Zante's Indian pizza many times over a number of years now, so thought I should finally add my yelp of approval.  I always get the vegetarian Indian pizza, of which you can find a photo and ingredients on Zante's website.  

I think the idea of Indian pizza kind of speaks for itself.  It's brilliant.  Often when it comes up, people assume that this must be a pizza made on naan bread, which it is not, but this turns out to be a good thing in my mind, because who wants to fill up on a thick crust?  I also appreciate that even though Zante serves Indian pizza - an obvious signature dish - they don't let themselves slack on the other more conventional Indian food on the menu.  I mean, it's not the best Indian food you've ever had, but it's solid, and some dishes are legitimately spicy.  
*Tips: (1) Order papadum; it is spicy and good, and you will get chutneys with it that you can put on your pizza.  (2) Most importantly, order saag, dip your Indian pizza in it.  

I have actually never been inside Zante and, despite having always gotten it delivered, have never been the one in charge of placing the order, so I can't really speak to other folks' complaints about that process.  My friend who always takes care of the ordering says that it is best to do it online.  It's true that it can take a hell of a long time for your food to show up, but if you know that, you can plan around it.  I still think Indian pizza is worth it.
author: Josh C.
