description: First Yelp! Review. Frequent giver of direct praise and accolades when experiences, service, or goods meet or exceed expectations or even standards. Anger when channelled is a motivating and powerful force and healthy to make change. I certainly hope zante makes some changes as their service and product are woefully lacking and unduly hyped. Steer clear. Do NOT under any circumstances get delivery. After an hour estimate and two hours later after a cold listless and seemingly aggrandized pizza was delivered by an entitled pie hole. If I could eat their words, I would be semi-satisfied but still feel duped. If you are into bait and switch and begging for things, this is your S&M home slice. I just feel empty, teased, hungry for more...or something other than zante.
author: Kami K.

description:
I have to say that Zante's is excellent when they get it right.

I ordered the pizza for delivery the second over the phone, instead of using the website, and they got the order right.  The guy who delivered my order this time was polite and helpful.

The vegan pizza is truly exceptional. It is spiced just right and doesn't try to hard to taste like pizza. The chutneys are fantastic.
author: Mel C.

description: I ordered an Indian pizza and the appetizer sampler.  It took over 1.5 hours to arrive, and everything was cold.  Cold pizza is edible.  Soggy and cold samosas and pakoras are not.  They gave me a partial refund, hence the extra star, but I won't be ordering from them again.
author: Seong P.

description:
I didn't come here for years because the cynical part of me dismissed Zante's as nothing more than a gimmick. It took my friends twisting my arm to give it a chance, and that chance was granted reluctantly and with a bit of sulking. I am so, so happy I took them up on this place, though: Zante's is awesome! There's a lot to love about traditional pizza and traditional (if Americanized) Indian food, and the combination is something that really does work quite well. 

I came here with three friends, and we ordered the a medium indian pizza and the Pure Vegetarian Thali. For about $12 each plus tax and tip we got a metric asston of food. That's four standard buttloads. The pizza was wonderfully aromatic. The crust reminded me more of naan than of the Sicilian style crispy goodness that I grew up with, but the toppings balanced that out with a fiery yet mellow flavor profile. 

On the non-pizza side of things, their Samosas are excellent. It had that crispy, almost crunchy texture that I felt was missing from the pizza. I enjoyed their Raita over the salad they provided; I felt its mellow coolness really complemented the pizza's zip. The stand out to me was their Chana Masala, though: chickpeas, spice, and pure unadulterated comfort. Their Kheer was an excellent end to the evening, and I got to eat most of it because everyone else was stuffed. 

The moral for me is "don't be so cynical" and for anyone reading this? "Go try some Indian pizza, 'cause you won't be sorry."
author: Aaron Y.

description:
Been to a few Indian Pizza joints and Unfortunately this one is one of the worst. Had the Indian vegetarian and was disappointed after the first bite. Try curry and pizza in Fremont for a true Indian pizza and CanAm in Seattle/Canada. 

These guys need to spice up their food in order to be considered competition with the other two.
author: Sunny J.

description:
For the Pizza only. Janette and I finally got to try this after seeing Michelle and Eddie check in here a bunch of times.

Mango Lassi - a must order if you like anything mango. Pretty much an indian mango shake. Its similar to Mango Calpico, but thicker and more yogurty. This thing absolutely wrecks any mango shake (boba, ice cream, calpico, etc ), and its such a great order to cool down any spicy foods.

Indian Pizza - insanely addicting. I swear, Zante's tricks you into eating veggies with how good this pizza is. Stand a lone, you're getting a spinach, cauliflower, chicken tandoori, some shrimp, mozarella over a spinacy sauce and curry sauce layer. The pizza dough seems to be doughy, yet light (maybe Roti dough is thrown in), and have a yellow color, probably from tumeric. It is amazing. If you like a garlic pizza (similar to garlic clam pizzas), this is the pizza to get. While there is a lot of masking of flavor (the garlic is over powering at times, the tandoori is chopped so that there aren't many large chicken chunks or huge tandoori flavor), it just tastes freaking good (then again I can eat a ton of garlic).

The key to the pizza - ASK for spicy and sweet sauce. The spicy sauce is a cilantro/pepper cream based sauce... that is seriously crack. While hot stand alone, the heat actually goes away when mixed with the pizza and adds another layer of flavor, though it also heavily emphasizes the garlic. The sweet sauce appears to be a tamarind based vinegar/sugar sauce, which also adds a layer of complexity when combined with the pizza.

I can't emphasize how ridiculously addicting this pizza was. It really is so different.
author: Marc T.

description: Yes, you should try the Indian pizza. You'll have to wait for it but try it once. The Indian dishes there are really good, too. I like Zante's better than Spicy Bite--two doors down . I won't ever order the pizza again but it was worth trying for the novelty. Big ups to the Rogan Josh. Naan was a little thick for my party's tastes but we lived.
author: Robert S.

description:
Two words: Indian. Pizza.

I was really disappointed when I moved and realized there was no wonderful Indian Pizza spot within walking distance from my new diggs. Alas, Zante delivers to the TL/Civic Center area, which is pretty awesome.

I was impressed on my first order that the Medium size is generous, but a word of advice: Just eat that entire thing tonight. It definitely loses something in the cool down, store, reheat process. Still super tasty, but not the same.

I've found their delivery time estimate tends to be about 45 minutes. You better crack open another beer and sit back down cause it'll probably be more like an hour, hour fifteen.
author: Reishi A.

description:
Food is great-  unfortunately, I was told by the delivery guy today that they would no longer deliver to me because I live in the Presidio- so I won't be ordering from them again.

All I'm saying: If you say "city wide" you should mean city wide.
author: Xander K.

description: Have tried lots of pizza joints in the city, but this is our favorite. Great flavors, crispy base. The negative reviews seem to be mostly associated with delivery, but I pick ours up and it's always been good. Tried Samosas once and they were so-so, but we'll keep going back for the Indian pizza!
author: Mike Y.

description:
This place is great on some days and eh, good on others. 

The chicken tikka masala is REALLY good but a little too THICK. The naan is really good when fresh but on some days it doesn't taste fresh- like it was made hours before eating it.
author: Jessie A.

description: Decently flavorful, ridiculous wait times for delivery, and skimpy portions on the pizza.
author: Seghel Y.

description: NO STARS.  I have NEVER EVER paid so much and waited so long for such miniscule amounts of food.  I'm so angry and disgusted!  I feel like taking this place to small claims court!  The sad thing is, it used to be a relatively good place to get food from.  Not any longer!    What a waste of my hard-earned money!  DON'T GO HERE OR ORDER FOOD FROM HERE!
author: Sadie M.

description:
Wow, Zante Pizza, really?

And I mean that in the sort of "I'm disappointed and expected more of you" sort of way. I ordered the  Medium size Best Indian Pizza (non-vegan thank you very much) for delivery and was GREATLY saddened by tonight's experience!! First off, this is the 3rd time I've ordered from them and have had no problems up till now. Granted, they have to travel quite a few blocks to get to my apartment but still, no excuse for this:

ordered the pizza (remember, the one with everything on it: vegetables, lamb, tandoori chicken, and shrimp) and figured it would be around 40 mins for it to arrive based on previous experiences. Fast forward to AN HOUR AND A HALF later= no pizza. So we call asking where the pizza is and get some lame excuse : "the system was broken". Uh, what system? Your system for charging credit cards? Well, that worked super fast. The buzzer to the door outside the apartment? 'Cause directions on how to ring someone up are posted on the box where you push the buttons to call someone. Oh, and we gave you our apartment number and PHONE NUMBER TO CALL when you arrived. 

Shenanigans, Zante! I call shenanigans on you.

So we end up waiting another 15 mins outside the apartment to make sure the delivery guy sticks around this time and when he does arrive, he takes his sweet time getting out and giving us the pizza!! What the hell?! We asked if he tried calling but he brushed us off and left.

I'm a nice and rather lenient person, but not when I've waited a long ass time to eat. And it pains me to be mean to Zante 'cause they make delicious pizza and I've had good experiences before (especially eating at the actual establishment; they let my group bring outside wine!). However: late pizza, unapologetic pizza guy, lukewarm pizza, and SCANT/NO shrimp= mediocre review and a metaphorical slap on the wrist. (let us take a moment for that missing topping...*tear*)

Will I order again? Probably, but I'll be super detail oriented and give them directions on what to do once they get to my apartment, 'cause apparently they need it.

Damn you Zante, if only your pizza wasn't so yummy I'd be more self-righteously angry.
author: Amanda C.

description:
Last night I hosted a little shindig at my place..there was 8 of us. 
I ordered two XL Indian Pizzas, and one LG Veggie Indian Pizza, a Thali Feast, Samosas an pakoras. Needless to say, I over ordered. We were starved by the time the pizza arrived (I placed the order at 4pm for a 6:30 delivery..we didn't get the food until after 7) but we barely made a dent in the food! 
The Indian pizzas were delicious and full of flavor. I would steer away from their other dishes. The tandoori chicken way charcoaled and extremely dry. I couldn't even put them out..went straight into the trash can.
I'd definitely order the pizza again...and a plus for delivering city wide.
author: Mimi T.

description: Perfection! Wonderful vegetarian options and innovative pizzas.
author: Geri W.

description:
So, I have written a review before about how rude the guy on the phone is, but had never tried their pizza before. We had been to a friend's place last weekend and they had ordered pizza from here so I tried it for the first time. 

The pizza itself: Decent flavors without being extra-ordinary. We couldn't really tell what kind of meat it was because it was almost minced.

The after-effect: My wife is down with some serious food poisoning. 

Moral of the story: Avoid the place like the plague. Your stomach will thank you.
author: Rahul O.

description:
I really misjudged this place after our first visit, but thankfully I kept good on my word to try it again. After the second visit, my perspective began to change, and by now it is my favorite dive restaurant in the city! 

The key is remember that the nan is ten times better than the pizza, so order the traditional Indian food and forget the pizza! On our most recent visit we had garlic nan, the eggplant bharta and tofu masala, probably our two favorites here. So yummy!

I will save this note from my previous review: Other reviews have described the decor as poor to fair. That is one way of describing it, but I enjoy the ambiance, especially the low-fi AM radio station that the waiter occasionally sings along with. 

But as must be the case for the place to qualify as a dive, the best part is the price!
author: David S.

description:
Indian Pizza, need I say more?

Ok, I will.

I've only had the Indian pizza, veggie style, and chicken style.(which are the only ways it's offered)
I've had it to go and in the restaurant.
Consistently delicious everytime.

Why don't more places have indian pizza?
author: Lance h.

description:
I thought it was quite expensive for the quality of food.

Because our dishes came out so fast and becasue the meat was so tough we must conclude that it must has been prepared ahead of time and then reheated.

Service was decent and our waiter was very nice.

Haven't tried their pizza, only their entrees so I cannot comment on the pizza.

Overall, I don't intend on going back but if you decide to try it out I sincerely hope that your experience is better than mine.

Good luck.
author: Franco L.

description: I've only had the pizzas here, but I'm not sure I could bring myself to order anything else. The paneer tikka masala pizza is sooo good - especially with a little mint and tamarind sauces! Service is kind of spotty sometimes, but it's still really friendly.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Good - regular Indian dishes (e.g. curry, rice, na'an, etc)

We also ordered the ultimate combo pizza. It was heavy! I wasn't a huge fan of the toppings since it literally tasted like a bunch of random Indian dishes dumped on top of a bread crust. I couldn't make out the different elements...the only ingredient I'm sure of is heaviness. 

The pizza crust was very soft and yummy. I could have eaten more of that. In fact, they should have bread sticks made out of that pizza crust. 

I think the service was okay. It's definitely more casual as the waiter impatiently motioned us to pass our plates to him  as opposed to him coming to each of us to collect our plates.
author: Margaret R.

description:
Rating for very poor delivery service.

Ordered a chicken masala pizza for delivery, and we were quoted 40 min delivery time.  After an hour, we called and they assured us it was on the way.  After another 20 minutes, we tried to cancel the order, and they said they couldn't cancel it because they were almost at our house.  After waiting another 10 minutes, we left to go get burritos.  On our way back home the delivery driver was there (an hour late).  They did give us the pizza for free, but it was pretty cold.  Seemed like it could have been good, but the customer service ruined it for us.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
4 stars for the indian pizza. It is delicious!
Otherwise, the rest of the food is not very good,
doughy nan and under seasoned dishes.
author: Antoine P.

description:
I've been going to Zante's for some years now, and I was just there a couple of days ago, so I thought I'd write up a review.

This is for Indian pizza only. I've never tried anything else there (but why would you?).

Their Indian pizza is still good and solid. It's a bright, carnival of exotic ingredients on your pizza. BUT I did notice one thing - there was less garlic than I remember. Although the garlic was such an assault to the people around you after you had a slice at Zante's, it really was what made their pizza unforgettable.

It still is pretty darn good though.
author: Aya C.

description:
I'd heard about this Indian pizza a while ago but never tried it till tonight.  My husband and I decided to make this a lazy Monday order-in night, and the plan was to have the delivery around 8pm, when he was planning on getting back home.  Since I got home first, I went onto GrubHub to browse for a new place to try.  I saw Zante and remembered I had wanted to try it before.  I checked quickly on Yelp and saw it had 4 stars and the first few reviews sounded reassuring, so since it was already 7:30pm, I quickly ordered several things, including an Indian pizza, of course.

It wasn't until AFTER I placed the order that I kept browsing the rest of the Yelp reviews out of curiosity.  And to my dismay, I saw the numerous reviews describing poor service, horrible delivery times of 2 hours, cold pizza, and mixed up or lost orders.  I get a sinking feeling in my stomach.  Our late dinner was going to become a very very late dinner....

Or so I thought.

7:33pm - GrubHub order entered.  Estimated delivery time 8:23pm.

7:35pm - GrubHub confirmation email received.  Updated estimated delivery time is 8:25pm.

7:51pm - I call Zante to make sure the have at least received my online order.  The guy who answers the phone asks for my address, then quickly says "Yeah, we got your order.  It's leaving now."  short pause. "It's almost ready, it will leave in a few minutes."  Since it has only been 18 minutes since I put in my order, and since I've seen all the other Yelp reviews, I think to myself he must automatically say that for every phone call.  I ask him to read my my order.  He reads the items.  At least they really got the order.

7:56pm - Husband arrives home.  I tell him I ordered food but warn him we might have to wait a while, really worried that I ordered too quickly before doing thorough Yelp research....

8:04pm - Cell phone rings.  It's the delivery man.  He says he's downstairs.  I'm suspicious, thinking this is too fast to be real.  Is he calling before he's really here?

8:07pm - Delivery man arrives at our door with the food.  I'm in disbelief.  He's 18 minutes ahead of schedule, and barely half an hour after the order placed.

And the food?  It's all hot.  Normal take-out containers.  No soggy gooey cardboard boxes.  The pizza is quite good, and the rest (saag paneer, chicken mushroom, salad, raita, samosas) is pretty good too.  Lots of food for the price - enough for 3 full meals for the two of us.  We're both happy and very full!  Maybe I was just lucky?  Who knows.  I'd definitely order again.
author: Mai-Sie C.

description:
This place is pretty mediocre.  Delivery took an hour and twenty minutes. 

Lamb Samosa had a nice crunchy exterior, unfortunely the filling was pretty flavorless.

Could barely taste the difference between the Chicken Curry and Chicken Vindaloo. 
I didn't think it was possible for curry to be flavorless, but i was wrong.   Imagine making curry at home and the recipe calls for 1 cup of water but you put 3 cups of water.  

I have not tried the pizza and dont plan to.  There are too many good indian places in the mission to try this again.
author: Richard H.

description: Decent pizza, but horrible delivery.  I've done this twice now and had to call multiple times... each time "it will be there in 10 minutes" followed by 30 minutes later.  I'll never order from these guys again, they are totally unrealiable.
author: Bill D.

description: The Indian Pizza with mango chutney is really good but not good enough to make up for the overpriced pizzas, rude delivery drivers, delivery distance of 5 blocks taking literally hours. I was a regular customer and now I am thinking- never again.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
Excellent Indian pizza!
The aroma hits you the second you approach the door. Curry and spices fill the air. You know the food is going to be good when the smell makes your mouth water. Nothing spectacular about the ambiance or location, but the taste of the food and the service more than makes up for it. The pizza was so good I could barely stop myself from eating the entire thing!
A MUST TRY
author: Kelly M.

description:
These folks sell Indian food, regular pizza, and Indian pizza. Don't be thrown off by the distractors: it's the Indian pizza you want here.

Why hasn't this concept been copied elsewhere? It's all the goodness of Indian food on a naan-like crust, with a garlicky curried sauce base and the added deliciousness of cheese. I mean, duh. It's the best ever. And they deliver! The vegetarian version has amazing curried cauliflower florets, and the meaty version adds lamb and/or curried shrimp. I think my favorite incarnation is either the vegetarian or just lamb. 

The chutneys that come with the pizza (tamarind and mint-cilantro) are excellent dipping sauces for crust. 

I understand their vegan Indian pizza is also incredible.
author: Monica S.

description: I have ordered a Indian vegetable pizza and they said ok it will ready in 45 minutes be delivered and after 2 hours I called and said where is my pizza and they say we don't deliver there why ? We are just 15 minutes away why can't I get my pizza its really poor service please tell why ?
author: Sarb S.

description:
My friends had told me about this pizza and I had listened to their swoons dubiously.  Finally, I got a chance to try it for myself last night.  OMFG.  

It may look like a pizza, and you may eat it like a pizza, but that is where the comparison ends.  The crust really isn't like any pizza crust you have ever had.  It is fluffy and buttery and naan-like. (My friends recommended the veggie version instead of the meat version.)  We ordered a veggie Korma dish and a spicy eggplant dish, along with the traditional spicy green sauce and tamarind sauce that I spooned onto it as well.    It was unbelievably good.  Just unbelievable.  The crust just soaked up the sauces and the flavors and the cheese was just enough to add a mellow richness.  

Fantastic.  Our friends brought lovely bottles of wine - a Syrah and a Zinfindel.  Corkage is only $2.00 and they open the wine and provide wine glasses. 

Both wines went well with the pizza, which stood up well to a good bottle of red.  I love San Francisco.  If Austin, TX, opened up a place like this (I'm from Austin), there would be lines out the door and around the block.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Went here with 6 people and sat right down.  Food was great and server was very helpful.  Try the Chicken Tikka pizza!
author: Philip N.

description:
The most unique looking pizza I ever had. At first I was reluctant to try this place out, I figured what do Indians know about pizza?  Apparently they seem to know a lot, because the slice of vegetarian Indian pizza tastes good.  It was probably one best slices of vegetarian pizza I had in recent memory. The pizza smells like a Indian buffet and the indescribable toppings looks like it also came from it. The pizza was warm and the crust was crunchy. Service was fast and efficient. The place looked nice and clean. Indian pizza slices starts from 3 dollars and up. Meat can be added to the pizza slice.  I also tried the Indian meat pizza, that had Tandoori chicken on it. It was pretty good.  

Since this place is an Indian restaurant, it will be closed from 3 pm to 5 pm, so they can be prepared for the dinner rush. This is definitely my first choice for non Italian pizza. 

This is much better than Taco Bell Mexican Pizza! I look forward to trying the pizza again when I am in the neighborhood.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: I wish I had checked Yelp before I ordered my pizza. Of course, I am stoked they have vegan pizza options, but I have now been waiting 2.5 hours and it's still not here. The first time I called 1.5 hours in and they said "15 minutes." It's now been over an hour since then. I called a second time 15 minutes ago and it was "5 minutes," and the guy hung up on me! This place is bonkers. I will definitely not get take out from here again.
author: Michael P.

description:
Super friendly staff at 10pm on a Wednesday.

We all know it's not really pizza unless it's made in New York. The poor excuse for a pizza that we consume in San Francisco makes me a Sad Panda. 

I've never had Indian pizza before, but of all the pizza-like-foods I've tried (flat bread and other gourmet options), this was by far the best. I cannot wait to return here.
author: David K.

description:
AWESOME INDIAN PIZZA.

Me, Friday get-together in SF 7pm, several months back, as my friends said they were gonna get delivery from Zante:  "what's Indian pizza?"

Me, Friday get-together in SF 8pm, same evening:  "oh my lord, this is incredible pizza."  

Flavorful. Different. Wonderful. Addictive.  Ask me though what the toppings are from the taste, and I'd be hard-pressed to rattle off the ingredients without seeing their menu -- but the orchestra of flavors creates a symphony in your mouth.  Nice chewy dough as well.  And my friends had the foresight to order the chicken curry for dipping.

The rest of the food ordered was good -- but dear lord, that pizza. Since that evening we ordered twice again, all three times delivery was within an hour.  I've only done delivery so cannot speak to the in-dining experience.

Zante, one suggestion: Open an East bay location or deliver to Oakland?  Pleeeeeeze??
author: John Z.

description:
I would rate them negative 5, but I dont have that option.

We placed an order online at 6p. They never called to confirm as their site says, so we called 20 min later.  They said our order is on its way, prob. in 10 min or so.

So at 8p, we called to see what the hell was going on.  They said they dont have our order.  their online ordering is not working today.  WTF?  when we called the first time, we mentioned that we ordered online.

Never ordering from them again!!!
author: Hiromi M.

description:
In some cultures, it is customary to haggle over prices on just about everything, not just cars. So here is how to have a predictable, good experience with Zante's:

1. 2 hours before you wish to eat, call Zante's and order your pizza. They will tell you it will be there in 45 minutes, they are lying.

2. after an hour and 15 minutes, call and politely ask where it is, they will tell you "5-10 minutes away". more lies. Don't be discouraged if they simply pick up the phone and hang it up again. They do this when they're really busy. Keep calling until they'll talk to you. This step is crucial as you need to go on record at least once as complaining that your pizza is late.

3. at 90 minutes after calling, pre heat your oven to 350 and wash your hands.

4. at 2 hours, their driver will call you saying he's outside. when he hands you the pizza, but before giving him any money, open the box to confirm it's correct (they've been known to mix up pizzas and orders) and if it is yours, stick your finger in the cheese to confirm it's temperature (cold). Then tell the driver he's an hour and a half late, and the pizza's cold, and you'll give %65 of the price. He'll apologize profusely and accept your offer. In my case an X-Large Veggie indian pizza list price before tax and tip was $27.99, so this is a good one because you can basically whip out a $20 bill and say "take it or leave it"... they're not stupid and know that if you refuse the pizza it's a total loss, especially since you just stuck your finger in it. Don't feel bad about not tipping the driver, just like you wouldn't tip for crappy service in a restaurant.

5. take your pizza inside and transfer it to a baking sheet and put it in the oven for 10 minutes, and enjoy. Their Indian pizza is really delicious after all.

Bottom line is their service sucks, and seems to get worse every time. There is no reason we should be expected to take it from them just because they have a one of a kind delicious product that no one else in town provides. Get the Pizza you want at the price you want to pay, and if you plan ahead, you can actually have it when you want it, not 2 hours after. If they want to start getting $30 for their pizzas again they can hire more drivers so they can get them to us in a timely fashion.
author: Lars S.

description:
Indian food+Pizza=Meh.  It is just not that tasty.  Try Twin Peaks pizza for better pies, service.  

In addition, delivery guy is not that nice (drives Zante pickup, blocks traffic in the street in Bernal and annoys residents).
author: Henry F.

description:
Ever since I moved from the Mission, I haven't been able to find anything like Zante's. Their pizza was culinary crack fuel for so many starving-student all-nighters. Tender dough crusted with cornmeal and generously slathered with an Indian masala-cheese sauce, heaped with moist bits of chicken, red onions and garlic. Oh heavenly aroma. My friends would wonder why there was always a slice or two missing when I arrived at their house a few blocks away.

On more than one occasion, I've ordered a slice to-go and opened the box to find two slices or even a quarter slab of pizza. They take care of their regulars is what I'm saying. 

Dine-in Highlights: chicken makanwala and mango lassi - maybe the best in the city.
author: Jaime Y.

description: I just ordered delivery. The website and confirmation email said 30-45 minutes. Just shy of two hours after placing the order the food arrives cold. I asked for a discount but was refused. Definitely avoid this place. I sent the food back.
author: Jason R.

description:
The vegetarian Indian pizza is one of my favorite delivery foods. I also enjoy their order online service. But keep your phone nearby for their order confirmation call and if you don't here from them in 15 minutes I would suggest just calling them yourself to confirm. 

The pakora and samosas are also very fresh and flavorful and are a great addition to any Indian pizza order.

They deliver to most places in the city and are pretty fast.
author: Leuwam T.

description:
Their vegetarian indian pizza is amazing and always the one dish I want to show guests when they visit San Francisco.  I'm not a vegetarian but it loads better than the meat version. As far as their other dishes, I've never tried them since I always end up getting the pizza.

5 star for food, 1 star for service.  The person taking the order is rude, bad english and gets frustrated when people don't understand him so he starts screaming into the phone.  The delivery people aren't much better.  While most delivery services come to the door, the delivery folks at Zante's call and tell you they're waiting outside 5 minutes before they actually get there, and they don't come to the door, they wait in their car and make you go hunting for the guy who looks like he might be delivering pizza.
author: Kevin C.

description:
UGHHHHH!!!!!
TERRIBLE!

Don't even think about ordering delivery from them.  They will take their sweet time and then argue with you and tell you to be patient when you've waited nearly 2 hours for a pizza. 

40 min from the time I placed the order I called to see the ETA.  The curt man said my order was done and out the door.  

Another 20 min later I called again.  They said it's on it's way still.  

Then another 30 min after that I called again and they said the driver was 2 min. away from the house.  

I didn't believe him and reminded him that it's been 1.5 hours since I placed the order, that he lead me on 50 min. earlier saying that it was done and it was with the driver.  I told him to just forget about it, cancel the driver, and to take the charge off the credit card. 

Right away, the guy lied again and said that he just heard from the driver and he was outside my door.  

I said that doesn't make sense because how could he hear back from the driver when we were still in the middle of this conversation?  Plus I didn't see anyone outside my house yet.   
I reminded him he was misleading and I kept saying I didn't want the food anymore and to cancel the order.

He argued with me saying he won't cancel it and then hung up on me!!

Because he didn't listen, lied numerous times, argued with me, and hung up, my boyfriend had to call back and tell him we're canceling the order and won't accept the pizza and we'll dispute the money if it shows up on the credit card...

Transaction is still pending, we'll see if it goes through...

A similar circumstance occurred a few years back. It took them nearly 2 hours for a pizza to arrive.  At the time I lived in the same neighborhood as Zante's.  The pizza was cold and they charged me TWICE!!! It took me a month of back and forth phone calls with Zante's and having to finally go into the establishment to show them the double charge in order for them to finally refund the money.  They would have never done it otherwise.  I swore them off for years because of this and they "fooled me twice" with this new delivery fiasco.  

I don't care how tasty to food is.  They are TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE!!! A BADLY RUN BUSINESS!!!
author: N F.

description:
Indian Pizza. Never had anything else here, probably never will.

For the years I've been coming to Zante's I've been undecided as to how I feel about it. It's not really pizza...it's not really Indian food...Indian Pizza is its own category. Much like how I feel about Curry Up Now's Indian Burritos, I used to think that I would rather have regular pizza or regular Indian food than a weird fusion of the two. But my last taste changed my mind. This time I was finally ready to accept the amalgamation of worlds and the Vegetarian Indian Pizza ended up being pretty good. There's also a meat-packed option with lamb, prawns, and other various ingredients.

To order: Go online and click "Zantes Specialty Pizzas" in the left-hand bar. The price ranges from $18/19 for a small to $29/30 for an X-Large.
author: Talia G.

description: Their food is great but their delivery is really atrocious. They told us 45 minutes and it was 2 hours plus. I hope they see this review and understand it as having a lot of love for their product but real annoyance with their service.
author: Marg R.

description:
I ordered an Indian pizza for delivery while at work.  They told me 45 minutes for delivery.  55 minutes pass by, and I decide to call.  "It's on it's way, maam" the Zante's guy says over the phone.

An hour and 15 minutes pass by, and I decide to look at their Yelp reviews only to discover in horror reported wait times of up to 2 1/2 hours. I was SO HUNGRY at this point, I said in my head "AWWW, MAN!!!"  Fearing that I might have to wait another hour for my food, I start scheming ways to run to Walgreens for a Balance bar.  However, they showed up at right about an hour and a half after I ordered, thank GOD!  That could have been bad.

The Indian pizza is DELISH. Super good. Great flavors, fluffy naan dough...very yummy.  However, order way before you're hungry or you're S.O.L.
author: Genevieve M.

description: The food is ok but don't order if you are hungry.  Its quite pricey. They always take twice as long as they say they will. My food was more than an hour late. I've ordered about 3 times and its always late.
author: Angela L.

description:
So here's the problem with Zante:

They actually make pretty good pizza... when they have their act together. But as things stand, this is not a business that can be trusted with your money or your order.

Zante has been our go-to place for getting pizza delivered for the last year or so, but the number of problems and errors have brought us to the breaking point.

If you're lucky, you'll get your pizza in about an hour.

If you're less lucky, you'll get your pizza in 90-120 minutes.

Surprisingly often, you'll get the WRONG pizza in 2 hours or more, sometimes cold.

They may even forget to deliver your pizza, and require you to nag them several times on the phone just to get it delivered in the first place.

They never straighten things out when you call them to deal with a problem. They may offer you a refund or a free pizza, but you never actually get it. They may also just hang up on you.

If you do order from Zante, do NOT pay by credit card. Pay by cash, when they arrive. Check the pizza before paying, to make sure that it is the right thing and that it is still warm... and send it back without paying if it isn't. Also, have a backup plan lined up, and don't expect your pizza in anything resembling a timely manner. You'll be sorry if you're not prepared. Does that sound like a ridiculous hassle for ordering a pizza? We thought so, to... and that's why we won't be ordering from Zante any more, after being regular customers nearly a year.

Their pizza is actually pretty good, but that is no excuse for the way they treat their customers or run their business. And both the timing of the delivery and the accuracy of the order are a total crapshoot.

So we are saying goodbye to Zante. They could be good, if only they'd get their act together. But as things stand, ordering from Zante is no different from buying a lottery ticket: sometimes things will work out well for you, and other times, you're just throwing money away.
author: Ian W.

description:
On a lazy Saturday, wake up late. Really late, like 12 noon or 1 pm. 

Don't even bother to get out of bed. Grab your phone (or go online) and place your order. 

Yes, of course, you HAVE to get the Best Indian Pizza (with meat, sister! with M-E-A-T)  and you might even get Veggie Samosas on the side. 

So, the voice on the other end of the line says "ok, about 40 minutes"

Well, 1 hour later.... (yes, it is true what everybody says here about the delivery time)

My pizza wasn't piping hot, but not cold either.  Warm pizza, yeah, I can live with that.  I take a bite.

And then....

There was a MYRIAD of tasty explosion in my mouth! Is it the tandoori chicken? the prawns? the lamb? curry sauce? spinach, eggplant, cauliflower, ginger, garlic, green onions or cilantro?  The folks at Zante's pizza were wise enough to put this on a thick crust.  It just makes it all the more filling. 

BTW, our order came up to a total of $24.65  (I don't know how that came to be, because the medium pizza costs $19.99 and the samosas were $4.99)

Guess we got a discount!
author: Janice C.

description: Placed an order for pickup. Wanted the lamb tikka masala, but they make it with almonds, so I got the lamb korma instead. I told them I really love the coconut milk in the tikka masala, so they added some to the korma and it came out sooooo delicious. It was a decent portion size for the price. I also got the rice, which was very fragrant and delicious. My boyfriend got the chicken tikka masala and he loved it. We also got garlic and plain naan. Only 2 pieces per order so kinda a small portion size. total price came to 35- for 2 people so not bad. Took about 10 minutes for them to make, so it was very fast. Overall, very delicious and glad I was able to find this so close to home!
author: Lindsey G.

description: I love the food here.  That is why I have given them 4 stars.  If you eat at the restaurant things seem to run in a timely fashion and as I said the food is very good.  Their delivery process however is bad (1 star I would say).  This is my second time ordering delivery and having a similar problem.  I ordered food via yelp from Eat24 for delivery.  It was supposed to be 45-60 minutes for delivery.  At 75 minutes I started a chat with Eat24 to check on the status.  It took several minutes for the first person to chime in on my chat and then they dropped off without any notification and left me hanging and then another Eat24 employee chimed in with "Hi"!  Frustrated, I ended up calling the restaurant myself and had a hard time getting a status update on my order.  Eventually I was told "a few minutes" (that was about 30 minutes before the order was actually delivered).  Total time for delivery was 1 hour 55 minutes from time of placing order.  I realize this may be a problem of communication between Eat24 and the restaurant, but the restaurant should change it's process if the communication is bad and they do not seem to care to do that.  So if you want their food delivered be prepared to wait and wait.
author: Debbie G.

description:
I've been ordering from this place for a long time (we live just a few blocks away) but the service has gotten so bad I can't recommend it anymore.

Their Indian pizzas are delicious (hubby isn't a big fan of pizza, but this he likes) with a nice light sauce, eggplant (I hate eggplant but this is good), cauliflower, shrimp and tandoori chicken all on top of a nice crust.

That said, the delivery takes so long that I think we're going to stop ordering from here. Last night we ordered a pizza at 8 PM on line (which we've done a number of times before). We got no email or phone confirmation that the order was in, and when I called back at 9:00, I was told it would be another 20 minutes. Clearly they had forgotten our pizza. 

Then when the delivery guy showed up he just telephoned when he was leaving the resturant and left me standing on the porch in the cold waiting for him. Clearly he doesn't understand that you park the car (in the driveway for a minute if you have to) and actually ring the doorbell.

And the pizza was almost cold when he got here. 

Zante has good food, but if you want good service go elsewhere.
author: Mike F.

description: Almost 3 hours since I ordered. Still no pizza at the door. This place is a mess of an operation. Sunday night and you guys can't even get your act together? Stop slacking. This is the last time I'm doing business with you fuckers.
author: Dean Q.

description:
I really want to give you guys 4 stars, I really do! But what you did last night was unacceptable. 

A couple weeks ago Kevin H. and I were discussing our love for comic books and having a southern accent contest. Of course, I don't win because a) I'm not drunk and b) I'm not drunk. But in any case, comic books. 

Let me tell you something about Kevin H. He is a dork. A dorkus maximus, if you will, and I wouldn't have it ANY. OTHER. WAY. He's super dorky awesome, so much that I want to make him a cape that says SUPER DORK on it, and make him wear his underwear over his pants. I mean, this IS San Francisco, he could totally get away with it.

So we made plans to read comic books on a day we weren't both busy, and that turned out to be last night. I was so damn excited, I was hardly able to park in front of the apartment. Seriously, though. I can't parallel park. 

Instead of reading comic books actually (I read a story, that was it), I found that he had MST3K, which is AWESOME, and we watched that instead. And looked at Failblog.com. And hamncheez.com. And watched random YouTube clips. It. Was. AWESOME. MST3K is the SHIT!

Doing all of this super dorky stuff worked up an appetite. Around 6:50 he said, "You ever try Indian Pizza?" Well, no. I've had...Indian food. And pizza. But...never...*together*. "Yer in fer a surprise!", he replied in his southern drawl. 

Unfortunately, the pizza took over an hour to arrive, when it should only take 30 minutes. It was really good (hell, I still have some slices in my purse for lunch), but seriously, guys? Took too long. 

FAIL.

I'll be adding on stars if you can recify this. Be lucky I had MST3K to keep me entertained.

side note:

Hot Stuff    07/16/2008

Kevin H. 

San Francisco, CA
Compliment

For your review of: Zante Pizza

*Ahem*

Shouldn't that read "Be lucky I had KEVIN H to keep me entertained."  :-P
-------
Yes--I'm lucky I had KEVIN H to keep me entertained! :P
author: Jaime L.

description: Best indian pizza ever ! even the vegan pizza tates good.
author: Vishakha G.

description:
4 stars for having tasty indian pizza!
and for the thin crust!
and for delivering to my office (although they are on the other side of town!)

My mind says 3.75, but my heart says 4. 
I think the .25 comes from my tastebuds always being thrown off by this so-called "pizza".
This will not taste like your regular pizza, or any other pizza you've had, for that matter.
It will taste like your favourite local indian buffet wrapped in garlic naan.
The regular best indian pizza tastes more like a mix of curry dishes, while the vegan
version tastes more like a mix of all the non-curry dishes - both equally yummy!
author: Jade T.

description:
One of the best pizzas in the City, bar none. For those who have never had Indian Pizza before, let's just put it this way... Some food is fusion food, and it's merely a creative exercise. But every once in a while, when the planets align, something is produced so delicious and perfect that it makes perfect SENSE. One bite of Zante's Pizza, and you wonder why Indian food and pizza weren't joined from the beginning. Zante's almost feels like an evolutionary ancestor to both, before some horrible catastrophe separated Indian food and pizza like soul mates estranged post-reincarnation.

Okay, mixed metaphors, sorry... but seriously. Just eat the thing. You'll see.
author: T R.

description:
Zante's is a living parody of the modern pizza delivery experience:

The online ordering system is crude but way better than calling.
You may or may not receive a confirmation email.
Your food is definitely coming late if you order at a sane dining hour.
When you call they will definitely be curt and brief. 
The driver will definitely get lost and be annoyed with you.

That said, this is some seriously good pizza and completely worth the trouble!  The price is also right: free delivery to anywhere in San Francisco and the specialty pizzas contain twice as many (exotic!) ingredients as comparably priced traditional pizzas.  Sure, you'll spend 30 bucks, but you'll be hella full by 2 small slices.

Points deducted for ass-tacular customer service and for the entrees sometimes come cold, probably because they're trying to satisfy the entire bay area with a small driving crew.  I've yet to dine there because I'm dread being served by with whomever picks up the phone, but I'm a huge fan of their food and couldn't recommend them enough -- if you have the nerve to put up with the soup nazi's of the indian pizza world.
author: niero g.

description:
I fell in love with the Great Indian Pizza! One of my favorite pizzas in the Bay Area.

First time I had it was a few years ago when someone brought it to my internship. OMG! The different flavors: curry, chicken, and other things that I don't know, but I know it all went well together. 

For my past birthday I decided to go there and expose my friends to the taste of this pizza. 

Parking is kind of hard if you don't want to pay the meter. The place is kind of bigger than I expected. There was table cloth and everything, kind of weird. I was expecting beat up wooden tables, so not that.

We had made a reservation, haha, there was no need to do that, they didn't even know what I was talking about, and the place wasn't busy.

There were 8 girls. We ordered the Chili Cheese Naan to start and the XL Great Indian Pizza. On the menu you can read all the ingredients to the Indian pizza. Don't be scared, you can't taste the lamb. The naan was served with a red and green sauce. It was good, and spicy. The pizza was big (I took a picture for you guys). It fed all of us and we were all okay after. The flavors were better than I remembered. Like Indian food on pizza. GENIUS! Some of us ordered the mango lasse, that was alright, not as thick but it still tasted good.

The wait staff  were all really nice. Refilled the water (which I needed) and I think my friends told them it was my birthday and they came out with a dessert on the house with candles in it. So nice! The dessert was the cottage cheese battered balls on a syrup. Not what I would have ordered, but still nice that they did that.

I know people hate that it takes forever for them to deliver, but this is strictly from a sit down in the restaurant point of view. You should try it.
author: Leanne K.

description:
I'm only rating on their delivery, for the Indian pizza.

Pizza...doughy.  It had lamb (which one cannot even taste.)  Plenty of tandoori chicken, curries, and veggies.  (I wonder if they should just use naan hybrid dough instead of what they currently use...)   Good flavors though.  It is a bit addicting...although, it just makes me want basmati rice and finish the meal with kheer...lol 

It was $27.99 for the XL which fed five of us.  We asked for a certain time, and they came nearly an hour before then...(early is not bad, except if...we hadn't been home! duh!)

I'll try this place again, maybe...
author: Fannie S.

description:
They'll do "whatever you want"! That was our waiter's catch-phrase. They were super flexible on everything from orders to paying the bill. The food itself was absolutely delicious! We ordered half meat half veggie, but I only had the veggie. Others said the two tasted pretty much the same.

Pro tip: order the paneer and pour it on the crust (or the pizza itself, if you're feeling indulgent). Amazing!

They also deliver. If I lived closer than East Bay I would order this way too often!
author: Isabelle M.

description:
Finally trekked to the outer Mission to try the famed Indian pizza.  We got there at 2:50, and even though they technically close at 3pm, they were really nice and accommodated us.

We got the veggie one and it was really, really good.  The dough is a little fluffier, like naan.  No paneer cheese, but the mozzarella really worked well.   My only recommendation is to stop at 2 slices.  I knew better but my eyes were bigger than my stomach and I went for the 3rd.  Holy food coma Batman!  I almost fell asleep on the 24 bus heading home. 

Total cost was $34 including tax.  Totally worth it!
author: Rani V.

description:
The Indian pizza here is amazing. The other stuff on the menu is okay but not worth a long trip or special delivery for. Regardless, I highly recommend this place for their Indian pizzas!

Be aware that delivery and pickup here is slow and disorganized. On multiple occasions I've seen them lose peoples orders or waited quite a while for a delivery to arrive. Despite these faults, they are super friendly and accommodating. Just be aware that they are slow and a tad bit absent minded.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Okay, all you crazy people that get takeout from Zante are missing out on the place's best feature:

$5 PITCHERS OF BUD.  

And they're not even those baby pitchers -- they're actual pitcher-pitchers.  I am for real.

Combine that with a piping hot medium Indian pizza that is too much for two people to finish, and it should be clear that Zante is the best.

Stop getting takeout and come enjoy the Zante atmosphere.
author: Megan D.

description:
Dear Zante,

Please don't ever stop making your Indian pizza.  My picky 21 month-old daughter -- who won't touch our regular Italian-style pizza -- nearly wolfed down an entire piece of your Indian pizza, while my 3 1/2 year old son ate 1  1/2 slices by himself!  Thank you, thank you, thank you!  Keep it coming, please.
author: Susan L.

description: Delicious delicious Indian pizza. But if you're going to confirm a 7 pm delivery, and on two follow-up calls assure a customer that it's 5 minutes away, and you don't actually deliver until 8:45 (30 minutes after that last assurance), 2 stars for you.
author: Erika F.

description:
fantastic pizza, terrible delivery.

ordered a tandoori chicken pizza tonight, and 2 hours and multiple useless phone calls later ("it's already left, it's on it's way.") our pizza shows up. we were told it'd be 45 minutes for delivery, and i always assume it'll take a bit longer, but a 2 hour wait is ridiculous.

i tip the driver (yes, i still tipped), and ask what happened, he says, "thank you very much." then hops in his SUV and leaves.

the pizza is ice cold, and now it's in our oven warming. we now have to wait even *longer* for the pizza to be warm.

very disappointed.
author: meeks b.

description:
POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE! Actually it's the worst customer service I've ever experienced.  

I first called to check if they deliver to South San Francisco, which they said they did. I then tried ordering from their online menu, which gave me an error because of the zip code I entered was not allowed for delivery. 

Afterwards, I called them again and explained the problem. But the person on the other end just keeps saying "try again, try again" and hangs up. 

I did try again, and it did not work. Guess what? I called them again. However, this time the guy is really annoyed and kept on saying "Oh my god, oh my god." And at that point, I had enough and just told him to forget about it. They will never get my business after that.  

I've never had their pizzas/food before and I probably never will.  But the restaurant makes or breaks its business by either their customer service or food quality. This time was their poor customer service.  

Perhaps their customer service is better inhouse, but I highly doubt it.

Be warned when ordering from this place.
author: Perry L.

description: If you like Indian pizza, then you'll love this place. A friend of mine recommended this as his go-to Indian Pizza restaurant. We split a medium sized Indian pizza and added tandoori chicken. It was quite yummy. The crust seemed to be lacking flavour but the rest of the pizza had a good taste to it. It doesn't get too crowded so you can sit and enjoy your food and converse with your friends as well without having to yell. It's well worth seeking out if you're in the Outer Mission/Bernal Heights area.
author: Amy J.

description:
I love this place!  The vegan and vegetarian Indian pizzas are awesome.  I actually think the vegan one's a little better because they put a "creamy" spinach sauce on, i guess instead of cheese, which is really good.

As for all the complaints about delivery:  I ordered delivery for the first time last night, and it came in 50 minutes, just 5 minutes over the time they gave, which is better than most delivery services, and the delivery guy was the nicest delivery person I've ever met.  He gave me a tip on how to save money on my next order.  I just thought I'd share my good delivery experience to balance out all the negative ones.

If you like Indian food (and are ok with some good, strong spices), I highly recommend trying this place out.
author: Susan D.

description: My boyfriend is from India and has only lived in the states for 3 years, SO I trust his judgement when it comes to Indian food. Personally, I flipped over the veg Indian pizza. No other words...just bliss. I could have eaten the whole thing! My boyfriend was equally impressed and made friends with the owner after some chatting over out pizza (we were the only ones in the place late one night). The decor may not be fancy but I liked everything about the place. The food, the interiors and the service. My only problem now is that we live in LA so Zante's Indian pizza can only be had on trips to the bay ;..( BOO.
author: V N.

description: Just Yes. They delivered the wrong pizza but I just don't care because the Indian Pizza was delicious.
author: Ryan U.

description:
Come to Boston, please?!?!?!

They fuse Indian and American (technically, Italian?) together so beautifully! I sampled 2 heavenly slices of their Indian pizza and I was blown away. It was like the flavors and ingredients of aloo gobhi (the potato cauliflower dish) with tons of garlic and a perfect amount of cheese, on a nice thin'ish crust. Not spicy at all, perfect texture, I will get some again on my way out of the city!

They are $3 per slice but each "slice" is really two mini-slices, so it's a perfect, cheap lunch option. They have a nice sit-down area but we opted to take-out and sit in a nearby park.
author: Wen-fai F.

description:
I am craving you. I would give you five stars but you haven't opened a shop in San Diego. So get on it.

It has been over a week since I last dug into your sweet Indian pizza  The bigger bummer is that I won't be in town again for a month.

San Diego has nothing like this. The vegetarian pizza is no joke. It has all the flavors of India or at least what I think India would taste like if you could taste it.  Traditionally, I am not a grazer and go vegi but you are so damm tasty. I just can't get enough. 

I haven't had any of the other dishes, but why bother. I have tried both versions of the pizza and honestly the vegi is the way to go. If something is this good, you don't need to venture off. Think Jesse James to Sandra Bullock.

Until my next drunk night in SF, I will faithfully wait for you.
author: Rossi H.

description:
Delivery from Zante is something you should never try. It took over 2 hours to get a medium pizza. The pizza itself was clearly made minutes after I placed the order. I can only guess that Zante's pizzas need about 1.5 hours to airate, soften, and otherwise become horrible for the consumer.

Please do not order from this place. Save your money, time, and sanity (calling them multiple times will not help).
author: Nathan K.

description: After the last 49ers game at Candlestick, we were craving some Indian food. Looked up a place and said we'd go to the first place we run across. I have to say, I am so glad we ran into this place! Food was delicious! The nice mister gave us a slice of Indian pizza to try too, and it was amazing. The staff were very friendly as well! Great people. Could be a little more organized & neat but non the less definitely will be going back soon!
author: Dina J.

description: Fast service- very affordable. You can order individual slices. Tried the Indian Veggie pizza and it was really different, but absolutely tasty.
author: Steph P.

description:
The Indian pizza is really something different and special.  I couldn't eat it more then once a month or so, but it is really tasty and if you are craving it pretty much nothing else will suffice.

However, I've watched the cheese pizza go from pretty good to pretty awful over the last few years.  I live down the street so their $2 cheese slices are one of the best cheap and quick meals you can find.  Unfortunately, there is just NO QUALITY CONTROL on this pizza.  Some days it is absolutely delicious - thick soft crust, w. lots of cheese and tasty sauce.  Other days (like last night), it's just a blob of dough oozing w. too much sauce and not enough cheese.  I can't fault them for the fact that sometimes the slices are kind of old - that's understandable.  But it shouldn't be such a COMPLETE CRAP SHOOT every time.

The Indian food itself is pretty boring from what I remember.  Not particularly flavorful.  I say go to Spicy Bite across the street if you want good Indian.

The Indian pizza is 4 or 5 stars, but everything else is a 2.  And they are really mean to the poor latino guys who make their pizza.  I don't know why they yell at them so much.

I like this place, but I think they have gotten a little smug with how popular they are, and stopped paying attention to the details.
author: Tmon B.

description:
I dunno about their pizza but their Indian food was sub par.  Recently ordered a couple different types of curries and garlic naan for delivery and all 3 people who ate it agreed that it wasn't very good.  The naan was the toughest naan I had ever eaten at any Indian restaurant....just one step away from being as tough as the Chinese green onion pancakes.  The curry was a bit too watery and kind of bland.

I don't think I will be ordering from here again.  My sister also stated that the person over the phone was rude when placing the order.
author: Gilbert C.

description:
Indian food is my absolute favorite food in the world.  This was terrible.  I could barely eat it.

I ordered Paneer Tikka Masala and Daal Makhani.  The tikka masala was so bland I felt like I was eating plain cream and the daal disgustingly watery.  

Not sure what's up with this place but I'm definitely never ordering from there again.

The only good thing I can say is that they were prompt and nice, but for restaurants, I really just rate based on the food.  (I try not to take points away for service because I don't really care if the food is good, so I'm not going to add points for service either).
author: claudia g.

description:
Everything...seriously...EVERYTHING we ordered was delicious.  We tried both Indian pizzas, 2 chicken curry dishes, 2 vegetarian curries, 2 lamb curries, 4 types of naan bread and the kheer when I ordered for our office lunch.

The food was rich, delicious and had just enough spice!  They delivered to our office promptly and were friendly when they called to confirm our office address.

My mouth starts to salivate when I think about their food - it has def made it to our office's top 5 lunchtime spots.
author: Carmel U.

description:
If you have nothing nice to say...

OK fine.  

Incredibly bland.  There are so many good restaurants in this city, and this is not one of them.  The tandoori chicken was inedible, the onion naan, was incredibly bland, even my beer was warm!   This was a complete waste of money.  Even the condiments were bland.  Will absolutely not order from here again.
author: Katy T.

description:
-1 star because the pizza always arrives warm and not hot like a delivered pizza should be.  These guys should invest in warming bags or something.

BUT delivery is free and they deliver all over SF so its only a small negative....


the pizza is truly amazing... I speak only about the Indian Pizza.... its so flavorful and tasty.  you have to try it!!!  The crust is soft and fluffy and the toppings are fresh and amazing.  Very garlicky but ohh so good!
author: Shawn A.

description:
I'm not a big fan of pizza in general, but this is the best pizza place I've eaten at. The pizzas here are certainly made with irregular ingredients, but they're good. Although for some reasons, I had to make myself stop after the 3rd slice!!! Also I tried their beer which was claimed to be imported from India, it tasted just like any other types of beer. 

I hope I'll have a chance to come back here in order to try other dishes.
author: Miiiiei P.

description:
Okay so it's indian flavored pizza. I will say I was expecting something a little more exciting than what came out. Everything was chopped up tiny and the flavors all ran together. Sure, it was more interesting than a cheese pizza, but I was hoping for even more flavor, and maybe some curry to dip it into. I don't know, it's worth trying just for the novelty, but I do not foresee returning.

I just wanted more Indian in my Indian pizza!!
author: Caitlin H.

description: Interesting. Good for take out/delivery, dine in is a little strange. Obviously get the Indian Pizza.
author: Aaron H.

description:
At least, I think I'm a fan....

While salivating reading about the "delicious" Indian Pizza and then reading the reviews about how they are liars and delivery is a nightmare. I received a Phone call 2 minutes ago from the driver who was calling from the car confirming where drop off the food. I put in a large order a little less than 20 minutes ago and it's Friday night. Am I lucky? Or should we cut them some slack? Running a restaurant is not the easiest thing in the world, especially when you are dealing with hungry people with low-blood sugar levels :) However... we will see if the food actually arrives in the next 5-10 minutes, either way... I'll be patient!  
To be continued...
author: Courtney H.

description:
I finally had the chance try out this truly ethnic fusion. Thumbs up. It is not a typical pretentious fusion joint that emphasize on the decor and how pretty the wait staff can be. You will not find young professionals rubbing elbows here on the weekends.

We had the ultimate extra large combo. Suffice to say, it fed four of us really well. You cannot categorize it as pizza or Indian food. Somehow it works together. At least for me because I am connoisseur of anything foreign to my taste palate. 

Even if you do not like the idea of this fusion combination, I would give it a shoot.
author: Tony N.

description: Several places in the city offer Indian pizza, but none of them stand up to Zante's. This is a great spot that is pretty unknown. They also have a 100 health score, which is fairly uncommon in this city.
author: Cameron B.

description:
It's a standard pizza crust w/ Indian-spiced sauce & veggies...I bet it could be recreated at home but the personalities of the staff make it worth the cost! 

Our server was very "Bollywood" in his speech & mannerisms. My friend & I got quite the laugh out of his show of "ok, 2 slices Indian pizza, 1 veggie pakora, 1 tea. That's it? No tea for you? Just 2 slices Indian pizza, 1 veggie pakora & 1 tea?" 

Pizza was decent - as noted above nothing overly special. But it was still good the next day as a cold slice. The pakora were over-fried. The balls were almost black & somewhat dry inside. The 2 sauces to dip them in are a spicy cilantro & a plum sauce. 

Service here is very good though. They make sure you have everything you need all the time. Bollywood movies play on a TV in the background (kind of distracting) & the bathrooms are painted in cotton-candy (very feminie) pink. Credit cards accepted for totals over $15.
author: Marissa H.

description: Ordered delivery from Zantes. That part of the experience was not great - the customer service was curt and unhelpful. The food also took quite a long while to arrive - about 60 mins - although that was about what they estimated. The food itself was very good. The pizzas smelled good and tasted better; it did not taste like Indian items awkwardly added together, but rather a creative and cohesive new concept.  The chicken masala pizza was very good as was the vegetarian special; the vegan pizza lacked flavor. The downside however was the crust itself, which was soon chewy and tasteless. The cheese in the pizza was also nothing special. I would order delivery from here again just to try another pizza, but I wouldn't expect great things from it.
author: Nikhil V.

description: Best Indian pizza!!  I love this place.  Been a fan for many years.  I have never encountered a long wait time for delivery as other reviewers mentioned.  Also try the chicken tikka masala and the saag paneer, very good as well.
author: A M.

description:
Really, I would like to give this place 3.5 stars. 

I went here tonight and aside from what I think may have been a dead dude getting picked up in an ambulance from the bench across the street, it was good. The look of the place could use some help, as well as some more lighting and an update to the old decor. 

I went with a friend and we ordered the Indian Vegetarian Pizza that comes with Spinach, Eggplant, Cauliflower, Ginger, Garlic, Green Onions & Cilantro. 'Twas quite tasty, and I ate wayyy too much of it. I also started with an order of Dal Soup, which was tasty as well with nice bits of fresh ginger, of which, I am a fan. I noticed that most people in the restaurant were ordering Indian food, so maybe I'll go back and try just the regualr food, and not the pizza sometime...maybe. I live in the East Bay, and I probably wouldn't make the $4, $5, or $6 trek across the bridge just for this place, but if I was out and about, and in Bernal Heights, I would. 

Also, ask for the mint sauce, it goes great with the pizza and serves as a great dip to the crust as well. 

Pros:
Good, and different pizza
Open relatively late
Server was pretty attentive and served us rather promptly

Cons:
Zero Ambiance
"Candle Dinner" as advertised on the menu = very poor lighting sans the candles.
Can be tough to find parking.
We tried to split the bill via credit card, but couldn't because the minimum had to be $15 (our bill was $27, probably could have let that one slide)
author: Eamon M.

description: The food is original and delicious, the atmosphere is inviting, and the service is friendly and efficient. We went here with our toddler recently and were thrilled at how welcome we were made to feel. Our waiter brought out a mango lassi and a cheese slice for our little girl free of charge, without us even asking for anything. Moreover, he brought them right away, so she didn't have to wait, and never even got a chance to think about losing it. A great place!
author: Estevan M.

description: The reviews led me to believe this would be a tasty Indian take on pizza, and perhaps it was my bad that I thought it would be a light and very different experience; but this is just regular, heavy pizza with Indian flavorings. Huge disappointment. Oh, and I felt absolutely horrible afterwords. It's not that it's particularly bad, it's just not very interesting.
author: Jackson D.

description:
Do you feel like Indian, or do you feel like pizza? It doesn't really matter because Zante lets you have both! When you really can't pick one over the other, get them combined. Well, technically the Indian is over the pizza, but you can easily flip it over or fold it in half and make yourself an Indian calzone... :P

They deliver all over the city, but since we're not too far away, we opted for pick-up. We called in on the way to Safeway across the street, did our grocery shopping, and then picked up the pizza. Easy as pie. Seems like the other reviews complain about delivery, so if you have the option of stopping by to grab your food, I'd suggest that.

PS - great hangover food.
author: Tinna H.

description: I don't like seeing bad reviews of Zante's. If delivery is taking a long time just call and see what's up.  Back in the day, they would deliver all the way to the financial district for free.  But irrespective of how good their delivery is, their food rocks.  The chicken tikka masala is uber creamy.  Its sauce makes an amazing dipping sauce for the pizza or naan.  A culinary highlight of indian cuisine.  Yes, the decor ain't fancy, but that's the charm.  I think it used to be a Greek restuarant and maintained its former Ionian name.  If you want honest food with no wait including on a friday night give them a try!
author: Armen Z.

description: I ordered some special Indian pizzas for a lunch meeting.  The driver called about 10 minutes late to say he was there, but turned out to be at the wrong location and took another 15 minutes to get there.  He was also kind of rude, like it was my fault that he couldn't read addresses.  However the food was absolutely delicious.  So I'll only knock off one star for the delivery problem
author: Benjamin D.

description: This place is interesting.  We ordered it as take out and although strange, the Indian pizza was a hit at our friend's place.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Terrible service - I have ordered twice online and received the food more than an hour (or two!) after ordering. 

Flavor-wise I was dissatisfied in the sense that this food doesn't even taste like Indian food! I have been eating Indian food my entire life, and I swear these people don't know what Indian spices are!

I haven't tried their pizza - looks like most people like the pizza from reviews - but after my experience with them I think I will pass.
author: Kate V.

description:
This is quite literally my first review on Yelp, EVERRR.

And this is the establishment that has brought me to my knees. 

From the very first moment you pick up your medium vegetarian Indian pizza, and that savory aroma seeps into the vessels of your vehicle, you know you've found heaven. 

Every time I enter, the owner remembers me, and tells me how many times I have been in prior..."Three times today, right? I remember!" 

I love Indian food, and this place not only serves up classic generous portions and flavor, but also substantially classy service.

Thanks Zante's!
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
I'll admit I didn't try the indian pizza with flavors like tandoorie and tiki masala, which is their big hook. 

However the service at lunch left so much to be desired I doubt I'll ever be back. No one notice me come in and when they did I was sat at a table so crooked that the water glass slid across my table.  I ordered spicy Chicken Tiki Masala. It wasn actually ok but it wasn't what I ordered.
No Lunch menu meant an $18.00 midday meal. :/

I mentioned the tameness of my spicy order on the way out and the waiter said oh I forgot. He asked me 3 times if I wanted it spicy after I told him to please make it spicy.

The food may be good but I doubt I'll be back.
author: Carlos S.

description:
6h40 pm: roomate orders a small indian pizza online.
7h00 pm- 8h15pm: roomate makes series of calls that lead to her either being hung up on or busy. 
9h30pm: roomate receives a call saying that delivery guy is outside. She goes out... and he's not there.
9h35pm: delivery guy calls my friend bac and she goes out and comes back with a small indian pizza and a large of the exact same kind. 

Basically... this was the worst food experience ever. Yes... we got a free large pizza... but you cant have more than 2 slices of indian pizza, which isn't bad... but not great. Regardless, they should have offered the pizza for free or something... or a credit. Never have I ever. All we could do was laugh about the situation... and my roomate gave the large pizza to a homeless dude. So atleast something positive came out of this. Wow.

The indian pizza is honestly an expierence that EVERYONE should have... but be forewarned about ordering from this place. And honestly... could have been some internet/wireless issue... hmmmm... probably not... but in this day and age one can only presume ;o.
author: roderick h.

description: rude on phone.  hung up on me after i stated my order and phone number.  nice in person while picking up food.  place looked clean in dining room.  got chicken tikka masala, garlic nan, and lamb samosa.  tasted good but an hour after eating had a upset stomach.  next day was puking out both ends all day.  only thing i ate that day.  so im pretty sure it was their food.  wont be returning.
author: Jb H.

description:
Food: watery and bland not spicy at all, naan was like eating a rubber band

Delivery: promised 40 mins after waiting over an hour and a half I finally got my food
author: Sabrina B.

description:
OMG Zante's Indian veggie pizza delivered to your house is just about the very best thing about living in San Francisco. 

I crave this pizza regularly, and don't care that sometimes it takes almost an hour for delivery. Whenever an out of town gets visits, we always get Zantes Indian pizza, because it is one-of-a-kind.

I've eaten at the restaurant a couple of times, but the ambiance isn't great. Just get a few pies and go home or have it delivered and your day will be complete.

You have to ask for the special sauces because sometimes they forget to add those to deliveries, and they are really good for dipping your pizza in.
author: Ren V.

description:
Ok, people, you can't write a review of Zante's if you don't try the Indian pizza!  Seriously!  That's like going to a sushi restaurant and writing a review based solely on your experience with the chicken teriyaki.  It's poor form.

Zante's Indian pizza is positively delicious!  Zante's perfectly executes Indian-Italian fusion with a spiced-up crust and cauliflower, garlic, cilantro, and chutney as toppings.  Zante's is this little Indian cheese-lover's dream come true - it's the best of both worlds and satisfies many cravings at once.  Also, it's not as heavy as regular Indian food (except when fatty also gets a curry on the side and dips said delicious Indian pizza into the curry for extra Indian-y goodness) so it's great when you feel like Indian food but don't want to feel totally crappy afterwards.

I highly recommend asking for the chutneys on the side when you order the Indian pizza and dipping your pizza in the chutneys.  It makes them MUCH tastier!  You will have an instant food-gasm.  No joke.
author: Julie S.

description:
This place is definitely filling a niche. Indian pizza - whowoudathunkit?! But seriously that is ALL you should get here. And ask for lots of the green sauce and tamarind sauce. You've been warned...

If you order normal pizza it will be meh and if you order regular Indian food it will suck. Also, order out if possible. The interior has a weird vibe and your waiter will obnoxiously remind you at the end of your meal to tip him in cash (you know, since he doesn't want to pay tax on it and all).
author: Steven H.

description: First things first, the service is not great slightly rude depending on who you get but stay patient and see yourself to the Indian pizza preferably TO GO. I've ordered here for years and always opt for the free delivery. It takes about an hour to get your food so plan accordingly. The vegetarian Indian pizza is AMAZING!  There is nothing like it that I've ever had (& I'm Indian). Also, the veggie Samosa's are the best I've ever had in SF. Get extra tamarind and mint sauce for the samosas and use it for the pizza DELICIOUS. The vegan option is good too for all this lactose intolerant. Stay away from the other Indian food there. Only the veggie Indian pizza and veggie samosas (PERIOD).
author: Cheryl C.

description:
Well, I feel like a class-A fatty today after demolishing multiple slices of this eclectic, greasy goodness last night.  My new roommates are teaching me how to combine Indian food with every other cuisine possible.  Last week it was in the Indian burritos from Kasa.  On the menu this week:  Indian pizza!  Be still, my waistline!

I would not rank this as some of the best pizza in SF, but its totally unique.  Plus, it fills a craving for both cuisines.  Want take-out?  Can't decide between pizza or Indian?  Kill two birds with one stone!

 Footnotes aside, for what it is Zante's Indian Pizza is scrumptious.  The crust is lightly spiced (like regular pizza....it doesn't come on naan or anything like that) and the ingredients are hearty and flavorful: curry, eggplant, cauliflower, spinach, garlic....dont eat too fast (and trust me, this is easy to do) or you will be hurting in a few hours.  

Zante's highly recommends you order online and will call to confirm.  Delivery time can fall on the long side, especially during peak hours.  Nothing about delivery is perfect, but Zante's completely sets itself apart from other take-out options.  It's the kind of food your find yourself craving at random hours of the day and recommending to others.
author: Kerry D.

description: Good Indian food and awesome Indian pizza. Never tried the regular pizza and would not recommend it. Zante's is a great choice for delivery Indian pizza or food, and is also a nice place to sit down in large groups. It is not fancy, it is outdated, but they play Indian music, and you will have a good experience and enjoy the food.
author: isaac t.

description: This place has amaaaazing Indian pizza but definitely lacks in customer service.  Our pizza was delivered 2 hours after making our order.  Great dipping sauces for pizza and naan.  YUM. Definitely want to try this place again but probably won't order delivery.
author: Daisy A.

description:
I love the Indian pizza!!!! Tastes so yummy. It was our easy first choice for Sunday-Oscars-watching-night food delivery.

So why the 1 star?  It came 3 hours and 37 minutes late.  We ordered an Indian pizza at 6:33 pm.  We called at 7:45 pm and asked what was going on with our pizza.  They told us it would be there in 30 minutes.  So at 8:30 pm we called back and they said it had just been loaded in the car and would be there in 10 minutes.  Starving and cranky, we officially gave up at 9:10.  My friends went home and I went to get a burrito.  After scarfing the burrito and getting ready for bed, the delivery guy buzzed the front door at 10:10 pm.  Are you kidding me?!?!  He asked if I wanted a discount or to cancel.  I said, "cancel" but I wanted to go out in the street and start a fight.  I was too tired to fight so opted to Yelp-bash instead.

Sorry, Zante's, but I am officially boycotting.
author: Bonnie M.

description: Meh!!  Had ordered a panner dish, a korma, some dal and stuffed Naan..all the curries were watered down and the vegetables didn't seem fresh. Low quality ingredients. Not worth visiting guys.,tons of better indian restraunts in the city
author: D T.

description:
The best Indian Pizza that I've ever tasted.  Otherwise this would be a * * * three-star * * * review.  The service when eating in the restaurant is extremely slow.  The regular Indian food dishes that I've tried here are above average but not show stopping.

Must try:  Vegetarian Indian pizza
