Perfect combination of spices, veggies, and cheese.  Cooked in a doughy pie....yes please!!
author: Smiley D.

description: Definitely does not even come close to Pizza & Curry in Fremont.  The Pizza is cooked fresh, but is underseasoned and the meat special comes with a bunch of dry meat.  To top it all off, I found a fly in my beverage!!!
author: Michael M.

description: The Special Indian Pizza is a must try. I mean, where can you order pizza with curry chicken, Indian spices, peppers, grilled onions and more? No where! That's what makes Zante's so special. It is a one of a kind recipe that they serve Indian style pizza which comes with Plum sauce to boot. My only warning is to beware of how many slices you consume because the pizza sat heavy in my stomach for a few hours after I wolfed down four slices. Maybe 2 or 3 slices at a time would be my recommendation. Now as far as the inside is concerned, I think Zante's could use a touch up on their tables and carpets (it felt old & traditional). No problem with that, just something to keep in mind. The Indian pizza was really good. I don't think I would try anything else whenever i go back here.
author: Maximilian R.

description:
Sure, the spices and oil sometimes make me ill on an already unhappy tummy but it fills my home with luscious Indian spices and I LOVE eating their "vegetarian Indian pizza" with spices and vegetables and all sorts of loveliness, especially when having it with mango chutney and raita. Yum!!

Really hard to park in the area. Delivery can take a loooong time and delivery people can be frustrating. However, co-hosted a group of 20+ vegetarian gay, lesbian, and bisexual adults and had a blast!
author: Abi W.

description:
Lived down the street from this place for years, and ate there a lot.  Love the food - the Indian pizza is innovative and delicious, pretty much every dish I've tried there was at least good (if not great), their samosas are top-notch, and their korma sauce is divinity itself.  The wait staff were usually polite and attentive.

Many people seem to complain about their delivery service, but, ordering Indian food (not pizza), I never had an issue.  

I can't give them five stars though, as good as the food is, because the place is a little dirty, and I once saw a cockroach there.  While I kept going back, that colored my experience of the place from then on.
author: Adam C.

description: Indian Pizza:  The entire concept was intriguing to me. The notion that East and West could successfully be combined in a single pizza seems obvious - but has been elusive for millenia.  Even today, the serious Indian Pizza places are few and far between.  I couldn't find it in Contra Costa.  Once the buzz got to me, the only question was "Where?"  Zante in Bernal Heights comes up over and over when inquiries are made and searches executed for the best of bay Indian Pizza.  Tonight, for my birthday dinner after the Giants game, we went to Zante.  Four of us ordered an extra large Chicken Tikka Masala Pizza, chai, and I had kheer for dessert.  (I haven't passed-up kheer since I had wheat kheer for breakfast in a Gujarati village).  The Indian Pizza was quite good and Zante executed it well.  The basic structure is pizza.  The spices and toppings are Indian, other than the cheese - which was typical of pizza (a rich mozzarella it seemed).  The service at Zante was prompt and the pizza was delivered in less than 15 minutes.  It comes with the traditional mint and tamarind chutneys, which are essential.  The chai was average and the kheer was the type that is more like rice pudding and less like sweet porridge.  I'm a sucker for rice pudding, though, so if someone tries to make another dish but ends up with rice pudding, I still like it.  I'll need to have more Indian Pizza to comment on the subtleties.  For now, I'll leave it at this:  Indian Pizza has a future and Zante does it well.  I look forward to this culinary art being perfected and to avoid the difficult choice between "Indian" or "pizza."
author: Jeff M.

description:
I've had this pizza place bookmarked for a while so when I suggested to A. that we try this place for delivery, I was none to pleased when he agreed. Thirty minutes later, we had a hot heap of indian pizza. I didn't know what we were getting ourselves into when I looked at the pizza. It kinda looks like a hot mess. Basically, it's a mixture of all kinds of yummy indian dishes on a naan like bread/dough, which acts as the pizza crust. Despite the softness of the crust, the pizza was quite yummy. It was like eating all of my favorite indian dishes all at once!

I still like Mirchi pizza in Fremont better though.
author: Sara J.

description: So I've only had Zante's once a few years ago, but it really has left quite an impression. My friend and I ordered the special for delivery, and I was in love. The tandoori chicken was tender and flavorful, and the pizza itself had a subtle curry flavor. All the ingredients were fresh and delicious! MmmmMMmm
author: Veronica C.

description: Amazing restaurant with fantastic service. One of my favorite spots in the city hands down. If you've never had Indian Pizza, you owe it to yourself to try it.
author: Johnny W.

description: I have a soft spot for this ghetto fab cheeky restaurant where you can get a great blend of pizza and tikka masala all at once! Go try it!
author: Omar M.

description: We've heard about Zante's for over 20 years and had the first opportunity to try it last night for my son's baseball game by having pizza delivered to the field. Even though the driver got lost (hence, one less star even though he was the sweetest guy ever it seems all delivery drivers should have a GPS by now), the pizza still arrived hot and the kids were ecstatic to have it after the game.  Now, you could be thinking that we thought the pizza was amazing because we were all cold, hungry and tired, but NO, we've had pizza delivered before and it was worse than Domino's thin, cardboard excuse for pizza.  Zante's pizza was truly perfect with a nice doughy crust (think, perfect naan bread of course), and generously topped with cheese and pepperoni.  They didn't mess up the basics, so next time we're looking forward to trying the Indian pizza and possibly adding on that extra star.
author: Cathy L.

description: The pizza is delicious ( after being heated up in the oven) the delivery experience was horrible.  We ordered the pizza at 7pm, they said it would arrive in 45 minutes- it arrived at 9:30pm! We were ravenous and livid. The owner of Zante was so annoyed with my phone calls, he gave the delivery driver my number.  Don't order delivery, pick up the pizza!
author: Liz Y.

description:
Definitely worth trying.  
I'd recommend the pizza first, and then the Indian food.  OK, the samosas are enormous, but the other dishes were a bit lack-luster.

So back to the pizza.
It's prepared in the brick oven (tandoori) so it the crust is nice and light, and a bit crunchy on the outside.

The toppings range from traditional pepperoni, etc to more exotic Indian vegetarian combo.  When you go, try at least a slice of that one.

It's really a no-frills place, but there is table service, and it was pretty attentive.
author: Ken B.

description:
I ordered online for delivery, the food was ok i guess rice with little flavor, my lamb curry was good. My cheese naan not so much.
Delivery 10 mn late.
author: Tiny D.

description:
i've heard Zante serves up delectable and innovative Indian-style pizzas.  I should have stuck to ordering a pizza instead of classic Indian dishes.  My chicken biryani and Madras murg curry were below average at best.  The biryani was a mush of tomatoes and ginger, while the rice was overcooked.  This is not how a biryani should be.  My Madras murg curry was nothing more than a glorified chicken makni, with a shockingly few pieces of tandoori chicken bits thrown in.  The $25 price tag for both dishes added insult to injury.  

I may go back for their pizza but for classic Indian dishes, I'd say, go elsewhere.
author: Vikram S.

description:
Friday night @ 8pm and Indian pizza sounds sooo good. I read the reviews and I'm all SHEEEZ its gonna take fo-evaaa it better be good!

Got- Veg Indian pizza and Lamb samosas
Got here in 30min hot and amazing!

Soo good. The pizza crust was crispy and doughy.. and the toppings- are you kidding me?Cheese, Ginger, Garlic, Curry, Grn Onions, Eggplant -YES!  It totally worked.

Lamb Samosas- Minced spiced lamb in a sweet crispy deep fried goodness. Got my Indian food hater bf goin whaaaat is that?

Def doin it again.
author: Shamie T.

description:
I LOVE Zante Indian pizza!!!! 

When I first ordered indian pizza, I was expecting a gooey, watery, curry-like sauce on top.  But the pizza turned out to be completely different!  It had a wonderful combination of flavors, ingredients..spices....dough...

Let's just say, I've gotten delivery of this Indian pizza, and eaten all of it.   

Both veggie and meat are good.  Haven't tried the other things on the menu, and you really don't need to at all! But to be fair that's why I gave it 4 stars..Not sure how the other dishes taste.
author: Amy H.

description:
Bringing Pizza and Indian food to the level of supreme state. 
A must try for San Francisco residents and visitors alike. 

The staff are warm and friendly...attentative. Always ready to sooth your boyfriend's burning tongue with all the springs of water...or waters of springs...=)....
author: Xiu L.

description:
I long for the days when it had an outlet  around the corner from Bombay Ice creamery and you could have an entirely fusion-y dining experience.

The crust tastes like naan and it's covered with savory bits of tandoori meat.

Wash it all down with a bottle of Indian beer.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
Was pretty interesting.. my friend was raving about how great Indian pizza is.  So I debated about ordering a few pies for a party.  I have to be honest, I am not a big fan of Indian food.  To be even MORE honest, I haven't even tried it.  I guess its the smell of spices and whatnot that has always turned me away from it.

I looked at Zantes website and noticed they had slices available.   I am throwing my dog's 3rd birthday party, and if I were to serve INDIAN pizza, I'd have to know for myself if it was edible.  

My husband and I tried the vegetarian indian slice and a normal cheese slice.  It looked weird, but after biting it.. it wasn't so bad.  Now, I would appreciate a normal slice of pizza.. with you know, cheese, pepperoni, mushroom etc.. but this is something different.  It tasted like exotic bread.  The cheese slice was a big hit for my husband.  He is a bit particular about the texture of the dough.. and this one had just enough crunch.. and it wasn't soggy.  Soggy pizza is an automatic negative for him.  It was pretty inexpensive too.. $6 for 2 slices of pizza and a canned soda. 

So.. in the end.. I will be ordering a few pies for my dogs birthday party.  I'll also be picking another pie up at Zacharys in Oakland.. deep dish pie baby!

I'll update my review after the party is over :)
author: Alice E.

description:
Indian Pizza -- it's as good as it sounds, even though it sounds too good to be true (wait, does that make sense?).  Seriously, every time I have it (whether homemade or from a restaurant) I wonder why I ever bother eating anything else.  Still, for some reason it remains a cult dish, and few restaurants bother to make it, let alone perfect it.  Fortunately, at Zante's the pizza is the signature dish, and you can tell right away that they've honed it into a masterpiece (with dough that would be the envy of any traditional pizzeria, I should add).  

The only thing I was shocked too see is that they only make one kind of indian pizza (even the vegetarian toppings are just a subset of the regular toppings).  What, no "chicken pizza masala"?  No "saag pizzaneer"?  No "pizzalu gobhi"?  They clearly have the skills to make these if they tried, so I have to dock one star for lack of ambition.  But other than that, eating Zante's is like eating in heaven (well, actually the interior looks like they took Naan-n-Curry and tried to starch-shirt it a bit, and it just ends up looking awkward.  So I wouldn't blame you for going the delivery route if you can).
author: Wes M.

description: Loved the veggie chicken pizza and the lamb. Go early.
author: Kevin L.

description: Very average food and not a good value.  The taste was average, the amount of chicken and lamb in my dishes did not justify the cost.  Over priced food.  They do deliver for those too lazy to go out.  Probably won't go back.
author: Doug B.

description: Wonderful vegetarian pizza. This place is a staple. Long waits for delivery though (an hour to hour and half) so plan ahead.
author: Kate R.

description:
I say, "Indian Pizza"

You say, "What the fu*k?"

I say, "Trust me. It's the best collaboration of any other cultures culinary into pizza format. "

And I thought the Mexican Pizza at Gumba's was excellent.
Everybody I've introduced to this pizza has begged me to take them there every time they come to visit. I can't describe it. It has curry and other spices, with cheese and some veggies. I can say that the tandori chicken that tops it is excellent but I find it too much! Me! I'm an avid meat eater who will always take some meat in a dish rather than not. Boy I hope that doesn't sound wrong. 

Just trust me, get the Indian Pizza, half meat and half not so you can decide which is better. Maybe I just eat fewer meat slices and then I cannot feel so stuffed, but that won't happen.
author: Dustin S.

description:
Just had lunch delivered from this place....

After waiting 2 hours for delivery, we called and enquired where our food was. We were told it would be here in less than 5 minutes. 15 minutes later we received a call asking for directions, and were told to stand outside and wait for them, because... well... I'm not sure, most other delivery folks can manage getting in the elevator and getting to the 3rd floor... After 20 minutes of waiting in the cold, they eventually showed up and gave us the food. Unfortunately waiting around for 2 hours messed up our plans for the day.

We took it up to our apartment and wow.... there was a lot of mysterious looking goo. I was rather surprised to open a tin foil package to see a cardboard box... with liquid in.... it got rather messy.

after eating some rice and... I'm not sure what... we turned to the chicken on the bone. Generally, back in England (where I am from) Indian chicken is in chunks, but I know different places in Indian prepare food differently, so I shrugged it off and took a bite. It tasted like rotting eggs. I know that it is NOT supposed to taste that way. This was some bad chicken, so that went straight into the compost bin. 

On a brighter note, the Naan bread and raita were nice, however the rest was just a failure pile in a sadness bowl. Including the service.

I would not recommend this place at all. I don't generally place reviews, but this place was just so bad I needed to get it off my chest.
author: Anna P.

description:
So you know what? the slow delivery did not bother me because I was warned. Also, my other Indian Pizza place in lower haight takes over an hour to deliver as well.

Our pizza arrived warm and I threw a few slices into a waiting hot oven to crisp up for a few moments. MMMMMmmmmmm we got the best Indian pizza with no prawns and it was TASTY! A terrific blend of spices, nothing was over powering and not greasy at all. The extra oven time crisped up the crust nicely. I also like the chewiness of the crust. 

The Medium will feed us for 2 meals and yeah over $20 for a med pizza isn't cheap. But 2 meals for 2 for $20 isn't too bad....

My advice, plan ahead. Order your order online before you are hungry and have a hot oven waiting. Ask for some extra spicy sauce and you are set to go!

We will be ordering this again.
author: Allegra F.

description: Tasty pizza, slow as hell. That pretty much sums up both my experience as well as most of the reviews.
author: Emily M.

description: Went here for valentines dinner and wouldn't even use the word disappointed to describe the service. After we were seated, the server didn't come to take our orders until 15 minutes later, sitting at our table with menus closed and ready to order the entire time. Once we were finished, server put down the check and told us to tip him cash only??? We tipped him and he gave us a dirty look and pocketed the money. Definitely will not be coming back.
author: Jenny M.

description:
i literally dream of this place at least thrice a week.

If I could stick their vegetarian Indian pizza in my face, I would.

I just realized that I can and am going to do so. 

Amazing and cheap as shit.
author: Elizabeth T.

description: This pizza makes me rethink everything I know about pizza. I was turned on to Zante's by a friend. I was the typical person looking at the Tikka masala pizza but was steered towards the light. Vegetarian! That's it, end game. It's the best most flavorful anything you could put in your mouth. You're welcome.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
I had to try it once.
we got the veggie Indian pizza and a few curries.

The curries were great and the pizza was interesting and surprisingly good.  We even put some of the curry on the pizza to Indianify the pie even more.

Not the healthiest choice but something to try once.  Next time I might just get the Indian food.  Tikka Masala was tasty.

DELIVERY TOOK WAY TO LONG - over 1 hour and I had to call to make sure they were still coming.
author: A S.

description:
Those white tablecloths aren't fooling anyone. This place is a joint, delightful in its simplicity.  The lighting is horrible.

I can't think of anywhere else that serves Indian pizza.  If you go here, you must order a slice or a pie - either vegetarian or whatever meat variety they happen to have that day (ie tandoori chicken).  It just makes sense.  The dough isn't an award winner or particularly naan-like, but it's a decent vehicle for the perfect blend of spices and just the right amount of cheese.

Worth a trek to the outer mission/Bernal Heights, most certainly.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Chances are, you are gonna go here for the Indian pizza that you have heard everyone talk about. Chances are, if you are reading my review you are vegan or looking for vegan food.

This Indian pizza is quite novel. It is slightly sweet and has a ton of toppings all diced into tiny pieces just how I like my food. It tasted better when I added the chutney condiments to my slices. It also seemed very bready while still being a thin crust. It didn't blow my mind but it was pretty damn good.

We ordered a XL pie for 4 people and had way more than enough.
The service was SUPER friendly and totally hip to vegan requests.

Your breath will certainly be kickin' after eating here.
author: shane s.

description: Of course this place is good, "The Best" is the best! got delivery from them twice and it was fine, I guess the spoiled millennials can't hang.  Support this business  it;s one of the few remaining awesome longtime local restaurants Thanks guys! Always good!
author: migliano b.

description:
Mmm, good stuff!

The vegetarian Indian pizza my bf and I had was really good -- it had spinach, eggplant, cauliflower, ginger, and garlic on top of the cheese with some kind of spicy curry-like sauce. Tasty!

Their prices are okay -- $20 for a medium specialty pizza, but then again where else are you going to get Indian pizza?

The one thing I really didn't like was the delivery time. Sure, they deliver to anywhere in SF, but it took almost an hour for our pizza to arrive. Get more drivers or cut back the delivery area, guys!
author: Sam K.

description: Ordered pizza and the man said it would arrive in 45 minutes. It's been 97 minutes and counting!
author: Francisco A.

description:
Any East Coast transplants are well aware of the serious problems this city has with pizza. I have been told that the climate here is great for the much cherished sourdough bread, but for similar reasons it is terrible for pizza dough. I have no idea whether that is true or not, what I do know is that San Francisco's pizza, whether we're talking about the cheap by-the slice variety, or the more bourgeois gourmet style, are both fundamentally terrible forms of pizza.

Enter Zante's, with its pizza composed of Indian ingredients. Does it really count as pizza? Not really, just as Chicago deep dish pizza isn't really pizza either. Is it better than any other pizza place in the city? Absolutely.

They also, of course, have Indian food here, which I've found to be unexceptional. Come here for the pizza. They also have "regular" pizza here too, but I don't think I have the guts to see how that is. They also have ridiculously cheap pitchers of beer, so actually going to the physical establishment is a good idea. Delivery can be pretty rough, the last time I ordered from here it took over an hour and a half for the pizza to arrive, and as you can imagine it wasn't particularly fresh at that point.
author: Paul J.

description:
I have to admit, I curled my lip when house guests gripping to-go menus voted for Zante's. The last time we got it it wasn't so great. The crust was more thick and less cooked than usual. But I gave in because I'm trying to be more flexible with many things out of my control. 

It took what seemed like forever but when it arrived, it was one of those celebratory occasions where diners move about the kitchen area as if in dance...two slices of the specialty pizza, a torn piece of naan, a few plops of pakora, spin around and grab the glass of wine all before the commercial break is over. The crust was phenomenal! The toppings amazing. A heavenly evening, once again, with Zantes.
author: Penne P.

description: vegetarian Indian pizza. that's all you need to know or order. anything else is meh. so 5 stars is for that only
author: Matthew R.

description:
This place is solid.
The best thing about it is the waiter (guy in white shirt in one of the pictures)
I like his no-nonsense approach and wish all serving staff would learn from him.
Helpful, to the point, no extra words or stupid 'how-are-you's. exudes competence but doesnt waste your time. terse, without being rude.
the pizza was good. a little garlicy but that can be a good thing. and cheap.
author: epic j.

description:
ZOMGWTFBBQ Zante Pizza, you complete me.

I always get The Best Indian Pizza off their specialty menu.  I mean really, "Topped with Spinach, Egg Plant, Cauliflower, Ginger, Garlic, Green Onions, Cilantro, Lamb, Tandoori Chicken & Prawns" what more could you possibly want??  Oh you want to put ham and pepperonis on it?  Ok you can do that too.  Srsly.  The first time we tried it, we were being open-minded.  Little did I know that it would change my life FOREVER.

In all seriousness, the pizza is flippin' amazing.  At first I wasn't sure if it would blend.. Indian food on a pizza?  But it's delish.  The crust is like a pizza dough/naan hybrid that's so tasty.  And I love that you can also order regular (boring) pizza or regular Indian food.  They really have it all.

Per previous Yelper recommendation, dip the crust in tikka masala sauce and it will rock your world.  You'll never look at Papa John's garlic sauce dip the same way again.

Can't say anything about their delivery b/c we always do take-out.  Def call it in ahead of time b/c it takes time to whip up some magic.
author: Christie C.

description:
I've been waiting for over 100 minutes for my food. I'm so so hungry. They told me it would be 40 minutes, took my credit card number and just keep telling me 'don't worry. its coming.' I'm very worried. Don't ever order from here.

Update: at the 105 minute mark, the delivery driver called to see if I wanted the food I ordered anymore. He's still over 15 minutes away. I've never experienced anything like this poor excuse for a restaurant business. 

Next update: Its been another 25 minutes. I still don't have the food. They still tell me it will come in 5 minutes. 'Its ok" they say. Its not. Its not at all. 

2.5 hours after my initial delivery: the delivery driver has finally come. I'm so hungry I'm in tears. He offers his face for me to slap. What the F%^&K?? This is the single most disgusting, unprofessional business I've ever encountered.
author: Alice A.

description:
you have to know how to order here- the pizza is amazing and everyone I've introduced it to agrees, as it's a very unique flavor and not for the faint of heart. The guys are really nice but I probably wouldn't recommend having it delivered as yes, it can take a while (they clearly make a lot of pizzas).  

recommendation:
-order the Indian pizza
-eat in as they have some of the cheapest pitchers of beer in the city (it's like $6 for a pitcher of Bud Light) or order for pick up, not delivery
-it's also close to a lot of fun bars...
author: Katie Z.

description:
Always count your change. And read your bill.

I haven't eaten in at this place in ages just because of the pretty bad to swindler-ing service, but oh my to I love their food.

Take out is the way to go.

1. You can order online and add comments on exactly how you'd like your food prepared.
2. Then they call you and confirm your order.

3. A lot of the people who take orders don't really speak English -- so calling is incredibly difficult. Order online.

You might be wondering what to order at this point. To that there is only one good answer: INDIAN PIZZA

Look under their Zatne's Specials and get that. It's addictively delicious, even if curry on pizza seems a little weird.
author: Elena C.

description:
I'd like to give this place a higher review but  I've had the same problem with deliveries as other reviewers.  It's frustrating when you're hungry and you've got a 1.5hr wait and have to make repeated follow up phone calls with people who don't speak great English.    

I'll probably keeping eating there.  The food is usually pretty good, and some of the spicy curries are really quite excellent. 

My delivery success has been better with phone orders than their online system.
author: aaron f.

description:
No, no, no. Never, EVER again. 

Used to be a huge Zante's fan years ago. Unfortunately, this place has slid right into the crapper and is now simply coasting on it's old reputation. 

Ordered delivery last night. Third time in a row I was told 30 min and it took well over an hour (I live less than 1/2 mile away). But this last time was too much--my delivery took almost 2 hours!! And when I got the food--it was cold and sucked! And one of the two entree I ordered leaked and spilled out of the cheap, crappy containers they all over everything else in the bag and leaked out through the bottom. One entree completely wasted--which also reminds me, this place isn't cheap anymore either. What a complete waste of my time and money!
author: Wendy G.

description: I tried their Indian pizza twice (via eat24). The first time the pizza was flavorful, with tasty crust, and the only thing I wish it had was more chicken. The 2nd time, I ordered the same pizza, and it was bland, stale and flavorless, with chewy crust. I guess the fact that it took them over 2 hrs to deliver didn't help either. never again!
author: Igor P.

description:
The food is very good, both the traditional Indian dishes and the pizza, but delivery is always a bit of a crap shoot.  I live less than a mile away, but as often as not it takes at least an hour.  Also, once you hit the hour mark, you can be sure they forgot the order.  Call back, remind them, and lo and behold the food shows up in about twenty minutes.

As for the comments regarding people who answer the phone, I don't think they are rude.  But I do think they have trouble with English.

Addendum -- who knew the timing of my review would be so, well, timely.  I placed my order at 11:30am.  After two follow up calls it arrived at 1:30pm.  Half an hour later I realized they had about half the order wrong.  I called and they offered to replace the whole thing at no cost.

The food really is great.  If they could just get a better handle on the kitchen and logistics they'd get 5 stars.
author: Hal M.

description:
The pizza is high quality and tasty with all the sorts of flavors you'd expect from Indian food in a pizza format.  The service, however, is insanely poor.  Delivery generally takes well over an hour - it took 1.5 hours on one occasion and nearly two tonight.  I don't know if we'll be ordering from here again.  We gave up hope after an hour and forty-five minutes and went out for pizza to get a call from our driver just as we arrived home.  He didn't offer any discount or anything and handed over a thoroughly cold, soggy pizza.

I'm sure dine-in is better, but delivery is nearly useless.  For God's sake, don't pre-pay because there's a decent chance you won't get your food at all.
author: Dan C.

description: Da-da-da-damn. As a virgin to Indian pizza I had no expectations, but during a recent trip to visit my sister and her bf I'm officially down for the cause. I was told that no one really eats there as everyone gets pizza to go and my trip there enforced this point. For pizza you get the choices of either meat (chicken) or vegetarian. I opted for the chicken with is topped with with Spinach, Egg Plant, Cauliflower, Ginger, Garlic, Green Onions, Cilantro, Lamb, Tandoori Chicken & Prawns. These are all capitalized because I want you to get the full sense of what you are ordering. Wow, wow, wow, wow, wow. Five wows means this is a life changing experience. This pizza is from whomever built the pyramids because it is so beyond anything I've tasted before. No bullshit, when someone asks me what the best Indian pizza is I will not pause or meander. ZANTE!
author: Steve A.

description:
The Indian pizza rocked my world. I was incredibly skeptical. "So, it's Indian stuff on naan? No? It's normal pizza? With normal cheese? With Indian food on it? Uhh... I'm not so sure about this..." Well, put your skepticism aside, friends. If you like pizza and if you like Indian food, you will love it. I don't know how it works. It shouldn't. But it is incredible.

They have a vegetarian pizza and it is awesome! The samosas were pretty good, too. We just got delivery, so I can't comment on the in-restaurant service. It probably took us a solid hour to get our pizza, but it was a Friday night, so I find this reasonable. Not exceptionally good or bad. The deliciousness of the pizza made the wait worth it.
author: Amanda J.

description:
I just have to say: These guys are amazing!!! No they're no five star classy restaurant, but I don't give a flying feathered frisbee if they can barely speak english! Their food is AH-mazing. 

I have been ordering food for delivery from them almost once a week lately, and they have been prompt, friendly and consistent! How many delivery places can you say that about? The food is always piping hot.

As soon as the lid lifts off the pizza box, I swear I turn into a ravenous wildebeest and forget who and where I am!! Until I poke my head back out about 5 minutes later, with crumbs on my shirts, and my mouth stuffed, and I'm staring at an empty pizza box thinking... "what happened? I think I blacked out..."

I mean, really people! It's that good!

Just go.
author: Mindy L.

description: This place used to be our "go to" for take out , the other night a total disaster...75min wait for delivery of cold pizza and wrong order of food.  never again
author: Ellen G.

description: Vegetarian Indian Pizza. Oh wow. I had my doubts, but they were dispelled as soon as our pizza hit the table. I don't even like ginger, but this was *godly.* the veggie pakoras was great too- in love with that pizza though.
author: Laura N.

description:
Wow, something really seems to be going wrong at Zante's lately. I ordered delivery from them semi-regularly (once a month or so), and always the food was good and delivery was timely. Last week I placed the same order as usual, which arrived in good time, but the pepperoni was BAD. You could tell by looking at the pizza that there was something wrong with the pepperoni, it was all brown. It smelled strange and tasted disgusting. Gross.

Sorry guys, you're no longer in the rotation, even if you are close by.
author: Dee O.

description: Our food was forty minutes later than the predicted delivery time that was given to us. When I called to ask about our order they were rude. I will not be ordering from here again.
author: Carly M.

description:
I ordered Zante's vegan pizza while on vacation in SF. The small was GIGANTIC! It took me three nights to even finish the thing on my own. It was covered in delicious vegetables and a nice sweet, mild paste. It definitely need a dipping sauce to enjoy it further. It was a bit difficult to eat due to having really no binding of the vegetables. i absolutely loved the pizza dough, it really did taste like a thicker, deliciously rich naan. The price was a bit more than I really wanted to pay, but I was on vacation. I would definitely order from there again.

I also have pretty fast delivery on a Tuesday night. I ordered online, they called to confirm minutes later, and it arrived within the 45min time they had given me.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Zante Pizza & Indian is this very unassuming establishment in the mission with KICKASS food!!!

My first experience here was for dinner... We ordered quite a feast and it came out to about $30... not bad for a full dinner for two, including leftovers! Personally we had great service- they were extremely attentive, efficient and helpful. That may have had something to do with the fact that business was pretty slow, but still! A+ for the service!

My second experience with Zante was when we wanted to get indian food delivered. They delivered free of charge, had it to us in about 45 minutes and drove all the way to NOB HILL!!! Pretty damn stellar, if you ask me.

I have yet to try the indian pizza, but it does sound rather intriguing...
author: Felicity M.

description:
The food is decent, but...a thin layer of curry on doughy pizza crust?  Eh.  No wonder they tout the "best Indian pizza" in San Francisco.  This is one idea that didn't make it beyond 1 location.

I would definitely go for either Indian food or for pizza.
author: John B.

description:
This place has been recommended to me several times.  I finally realized that they deliver to my place and tried them out.  My first experience with them was good.  Both the pizza and the Indian food were very good, if a bit pricey for what you get.

The second time I ordered, was shocking.  My pizza showed up after 2 hours, and several calls.  The guy on the phone was very rude.  Each time I called he would say that the food would be there in 5 minutes then hung up.

Finally, when the pizza arrived, I asked the driver why it was so late.  He said that we were too far and they didn't pay him enough to come that far.  If he has a problem with the delivery area, he should take it up with them, not with me.

Of course, since the pizza was so late it was barely above room temperature. 

Between my experience and that of other yelpers, I'm not planning on ever ordering from here again.
author: James W.

description:
$3 buck veggie indian pizza! What a deal. I am amazed that the fusion of pizza and indian food works so well. It is now my favorite place to stop for a quick slice. 
The dough is perfect, crispy crust and tangy/ sweet flavor from the chuntneys that you dip your pizza in! True goodness!
author: Rachna P.

description:
in the bernal area and short of cash yet hungry for a snack? look no furthur than the $2 (or was it $3?) slice of pizza. sure its not the most amazing i've ever had and i feel kinda strange walking in to a sit down spot to get a to-go slice but hey... they get the job done. 

*high-five* for zantes.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Indian pizza?! What? Best in SF, wait a minute...

I never heard such thing as an Indian meat pizza, minutes later....wow, this is really good. Order the mango juice, it's quiet impressive.
author: Stanley K.

description: One of the best pizza joints in the US. No BS'ing - crisp crust, spicy, fresh toppings. Delicious!
author: Ms. T.

description: Ordered a pizza online for delivery last week. Apparently they are supposed to call you to confirm receipt of the order. We didn't hear anything for 20 mins and then called them to check on the status and they said it would be 25 minutes to delivery....and 45 mins later I call and try to politely ask them again about the pizza. The guy picks up the phone and says 10 more mins and hangs up without even checking who was calling. And guess what! We called them back 15 mins later. They were completely unapologetic and said it will be 5 more mins. At this point we are starving and it's past dinner time! 10 minutes later we call him again and say if this is not going to happen we just want to cancel it now, we've had enough! They said that the delivery person is already on their way and will be there in 2 minutes. I suspiciously hang up. Still no pizza - almost 2 hours since we placed the order. We politely ask him to just cancel it and return our money back. He then says that they should be at my place by now, and he won't charge us for the pizza. The doorbell rings and we pick up our pizza and tell him this way way later than we expected (implying that we won't be tipping) The delivery guy basically curses us under his breath and announces sarcastically "thanks for the tip" and leaves. The pizza is completely cold. At this point I'm furious about ever ordering from this place. If they told us it would be 2 hours we could've made alternative arrangements. I see on yelp that they have done this before. If you're a pizza shop and you fail to deliver for 2 hours, sorry you don't deserve to exist. And a day late, as per my suspicion this charge shows up on my credit card. Wish I had just cancelled and returned the pizza instead of accepting their cold pizza and being cussed out by their delivery guy. Never ordering again.
author: Anitha I.

description:
Indian pizza? Where have I been my whole life?
At a dinner someone had 2 indian pizza pies - one meat and one vege. The meat pie had all the colors of an Indian festival and combined the best of a fluffy pizza crust with the flavors of Indian food.

If I'd been hungry at the time I'd have gobbled it all up. As it was, I was stuffed so managed to only pack down 1 piece - very happily.

Now that my genie has come out of the Indian pizza bottle I didn't know existed I'll surely try it again. Very yummy and worth trying.
author: Susie W.

description: I go here every time I want vegan pizza. I once got their regular cheese Indian pizza (by mistake) and it was ok, but their Indian vegan is far better. I usually order it with a side order of Dahl, which is good to dip the side crust into. I try to go once a month.
author: tony m.

description:
My boyfriend and I have been ordering here for the past year. Anytime we want pizza its Zante's. Mainly because they have a really good vegan choice for my boyfriend. So tonight we are having a gathering and early n the day decide well all have Zante's.. we order 3 med pizza..  1 pepperoni and sausage, 1 veggie with pepperoni and 1 vegan thru the online ordering site. They arrive with 2 pepperoni and sausage.. with it clearly marked being only 2 out of 3 pizzas and we explained that one of the 2 pizzas should be the veggie with pepperoni. 
The driver was nice (hard to understand) and said he would be back after calling his boss. I decided to call to get it straightened out. When i called i explained that the order was wrong. They guy on the phone said yes that it should be 3 pizzas but was his order showed 2 pepperoni and 1 veggie with pepperoni.  I kept telling him that i was reading of my confirmation message but he insisted on reading his telling me that I was wrong.. We went back and forth and he began to get loud with me.. I asked him if we could agree there was an error and if he could please make the order that I wanted. And in this a$$ remark he insisted on reading what he thought was my order... Why would you argue in such a mean voice to such an extreme? i am in the restaurant business and trust in me that this was NO way to treat someone who orders for  year and wants to give you money for something good that you sell. 

15 min after we hung up.. the boss made his sweet driver come back to show me the order form.. HOW RUDE! 

Please do NOT order from here!
author: Ryann C.

description:
The Indian pizza is pretty epic
The free delivery is also wonderful. They called to confirm, told me 45 minutes and it arrived at 40. Hot, delicious, and huge! The small was 8-10 slices..not too sure, as soon as I opened the lid I immediately grabbed for one. I've never had a pizza look so good....
author: Laura T.

description:
As my little cousin would say, DEEWISHOUS! 

I heard so much about this place I had to give it a try. Lets see, nothing to fancy inside but the dining area, Indian music that was a little too loud and a few folks behind the counter. A nice man greets us and seats us. 

After a few minutes we decide on, The Best Indian Pizza, lamb samosa and 2 Lassai drinks.


Mango Lassi-Personally, I didnt like the drink., reminded me of a GoGurt. 

Lamb samosa- YUMO 

For all you people who like Indian food and love dipping your naan into every sauce you could dip it into, this pizza is the perfect creation. You no longer have to dip! The pizza contains so many flavors and so many toppings, its like a party in your mouth.
author: Trisha C.

description:
I swear, sometimes I think my people can do no culinary wrong. This Indian pizza is INCREDIBLE - packed with flavour and veggies and really amazing. The other Indian food here wasn't great; you definitely want to try the pizza if you're coming here. 

Service can be patchy; on some occasions when we've been there the server has been very attentive but on others extremely curt and almost rude.
author: Vaishnavi J.

description:
I'm the perfect person for this food, what I hoped was spicy delicious Indian on crispy crust ended up taking almost two hours to arrive cold cold cold.   I know it wasn't the drivers fault, having only one driver for a cold foggy Saturday night is not acceptable.  I don't think that they should be cutting costs on their service like that.  

It actually was good once I re-heated it up on the pizza stone and slathered the mint chutney and other sauce on it.  The crust was a bit bland but maybe it's one of those foods that you actually have to order in the restaurant.
author: Brye L.

description: Service is incredibly inconsistent -- I've called to order a delivery and received my (indian, of course) pizza in 20 minutes! I've also called to order a delivery, been told that they don't do delivery, that they already have an order from me and it will arrive in 90 minutes, and been hung up on. So... know that that's a gamble, and only order in situations when you'll be hanging around for a while, are not immediately starving, and have a backup plan!
author: Maia B.

description:
Indian Pizza? I thought only Italians made pizza... 

A great fusion of pizza and sauce mixed with the flavors and spices of India. We ordered a Large with Tandoori Chicken, Spinach, Cauliflower, Garlic, Green Onions & Cilantro. The first bite was incredible. The flavor was amazing, and the taste was like nothing I had ever tasted. I think I could of ate the entire pizza by myself but I only had about 3 slices. 

The delivery guy was really nice too. He called me to let me know that he was having trouble finding it but he was actually already here.

A different option to just ordinary pizza.
author: Norma Denisse S.

description:
Right on!!!

We picked up an Indian Pizza to-go on Saturday night...  I had been sick and sad, and my boyfriend had a feeling it would be the right thing to make me better.

The service was fine for us, and it wasn't long at all before our order was ready.

Did I mention they also have ONLINE ORDERING from their website and deliver anywhere in the city for free?!  I dig that.

Anyhow, the first bite of that pizza rocked my world.  I love Indian food, so Indian food on a pizza?  YEAH!  It really was delicious.  It was the perfect combination of spices and flavors.  I went from having no appetite at all to devouring about half of the pizza, ready and willing to fight Marcelo for the other half.  I had a butter knife nearby and probably would have used it.

I do have to say that I didn't eat there...  This review is REALLY just based on the food itself.  Maybe that's the way to do it, just take it home.  Sounds like the service is sub-par at best.

But this pizza is delicious to the max!
author: Jess R.

description: Best Indian pizza ever! I love ordering this for take out and having people try it. Everyone laways loves it
author: Jackie G.

description:
Those of you who have checked my review know that I seldom review anything that isnt great (or horrible).  If I havent rated it it is probably average!
 So, What is Zante's?  GREAT or horrible?

The answer is GREEAAATTT?

The only time I have had Indian pizza this good was when I was in Mumbai.  The Mango Lassi had so much mango that it seemed like a mango smoothie.  GET ONE!

The menu beyond pizza looked great, but I seriously doubt I will ever try any of it.  The pizza is too danged good!

Now, shut down your computer, get of you butt and get over to Zante's  (btw parking is not easy, but it is worth the work if the walk it too far)
author: Dan W.

description:
What to do...what to do...Pizza or Indian? Pizza or Indian? Hmm...let's see what Yelp has to say. OMG Indian Pizza?! SOLD!
So that's what we did one lazy ass afternoon when we couldn't even get up to the kitchen to check out what was in the fridge. We ordered Indian Pizza from Zante's and this is how it went:

Online ordering system with enticing pictures? check.
A quick confirmation call and delivery faster than promised? check.
Friendly Indian guy telling us that he made us a great dinner? check.
Opening up the boxes and unwrapping tin foil to find delicious, steaming food that looks just like the enticing pictures? CHECK CHECK CHECK

We had a medium Indian pizza, spicy daal, mango chutney and samosas. All yummy and devoured in a very short period of time. No doubt we'll be order again soon, next time laziness sets in.
author: Dima A.

description: Watery, bland and overpriced.  Not even sure the lamb was lamb, because it was flavorless.  There were about 4 pieces of "lamb" in the order of vindaloo for $10.99, lame.  The channa masala had way too much cilantro and hardly any garbanzo beans.  You can't tell me they're expensive, because I know that they ain't.  The sauces were watered down or crappy.  I guess the pizza is the way to go, but how the hell would I know?  Not to mention I can't eat pizza.  The only reason they get 2 stars is that the food was edible.  Never again.
author: Heather S.

description:
Contrary to what EVERY single person in other reviews said, no this place does NOT serve indian food on a pizza.

It serves SEX on a round thing of MAGIC sprinkled with a generous dose of PARTY IN MY MOUTH.

I just wanted to make sure. That you guys understand. So that there is no confusion.
author: Tanya F.

description: By far the worst pizza. I ordered a slice a pizza and when I got the pizza the guy said I had to eat it outside because "I" got it to go, what???? He assumed I got it to go because it was a slice. This place makes me so sick, and everytime I pass by this place I feel sick because of the smell. SO GROSS OUT.
author: Nicole B.

description:
I love that they call themselves "The Best Indian Pizza in San Francisco." For the record, I make "The Best Texan Matzoh Ball Soup in San Francisco."

Zante's is good so long as you keep a few things in mind:

1. Don't order online. I'm not sure why they have this feature on their website. They don't check it. If you forget that you ordered it online, then so will they and you will be hungry.

2. All versions of their Indian Pizza taste exactly the same. Extra sauce? Tikka Masala? All the same. Don't think too hard.

3. Ask for extra red & green side sauces. They won't remember to bring them, but that's cool. If you don't order them you'll wish you had, and at least now you know you tried.

4. Be high when you order. It's fun. Not just from the usual "it's fun to be high" perspective, but because you have people offering you Indian Pizza on the other end of the phone, a proposition who's full impact can only truly be appreciated when you're three millimeters of impulse control away from deep-frying batter-dipped chocolate chip cookies. 

5. Get at least a double order of pakora. Small servings, and the part of you that is demanding deep-fried food will be satisfied. 

6. Put on a movie. No matter how long the movie is, the food will arrive exactly at the midway point, ten minutes after you start wondering just where the fuck your food is.

7. Double check your order when it shows up. Like I said, they won't have the green & red sauces you ordered, but let it go, let it go. Just make sure your mango lassi made it from the driver's car to your house. It didn't, and you need to call them to have them call the driver and tell him to turn around and bring it to you. This conversation will take a little while, because they won't initially believe you.

8. This is a superimportant one: don't eat the whole pizza. Stick what's left in the fridge. In the morning, scramble & soft-cook a few eggs with whatever's left of the green & red sauces that you hopefully didn't actually drink, and then bake the remaining pizza with the eggs on top.

Keep these things in mind, and you will have a fantastic experience. I promise.

UPDATE:
I'm totally deep-frying batter-coated chocolate chip cookies.
author: jason l.

description:
Om Zante - Om Zante.  While not a true religious experience, I happily light a candle of gratitude on the Zante shrine for:

1- Making killer Indian pizza  
2 - CITYWIDE DELIVERY !!!!

Thus enabling me to enjoy killer pizza even though I am not in a distinct delivery district. Halle-freakin'-lujah to a place that recognizes a car can easily traverse the 7 x 7 mini city we live, love, laugh and hopefully eat great Indian pizza in. Even at night. In bed. When not able to go out. High five Zante! You meat me more than half way.
author: wendella a.

description:
Oh, yes...grease, I tell you!  GREASE!!

An order from Zante Pizza often seeps through its foil wrapped container, through its paper bag, and even through the table on which you place it.  Once in your mouth, that grease goes on to seep through your stomach and through your chest creating a vaguely opaque, grease-laden window to your very soul upon which your most secret passions are forever revealed to the public, and those passions cry out into the darkened universe, "FEED ME MORE!"  'Cuz despite being greasy, Zante's is good!

Complications abound, however.  If one orders their food "as hot as you can make it" that person's soul too often finds itself plummeted into the Hellish depths of spice.  A single bite can feel like a punch in the mouth, but with a flavor that leaves you clambering for another...and another.  The spices are so hot, yet so tasty you'll find yourself shuffling a scalding morsel around the interior of your palate as you simultaneously inhale air in quick huffs to make the the entire experience somehow barely tolerable.

Hellish though it may be to the soul, however, Zante will forever have a place in Heaven.  Why, you ask?  Well, simply put they will deliver anywhere in the city.  Yes, anywhere.

Finally, if a dog ever gets caught in my ventilation system, I'm pretty sure I can prepare myself for crawling through the ventilation system by going to Zante's and reenacting this scene from The Simpsons...

Groundskeeper Kevin H:  Zante employee, have ye got any grease?

Zante Employee:  Yes, yes we do.

[Groundskeeper Kevin H tears off his shirt]

Groundskeeper Kevin H:  Then grease me up woman!
author: Kevin H.

description:
Just horrible! Need motor oil for your car? Just order the saag paneer because our S.P. was drowned in it!!  Oil was the main "not so secret" ingredient in both the saag paneer and the chana masala.  Bleck!  As soon as I opened the to-go containers of these dishes, I saw green and red oil!  The saag really looked like green vomit.  My husband tasted a cheese cube and said it tasted like chemicals!

There was no hope of saving the saag paneer and we had to trash it, but we did our best with the chana because we were so hungry.  I had the bright idea of dumping it into a colander and letting the oil drain.  We then put the dry beans over rice.  Bland!  We then topped it off with raita.  The raita made it semi-edible, but even that was watered down.  

All this was after we had to go back, after almost being home, to get the rice they "forgot" to put in our carry out bag!

Maybe we should've tried the pizza!
author: R C.

description:
You ever get a craving for pizza AND Indian food. Yeah, I thought so, stoner. Well Zante makes a pretty sweet version of Indian pizza. They advertise as "The Best Indian Pizza in SF." Of course motherfucker, you're the ONLY Indian pizza in SF that I know of (in the eastern half of the city.) I guess that allows them to make any outrageous claims they want. "Sexiest Indian Pizza Delivery Guy in SF," "Fastest Indian Pizza in SF." 


Which brings up an issue I have with Zante. The pizza is delicious but if you get it delivered you'd better be prepared to wait. An hour and forty-five minutes for a pizza?

"Hello, we ordered a pizza about an hour ago."

"Yes, the driver already left. Be there in 5 minutes."

15 minutes pass.

"Yeah, it's still not here."

"Be there in 10 minutes."

Whaaa? Well, the pizza finally arrived and it was tasty. Actually, the last time I ordered from them it came in a record 45 minutes but the driver spilled the riata. That was a huge bummer. It's still "The Best Indian Pizza in SF."
author: Josua P.

description:
Yes the pizza is good, really really good. We get the Vegan Indian pizza. It's delicious, especially if you dip it in the sauce of the Chicken Tikka Masala...

BUT:
-the Chicken Tikka masala comes with 4 tiny pieces of chicken (not even worth it for the sauce)

AND:
-The pizza takes FOREVER to get there...Like 2 hours...

So pick it up, or skip it, the delivery is hit and miss and mostly miss :(
author: julia h.

description:
Good pizza. BAD service. Ordered at 7:30...still waiting at 9:30. An hour later, when I called to ask about the order was hung up on, No apology. 
We were told three times "5 more min." We ended up canceling the order and no one there seemed to care. A charge better not show up on the card...
author: Lizzi M.

description:
damn, the "Best Indian Pizza" is so good... it's like a complete indian meal on a pizza (or...er a big naan).  saag, cauliflower, cilantro, tandoori chicken, lamb, lots of goodies on that pizza, with some kinda indian-spiced sauce.  Kinda greasy but OH so good.  5 stars for the pizza.  -1 star for delivery taking 45 minutes, though tyey DO deliver ALL OVER THE CITY!!  

never been in the actual restaurant, but with delivery all over the city, why bother going in?  I don't know if Indian pizza is unique to SF, but it might well be, so get some for your out-of-town guests!  and they have a vegetarian and vegan pizza too, chock full of goodies.
author: Fong L.

description:
I feel lucky to live in a place with Indian pizza.  Great fusion concept.  I've tried a couple of different Indian pizza places and have liked every Indian pizza I've had.  

Zante's non-veg Indian pizza topping is really good and it has so much going on - tandoori chicken, lamb, eggplant, spinach, etc.  I prefer the Indian sauce to tomato sauce any day because it incorporates more spices (e.g., cumin, coriander, etc.).   The crust needs work though.  It's thicker than it should be and pretty bland and doughy.  The veg Indian pizza is good, just not as good as the non-veg version (not as flavorful).  

We also ordered a chicken and sausage pizza for my nephew and they put tandoori chicken on it.  Interesting.  He didn't like it and I didn't expect it.  And we ordered a cheese pizza - it was okay, pretty average actually. 

You can order online.  They take forever to come though - much longer than the 45 minutes they told me.  We thought they forgot about us.  I think it took 1.5 hours to get the pizza!
author: Lolia S.

description:
Not a fan, based on this experience (delivery)

I had what appear to be the usual problems with delivery -- place order online at 6:05, receive confirmation call at 6:10 "45 mins to 1 hour".  Called at 7:20 to see where it was...after much discussion in the background and repeating name and address, "driver's on his way". Um, yea, right. pizza arrives at 7:50. No surprise, completely cold.

But unlike many of the other reviews, I thought the pizza itself was meh.  Had a large indian pizza; thick chewy crust (and not in the good way) and very sparse toppings.  Was there actually any cheese on it?  Hard to tell. 

All this for $30+ with tax and (small) tip?  Hmmmm, don't think so....
author: John R.

description:
Interesting and unique pizza combining two of my favorite things:

1) Indian food
2) Pizza

The pizza is decent, with good toppings that certainly give the pie a distinctly Indian/Pakistani flavor.  Nicely spiced and quite tasty, I heartily enjoyed my 'Indian Meat' pizza (distinct fro the 'Indian Veggie' pizza by the inclusion of chicken, lamb and prawns). I was with one other person and we got a 14" pie for $19.  A 12" pie for $13 would have been sufficient.

The crust isn't spectacular though, and the atmosphere was a bit dingy...but it is cheap Indian so what do you expect?  Kind of strange that they played Michael Jackson music the whole time. 

After the meal, you're only three blocks from Mitchell's Ice Cream, which is nice too.
author: Eric M.

description: Zantes vegetarian Indian pizza: quite possibly my favorite meal in all the world.
author: Joyce G.

description:
Yeah yeah yeah this place isn't that great, but fuck the concept is genius! I mean, Indian pizza? Whoever thought of that must have been getting laid a lot - don't we all love happy people who have put on that handsome twenty after falling in sweet sweet love? 

I like to get me some pizza, dose it with salt and chutneys and umm. Sure I keep wishing for more flavor upon each bite but at least I can taste cilantro. Then there are the curries. I just had the korma the other day. It had almonds or coconut in it and this little tid bit made it much more glorious than I would have imagined curry at this let's not try to impress anyone pizza joint. The lamb samosa, on the other hand, came out cold and were obviously gracing the unfrozen life for the first time (no I didn't experience freezer burn, but the hint of ice taste is always a little shocking). 

Regardless, I'll probably go back. Why? Because it's Indian pizza and it's near my house.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Two hours.  You can do a lot in two hours.  You can drive to Sacramento from San Francisco.  You can watch a movie.  You can watch 4 episodes of your favorite sitcom (5 if you have a Tivo).  But what you can't do is get a pizza from Zante Pizza in two hours.

It was 8:00 on a Thursday night.  I was hungry, and didn't really feel like going out for dinner or cooking.  So I turned to the internet.  Having heard someone else rave about this "indian pizza" concept before, I looked up Zante's and placed my order.  Afterall, how could the pairing of the wonderful bold flavors of indian food and pizza be anything but wonderful?  Well over two hours later I was to find out.  I felt sorry for the delivery driver as he acted like a whipped dog.  Having read the reviews for this place during my two hour wait, it was clear to me that this was a horribly run restaurant and sadly the delivery drivers had to bear the brunt of the complaints.  Feeling sorry for the guy I gave him an average tip and sent him on his way.  

Starving at this point, I carried the pizza in and grabbed a slice. I expected the wonderful tastes of indian food, but instead I got a horribly bland, mushy, cold, disaster.  Mind you when I say bland I don't mean "subtle and complex" but rather BLAND.  Were you to add a pinch of curry to mashed potatoes and then spread them on a store bought pizza crust, you might get close to the flavors and texture that you get with this abomination.  I have had few meals in my life that have really pissed me off, but this is without a doubt one of them.  Not only will I never order from this place again, but I'll do everything I can to ensure than no one that I know does the same.  Absolutely pathetic.
author: Joshua W.

description:
The pizza reminded me of Arnell's during the 80's in Berkeley--only Arnell's crust was a bit more crisp.  I thought, pizza pie, when I bit into it. Good memories...good cheese, thin crust.  

It _was_ greasy.  I had to soak up the puddle with a paper towel. It must have been a long time since I had pizza with real full fat mozzarella. Very good quality cheese--you knew as soon as you bit into the slice.

I don't know how they had the pizza in the delivery car, but a lot of cheese had slid off to the corner of the box. I guess that's what you get when you order a medium pizza with light sauce and extra cheese--there's no glue to hold the weighty cheese in place.

I'm glad that someone knew what extra cheese meant.
author: Priscilla L.

description:
Unfortunately, you have to roll over a star (at least one star) to rate this place.  Picture a rainy night during this monsoonal rainy season we just experienced.  You know, the kind where "garden apartments" flood and water mains explode?  Anyway, it just seems to bring to mind "Indian food" for some strange reason. 

Well, after thinking "Zante's" since it's only about 5 minutes way by MUNI of all things, I decide to place an order using the Zante's Online Ordering system.  A half-hour goes by without a confimation call.  So I decide to take the initiative....

"Zante's."

"Hi.  Did you get my order?"

"Yes--it will be there in about an hour."

Said hour goes by....

"Zante's" in an even more defiant tone than before.

"Yeah, it's been about an hour and half, and I'm wondering if my food is on its way?"

"Oh yeah, that order just left."

45 minutes after said order just left....

"Zante's."

"Yeah--I called 45 minutes ago about an order that I placed over two hours ago and I want to know if my food has left or what."

"Well, you know sir, it's raining out, and we want our drivers to be careful."

"So this means that your driver has been driving VERY CAREFULLY for 45 MINUTES to bring me my meal?"

"Well, no.  Your dinner hasn't left yet, but it will be with the next driver."

"The next driver?  I don't think so.  Cancel my order."

"SIR!  I'll give you a FREE DRINK!"

"No thanks.  Please, do not deliver to me.  And if your driver comes, or if I see a charge on my credit card, you can be assured you'll be hearing from the Better Business Bureau."

"In that case, I'll give you a free drink, AND $5 off your dinner!"

"No."

And with that, I ended my quick and short relationship with Zante's.
author: David S.

description:
I really wanted to like Zante's Indian Pizza. Always wanted to try Indian pizza and so far this is the only place i know that does it. They had to really mess up for me to be disappointed. 

I am really disappointed in this place. 

First, i got a delivery of one of their specialty pizzas. I did an online order. I don't know why i order online, every place that does it never checks for online orders. I won't hold this against them, i'll hold it against the general "online order establishment."

Second, they said they would call to confirm an online order after 15 minutes and to call if you do not receive such a call. Sure enough after 20 minutes, no call. So i called, and I heard them shuffling some papers and the order got going - they said it'd be 45 mins. Keep in mind, i ordered at 12 noon, not too busy for pizza.

After about an hour and 20 minutes from initial order I called asking where it was, they said on the way. 

After an hour an 50 minutes, I called to cancel the order and told them  I didn't want the pizza anymore and the guy just hung up on me. 

After about 2 hours and 15 mins , i was walking out the door to get lunch somewhere else and Zante's pizza arrives. I've worked delivery jobs so i just bought the pizza anyways, for the sake of the delivery driver.

Dry pizza, If you like a saucy pizza, don't order from here. Just kinda like a big slice of naan with meat on top.  You'll have to do better than that Zante's!
author: Killian E.

description:
Put the pizza down and step away from my slice...or I'll shoot.

Have been there numerous times for their Indian food. Good stuff.  But recently went with a larger group of people and we decided to order the Indian pizza. Freaking amazing ish. 

It was so good that I had to fake like I didn't really like it as much as everything else. You know a lil' reverse psychology, so that people wouldn't get all crazy over the pizza. I mean after all... we only ordered a medium.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
HYPE!!!!

I've given this place 3 tries now and have not been impressed. It generally takes 1-2 hours to arrive cost $30 and is just not good. It's sounds great taking two really good things and putting them together to make something great! But they manage to take two good things and put them together to make something really mediocre that is actually quite bland unlike indian food or pizza!
author: Thel D.

description: The indian pizza is awesome. If you never have had it , its worth  a try. Its like a thicker naan pizza bursting with spices The vegan and vegetarian are really flavorful, add a little of the chutney and  your good to go. Good delivery service. I can't say anything for the other dishes but the pizza hits the spot.
author: Tamrin H.

description:
OVER TWO HOURS FOR DELIVERY. 

And while I love spicy, this stuff had so much heat it was inedible. 

NO NO NO. 

NO.
author: Kristina H.

description:
I have introduced every person I know to Indian pizza and I intend to continue spreading the word. It is one of the most genius fusion foods ever invented. I would give them a fifth star if they could ever deliver in a reasonable amount of time and not forget something.
    I was fortunate, I was introduced to Zante's at a young age by my parents. We had pizza night once a week and my mom liked to mix it up. They also have excellent Indian food. Tandoori chicken with raita is a close second favorite to the Indian pizza raita combo. It is both good pizza and good Indian food and a great melding of the two.
author: Esa Y.

description:
What a let down.  The concept of Indian pizza sounded great.  Unfortunately, our delivery was about 45 minutes late.

That's understandable, it was peak hours.

BUT, the pizza was lukewarm!  That is not acceptable.

Also, the toppings were sporadically thrown about, and there were many "bald spots" on the pizza. 

It served its purpose of being my dinner, but that's about it.
author: Chris Q.

description:
In college I used to live by a pastry/seafood restaurant. They always advertised their donuts and fish. I never could muster up the courage to walk in and check it out. Fast foreword to present time. Every time I drive by Zante, I think of the weird combinations it offers. Italian and Indian. Not necessarily culinary cousins, but it works. If when you eat Indian food and you have put everything on your Naan and are eating like a slice of pizza, well that is what their pizza is like. Different (in a a good way) and tasty. 
Post Script:I have had wicked wicked gas since eating there last night. Enjoy!!
author: Bucky K.

description: The idea of indian topped pizza is a pretty good one. There was almost no one, which would normally be a good thing, but for the first half hour my group of 3 was LITERALLY the only group in there. The pizza is good, as are the other dishes, but when a place is deserted its hard to not feel awkward.
author: Nik K.

description:
Oh GOSH! my stomach hurts so bad!!! someone give me tums or ginger ale to aid my tummy!  mommy please rub my tummy now!

My first time eating curry pizza and I ate 5 slices like cookie monster tearing up a cookie.  Yes, I said curry pizza. For real!  Curry pizza.  
My first bite and I was hooked. 

The pizza had bits of cauliflower n onions, loads of garlic, chopped cilantro, indian spices, tomatoes, cheese and curry.  This unique pizza is a must try for anyone who loves pizza or indian curry.  I'll definitely be back for more.
author: Ame S.

description:
A recent on-line topic about the worst meals of 2007 reminded me that I still have a backlog of reviews to post. Meals that turn out poorly make me cranky, but my Zante's delivery experience was somewhat entertaining, it was that bad!

Back when I still lived in Santa Cruz, I remember being compelled by Zante's Indian pizza. I mean it's two great worlds colliding, and it was decent back in the day. However, I rarely hear people saying anything good about the regular Indian portion of the menu. The yelp holiday party called for a mid-week, pre-finals party trip back to SF. After we fought the crowds at the party and got a bit sauced, we decided to grab a cab and head home for some Project Runway (I know, my life is tres exciting, no?). We were feeling peckish and enjoying some wine when we decided to call for Indian delivery. Spicy Bite was closed and we wanted somebody to bring us some spicy CTM fast! We spaced on Al Hamara (Not my favorite anyway, good Indian delivery in the Mission/Bernal area is hard to come by) and ended up with Zante's b/c it was still open. 

I think this qualifies as the worst Indian meal I've ever eaten, and that's saying a lot b/c tipsy people aren't the hardest to please. We ordered CTM, some chana dal, naan, and rice. The Chinese style take-out containers were double reinforced with foil...but it was no match for the epic oil slick fighting to emerge. We dipped the naan in the CTM sauce and watched in amazement as the oil seeped out of the container through the  double layer of foil and formed a huge oil mass on the coffee table. I normally enjoy unctuous meaty foods, but this was something new. The most puzzling aspect, was that the 4 dry, white chicken chunks in the CTM surely were not the source of the oil spill, so what was the root of origin for all of that lipid matter?

Yeah, not much more to say about it. Skimpy, dry chicken, epic oil slick, not spicy, one star it is.
author: Candice L.

description:
Let me spill the beans right up front:  Zante delivers beer!  You might not see the cost effectiveness of ordering a case at 2.99 a bottle, but getting a couple of Kingfishers with your chicken tikka masala and naan wouldn't be the worst proposition in the world, would it?

Furthermore, the website is set up to let you order delivery without picking up the phone.  You get some pictures, and then you can click to order.  Not bad, not bad at all.  They usually call to confirm the order, so if you're a strange-number-so-I-won't-answer kinda person, you should be anticipating an important call about your food after ordering.

The food is pretty good.  Not super exciting, but I'd give it a solid 3.  I have no idea as to how far they will deliver to, but if you live in the Bernal Heights, Outer Mission, Glen Park, Noe Valley region, you should check it out.  The restaurant itself is pretty low budget, but not shabby. The Indian Pizza is decent as well.   

Of COURSE I'm giving an extra star for the beer.
author: Nelson W.

description:
I stopped in here while doing my laundry on a Saturday afternoon, so I can't speak for the dinner atmosphere or service, but I can say the vegetarian indian slice set my face on fire in a really good way.  

There was nobody in there but me. I'm not sure the dining room was actually open.  They set me up at the counter and gave me a giant glass of water and a cilantro dipping sauce.  I went through that glass of water FAST. I probably would have given the 5th star if they'd brought me a pitcher.  

The pizza was delicious though and i would definitely go back, though maybe I wouldn't torture my more sensitive-tastebudded friends.
author: Poz L.

description:
FUCK THIS PLACE.

We ordered from them.  Wonderful.  Over an hour later, after a phone call, they finally showed up.  With. Half. Our. Order.  We called them back and they hung up on us.  Four times.  Supposedly the food is back on it's way.  There are many ways to do business, these homeboys are not in the know as to how.  We will not be ordering from here again, we will be actively seeing to it that nobody else we know orders again.  Do not give these cocksuckers your business.
author: Josh T.

description: If you've never had Indian Pizza, you seriously must try it. It will not disappoint. They will deliver practically anywhere in the city.
author: Renee T.

description:
I know better than to order delivery from Zante's.  I do.  But the Indian Pizza's just so damn tempting.

I waited three hours before canceling my order - I no longer believed the rote "It will be there in half an hour!". What really pissed me off, though, was that I called to confirm an hour after ordering and was misled about how long it would take.  And I had to go to work three and a half hours after ordering.  And I ended up with yet another burrito instead of wonderful curry paste on pizza with all of those fantastic toppings.

To Zante's: BE HONEST ABOUT HOW LONG IT WILL TAKE!  You just lost (another) customer.  You are busy and I understand, and I would have waited for your deliciousness. When I had time. But don't be rude!
author: erica d.

description:
Indian Pizza?  FREE DELIVERY CITY-WIDE?


There is a god.
author: Sid D.

description:
I must have gotten lucky with delivery, based on the other reviews. I called at 8:15pm on Saturday night to order two extra-large Indian pizzas. They told me it would be 45 minutes. At almost 9 on the dot, the driver called to clarify directions and arrived a few minutes later. We had no problems whatsoever and it was still warm. 

The pizza is delicious. The toppings are very flavorful and blend nicely with the cheese. Definitely a treat!
author: C M.

description:
I love Zante's. 

First, I prefer their Indian food to most other places in SF. It's not as goopy -- it tastes like they actually cook the different dishes in different pots, and use slightly different spice mixes in each.

But the pizza.... oh the pizza. I *LOVE* their vegan pizza. Do I like pizza in general? No, I eat normal pizza about once a year. Am I vegan? No; just yesterday I ate bacon-wrapped scallops, sausage, and a poached egg with bernaise for breakfast. The vegetarian and meatitarian pizzas aren't particularly exciting, I've found -- but their vegan pizza is a delicious pile of yummy seasoned veggies with what is probably yesterday's bengan bartha, saag, and aloo gobi on top. It is SO GOOD. I have served it to lots of people and just about everyone thinks it's great. If you really want meat, it's particularly good with some sliced up chicken sausage on top.

I've also had them cater a 10-person dinner party. They did an awesome job and brought an INSANE amount of food. I started ordering 14 Thali platters but they asked if we just wanted everything family style, which was perfect.

I've never had a problem with prompt delivery, tho coincidentally tonight I ordered an hour ago and no pizza yet. Very sad.
author: Ellen B.

description:
Excellent desi pizza!!

Very flavorful and good portion. The staff is also very friendly and clean dining room
author: Alnadi P.

description:
When I worked on Cortland, and before I lived in India for six months and still ate indian food. Zante's was the best. 

Indian Pizza. 

Thats all I really need to say.. If you have never had it ...get on the phone and get one delivered.
author: Charlie B.

description:
It's been said before in these reviews. Though I love Zante's, DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY, unless you have been on Survivor and are used to not eating for 40 days. Or if you feel like fasting for a political cause of your choice. Or if your definition of "delivery" involves a donkey or lame horse. 

Love the pizza, but for delivery...I'm just sayin'.
author: Kathy A.

description:
I ate there once, and it was alright. I wasn't planning on rushing back. But a while back, I was walking up Cortland and saw a couple of guys in their scummy yard area washing pieces of chicken in a bucket then drying them with towels. Seriously, that's disgusting, and doing it out in the open, that takes balls. 

Moral of my story, stay away from the chicken dishes.
author: mary y.

description:
Its 10pm and most of the eateries are closed that I usually walk to, I've decided to go home to order some food and had thought about what I wanted to eat. After 15 minutes of debate between the growling tummy to the over-thinking mind, the craving of pizza and Indian cuisine will be both satisfied.

After a long wait of an hour, my thoughts were damn this pizza must  be damn worth an hours wait.

The delivery guy was pretty friendly and polite, which is a plus because I have a few rude ones. The guy seemed really genuine when he told me to enjoy the pizza.

When brought inside the house the aroma of coriander, turmeric, cumin and other Indian spices  filled the air  with the scents of familiar Indian cuisine.  

The opened pizza box contained a pizza crusted that is naan like, topped with green onions, cauliflower, chicken Tandori, prawns, lamb, a sauce made of spinach, garlic, cilantro,  and  eggplant cooked in blend of Italian/Indian spices topped with melted mozzarella cheese on top.

When I first took a bite of the first slice I could feel the oils of the pizza squish in my mouth but the crunch and the taste of the crust was like eating a flat crispy naan.  

The chicken tandoori, lamb  and prawns in the pizza must have been minced because I could not see nor taste it on the pizza. What I would recommend is to shred the meat instead to where you can see and taste more of the flavors of the meats.

The cheese on the pizza was not  stringy unlike the freshly hot pizzas on the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles or anywhere else. May I suggest that Zante's Pizza use a thermal bag or some type of heating devie to keep the pizza from getting cold, especially since mine had to take a journey from Mission and Cortland to the Excelsior.

As for the Best Indian Pizza...is something I would want to eat every so often? more than likely no but as far as coming back? I can say I would just to try the other things on the menu and compare them  to better rate Zante's Pizza.
author: Mike L.

description:
Great date idea: Grab the 14 or 49. Go to Zante's and get the veggie pizza. OUTRAGEOUSLY GOOD! 

Then hit the Knockout or El Rio and get dreezed. Bus it home.
author: Justin And Courtney L.

description:
I love Zante's Indian Pizza -- so tasty!  Best. Fusion. Ever.
