The place itself is OK, and has cheap beer, but I'd say I prefer delivery, so that I can snarf spicy indian pizza in private.
author: Nicole P.

description:
Hello.  My name is Chris and I'm a mid-westerner.  

*waits for mellow clapping to subside*

I've never had Indian pizza before I came out West.  I was inspired one night and decided to try it.  My eyes are open now.  I can't look at any other pizza without questioning its curry value.

Thank you Zante for showing me the light!

*massive applauding*
author: Chris M.

description:
Indian Pizza? Really?

The menu has normal Indian food, normal pizza, and.. *drum roll*... Indian Pizza! There is only one kind of Indian pizza. There are two reasons for this:

1) It is called "Best Indian Pizza". Why settle for less?
2) Best Indian Pizza has EVERYTHING on it, so you will not need anything else. Chicken, eggplant, spinach, prawns, lamb, mint sauce, sweet sauce, and various other indistinguishable things were competing for the space on the slices.

At least the crust was good, and our waiter refilled our water glasses with inexplicable joie de vivre. I think I will come back for normal pizza. Or normal Indian food. Just not Indian pizza.
author: Daniel E.

description: One of my favorites in my 'hood.  Indian pizza is something you dream about, miss and always come back to.  Get it without the prawns though even if you like them.  Somehow it's just not right with them.  Free delivery and online ordering make this a no brained go to place.
author: krystin k.

description:
Damn this place is deep. I mean, I thought that about Front Porch and about The Knockout and about the Dovre, all of which went whooshing by as we continued to head down Mission. Forever. 

But Zante's is pretty dope if you're looking for Indian pizza. It's dope for two reasons: 1. it tastes really, really good and 2. um, who else actually makes Indian pizza? you don't really have any other choices.

I'm a little hesitant to order delivery just because I live really, really far away from this place so I find it impossible, no matter how fast or competent the delivery guy is, to have hot unsoggy pizza delivered. But...I will warn you...dining in is not spectacular either. You have to go here because you're dying for Zante's and nothing will stop you until you have some piping hot delicious indian pizza that can only be found way the hell deep in the mish in a dingy, awkwardly quiet dining room because at that moment it is the perfect, perfect food.

Kinda like Harold & Kumar.
author: Kate S.

description:
On a high recommendation - we ordered delivery of the Indian Pizza.  

Plus:
* On line ordering
* Quick confirmation turnaround via phone call
* Tasty indian pizza 

Not so good:
* Took 1 1/2 hours to get our order.  They should of been more clear o the confirmation the time, and if it was shorter time to pick up, we would of done so.
* Pizza not hot, warmish so we had to reheat in the oven

All in all, it was good but if I ever order again for delivery - I will ask how long it will take.

I would definitely try them again but will go into the restaraunt next time.
author: Gina C.

description:
"Hello.  Is Ghandi Zapporelli there?"

"No.  But that sounds like a fake name.......Indians and Italians don't mix!"

THEY SURE DO!

I really loved my first bite of that damn Indian Pizza.  It was heavenly.  But after helping my fiance finish off the whole giant pizza she ordered...I started to think this dish is a once in a lifetime eat.........and began to understand why Mario Batali didn't call these folks for consultation when he opened Pizzeria Mozza in Hollywood.

But please go here once in your life and eat that one pizza--you'll certainly never have anything similar again in your lifetime...for better or for worse...
author: Black X.

description:
"Indian pizza, what's that?" Only a tasty collision of cultures in your mouth! Yummy curry, tandoori chicken, lamb and cheese in a single bite. 

However, Indian pizza breath is not cute.
author: Joel A.

description:
Three words:  NEVER ORDER DELIVERY.

Ohhhh, Zante's... you've sunk to the bottom.  I still love your pizza, but your broken promises and pathetic attempts at timely delivery have made this my last order.  Alas, since my earlier review things have only gotten worse.  Optimistically I gave it one more chance, but other reviewers' warnings of delivery problems bore out:

PROMISED: 45 minutes
ACTUAL: 90 minutes
PIZZA: Lukewarm
PAKORA: Cold

If I wanted cold Indian food, I'd buy some Tasty Bites pouches.  

Goodbye, Zante.
author: TradeMark G.

description:
Yes, it's all about the Indian pizza. Yes, you can get the fat slices to go (highly recommended: 4 fat slices is about the same size as a small pizza but cheaper).

Delivery ... well, yes. It runs on 2 speeds: Slow, and Stop. If it's running on Slow, the food will show up eventually. If it's running on Stop, your food will not get delivered. At all.
author: Emily D.

description:
Their Indian pizza is really good and you should probably try it sometime. They take forever to deliver, though, so order early. And make sure to pair your order with an order of your favorite indian side dish to dip your crusts in!

Fin
author: Dustin K.

description: Amazing!!!! Never had Indian pizza, and loved it. It was perfect. The service SUCCCCCKS though. lol
author: Tanya H.

description:
Delicious, excellent, yummy food. Nice menu options. 

But more often than not, it's over an hour late! I've seen 1 1/2, 2 hours late. They have you use an online ordering system, but they don't seem to read it. They've even delivered to the wrong apartment.
author: Jade P.

description: A friend picked some of the "best indian pizza" and the vegetarian version for a get together at his place.  I'd heard a lot about this pizza, so it was a bit hyped up, but it was pretty good and it actually was different from what I expected.  There's an Indian pizza place in Seattle called Can Am Pizza that has a butter paneer pizza, which is what I expected this to be like.  This was a completely different flavor profile and definitely tasty.  I think I still favor the pizza in Seattle, but if I don't do a comparison, this is definitely good.  A point to note: they offer free delivery, but apparently there's no system to their delivery (it can take 15 minutes to be delivered or over 2 hours)  Therefore, it's typically in your best interest to go pick it up yourself, especially if you have a time line you need to stick to!
author: Rachana S.

description: Why can't I rate them ZERO stars???  After nearly a year and a half, I'm giving them another try.  Placed the order online and followed up with a phone call 30 minutes later.  They said the order was on it's way.  Called again, "the order is on it's way".  After 1 hour and 50 minutes from the time of the original order I called again, waited on hold for 6 minutes to have someone got on the phone and tell me that THEY LOST MY ORDER and asked if I wanted to place the order again.  "uh, No!!!  Never again!"  What has happened to this, at one time, great establishment?
author: Aaron C.

description:
Although Shatangi found the Indian Pizza a little on the grody side, they have some of the slaminest Indian food. I recommend asking for the chef's special combo (veggie and meaty are both good) and get delivery. It can take forever but it rocks the casbah in your mouth. Love to go there before or after El Rio.

Shatangi told you
author: Njon W.

description:
The novelty of Indian pizza and the lure of being only ten minutes away from work drew me here on a weekday lunch with the interns.  

Although we were intrigued by the promise of surprise  

I was expecting a cumin-scented curry sauce, exotic pungent cheese, and a clay-oven naan crust.  

Zante's specialty, "The Best Indian Pizza" is described as being "Topped with Spinach, Egg Plant, Cauliflower, Ginger, Garlic, Green Onions, Cilantro, Lamb, Tandoori Chicken & Prawns."  I was hoping for a pie that tasted like the tandoori over threw up all over it.  What I got was something much milder, much more chopped up and unidentifiable, and a pizza that lacked a point of view.  There was little about the pizza that was Indian (except maybe the color of it) and it wasn't quite good enough to compete as a regular pie.  I have no reason to check back unless they were just having a really off day when I visited.

I'm assuming they do a brisk delivery business since there was no one else in the restaurant that Wednesday afternoon.  The location probably nabs them better dinner traffic, though.
author: Monica T.

description:
We order a pizza at 7 pm, they told us it will take around 45 minutes to one hour.  So we wait and wait.... 2 hours and 15 minutes later...they brought us the wrong and cold pizza.

The driver was so rude, when we questioned how come it took so long.  He said "do you want your pizza or not, I can take it back and give you back your money!"  Once we discovered it was the wrong pizza, we called right away.  The person said we will send the correct pizza and credit you $5.  Same driver came back in 10 minutes and said "give me your pizza".  We said "can we see if the new pizza is the one we ordered?"  He said, "NO, you have to give me the pizza before I will give you the new pizza."  He then toss the a $5 bill at us.

OMG, how rude is this!   I am sorry that I gave him a tip at the first trip, I wanted to call my credit card company and refuse the charge, makes me sick that I have to pay for a cold pizza plus all this bad service.  We won't be ordering from them again.
author: Amelia H.

description: I'm sure I am just echoing the masses when I say that most of the cuisine is meh, but the pizza is something unexpected and delectable if one has never tried it before. As a NY native, I can say that the crust is acceptable, but it's not about the crust with this pizza, it's what's on top that counts. I love introducing people to Indian pizza, and I love introducing it to my mouth even more. Pizza, meet mouth. Belly, meet satisfaction. Wallet, meet empty. I wish good pizza wasn't so expensive, but I'll make an exception for Zante's.
author: Patrick V.

description: I'm craving some Indian pizza right now. So so good. And they sell by the slice! I wish I lived in the Mission for reasons like Zante PIzza.
author: Amanda C.

description:
PROS - 
Indian pizza.
Delivery and Take-out.
Dining in - cheap wine.

CONS - 
Dive.
author: Monica S.

description:
**Review for dine-in, not delivery**

The manager/owner was super friendly and helpful in accomodating a last minute reservation for 14 people on a busy night.  When we arrived a long table was nicely set up for us and the service that night was quite simply fantastic for a pizza joint.  While it took a while for all 14 of us to agree on what to order, once we did the pizzas and beers came out punctually.  I needed to be at the airport to pick up someone directly after dinner and was sure I would have to leave mid-meal, but I was able to make it on time thanks to the prompt service.  

The restaurant itself is not pretty but the Bollywood tunes were bangin!  The pizza was wonderfully spiced and toppings perfectly distributed.  We ordered larges of the veggie Indian, the Special and a tandoori chicken pizza and it was a copious amount of food even for a big group.  Do yourself a favor and order a couple sides of the mango chutney and raita, they make for great crust dipping.  The combo of ingredients -- a Top 20 Greatest Hits of Indian cuisine nicely baked onto an almost naan-like crust -- will leave you craving for more, so order a large and take home the leftovers!

The best thing about this place is the screaming value -- total including beers, tax, tip and a couple salads (tip: avoid the salad unless you are ok with iceberg lettuce, tomato & garbanzos dressed in Kraft Italian) = twelve meager bucks per person!!
author: Molasses C.

description:
The Indian food is decent, the pizza is definitely more spicy than "normal" pizza. It's interesting enough to warrant a "order it at least once in your life" and different enough for me to say "don't blame me if you don't like it." 

The good: I like the vege pizza and have ordered it many times. I love their chicken tikka masala because of the sauce. The vege samosas are good, especially with their side of sweet sauce.

The bad: Chicken can be a bit dry- which is why the sauces really help.  Pray you don't get a big chunk of ginger with your pizza slice, as it can be a rude taste sensation.

The awful: Their delivery is the worst I've ever experienced. Order early, like, WAY before you are hungry. They've come HOURS late (yes, HOURS late) on at least two occasions. The rest of the time they are just horribly late. I always say "never again" and then after a while I get the hankerin for that damn tikka masala (they must put heroin in it or something). Anyway, tonight the delivery guy called me from his cell and refused to come into my condo building and sat in his car. I explained that if he used the front panel I would buzz him in. No go. Never has any food delivery been such a pain in the ass. Next time I get the tikka massala craving, I'm just going to go straight to the heroin.

***July 2013 Update*** 
I'm upgrading the Stars from 'Meh' to 'A-OK' because A) the heroin alternative was becoming a problem, and B) they've really turned their delivery around. And the food has always been good.
author: Chris P.

description:
The first time I tried Zante's Indian Pizza, there were leftovers at my work, which I sneakily snatched before realizing they were up for grabs. OMG SO GOOD. Pizza + Indian flavors and toppings? I never would have put those two things together, but it is one of the most amazing and tasty things I HAVE EVER EATEN.
I highly recommend the vegan pizza, with extra sauce AND their tamarind sauce. One time, after I got stood up (okay I didn't get stood up, but he canceled 30 minutes before we were supposed to hang out and never rescheduled, samedifference) I decided to treat myself right and order a Zante's vegan pizza.  And then proceeded to eat the whole thing. I would like to tell you it was a small, but no, it was a medium. Possibly a large-oh gawd, I'm disgusting. I'm going to die alone, surrounded by cats and pizza boxes.  Look for me on a future episode of  'Hoarders'. 
The actual Indian entrees are just so-so, and on the quite greasy side. Zante's loses no stars, however, because their pizza is just brilliant and they deliver ANYWHERE in the city. I've never been to the restaurant, as no one needs to witness me scarfing down an entire pizza. I'd rather do that in the privacy of my own apartment, thankyouverymuch.
author: Jenny B.

description:
I don't care how good the pizza is.. three and a half hours is too long to wait for delivery, especially after being repeatedly assured that "it will definitely be there in five minutes". Fuck this place.

edit:

Against my better judgment I was talked into trying again and the order was delivered quickly and cheerfully.. too bad it was blindingly mediocre. I really don't get why this place is so popular. Anyway, one additional star for the slight potential that your food might eventually arrive.
author: erik h.

description: My family took me here for a birthday dinner. I've been wanting to try this place since my sister always spoke about the Indian Pizza here. I loooove Indian food and I love pizza even more! I was a little thrown off though my their infamous Tandoori chicken pizza. Maybe I'm just a picky eater but the cilantros and eggplant was just not doing it for me. I nearly puked but thats because I'm not a fan or neither cilantros and eggplant. They told me I wouldn't notice the eggplant but boy I sure did. I wanted to love the Tandoori chicken pizza so badly too. Oh well, different tastes for different people. The normal pepperoni and sausage pizza that we had was incredibly delicious though- I'd come back for that. Their samosas were pretty good too. Service wasn't too great, and came off somewhat almost rude to me but I guess they were nice, humorous. Parking was a pain here. The bathroom was disgusting, they was some dirty water in a drain hole in the middle of the bathroom floor and I could've sworn there was something moving in there! Eeek!
author: Monina C.

description:
It's an amazing idea.  Indian and Italian.  WTF?  Can you believe how good it is? I really can't.  There is also NO way to describe it to anyone.  The perfect blend of indian food, spices, cheese, some kindsa sauce! And, the crust is amazing!  I LOVE THIS PLACE.  I dream of indian pizza.  It's like a party in my MOUTH!


ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!!!!!!!
author: Gina C.

description:
Hmm...worked late from home and ended up being hungry at a very late hour. Searched through the various found-on-the-door-step menues and decided I wanted Indian food. Zante Pizza won.
Didn't end up ordering the pizza from there (which I now understand may be pretty damn good based on the reviews below here - then again you people also liked the supperclub and Luna Park so what do you know? ;-)).

Anyway...I ordered....Lamb Korma, Nan, a drink and Kheer.
The guy who took my order had some severe A.D.D. and once he had eventually gotten my order down he hangs up. I call up and ask that I would like to pay with credit card upon which he replies, and I quote;
"Come on man, it's only twenty dollars.."

I found some cash and went with that.

Food arrived 40-45 minutes later.
Naan: Soggy and cold.
Lamb: Bland and the pieces of meat were not well cut.
Kheer: Frigg'n weird - more like wallpaper glue meets porridge.
Drink: It was a coke. It tasted like coke. They did a good job on that one at least.

Will I order again? Well I do want to figure out if the Indian Pizza is any good but the bad experience I had tonight will most likely prevent me from trying it out.

Two stars and three 'yucks'.

---

Update: Tried the Indian Pizza. The flavour was good but as with anything you order from these guys it's LATE and COLD and served up with some shitty attitude.

No more business from me. (And they dropped from two stars to one)...
author: Rich S.

description: First time here and I am VERY impressed with the quality of the cuisine. Ordered veg samosas, lamb korma, chicken vindaloo and sag paneer. All delicious. Also hot and  right out of the oven: plain and onion nan. Asked about their "Indian pizza" and was provided a large free slice, which had the lightest crust and a tasty spinach sauce instead of tomato. So good that though I'm stuffed, I ordered a medium pizza to go. I live in Reno, but I'll be back to Zante's for sure.
author: Scott D.

description:
Let me caveat this review that its New years day, raining and cold out, and i'm still in my PJs.. so keep that in context, and please read on...

If you have nothing else to do for a few hours and don't mind if your order shows up, go for it. This was a 50buck order and they could care less and didn't even offer anything but some stupid lies/excuses to make up for their horrible food and service.



We ordered a pizza and some curries for delivery tonight they are PATHETIC. First off, they delivered the food 2 hours after the order was made, and only the curries showed up. The nice driver said he forgot the pizza but another driver was right behind him, 2 minutes away. But 1/2 HOUR later, 3 phone calls later, STILL NO PIZZA. So I'm on YELP , and its now 45 minutes later from when the f*C(Dng pizza was supposed to be here - to bitch to y'all that this place sucks.

BTW - the lamb curry was spicy, when we ordered it mild (b/c hey, its NYears day and need it to be mellow) and freezing cold. Naan was worse than that frozen stuff from costco.
author: Sylvie L.

description:
Gah, well, it's a decent idea. I like pizza. I love Indian food. Do I like the sound of Indian food on a pizza, erm, yeah, actually.

Do I like oily curry-flavoured paste with oily cheese that occupies only the center 50% of my 24 inch pizza (there were four of us). 

No, not all that much to be honest.
author: bristol b.

description:
This review has a very specific scope: the so called "Best Indian Pizza".  I haven't had any of their other food yet, so I have nothing to say about anything but their pizza.

First I'll say that I like Indian food, and I also like pizza.  This doesn't necessarily mean that I'd like them together, though.  (For example - I like dry diced chicken from San Tung on Irving, and I like pearl milk tea, but although I've never had it, I suspect that I would not like milk tea with diced chicken bits in it, if you know what I mean).

So when the idea of getting an Indian pizza was put out there, I wasn't sure whether to be excited or nervous.  

After watching a PBS special, though,  where two guys out ice climbing on a glacier somewhere in South America got separated from one another, one of them falling 150 feet down onto the ice, crashing through it and falling 50 more feet into an icy crevasse, getting stuck there for a day or so and finally crawling his way out of there and pulling himself across 5 miles of treacherous ice, over boulders and back to the camp with a compound fracture in his leg, to rejoin his buddies who had already been mourning his certain death for the previous 4 days, I figured it would be rather wimpy to avoid trying a pizza just because it seemed like the toppings might be outside my normal comfort zone.  

And I'm really happy to say that like those ice climbing guys, but very likely with a good amount less bravery, I went for it, living on the edge.  The Best Indian Pizza, topped with spinach, eggplant, cauliflower, ginger, garlic, green onions, cilantro and tandoori chicken was really, really tasty.  I loved the spiciness of the toppings and the way the flavors complimented each other.  I'll definitely have the pizza again, and even though it seems that other yelpers have had less than stellar experiences with the other food here, I'll probably give it a go next time just because I liked this pizza so much.  

Also, I took the pizza out so have no opinion about the service or decor.  More on that at a later date . . .
author: Chris S.

description: $3 bucks gets a good veg Indian pizza!
author: R C.

description:
The pizza is very good, but you take your chances on the delivery.  I've ordered quite a bit from Zantes and the delivery has been horribly late a few times.  More often it will come at about the quoted hour wait, but it will be lukewarm or cold.  Also, I've had several pies that were obviously stitched together from multiple pizzas.

My recommendation is don't order hungry or don't order at all.
author: Garth W.

description:
At school a bunch of my friends lived in a frat house with a fry-a-lator, or whatever the thing is that fries stuff. We used to get really drunk and fry pizza. I used to think frying it was the nastiest thing one could do to a pizza.

But I was wrong. The nastiest thing one can do to a pizza is to pour the entire Indian buffet on it before cooking. 

And yet, I ate two pieces of such a pizza while sober. So now that I think of it, the question is not what is wrong with Zante's but rather what is wrong with me.
author: Liz G.

description:
KAPOW!  indian pizza all in your dome.  they've got other stuff on the menu but, quite frankly my dear, i don't give a damn.  not only is the pizza hot stuff, but you can actually eat your entire quota of cauliflower for the year and not have to do it with a scowl.

i should probably sample some of the other offerings but i'll be damned if i can even read the rest of the menu when i see the pizza.  come to daddy.
author: W G.

description:
DISASTER!!!  Whatever you do DO NOT ORDER TAKE OUT from this place.  First, it was late by over an hour (took 2.5 hours to get).   Second, it was the WRONG pizza.  We ordered vegetarian and it had meat!  They knew it was wrong.  Last, they were completely rude and obnoxious.  Especially Tony who was completely unprofessional.  
Pizza was also overpriced!
author: Greg B.

description: I tried Thai curry pizza at a place in Long Beach, and the Indian curry pizza here blows it away.  The pizza dough has that dense yet soft texture of naan.  The curry itself is spiced well with lots of garlic.  We got the vegetarian pizza, and I really liked the cauliflower and eggplant as toppings.  Each slice is pretty hefty, and four people sharing a large ($23.99) was very adequate.  I'm not a huge fan of fusion foods, but the combination of flavors on this pizza is a winner for me.
author: Jaclyn W.

description:
Tandoori Chicken Pizza is amazing, the delivery service was fast, the call back verification was perfect.
Now one of my top places for pizza in SF!
in fact...that may be the plan for this weekend...hmmm
author: Hans H.

description:
I Love pizza, and I Love Paki/Indian food.. Why choose?!?!?
Seriously? Open till 11, great sides! Chicken poppers, yes, Keema naan, yeah!
Indian pizza rocks my world and is seriously worth a try!
I'm a lifetime believer!
And my delivdery service was very prompt! about 30 mins, for realz!
author: Jen L.

description:
If you guys like Indian Pizza, try Can Am in Bellevue (Seattle) Washington - God that place is unbelievable.  I'm going to try this place, but I'm guessing it's not from the pictures and topping lists...

UPDATE: I tried this place.  It sucks.
author: Omar S.

description:
When I found out that both me and my mom had somewhat surreal experiences at Zante, I went "Oh, I should write a Yelp review about this!"

My first time at Zante was a very rainy night when I was supposed to host a top-secret meeting of a band of local superheroes, but no one showed up.  I was the only person inside at the time.  Someone who was going to interview me for a radio show said she might have been coming, and she did.  But she only stayed for about 10 minutes and left again.  I got this odd feeling that I was in the mafia...I don't know why...at any rate, I enjoyed the pizza.

Later, when I was moving into the Bernal Lowlands, my mom went to Zante to pick up some pizza.  Someone started telling her all about everything on the menu, which she found annoying.  Then, the staff started saying that she shouldn't listen to him because he's just a customer.  Then this customer apparently starts trying to pick up my mom by asking her to have a cup of coffee.  My mom goes into this long explanation of how if she drinks coffee, she'll get really sick.  She tried to get out of there quickly with the pizza.  Which was delicious.
author: Lego S.

description: Zantes is 0 for 3 in getting my order right.  I can't believe I gave them a THIRD chance and they messed it up.  The person who answered the phone "Singh" said the next one is free on him.  He never took my name or info...so everyone reading this.....call them up and tell them Singh promised you a free pizza.   _____  even if they get the order wrong, at least it's free. enjoy! __________________
author: Pamela W.

description:
Food: 4 or 5 stars.

Delivery: 0 stars.  Delivery takes 90-120 minutes without fail.  At times, I've lived as close as 10 blocks from Zante's and as far as 40 blocks and it is always excruciatingly slow.

Ordering off the website: 0 stars.  After you place your order, they tell you to expect a confirmation call within 15-20 minutes.  If you don't get one, then you're supposed to call them to confirm.  I've ordered off the website at least 10 times and never gotten a confirmation call.

Phone: Tonight I called about 100 minutes after my dinner was ordered.  I was assured it was only 5 minutes away.  30 minutes later and I'm still waiting.  And they put me on hold for 7 minutes while they try to figure things out.  I wish this was infrequent.  Just bad service.

Great food, terrible delivery and mediocre service.
author: Tyler K.

description: I had a horrible experience with the delivery.  I ordered through eat24.  The estimated delivery time was 45-60min.  It took over 2 hours.  The driver did not even get out of the car to give me my food.  He honked the horn at me.  I walked over to his car and took the food.  Horrible customer service.
author: Alex C.

description:
Comfortable atmosphere for a large group, tasty indian food and pizza, but horrible service and nasty wine.  We had a fun time, but I don't this it's worth the trip to a sketchy neighborhood.

Before getting here I expected it to be Indian and Pizza fussion - a pizza for each of my Indian favorites.  But sadly no.  It's Indian food OR pizza.  They have one Indian pizza, which was more of a novelty than a brilliant culinary masterpiece as I was expecting.

Furthermore, the wine was a disaster (I suppose Pizzaria Delfina has spoiled my pizza and wine palate).  Not only were they out of the adequate wine, but they were out of everything else on the wine menu and brought us some $2 crap but charged us for the nice-ish one we ordered.  What?  Luckily after a couple glasses we all forgot.
author: Tessa M.

description:
Indian pizza is one of those things I hadn't heard about until I moved to SF. It's one of those things I tell people from other places about and they think I'm joking or that it's really disgusting, as if spicy meat doesn't belong on pizza or that you're going to get some kind of pizza covered in curry sauce. Luckily, Indian pizza does exist and the result is glorious.

 A word of warning to those who have it for the first time: You can and will over do it on Zante's. So, take a break and return to it every couple of months so you can actually enjoy it. I actually enjoy dining in the restaurant, it's got a divey, neighborhood feel. The Indian food itself also isn't bad but don't let it deter your focus: this place is all about the pizza.
author: Maria D.

description:
For years, I've avoided trying Indian pizza. Yes, my pals have raved about how insanely yummy it is but honestly, it just didn't sound good to me. However, I had a few friends over last night 
(and some wine) and they talked me in to ordering from Zante. It smelled okay, looked delish and tasted pretty darn good!! After piece numero three or four I was definitely changing my tune. I'll be ordering from Zante again. Maybe even tonight...

Delivery was a wee slow but it wasn't too bad. Just sit back with a glass of vino and salad at home while you wait.
author: Shara H.

description:
I've struggled to come up with something to write.  A stinging diatribe?  No.  A profession of absolute adoration?  No.  And, so, I've concluded that therein lies the rub in figuring out what it was about this pizza...

Eh - it was just okay.
author: Tamar D.

description: So the chicken pizza is okay. Its like having chicken tikka overcooked naan so I can't complain, its edible and enjoyable. The vegetarian pizza is okay.. but not great. I'd never order it again unless I was with a vegetarian. The vegan pizza.. don't even bother unless you're actually vegan. And if you're a friend of a vegan, don't try and be polite and split it, you will regret it.
author: Analisa S.

description:
Zante's deliver is a hit or a miss!  Their pizza is alright I will give them that benefit.  On the other hand, today we canceled our pizza because it was over 2 hours late!!!  The man on the line promised our pizza would be here in 1 hour.  I called 20 minutes post the hour and he stated it would be at our house in 6 minutes, not so.  I called after another 20 minutes only to be told it would be here in 5 minutes.  Ten minutes later I called to cancel only because I was starving.  Fifteen minutes after I canceled the pizza guy had arrived.  He was great and understood.  But I was done with Zante's.

To have the only Indian pizza in SF one would think that the service would be, at the very least, honest.  This is not true.  I suggest that you hold out on their "Indian" pizza, and dine in at a restaurant where you will be served at a normal time.  Very poor Service.
author: Mac D.

description:
I've been eating at Zante's for at least 12 years now, and stopped in today for some Indian Pizza and it still rocks!
Used to own a business in the neighborhood, so ate there a lot. Now it's just random trips to SF from the East Bay.
I also used to order the Indian Pizzas for a software company I worked for, for our team meetings. I got rave reviews from most people...of course others turned up their noses, but I don't care, I love their food!
author: Duane W.

description:
i love the chicken korma and their naan!!!  but i absolutely HATE their service.  

when i dine in, they are super rude and tell me that i've ordered too much food and that i should take something off my order.  excuse me, but i know what i want to eat, and i know how much i can eat.  don't tell me to limit my order, especially if i am PAYING you to make it!  and then when i'm done, the waiter then points at the empty dishes and motions with his finger to hand them to him instead of just picking up the dishes himself!  come on! really?  did you just do that?  don't do that, i'm not a dog.

and it's not just their dine-in service that sucks.  their over-the-phone service is rude too!  i called to place an order and they were so quick to hang up on me!  i wanted to pay by card, so i had to call them back to give them my card number.  then they hung up on me as soon as i finished reading them the last digits!  so rude!

if it wasn't for my love of the korma and naan, i would never, ever, EVER eat food from this place.  you've all been warned!  but seriously, their korma is hella good =)
author: faye b.

description:
this place is the shit.
INDIAN PIZZA? NAAN WITH CHEESE AND CURRY AND CORN AND SHIT?
i'm there homes.

everything was affordable and lovely. we got the samosas. get those!

we also obviously got the indian style pizza, which is [pasted from their webiste] Topped with Spinach, Egg Plant, Cauliflower, Ginger, Garlic, Green Onions, Cilantro, Lamb, Tandoori Chicken & Prawns. since i don't eat meat 75% of the time, we just got it with the prawns and NO EGGPLANT CAUSE THAT SHIT IS GROSS. it was pretty delicious.

also, if you're gonna order a corona, expect to ask for a lime. and if you're gonna ask for a lime, ask twice cause i only asked once and the dude never gave me my lime. he was really nice though, and gave me plenty of water.
author: Edmund C.

description:
Indian pizza? YES indian pizza, delicious!
I had doubts when we ordered, and was expecting a total mess, instead, found great pizza.
Delivery time was 45 minutes, not bad at all
author: Pug P.

description:
OK so the driver was a nice dude. Opened the pizza and was happy everything was the way I ordered. Garlic, tandoori chicken and mushrooms. I guess I was expecting a lot of tandoori flavor and bigger pieces of meat, but it is good.

It came luke warm, but my toaster oven fixed it. Wish I had something to dip the crusts in.

I think I will try the full on indian pizza next time, but I will probably order it there and take it home.
author: Ken W.

description:
I've been coming to Zante since i was a kid and I always ordered the combo pizza because is soooo damn good, whatever you do DON'T order the indian pizza unless you like a whole bunch of spices on your pizza,,,i made that mistake long time ago. 
The people at Zante are freaking cool as hell, the owner is a great guy he would give me a free slice once in a while when i was a kid (he doesn't  do that any more...bastard lol)
I just recently tried the indian food, the chicken tikka massala and curry with some naan was SLAMMING...all this time i was just satisfy with their combo pizza.
author: Angelisimo G.

description:
Everything was average.  We had 1/2 lamb-1/2 vegetarian pizza.  
Quality of sauce, toppings & dough...average, average & average.  
They did not have deep dish so we had to order thin crust.
I so much prefer Chicago style deep dish to New York thin crust.

Their only dark beer was Beck's in a bottle which was not the equal to the quality of almost any good American micro brew.  

Service was nothing to rave about, nothing to complain about.

The large pizza @ $25 plus, definitely overpriced for the quality.
So since the restaurant does not price for value they should at least provide an entertaining experience.  Not a chance, really ennui.

I often get a large pizza @ Safeway for $5.99 then add my homemade sauce and toppings for another $2 or so.  So for $7.99 I get a pizza that tastes much better.
author: Saul M.

description: The food from this place is AMAZING and should be classified as it's own food group. The issue: customer service oh my god it's not very good especially if you order delivery. I would HIGHLY recommend doing pickup if you don't want to wait for 2 hours to get your food. On multiple occasions we have waited over 2 hours for delivery, and upon calling to ask where our delivery is and eventually asking for a refund we were literally told "No." by whoever was working there. I couldn't believe it. They just kept saying 5 more minutes, 5 more minutes, and denying us a refund even as time dragged on into the night. We didn't even get an apology. Eventually it showed up- cold, but this was only After they guy called me- Lost, several times even though by this time I had told them to forget it- i don't even want it anymore! Then he still had the audacity to ask me to pay for it! They have NO idea how to serve customers but damn- they know how to make food. So just save yourself the trouble and go pick it up yourself.
author: Cat S.

description:
BUYER BEWARE!!! DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS ESTABLISHMENT!!

We placed the order at 6:43, it is now 9:30 and there is still no pizza. No confirmation call as promised. We called them no less than three times and every time we were promised that the pizza would arrive in 3-4 minutes. We've given up hoping that they might come, now we are just hoping the credit card won't be charged...

Total and complete disappointment. Even the worst pizza ever would have been better than nothing. Even calling to tell us "we fucked up and forgot you" would've been an improvement, but these guys aren't even professional enough to admit it.

Lamest of the lame. You'd be better off giving your credit card information to a stranger off the street and hoping for a pizza.
author: Danielle H.

description: yummy vegetarian  Indian pizza!!!!  very unique taste.  If yo ulike Indian food and pizza then you should try it.  i got it delivered, never been to the restaurant.  But I loved the pizza!
author: Cynthia B.

description: I don't know about the pizza served here, but it has been highly recommended. But as the others said, DO NOT order any traditional Indian food, it's HORRIBLE! And I wouldn't recommend delivery either - they refuse to go up floors for apartments and they forgot the drinks I paid for - yet I still had to pay for them!! Disgusting food so far, I'm too fearful to try the pizza now.
author: Melanie P.

description: Over two hours no pizza, and people just yelling at me when I call. The pizza can be good, but even when it does arrive it is hit or miss. Indian pizza, a great idea. Some other restaurant that can actually deliver orders should try it!
author: Rachel M.

description:
I have to say that I love Zante for many reasons.

You can pop in most anytime and get a table. 

The food is amazing. If you want it spicy, just tell them! They adjust each dish individually. I LOVE the Muill Igatawny soup! Perfectly spiced, with ginger and shredded chicken. Sooo good. 

The Chicken Korma is my other favorite. Not spicy, just creamy and delicious. The lamb Somosa's were perfect appetizers. 

We have eaten there many times and always have enjoyed our food and the waiter is always friendly and helpful. 

My son ordered the pizza once and wasn't totally impressed, but it is to be expected from a 12 year old wanting regular pizza. It worked well enough for all of us to eat at the same place and have what we wanted. 


 I will admit that the one time we had delivery, it took forever, but since then, we just pop in. In my opinion, regardless of the restaurant  delivery is never as good as eating in the restaurant, so I still give them 5 stars!
author: Keri V.

description:
I heard a lot of hype about Indian Pizza. Fairly unique concept. Walking into Zante's, it looked like a pizza joint, but then it smelled of Indian spices. I opted to eat at the restaurant (given all the delivery probs I read of other reviews), and pleasantly found lots of open clean tables.

I went with a friend who had just read "Kite Runner" so he was excited about satisfying his Indian food cravings. We started with vegetable pakoras (deep fried veggies) which were rather tasty. Oily but flavorful. 

Then he had a special lamb curry - the Rogan Josh. Rice and nann are not included but we got them anyway. Since I don't like lamb, I can't say whether it was good or not. But I tried the curry portion of it, and it wasn't 'lamby' which was a good thing for me. The curry was of a tomato base but much more pungent and flavorful.

My main meal arrived with the "Best Indian Pizza." A small (about 8 slices) was definitely big enough for 2. It was loaded with toppings and tandoori chicken (upon request) and had a curry taste. While the cheese kind of threw off the flavors, overall it was quite good. My only suggestion to Zante's would be to use a nann crust rather than plain old pizza crust. I think nann would have made "Indian Pizza" more credible and complete.

The total came to under $40 with half a pizza to spare. Worth trying at least once.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Five stars just for the Indian pizza! I love it, even though the crust isn't all that (too doughy). But the toppings, ohhh. I always get the meat variety, but I imagine the veggie version is good, too, for those who are strictly herbivores. A kaleidoscope of flavors mixed together, somehow achieving harmony. I've never tried the "regular" Indian food and have no need to -- there are enough other places for that.

I live nearby and always have my pizza delivered, so I can't speak to what the restaurant itself is like. Order-taking on the phone is fast and curt.
author: Tara M.

description:
The Indian pizza ROCKS MY WORLD!  Seriously, other places call Indian pizza a regular pizza with some tandoori chicken on it.  This place, I have no idea what is in it or how to describe it other than love on a plate.  

I've only had their other food once and it was good.  But if I'm going to travel over to the end of the Mission and find parking, I'm getting that damn pizza.  Oh, they deliver too but it's just not as good as getting it right out of the oven.  

Only missing the last star because I want the place to have a facelift.  Did I mention they had awesome Indian Pizza?
author: Mike C.

description:
be advised i'm only reviewing the take-out, i've never actually eaten at the restaurant. my friends and i ordered a bunch of food for a friend's going away dinner. we ordered the indian pizzas, chicken tikka masala, paneer, 4 different types of naan bread and a bunch of other food that i can't even remember. everything was super yummy and really hit the spot. the only thing that was not so good were the samosas. but i am probably really biased because i've had authentic home-made samosas and the ones we ordered don't even come close to how good those were. 

they delivered the food quickly and the food was really affordable. super yummy if you get a craving for indian food. it is really rich though so definitely not something you want to eat everyday. but its worth it to splurge every once in awhile. =)
author: Linda N.

description:
Zante's is only a few blocks away and I eat here mainly by delivery.  I know, lazy, lazy American.

That being confessed, I LOVE their saag paneer.  For the uber healthoids, the amount of butter would repulse you.  For me, the world slows down, everything has a romantic soft haze and then I see twinkly stars.  I don't think that's from vessel blockage?

At least I only get rice and not rice AND naan.  Also, I drown my food with raita(yogurt) so that balances everything and makes it healthier,  right??  ;)
author: michelle s.

description:
Its entirely possible that I just don't like Indian pizza.  I've had it before and wasn't too crazy about it.  I thought it would be a good idea to to give it another try and see if my tastes had changed.  Word on the street is Zante's might be the best IP in the universe so the husband and I placed an order on a lazy Sunday afternoon.

We phoned in an order for "the best indian pizza with tandoori meats" and an order of veggie samosa.

It took an hour and a half to deliver our order.  When it finally arrived, it was cold.  It was the wrong order.  We were hungry so we shrugged, re-heated everything and joked about the poor vegetarians who got our meat pizza by mistake.

(If I had read the yelp reviews first, I would have known that it would take almost two hours for delivery.  However, I don't think that its acceptable to offer delivery service in the first place if its going to be soooooooo sloooooooooow.   ...and we only live a few blocks away.  But I digress...)

Anyway, bottom line is, the pizza just wasn't that good.  I failed to find any real flavor other than green onions and bread and cheese.  (...and I actually prefer vegetarian pizza most of the time.)  Where were the spices?  The delicious melding of East/West?  The Indian-ness didn't really emerge for me.  Or the pizza-ness.  It was just odd and poorly balanced.

Samosas were good though.

I wanted to like it, I really did.  I have given up on Indian pizza for good, I think.  

+ 2 stars for yummy samosa
- 3 stars for late, cold, wrong order
author: Miss Information X.

description:
Don't listen to the Ben guy... he's on crack!

This place serves the most original and tasty pizza in town. The trick to making it EVEN BETTER is to get an order of Chicken Tikka Masala and use the left over "jesus juice" as pizza topping.... YUMMY!

Enjoy!

Minus 1 star for shitty customer service and slow ass delivery!
author: Simon S.

description:
Hey you got Indian food on my pizza!

Hey you got pizza on my Indian food!

Wait..this is amazing!

I've never been to the actual resturant, nor have I eaten anything besides the pizza, so the 5 stars are for the pizza and the pizza alone.  Oh and the fact that the delivery was pretty damn fast.

Viva la fusion!
author: b s.

description:
Pizza is a 4 star--it's interesting, its nice.  We had the Indian pizza and even the small gave us enough for left overs...

We got there right at 5 and that might have changed the experience, but we had excellent service and the food was pretty good.  Pitchers of beer are only 5 bucks....I mean, really...how bad can that be?

Main problem:  there is this weird prayer picture that kept on making this weird song/noise.  It was loud theme music that sounded exactly like the theme from Encounters of the Third Kind.   It never stopped...for over an hour. I wanted to kill myself.
author: Val K.

description: I've only tried their Indian Pizza (vegetarian and vegan) because I can't bring myself to eat anything but that. You've got to try it. And make sure you get the sauces. Sometimes they forget to bring them. Red is sweet, green is spicy. Both are delicious. That's all.
author: Roxy B.

description: I thought the Indian pizza was overblown. It's totally the kind of thing I could get into, but it's too dry. It needs a sauce or something. Give me some masala. The other food was decent. The whole experience was decent.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Went only once, but that one time was enough to tell me that I MUST stop by again. 

They have a great giant veggie pizza, which I had fun watching a friend munch on. 

As a carnivore I split the 26' meat lover pizza with a friend and it was a delight to obliterate. 

I'd recommend this place to anyone that wants something new and different. If your not too sure about lamb, curry on thin crust, or a shy server then you might want to go somewhere else.
author: Arthur A.

description:
As my friend put it, "This is the best bastardization!"

All I know is I was all smiles after I ate a piece of this pie.
author: Sara L.

description:
A friend and I were debating between Zante and Little Star, two VERY different pizzas. Having already tried Little Star and Zante delivers, we decided to be adventurous.

OH MAN, it was like having a delicious piece of fluffy garlic naan topped with tons of mozzarella cheese, cilantro, onions, tandoori chicken, and other meaty/non-meaty delights. Whoever first thought of this was a GENIUS.

As impressed as I was, I feel like we should've ordered extra cheese or extra chicken on our pizza. (Maybe that's just me craving some mega cheesy goodness from Little Star.)
author: Richie K.

description:
Love Zante for what it is... a zany hodge-podge of cultures and ingredients.

Believe it or not, I'm no stranger to Indian Pizza.  I've been eating the stuff since 1988.  My best friend in junior high was Indian and his mom was an unbelievable cook.  I have fond memories of inviting myself over to their house every weekend to leach food from her oven.  Sure, she made the traditional dishes, but some of her best stuff was the fusion cuisine.  I tells ya, she had an Indian nacho recipe that would knock your socks off!!!

But her pizza, oooooh, her pizza!  Sure, it had the requisite bread-like crust and mozerella cheese.  But one bite, and you knew something special was happening in your mouth.

My visit to Zante brought back vivid flashbacks of those simple times.  And like LSD, PCP, GHB, or the hallucinogen of your choice, I kept coming back.

It's good stuff.  Order some online and make some flashback memories of your own.
author: Gracie-C Y.

description:
Zante's Pizza is great, fuckin ingenious, and tasty (I'm referring to the Indian Pizza there), dont get the meat, its kinda lame, barely noticeable, rather chopup the bbq meat from pakwan myself on these pizza and eat em.

Jessa, B. introduced to me an interesting concept, eating raita with your pizza. What a random but tasty concept, and I now have reasons to believe, that she got this idea from Isa Y, whoever it is was, good work.

besides pizza, they do a great rendition of bombay potatoes, they just dont have anything in their bread selection that would go well with it.

I just wait for my mom to send me her homemade poories (same items as Burma Superstar's Poodi bread), though my mom's is much better. Your option would be to goto indian groceries, next to bombay ice-creamery and pick up frozen parathas to go with dem bombay potatoes.

PS: Vegan Pizza (I know wtf is that?) well its here, and its great, basically cheese less version of Indian pizza, its darn good, I kid you not.
author: An u.

description:
After those Kennedy's Naan-Burritos, Indian pizza is my other favorite food hybridization.

I recently discovered Zante's after my old Glen Park Indian-Pizza spot changed hands. The Indian dishes are solid fare and relatively inexpensive -  above West Portal's Roti Bistro and the overpriced Embarcadero Gaylord. I guess it's the closest thing we have to Baluchi's in NYC. The "bargain" lunch specials are worth every delicious penny, but the pizza is why we go back.
author: Be N.

description:
This is the kind of fusion that either is really good, or really bad. Their Indian pizza is REALLY REALLY good. I love the vegan pizza and my wife loves the "Best Indian Pizza" (yes, that's what it's called). 

The other Indian dishes are good as well, but the pizza is the real gem at this place. 

Decor and ambience are not the focus in this place...so dont expect  too much on those fronts. Have a Kingfisher beer with your Indian Pizza, and you will won't regret this dining experience!
author: T C.

description:
My first experience with Indian Pizza, and you know what... it was delicious!

The good:
They actually deliver to my house in the outer, outer mission!
The pizza arrived warm and quickly and without any hassles!
The pizza was delicious. I would have never thought to put indian food and pizza together, but whoever had this idea is a genius!! A perfect combination!
You can order everything ONLINE!!

The bad:
I can't stop eating the delicious pizza!! It is SOO good.
I ordered over the web, and had to call them to verify my order (although they had the order and were already delivering it by the time I called so it wasn't a problem)
author: K. C.

description:
I love Delfina and Pizzetta like the rest of y'all yupsters. But whatever, who doesn't like a bit of curry and cauliflower on their pizza on occasion? Two international cuisines at once makes you feel all intercontinental and stuff. (California does not count as international cuisine.)

I've had horror stories ordering from these guys in the past, but tonight decided to take the dive yet again. I resigned myself to the following workflow:

1. Call while on the way home from Sunday shopping, much earlier than I actually want to eat
2. Have them repeat back my order, my phone number, and my address a few times
3. Take time walking home, stopping at Dog Eared and to chat with Omer Travers
4. Get home, plan to call again after 60 minutes have passed from order time
5. Call every 30 minutes until they deliver.

Actual workflow:

1-3. As specified.
4. Get home
5. Wait 10 minutes
6. Answer doorbell

The pizza was a bit cold, but that is why God invented ovens.
author: Blake E.

description:
Dear friends of mine had me over for mystery take-out dinner after my marital property left me solo in SF while he's in Italy on a six-week work trip.  Imagine my delight when it turned out they ordered from Zante's, a place I had been meaning to try for ever.

So, like other reviewers, I thought the traditional Indian entrees were rather greasy and meh.  Same for the stand-alone naan - it seemed soggy yet simultaneously dry to me.  

On the other hand, the pizza was BOMB.  Get this, "The Best Indian Pizza" is "Topped with Spinach, Egg Plant, Cauliflower, Ginger, Garlic, Green Onions, Cilantro, Lamb, Tandoori Chicken & Prawns."  (For the record, I detected no prawns on the pizza, but with all the other awesome stuff that was covering the pizza, this was not a loss).  I cannot wait to go to the restaurant itself for a pitcher or two of beer.
author: Katina M.

description: Prreeeetttttyyyy good. Not the best pizza ever, but for an Indian and vegan and pizza fusion, I was impressed. The price was right as well, and me and my dining companions ate it up and were the perfect amount of full. The menu, however, could use a serious once-over for copy editing purposes, but I won't hold it against them.
author: Natalye R.

description: I had to try the much-heralded Indian pizza, and it was definitely tasty.  I  liked the spiciness, but I wish there was more meat on it.  I had a handful of shrimp, but I didn't taste any Tandoori chicken or lamb. So while I enjoyed the pizza, I didn't glean any strong or distinct Indian flavors from it.  I got delivery, which took about 30-40 minutes.
author: Melinda C.

description:
ok so i get a flier on the door for this place. we tried calling in and ordering. first call, my girlfriend couldn't understand his accent so told him to hold on while she adjusted the volume on her phone. she tried to put it on speaker phone and soon found out it wasn't. the guy on the phone was so impatient that when she did get it on speaker phone he had hung up. second call, she was ordering the items and told him which ones she wanted medium and which spicy. then the guy presumably repeats the order back but did so in such a incoherent mumble that she asked him to repeat himself. HE BLEW UP AT HER! yelling, yes, yelling that he was very busy and asked her what she wanted. so she calmly repeated the order then he asked for our address and she slowly enunciated each letter of our street and the guy wasn't getting it. after 3 times i jumped in as it was all on speaker phone and had to have a stern almost yelling tone for him to understand. i asked for the total while already knowing how much it should be. he told me it and it didn't seem right. so i asked him to break it down for me dish by dish. he was charging me a dollar more on the prawn vindaloo. i told him that the flier said it was a dollar cheaper and he abided. the website had the wrong price for the vindaloo as well as a dollar higher on the sag panner. this is why we didn't order it online. bad customer service man, i mean bad

we got our food in the quoted time. the naan was, in fact, rubbery as noted by another yelper. the sag panner and prawn vindaloo were severly watered down and underseasoned. the vindaloo was not spicy as requested. you could tell they could've been good if they weren't so diluted. i have a high suspicion that the 'prawns' were actually shrimp. they were tiny and mangled. they did give a generous portion of each in their own pint containers full to the brim. i am very full, but am i satisfied? that's a hell no. maybe i should've gotten the pizza. doesn't matter they've lost a couple customers here. there is no reason you should ever, EVER yell at a customer, especially a patient, kind-hearted girl like MY GIRLFRIEND! you're in the wrong industry buddy!
author: Eugene H.

description: This place was the bomb for lunch a friend took me here years ago and I've taken other friend and they can't believe how great the Indian food is in a pizza restaurant.
author: N A.

description:
Typical San Franciscan pizza crust topped with suprisingly good indian sauce and toppings (Pizza Offering).

Indian food: above average

Yeah, not bad.

UPDATE: I've gotten sick a few times eating here and I have some food safety concerns, dropping two stars from my review
author: Anony M.

description:
Their service is simply terrible. Why should I be treated any different?

My two hour plus late pizza arrived cold with raita spilled all over the rest of the order. I ended up having to call three separate times, each time receiving the promise of "just 5 minutes".

I so wanted to forget my long wait with some delicious pizza, but it was cold and soggy and not that satisfying.

Never again Zante.

Save yourself the time and the hunger pains and just order from your favorite Indian place.
author: Angela K.

description:
Something wonderful happened on the way to Thrillhouse one evening...my friends and I stopped by Zante's Pizza. Until that glorious day, I had never even heard of Indian pizza before. I'm still not quite sure how this is possible, considering Indian food is one of my reasons for being, but oh well, moving on...

I've been reading the negative reviews, and all I can say is: I've never tasted Zante's traditional Indian food. Nor have I ordered their delivery food. They may very well suck, but my review is all good. The pizza was delicious. That's all I know.
author: Nikki H.

description:
After 4 years of skepticism, I decided to try it, and was not disappointed! When I first moved to San Francisco I heard about the Indian Pizza place and was afraid, very afraid. Over the past 4 years my culinary tastes have broadened and become more creative, and decided it was time to give the Indian Pizza a try!

So the bonuses are (1) the taste and (2) the price. Make sure that you request an "indian style pizza though", because they also serve a lot of regular pizza that isn't any different than any other place. We also tried one of their veggie curries, the Sag Aloo, which was delicious. Good naan too. Perhaps the most exciting was the $3.00 glass of wine that was more than just drinkable :)

The only negative was that there were fruit flies buzzing around, which was kind of gross....Ok, it was really gross. But I tried to ignore them :)
author: Jennifer C.

description:
As far as a dining out establishment, I'd go elsewhere.
As far as a delivery service, I'd go nowhere else.
Ive been angry with them about some miscommunication errors and in my heated moment, looked elsewhere for Indian-delivery; but, my infidelity proved unsuccessful and forced me to practice my mindfulness skills in order to let go of old injustices.  Because by far, so far, Zante's delivers the most diverse, spiciest, and intriguing dishes.
author: Jen L.

description:
Though the Chicken Tikki Masala was a tad overcooked, the food was tasty (if a little bland), it was insanely cheap, and seating was readily available. Special mention goes to the giant Tandoori Chicken Pizza, which, despite its uneven base and healthy serving of topping, held together without turning into a slopfest.

I'm most saddened that they haven't taken the next logical step and started offering curry pasta (which is super delicious).
author: Glen M.

description:
I've only had the Indian Pizza and it is delicious! I doubt the other dishes could be as good as Spicy Bite next door . . .
But my issue is they consistently take nearly TWO HOURS to deliver - and we live less than a mile away. So if we want Zante pizza, I actually have to order it in the late afternoon before leaving work. Which is totally lame.
author: David C.

description:
Yes, the food is interesting, but I wouldn't return.  The only way I would is if someone I knew wanted to try it for the first time.  

I don't know if I should say this, but there was something in the pizza, that wasn't meant to be there.  Well after that I couldn't enjoy the rest of the food. 

I also had the shreded chicken naan, it was ok.  But I thought that the Naan that is sold in Trader Joes tastes better to me.

Then I also had the shrimp in some spicy sauce, like a soup, again, it was ok.

Mostly, I just imagined replacing the Zantes naan with the trader joe's one, skipping the shrimp, and having any other pizza with hot sauce spread over it.  

The service was nice though.
author: see y.

description: This review is on their Indian food. Their pizza which I have also had (once) is pretty sub-standard and definitely nothing to write home about - that being said we are from NY and maybe a bit picky in that department. But... their Indian food is universally terrible, just gross!!! First of all the dishes were all grease and butter (Ghee), and then to top it off the rice pudding was liquid. Seriously? Never again... Oh and be prepared to wait a long time for your delivery. PRO TIP - If you want good Indian try Udupi Palace on Valencia.
author: David C.

description:
I smell like it for days afterward, but ordering a vegetarian or vegan Indian pizza is really a guaranteed way to have an awesome night.  As a lady that derives vast amounts of pleasure from eating, I recommend pizza from Zante with confidence.

Delivery service tends to be slow, but knowing this merely justifies an overload of ordering. Like, if it's going to take so g.d. long then I might as well go overboard with delicious treats! Sit-down service is also a bit slow, but the servers and cooks are really nice guys. Warning: I've only ever heard them play Indian techno music, which is a bit disconcerting to non-techno listeners like myself.

I'm also a  big fan of their vegetarian korma, and consider it the best I've had so far in SF. . . but don't let that distract you from the pizza--the pizza is the real reason for making it a Zante night.
author: Chloe S.

description:
3.5 points for the good axe food
1.0 point for selling Kingfisher, my favorite Indian beer
(-1.0) point for delivery service.

The Indian pizza is sooo good we actually eat the entire thing.  When I say entire thing I mean a small size, but we are both small eaters and can usually only have 2 pieces each.  

This is what you need to do - go there, order the Indian pizza (I only get the chicken - no shrumps, no lamb),  get a side of Raita, and dip that shit like it's ranch dressing.  The crust is essentially Naan, and the sauce, instead of a marinara, is like this unbelievably scrumptious eggplant puree.

Don't be thrown, if you don't like eggplant, like my mother, you will NOT know the difference.  

** NOTE ** : DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY UNLESS YOU ARE PREPARED FOR VERY SHITTY SERVICE! THE PIZZA IS WONDERFUL BUT THE DELIVERY IS TERRIBLE.  TWO HOUR DELIVERY TIME & COLD FOOD.
author: Jerkey J.

description:
Pizza was good but cold.  It took them 3 hours to bring it to Potrero Hill, and everytime we called it was another line of bullshit...ranging from "we went to 22nd AVE" to "we went back so we could get you 2 more pizzas".
Seriously...WTF?  We got one pizza...and it was cold!
That being said, it was pretty good, but doesn't compare to Indian pizza you can get in Sunnyvale.
author: Johan E.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying out Zante Pizza, since it came highly recommended from a good friend.  I placed my order for "The Best Indian Pizza" online at 8:33 PM.  There's a note to call them if you haven't received a confirmation call from them within 15 minutes, so I did.  The guy who picked up the phone made me feel like I was bothering them by calling.  He confirmed that they had my order and said the pizza would arrive within 45 minutes of when I placed it.  Ok, no problem. 

I called back at 9:30 PM when my pizza still hadn't arrived.  They said it would be 10 minutes.

I called back again 15 minutes later.  Still no pizza.

The delivery guy finally arrived an hour and a half after I'd placed the order.  The pizza was cold and tasted kind of meh.  I had three pieces and lost interest.

Zante Pizza was a big disappointment.
author: Jake T.

description:
Woooohoooooo!

Indian Pizza! It's just crazy enough to work. SO delicious. Regular pizza just won't do anymore.
author: Conster A.

description:
I love this place. Everyone I know knows that I love this place. I rave about the pizza. I want to give it 5 stars so badly, but EVERY time I've ever gotten delivery (from anywhere in the city, the mission, SOMA, castro, doesn't matter), the guy on the phone tells me "45 minutes". An hour and a half later, the pizza comes.

Went to the restaurant for the first time yesterday. Delicious as usual (although I've noticed it vary recently more often than it used to).

Side note: Highly recommend an order of raita to dip their vegetarian Indian pizza in.
author: Chris T.

description: Pizza is Pizza, it's always gonna be good. These guys do it pretty good, the crust is nice and chewy and the flavors work pretty well. I just wish they had a bit more pizzaz to it. I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala pizza expecting it to come with Chicken and Tikka Masala sauce but instead it just came with tandoori chicken on it. Just call it a tandoori chicken pizza or just stop denying me my carnal pleasures and sauce it up with some masala curry! Uber expensive and slowish too, but I'll be back.
author: Jackie S.

description: If you want Indian, and your friend wants pizza, you eat Zante's Indian Pizza.  Ha, ha, ha. This is what it said on the wall.  The saag aloo was really good.
author: Wakako U.

description:
(This review is based solely on their pizzas)

I l-o-v-e their pizza. It's so delicious!
Why didn't anyone think of combining Indian food and pizza before? Maybe someone did, but Zante's is the first place where I tried it so I'll give them the credit!
They also have free delivery if you live in the vicinity which has saved my day on more than one hung over occasion.

So, to put it in short: try their pizza!!
(The rest of their food I haven't even bothered trying yet :)
author: Pastor Z.

description:
When six friends can go out to sit-down dinner in SF and get beer, pizza and an appetizer for less than $55, that's pretty great.  Not to mention the Indian pizza was brilliant.  Finally:  naan, meet melted cheese.  
The waitstaff was VERY nice too!
author: Alice M.

description:
I think I'm in love!
Yup, love is a big word. 
And yes, I'm ready to use it for my relationship with Zante. 
I love Zante!
The pizza was fabulous.
They are so right. 
The Best Indian Pizza.
Totally called.
Who doesn't love a pizza with tandoori chicken, shrimp, cilantro, garlic and love?
I really was full after having just a slice, but lived large and the second slice was like a little piece of heaven.
author: Valarie A.

description:
A long time favorite has recently started upping their game. The menu had expanded a bit and their delivery has actually been impressing me lately.

Now that you know there are even more Indian pizzas to try you should get one of each.
author: Josh Z.

description:
The pizza is heaven even if parking is a complete bitch.

The last time I was there a wobbly, super high junky was standing just outside the door getting more and more hunched over and shriveling inside his sweatshirt while people came and went for more and more PIZZA!!!  They didn't even charge extra for that. 

Indian Pizza.  Great Idea.  Wish I thought of it first.
author: Emily H.

description:
I'm not sure what people expected when they ordered Indian pizza from this place. Most of the bad reviews seem to be along the lines of  "It's like they took pizza and put Indian food on it". Well... yeah.

I like it, but then again I'm not shocked beyond belief when my large coke comes with coke in it...
author: Andrew L.

description:
In Neal Stephenson's sci-fi classic Snow Crash, if your pizza takes more than 30 minutes to arrive at your door, the mobster owner of the entire restaurant chain choppers in from his family vacation spot to personally apologize to you on live television.

In San Francisco when your Zante's pizza takes three hours to get to your house, you get to practice your assertiveness skills on the phone to the staff and then the manager and then the driver.  

Then your pizza is free.  Cold, but that's why we have microwaves.
I still love their food.  But next time, I'm driving over myself.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I had eaten at the restaurant several times and was a pretty big fan of the vegan indian pizza.

unfortunately, as other reviews have stated, delivery is not their forté.
we ordered at 5:00pm, and it didn't arrive until 7:43 after three phone calls.
it was cold and they didn't include the chutneys which are basically where all the flavor comes from.
author: Sean R.

description:
I don't like indian food.

The Best Indian Pizza (vegetarian) makes me want to revisit my prior statement for more thorough evaluation.

It doesn't matter that the garlic and the green onions will make me a veritable fart box for the next 2 days.  

I guess this is why we gather and scarf down the pizza...then scatter to different corners of the apartment all of a sudden needing "alone time".

Cue Coldplay.  "Nobody said it was easy..."

Good food sometimes does equal payback...and isolation.

------------------
Update 10.04.07

Please also order the veggie samosa's and proceed to stuff your face with it.  

You will not regret it.
author: Jen I.

description: was very, very sick one day and ventured forth into a yelp search only to stumble upon this restaurant.  Decent delivery time and delicious memu!  Only issue is when I requested "spicy" I did not get as advertised.
author: Francesca H.

description:
We ordered the indian pizza. I don't know what I was expecting but the thought of putting indian flavors on a pizza intrigued me. The pizza was good; not great. It was loaded with toppings but I was a little turned off by the color of the meat and shrimp (Read: FD & C Red  No. 40). The flavors worked together nicely. 

We ordered delivery despite reading some negative reviews about the delivery service. Our pizza arrived promptly (30min or so; keep in mind we live close by) and our driver was polite but not friendly. 

We are certainly glad we tried the pizza and would recommend that others try it, but we are not adding it into the regular rotation.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
I was walking up Mission looking for something to eat. Something healthy. I resisted burritos and papusas. I resisted Goood Frikin Chicken. I walked by countless restaurants, considered Safeway, then suddenly ran out of options. 

Then I turned to my left. What the crap?! Indian Pizza?! I remember reading about this a while back and seeing high marks. It's not the healthiest, but fuggit, It's something new to try. $7 for 2 slices and I bounced out of there to get them home and put them in my pizzahole. 

Not bad. Tastes like indian food on a pizza. About like what you would think. It's pretty tasty and has awesome crust. It didn't knock my socks off, but it's better than even the regular pizza joints around here.
author: Gabe M.

description:
Although I haven't had Zante's in some time, I always look forward to it when me and my friends order it.  Indian style pizza is a fabulous idea and Zantes was really able to pull it off.  The indian food is pretty good there as well (no shalimar or naan n curry).

The decor of the restaurant is pretty meager and I never go there to actually dine-in.  I also feel like as the pizza is really good, it does stand to be a little bit greasy.
author: L A.

description:
Indian food and pizza: sounds gross, but  SOOOOOOOOO good.  I would actually drive up to the Mission from San Jose *just* to get  one of these Pizzas.  The only other menu items I tried were the vegetable and lamb samosas, and they were perfect.

They lose a star because the pizza tasted a little bit like the hand I was forced to eat while waiting FOREVER for my food.  That, and the pesky little fly that kept landing on my water glass.  

Anyway, thumbs up.
author: Tyler C.

description:
Zante, you're delicious.  Your pizza's delicious, your samosas are delicious, your curries are pretty delicious (aside from that time when I ordered one of them "spicy," and you gave me spicy, and my lips nearly fell off, and my tongue couldn't taste anything for days.)  You're delicious.  

And your employees are nice, like the guy who didn't mind when I was short a dollar on my slice last week, once I offered to bring in the dollar next time I stopped by.  

Thanks for trusting in me, Zante.  Thanks for providing all the snacks for the small bday party I threw my sister a month ago.  $70 seemed a little steep for what I ordered (two big pizzas and a bunch of samosas), but heck.  I forgive you.
author: Sara L.

description:
There's something about this place that brings me back every time I'm in San Francisco. When someone told me we were going to an "Indian Pizza" place in Mission, my mind started spinning. What could it possibly be? What makes it "Indian"??

An excellent curry sauce on some tasty naan bread, topped with an interesting array of delights such as shrimp, eggplant, and cauliflower ensured I would not leave without eating to "I'm gonna puke if I take another bite" status. As other reviewers have noted, it's well-priced and has a range of dishes. The more traditional Indian dishes (I had the Benghan Bartha and a couple of other vegetarian plates) were also good. Service has been slow, and the ambiance is not the most relaxing, but it's got a pleasant bustle from all the delivery orders. The only thing that didn't quite work for me was the rice pudding! Too syrupy or something. 

Miss ya, Zante! Wish you were in San D.
author: Elisa Q.

description: I LOVE their pizza. It's like something out of Willy Wonka - a pizza that tastes like you're working your way through an Indian buffet. I've never had anything else on the menu but both the meat and vegetarian pizzas are deeeeelicious.
author: Anonymous F.

description:
I love this place!  The only reason I "4' star'd it vs "5" starrin' it was because of price and parking IF you decide to dine in.
Ahem...now then...the reasons I love this place?

YUMMY pizza...and I mean, your typical pizza pie, with everything on it...very yummy crust and generous with the toppings!  Also, they make INDIAN pizza with spinach and tandoori chicken and other yummy seasonings! Definitely worth a try yelpsters! Even if you order a regular pizza and then a slice of the Indian pizza! You will not be disappointed!

REALLY YUMMY Indian food! I love love LOVE their Chicken Korma! Creamy, slightly spicy sauce, tender, white meat hunks of chicken...I'm salivating as I type this!  Also try their Veggie Samosas, and their Saag Prawn...basically lovely creamed spinach with spices and nuts and PRAWNS!! DEE-lish!!!

You know what else I like to do?? MIX it UP!!! For instance, a really divine meal involves ordering a cheese pizza and then an order of Chicken Korma and then dipping said pizza slices into the sauce!  It's a departure from the Naan bread you would normally use to sop up the yummy sauces (though this place has GREAT naan..I recommend Plain or Garlic Naan)

I have had no problems with ordering over the phone...in fact, one of the owners, Tony, who is totally hot by the way, knows my VOICE now! and my favorites!    Hot! Hotter! Hottest!! (~_~)   Yes, sometimes when I call and Tony's not there, you might get someone who speaks with an accent, but we can understand each other enough to give/receive a dinner order!   I agree with other posters who mentioned, this place surely is NOT the Four Seasons in terms of decor..it's a Pizza-Indian place in the Mission, are you that surprised this place isn't like a scene from a dinner party in "Brideshead Revisited?" BUT..they have cheap pitchers of good  beer, (TAJ Mahal? KingFisher anyone?)  plenty of room if you have a big group or someone has a kid in a stroller or someone's in a wheel chair (I run with a wild crowd (~_~) I dunno, all around this place is a winner,  I wish the prices were a tad cheaper AND I do wish they had parking!  It's a very busy area, the nearby corners are almost ALL bus stops, you may circle 5-10 times before finding a space 3 blocks away!  You could "bus" it there if you're into that sort of thing...they do have a parking lot in the back  (Enter on Cortland Ave) but it's kinda dark and narrow and scary...always filled with cars (of the workers) or delivery guys...so it's almost a "why bother" shrug type thing...oh well.  Still love this place for dine in or delivery, yum pizza and Indian food, cute Tony on the phones or handing you your take out...Git along lil doggies...over to Zante's!
author: Karen S.

description:
If you're in the mood for (a) incomplete deliveries, (b) starving to dealth waiting the 2 hours it takes to arrive, and (c) the incapacitating and violent food poisoning that occurs thereafter, then fuckin' A, Zante's is the place for you. 
Hope you're not doing anything for the next 48 hours... buy toilet paper before you order. Better yet, get off your lazy ass and go to zeitgeist instead. Get yourself a burger.
author: Farallon Living I.

description:
I can't vouch for any other dishes but O my goodness. The Indian Pizza was banging. It's like a culmination of everything positive about Indian food on top of a soft delicious crust. Just like any good Indian place they don't skimp on the spices and combined with the cheesy tandoori action they got a good thing going here. It has a very distinct flavor and to the best of my knowledge the only Indian pizza place in town (I could be wrong.) Innovation what a beautiful thing.

The reason they didn't get 5 stars though was because the so-so service. The delivery took an hour and a half (although it was free) and the guy taking the order was rude. Well, rude is kinda of a strong statement. It was more like he didn't understand me and I didn't understand him because he didn't speak very good English.

Although, the pizza made all the troubles melt away...
author: Rodney V.

description:
