Since moving to the city, I heard tales of an Indian pizza joint, and lo and behold, I ended up moving only blocks away from said establishment.  

To me, the fact that the owners decided to carry both Indian and Italian cuisine is pretty funny since they are on opposite sides of the food spectrum, but if it were not for this strange combination, we wouldn't get the Best Indian Pizza!  

I'm surprised they haven't explored any other types of Indian Pizza, but I gladly eat up the stuff as is probably every two weeks.  I especially love it because I'm lactose intolerant and I get to eat "pizza" that's not a pathetic sprinkling of toppings and tomato sauce....Oh, and I can't speak for any other food of theirs as I haven't felt the need to venture into other territory; it's Indian pizza or nothing for me at Zante's.
author: Genoa H.

description: Indian and pizza are not two genres of food I would ever imagine would go together, but much like every cliché romantic comedy, these two total opposites were meant to be together, even when they seemingly have nothing in common, once joined they make the perfect match.  I was invited by a friend living in the Mission at the time to Zante's Indian Pizza, a tiny little restaurant in not the nicest of areas. I was more than hesitant to try this combo, but once I took a bite of their veggie Indian pizza, I would never again imagine ordering an Italian pie again. The spices are amazing and have such a complexity of flavor, and they even come with the spicy mint chutney and sweet dip usually reserved for samosas.  They also deliver anywhere in the city. Wish I still lived there so I could order it right now...
author: Katie B.

description:
there is a god people.
their name is zante.

seriously, if you haven't tried the vegetarian indian pizza you haven't lived.
also, back when i first tried this place i ate meat, 
and ugh the chicken tikka masala is to die for.
the sauce is so creamy and delicious. 
it sort of tastes like it may have some maple in it? or something? 
i have no idea. it's just fabulous.

the saag paneer is amazing.
it's spicy, but not too spicy.
chana masala is awesome.
EVERYTHING ROOLZ.

only downside is that it's a tad bit expensive and if you order delivery, chances are yr gonna be waiting awhile.
usually an hour, sometimes 45 minutes if yr lucky.
it's definitely best to just walk yr little self on in, 
ride yr bike or hop on the 14 or 49.

GO GO GO.
author: Jena R.

description: Okay, so I would definitely recommend the veggie Indian pizza, but I've got to say that Zante's regular Indian food is not the best.  I didn't think that a mango lassi could ever be bad, but Zante's proved me wrong.  The only exception is the samosas.  They're pretty good, although I've had better. So, go there for the pizza.  But don't go there for the Indian food.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
This place is awesome. The Indian Pizza is super good!! 

If you are a pizza lover go check it out... it's the most beautiful pizza I've ever seen. 

I'll definitely add this to my faves in San Fran.
author: Deborah H.

description: Haven't tried the Indian food yet, but the pizza was delicious!  I love how you can get tandoori chicken as a topping.
author: Paige W.

description:
Its certainly worth a try. If you love pizza and you love indian food, this will be entertaining to say the least. The other food isn't half bad. Pretty standard SF indian fare. But its all about the indian pizza which, if you have an open mind, is pretty good.

The service on the other hand, is kooky.

"The Best Indian Pizza" is actually the name of one of their pies, and it was pretty good. I think I tried some sort of Tikka Masala pizza thing which was also good. I don't know if I would get it again since there are both better pizzas and better indian restaurants in town. Maybe if I am in the neighborhood.
author: Zac H.

description:
Three stars seems about right for this place, though, I wouldn't hesitate to offer another half star if I could.  My roommates and I ordered pizza from here this weekend, and we had pretty high expectations based on the reviews we'd read - especially the one comparing eating Zante pizza to receiving a blow job from God (personal favorite).  

The pizza did take about an hour and fifteen minutes.  No foul here though, since we were anticipating a long wait based on the reviews - and accordingly ordered about an hour and fifteen minutes before we wanted to eat.

The pizza arrived, the smell was awesome, it looked delicious, and I was officially "amped."

On the first bite I was still in pretty high spirits, but the more I ate the more I felt that this pizza was just "ok."  

Now, I've decided not to add any points for being unique - though I think others could feel justified in doing so.  Nonetheless, once you move past the fact that this is truly something "different" what you are left with is simply mediocre Indian food on a mediocre pizza.  

Also to be fair, most of the reviews that make a specific recommendation for this place suggest the veggie pizza - whereas we had the "Best Indian Pizza" specialty.  Maybe we should have stuck with the veggie pizza, but tandoori chicken sounded delicious.  

All and all, not bad.  I'm sure we'll try it again just because there is no other place like it.  Otherwise, my roommates and I were all in agreement: Zante's was a little underwhelming after all the lavish praise heaped upon it.
author: Matthew H.

description:
I haven't managed to re-calibrate my "Indian, now!" impulse since moving off the Lower Snob. And "delivery Indian" isn't exactly ever worth it. Really, I'd rather hop on BART in the cold and shove through Union Square and sit at a table at Chutney or Lahori by my lonesome.

Except Zante delivers everywhere in the City. And I'd been in once three years ago for a pizza, and forgot that. Lamb korma + paratha + saffron rice = $20 with tip, which you'd feel terrible about in the Tenderloin, but for this, I did not have to put on a coat or earphones or a steely-eyed stare. I'll consider that the San Francisco Indian equivalent of a convenience tax. And it was yummy.
author: Melissa G.

description:
mmmmmmmm
Chicken Kurma
Chicken Kurma.
and they deliver.
Perfect for when you want to stay in and watch movies & not order Chinese & be hungry in an hour.  It is delicious & you will be full for quite some time.
author: Catherine D.

description:
okay -- I was pessimistic at first... an indian pizzeria?  I've yet to try any of their pizza offerings, but have ordered their traditional indian fare for delivery many times.  it's surprisingly good -- though a bit variable (i.e., I've been handed some dessicated tandoori chicken on more than one occasion).  overall though -- a good bet.

if it's an indian dinner-for-two you're hankering for, just order the "taj's royal feast."  you'll get a tasty assortment of yummy bits in about an hour.

definitely skip any and all of their indian desserts though.  just plain nasty.  that's sad, given that indian cuisine has some faboo sweets to offer.
author: Mark B.

description:
I've always been a fan of Indian Food, my old roommate, has not. So when one night she advised me of this strange yet magical pizza with an Indian flare, I surely thought she was crazy. We gathered around the apartment kitchen table listening to a woeful tale of condiment love and loss, vegetables and sambusas. I said bring it on--with extra dipping sauce...I must try this leavened luxury you speak of.

How can this be? A veggie pizza that tastes like a little bit of Love Me Tandoor all in a box? I had to stop myself from eating the whole thing. Never mind the alone time, I'd even let the bf eat this pizza off of ME!
author: Jessica P.

description:
Good stuff! Whether you get the pizza or plain ol' Indian food, it's a nice break from the city (kinda deep in the mission, so parking DOES exist), and the service is great. One of the servers even gave us an opportunity to brush up on our Hindi! My slice wasn't as spicy as I normally like, but that's what chutney is for (it was also great dipped in the saag paneer). Also - great samosas. YUM. 
Make sure you save room for dessert - Mitchell's is right around the corner from this place.
author: Anika K.

description:
Mr. Pizza Truck and Ms. Indian food delivery van collided and wet, delicious carnage ensued! 

The pizzas are a mess in a box but so tasty. Worth trying at least once. Sort of a Messina/Masala mashup.

The other items me and a colleague ordered were just 'okay' --  suitable for when you're chilling in front of the TV and ya just gotta have Indian from the nearest place that delivers. I did like the Daal Makni though, much thicker than the normal soupy crap you get, with vegetables and well-seasoned. My Gujarati buddy Vince swears the Daal is the most authentic he's had in a long time.
author: Karsten P.

description:
They know it makes them unique but for some reason you have to hunt for the "indian pizza" on the menu.  It's past the traditional Indian food that takes up the first three pages on the menu, past  the regular pizzas, and listed on this little box on the back page.  

But it's worth it.  They keep it simple, just say "I'd like the Indian Pizza with (or without) meat".  Boom...that's all and soon you'll be feasting on something that looks just as beautiful as it tastes.  Yum, can't wait for the leftovers...
author: Mark D.

description:
over-rated

First time I ordered this I liked it - unique flavor that is worth trying.  I was craving it so ordered again and it was disappointing.  Delivered late, not warm, and skimpy on the toppings.  Too much pizza, too little Indian...
author: Brad C.

description:
Damn you! Open up an east bay location (preferably one right next door to my house)

Indian Pizza! Indian Pizza! Indian Pizza!

best! thing! ever!
author: I M.

description:
What starts with a "Z," combines the best of Italian and Indian in one etherial unit, and takes WAY too long to do it?  Zante Pizza!

The SF buds RAVED about Zante, we came, we ordered, we drank large Indian beers at the bar, and we waited...

After 40 minutes, we inquired as to the whereabouts of our prized pie, and they looked puzzled.  Five minutes of confused searching behind the counter produced said pizza, it had been done, sitting above the pizza oven for who-knows-how-long.  

But DAMN was it tasty.  The cheese, the sauce, the veggies, they melded together  with Indian goodness, and when washed down with a tasty beer, Zante's Indian pizza was worth the wait.  Minus one star for the wait, and one for the slight overpriced-ness.
author: Eric S.

description: Get the indian pizza. i like the meat, but my vegan friends love this place too. I always go pizza not regular indian food. don't bother with the american pizza unless you're super broke.
author: David D.

description:
Reasonable prices, Indian pizza is definitely the way to go. Nice crust and a very tasty and unusual pizza flavor. The food itself is poor and the decor is very basic. Service was very friendly.

We've only dined in, never ordered delivery.
author: Vikram K.

description:
I attended my friend's son's 10th birthday part here on a Saturday night. There were about 12 of us and we ordered three pizzas. All were very good, a lot of different burst of familiar flavors you would find in normal Indian cuisine except atop a pizza. I also ordered myself a bowl of their soup called Muill Lgatawny, which let me tell you I enjoyed even more then the pizza. Super spicy and even a bit citruses, I'm already craving more!

The folks who own the place are very welcoming and great to their guest as well. We were a pretty loud bunch of people and stayed there for over 3 hours and they didn't make us feel like we needed to hurry up and leave at any point.

Can't wait to go again!
author: Ericka A.

description:
I shared a big veggie pizza with some friends, and it was pretty good. I can't get too excited about it. It wasn't bad, but it didn't do a whole lot for me. I liked the indian flavors, but I would rather eat my indian food in curry/naan format. 

The samosa, however, were delicious and nicely spiced. If I went back, I'd probably stick with the regular Indian food options.
author: Lauren H.

description:
It DOES just taste like indian food on naan. I wasn't too impressed. We ordered by phone and picked up so no problems with delivery and it was ready when we got there.
Nothing spectacular, kinda pricy.
author: JaM W.

description:
LOVE IT for the take out INDIAN food !!  MMM.  Great Samosas !

They also have a nice place to sit and eat and a good slice of cheese pizza.  What's not to love??
author: Dave W.

description:
A friend of mine Ro V. told me this place is amazingly awesome deliciousness.  Hyped it up big time.

I must say the pizza was freakin' good.  I can tell this is great place to go when drunk.  Where I can easily devour 4-5 slices and not feel guilty.

The delivery took ages, which added to the frustration and more of  "This pizza better be F'n amazing" comments.

It was good, the 5th star however is reserved for those who can not only deliver on time, but at least give courtesy calls if they're running late and not leave that task up to the customer!
author: Mary R.

description:
I've had Zante's delivered, eaten in, with small and large groups.

The food is tasty and not terribly expensive; for example the Bindhi Masala (awesome okra, sounds iffy but it's great) is $9.99, and you get about a pint and a half of the stuff. Put that with rice and naan and you're talking 2 - 3 servings, for under $20. Or one very painful serving, if you do like I did once and gorge like mad on this stuff. Yum, but ow. Pace yourself and save some for lunch tomorrow.

The service when dining in is slow slow slow, even on nights when not many people are there.

Delivery is fast and you can order online which works very well, it's actually one of the best I've seen.

Basically, I like this place but ordering is better than dining in. It is far from swanky, but would be good for a big relaxed group dinner, meaning OK as long as you're not all starving or in a hurry.
author: Jamie F.

description:
We were actually trying to go to Emmy's Spaghetti Shack, but when we got there the wait was an hour and half and.... we don't have that kind of patience.

So we headed back down the street toward the car and "that place that smelled really good."  We ended up at Zante, where my friend and I split a pitcher of beer and a medium Indian pizza for $28 (which included tip).  The pizza was very good.  I've never had cauliflower or prawns on a pizza before, but this was great.  If you're bored with traditional pizza (though I don't know how that could possible happen), then go here.
author: Jin D.

description:
When my particular Virgo pal told me about this pizza I have to say I had some thought such as "hold on, buddy"  and "um.....you know I hate pizza right?". Yeah. Boy was I wrong.

It was amazing, the chutney was key and I will never doubt him again! 
Well, until he cuts down the neighbors bamboo, then maybe.
author: M C.

description:
DONT GET DELIVERY!  This place is ok if you don't get your food delivered.  The delivery guy is this stupid wannabe player douchebag who doesn't care about you or your pizza/Indian food.  The stories on here are all true, a while back we clocked them at just over 3 hours to deliver 4 blocks away.

The food is pretty good though, if you can, pick it up.  Their "normal" pizzas aren't all that good but their Indian specialty pizza is good stuff.  They're also priced pretty reasonably, $25 for a gigantic pizza is something I can appreciate.
author: Scott S.

description: Poofy pizza. It's the kind with the squishy crust and when you grab a slice everything slides off onto the metal pan with holes on the bottom. It's also white tablecloth, which just doesn't really jive with za.
author: Klevin D.

description:
hungry for some spicy CTM i decided to check out nearby indian restaurants and see what's out there, straying from my usual joint (little delhi). i ordered over the internet (fun!) and was given a call as promised within the ten minutes of placing the order, as a confirmation. great start!

i ordered the CTM (which they advertised as zante's best) as hot as they allow--and chicken mushroom mild with garlic kulcha (garlic naan).

there was a hiccup with delivery and but despite the confusion as to where my address was exactly, the food arrived faster then the 45 minutes the man over the phone promised and was still piping hot.

all of this, saves them from getting a star--stellar service for sure.

the food?

NOT

the chicken tikka masala (CTM) is not hot at all. the color is a light yellow/orange color and very very watery. curries are suppose to be thick! this was so watery when i dipped my garlic kulcha in it the liquid just runs off the bread and back into the container leaving the bread simply wet.

the chicken itself was okay. 

the CTM was not spicy at all

and the garlic kulcha was very dry and bland. no taste to it despite the show of color and all the seasoning on it, it appears to be tasty but when you bite into it there is no flavor at all.

really disappointed with this, as naan and curry can do better then them tenfold and the cost is not as high.

11.99$ for the chicken tikka masala
2.99$ for the garlic kulcha
10.99$ for the chicken mushroom (which was also runny in curry, i only sampled a bit as it was my sister's order)

horrible taste. but excellent service
author: Whitne Y.

description:
What is with this place? Their Indian pizza is delicious; an amazing fusion of Indian food and pizza that could have only been created on a dare after a long night of vodka, red bull and LSD. (Which I believe is available at Go-Getters Pizza.)

But the service here sucks. I've never tried delivery because I've read everyone else's reviews, but I've sat at table B2 for freaking ever waiting for someone to bring water, beer, plates, anything. If, somehow, you manage to go to the restaurant and aren't starving (which never, ever happens to me but maybe you're a good planner), then you're fine. Otherwise, it's a toss-up. The food is worth the wait; but it's a long-ass wait.
author: Tim B.

description:
So, to be fair, I only tried the Indian pizza. honestly, i could probably handle a couple of the ingredients, but I can't hang with both shrimp and lamb on a pizza.... When i tried it though, it wasn't very flavorful...

My vegan friend seemed to love the vegetarian one, because he finished the whole thing on his own....

The tikka masala was good, but the other pizzas were just pizzas...
Probably wouldn't come back for the pizza but the Indian was pretty good...
author: Tasha R.

description:
I would give this place 5 stars, except you gotta watch out for your belly and the bathrooms are totally gross. 

The Best Indian Pizza is truly the best, but if you have too many slices of greasy cheesy buttery goodness, you and your tummy may pay the next day. Pace yourself, if you can....

I ate it in, so waiting for my 'za was a breeze.
author: Nima K.

description:
Zantes has been around forever. It took us a long time to get it right. Here is our secret. We are pretty much vegetarian so that may have aided us but we get this and meat eaters love it too!
 Indian pizza, no meat, no cheese and sides of indian sauce, mint chutney and tamarind for drizzling. Seems the pizza is just much more alive and tasty without the cheese. We go nuts every time we get one, we almost went back-to-back nights on it this week, prompting this review.
 Oh this is not some pizza delivery chain so whining about the almost one hour wait is unwarranted, you know where to get that 30 minute to your door or free crap. This is a one-of-a-kind delicacy!
 I have dreams about this dish. No, it is not a substitute for pizza, it is something unique unto itself, give it a shot, you won't be sorry.
author: Steve R.

description: The other reviews are true- they'll tell you 45 minutes for delivery, then show up 2 hours later withe a cold pizza.
author: C. W.

description:
I used to order food from Zantes when I lived in the Mission as a college student, and we never have resentment, its good, you eat it, late & on time on and off, same story as any delivery... 
But what pissed me off and made me never eeeever buy from this restaurant ever again, was when I moved into Bayview with my family and called in for delivery, I mean these people were complete jackasses and didnt want to deliver to "my neighboorhood" wtf? They are signed online with the 24hr delivery.com with MY HOME ADDRESS as deliverable, but yet on the phone they say that "we don't deliver to your area"... After being their client for years, they give me that bulls**t. No thanks, I will order from the India Garden Restaurant that has amazing tandoori chicken, and has no problem to deliver... 
I will recommend any Indian restaurant in the city except for these jackases in customer service, who were also once racist to my husband for a pick up order a few years back.
I do not support this business
author: Christina L.

description: We waited about forty five minutes for a half veg/half meat XL Indian pizza. The mango lassi was an unnerving and highly unnatural shade of neon orange which even the super dim lighting could not hide. The veg side was alright, but the meat side was...questionable...to say the least. All of the meats were pulverized into little bits, so I had trouble telling what was what. The tandoori chicken shards were an unearthly shade of red, as if they'd been soaking in maraschino cherry dye for a couple years. Having eaten at many [better] Indian places in the past, I know that those technicolor foods were not just "a result of the spices." Maybe I should have asked them to forgo the dimmer and just shut off the lights? Not worth the price -_-
author: Skye L.

description:
Clever Indian Pizza idea, so props for that.

Nasty pizza though! So I guess to each his own. Some like it, some don't. Don't take my review to heart, just try it for yourself.
author: G J J.

description:
Indian pizza: four and a half stars, easy! The vegetarian curry pie was piping hot and delicious, every bite an explosion of garlic, finely chopped veggies, and spices. The crust is typical American not-thin, not-thick style, but quite well made for that genre. Definitely a tasty treat.

Service: two to three stars at best. We had read so much about their crappy delivery that we went for carryout. We ordered from their website and never got a callback. When I finally called in, they were like "oh yeah, we got your order" and hung up right away. I had to call back to ask when it would be ready, and they were like "oh yeah, it's ready now." Uh, thanks guys. Would it just have sat there if I hadn't called, TWICE?

The review consensus is right: great food, shitty takeout/delivery service. I recommend phoning in your order, requesting a time estimate, and picking your pizza up.
author: Andrew H.

description:
The online delivery system is sweet, and delivery is fast.  It's a little more expensive than I would like (our bill was $48 before tip for two people), but the food was pretty damn good.  The tikka masala was spicier than I was expecting.  

Overall, it was a great complement to our American Idol watching needs.
author: Bill J.

description:
Oh........ this one......
OK, their pizza is pretty special. Yes, I meant special. 
I was expecting pizza with chunks of lamb topping when I was thinking lamb pizza.... It turned out to be tiny pieces of lamb...... and TONs of Cilantro.....Too much cilantro.... that I couldnt taste any meat.... And on top of that, my girlfriend hates cilantro.... So it ended up not that fabulous at all. 
But if you love cilantro, go ahead.... price is good though, well, after all, it's a pizza place.
author: JJ G.

description:
Everyone I know who's had their pizza raves about it... I don't see what's so hot about it.  It's okay, different, but not  great. However,  I have had their other Indian food delivered and have been pleased.

Tonight I'm nursing a bad cold and wanted some comfort food.  Zante's hit the spot, plus I was able to order online, which is always awesome. We had the chicken vin da loo and a lamb dish, plus veggie samosas.

yumm.  If I see a bit more consistancy throughout their menu, I'll gladly give them 4 stars.
author: cindy p.

description:
545pm, pizza order is placed
645pm, phone call to Zante's "Where's my pizza?"
700pm, driver arrives
715pm, I sink my teeth into the often spoken about pizza.
716pm, I think to myself...hmm.  this is ok.
717pm, I take another bite.
718pm, yeah, it's ok.
745pm, I wonder why everyone speaks so highly of this place.
746pm, yeah, it's ok...
author: Matt V.

description:
the pizza indian pizza is amazing,

I left my indian lunch left-overs at biglots in the towel section, which pretty much consisted of my whole meal...
needless to say stick to the pizza and only the pizza.
author: A. Gun n.

description: I really wanted to love this place! The pizza was just OK. I thought the flavor was going to be more on the Indian side (i.e. naan-like base and spicy, saucy toppings) but it really tasted more like a regular slice you'd grab after a boozy night. And skip the curry dishes completely. The service was really great though, so an extra star for just being nice.
author: Julia G.

description:
We almost always ordered takeout, so I don't have too many comments on the service or delivery here. I only can say the the indian pizza is wicked delicious and I miss it so so so much now that we've moved down to Mountain View. (If anyone has suggestions for most excellent indian pizza down this way, I'll take them!)

Mmmmmm, want.
author: Lindsay J.

description: The Indian pizza without cheese is almost better than with cheese, and I didn't think that was possible. Definitely pick it up from the restaurant though, delivery can take hours (literally). I think they only have one driver so if there are a bunch of deliveries ahead of you way out in the Marina or the Outer Richmond or something, you'll be waiting a long time.
author: Gaelen X.

description: I've ordered from Zantes many times. I do love their pizza BUT every time the delivery has taken over an hour. The last and final time I ordered from this joint, the guy (who turned out to be the manager/owner) was extremely rude and condescending. I will never order from them again.
author: Shannon B.

description:
need a vegan, indian curry pizza with a slow-ass delivery that's gonna give you gas later?

put some sriracha on it.
author: Y K.

description:
Are you tired of the norm? In need of a different kind of pizza all together? Zante's is one of the best kept secrets of the Mission.

This was the first time I've ever had Indian pizza. Tandoori chicken with cauliflower and a mild curry sauce with cheese and other toppings.
author: Genghis M.

description:
Zante's, oh how we love thee.  The only thing we've had, based on other yelpers and one brief experience with their samosas is the Indian pizza.  If you think it sounds disgusting, or a deeply wrong clash of cultures, you are a misguided soul.

We've had the vegetarian and the meat Indian pizza.  Both are amazing.  Honestly, I don't know what they do to it, but you just can't stop eating it. I am convinced these guys need to open their own franchise.
author: AaronandMaureen B.

description:
Indian Pizza: it's good. Pair it with some tikka masala for dipping and you have a winner. Unfortunately, Zante takes FOREVER to get your order delivered. I mean, if you want it at 7 order at 5. Also, they are really expensive, and I can't figure out why - it's not like the ingredients are innately costly. Unless there's a fine layer of foie gras in the crust, they are seriously overcharging for their food.

Three stars because with all their flaws, they make solid food (not just the pizzas).
author: Mark W.

description:
Indian pizza, mmm.

One time I ordered it with "everything" and it had lamb and shrimp on it, which was interesting but I'm not a huge fan of lamb.  The rest of the time it comes with chicken tandoori only.  Not sure if I said some code word and got the super secret special recipe or what.

It would be more awesome if it came on some sort of naan bread but it's not bad as-is.  They make pretty decent "ordinary" pizzas too, better than I've had from other places in the Mission.  Their supreme is tasty.

Delivery can be slow but they have a fairly wide radius they will deliver to.

For a while I was eating this once a week, and it never got old.  I still go back regularly.
author: Jeff K.

description:
The Indian pizza (with everything, which includes bits of lamb, shrimp and tandoori chicken plus some bits of  vegetables) is the way to go here. I am never disappointed and the to go slices heat up nicely.  I always get the pizza with the Prawns pepper masala (medium spicy) and have them both separately first, then dip the pizza in the masala. 

If you have not tried Indian pizza and you really like Indian food, you must go as soon as you possibly can. 

Golden gate pizza on Judah has a good vegetarian Indian pizza.
author: Eve L.

description: So I've given up on finding what I consider a great traditional Pizza in San Francisco because I have just been disappointed too many times, and converted to Indian Pizza. This place is amazing...love the spinach curry sauce, love the spices, love the speedy delivery- haven't tried anything else here yet because I always want the pizza. They have an amazing array of ingredients. Veg friendly, which is always nice!
author: Queenie R.

description:
Indian Pizza?  Yes, that's right, Indian Pizza.
A group of 7 headed down to this part of Mission with Indian Pizza as our objective.  
Our party ordered an extra large The Best Indian Pizza - which includes all 10 toppings - as well as some traditional Indian fares such as the chicken tikka masala, sag paneer, and plain & garlic nann; and we cleanly polished it all off.
The Indian Pizza was definitely the main attraction of the night, especially for its uniqueness.  It was good to have 10 ingredients, but the quality got lost in the quantity.  Each bit was a different flavor (a little too much of garlic in my bites...) and I wish the ingredients were better evenly spread out and in bigger pieces for better taste recognition.
The rest of the dishes were ok.  Not bad, but the dishes were rather bland and lacked certain flavors/spices.
Enjoyed the novelty and recommend it as a place to try.  Also a good price point and good place for groups; came out to ~$13/person.
author: Carol K.

description: zante's rocked my face off, i mean seriously this was good, i'd had it before yes, but there was something special this time, and i really loved eating it. HINT: get mango chutney to dip your crust in.
author: Jared Z.

description: Delivery can be slow, but he Indian pizza is a delectable one-of-a-kind treat.  Wonderful vegan, veggie or meaty.
author: Ziadee C.

description:
When they were on 16th st. I sometimes used to stop and get a slice on my walk home from work.  Indian pizza is surprisingly tasty, let me tell you.  Like some of the other reviewers, I'm really not interested in their non-indian-pizza offerings such as the "normal" pizza or the non-pizza Indian food, as such things are surely far better elsewhere.  Really the whole point of going to Zante is to get the combination of the two.  4 stars for novelty and creativity: Yum!

Update:  I went to Zante the other night after work, and on my way out I noticed a couple who had ordered a small Indian pizza and an order of chicken tikka masala ... and were DIPPING the pizza in the tikka masala sauce.  Sweet Jesus how did I never think of doing that???  Next time, I swear, next time.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Been eating here for years.  The Indian pizza is unique and wonderful.  Love it. L-O-V-E .  Seriously.

The regular Indian food is so-so, BUT... there's never a wait for a table if you get fed up with the crowds elsewhere along the Mission/Bernal corridor.
author: Telstar L.

description:
Last night I ate zante's for like the gazillion(th) time. This particular eating extravaganza was for a birthday. Usually I do delivery (in which they arrive lickety split).  For this event we took up a big portion of the dining room, and as only a big group can be, were highly disorganized, confused, particular, and demanding when it came to ordering. Our unfortunate waiter was SO patient--so accomodating--so accurate. He was not only a waiter, he was a magician.  We had like 7 chicken tikka masalas, and at least that many saag paneers--slices of pizza, lassis, samosas, plain naan, cheese naan, garlic naan, and naan were messed up (drum roll please), and everything was delish as usual. The total cost per person for a feast fit for a Raji? 25.00

I could go on and on, but i'll just be repeating all the other 4 and 5 star reviews.  I just have to say that this place is a local treasure.  I feel so lucky to live around the corner.  
ps. Did I mention the mango chutney?
author: Aishe B.

description:
The only and best Indian pizza I ever had. But I prefer ordering it from home, or a friend's house. The restaurant itself is nothing special.
I think the delivery is better is the mission than outlying areas. But as other reviews suggest, it's best to have some chewing gum or toothpaste at the ready, if you're going out after indulging on these scrumptious slices of garlic heaven.
author: wayne s.

description:
woah, how have i forgotten to yelp this place already?

Zante's Pizza is the bomb(dot)com for reals. despite my irrational fear of anything potentially spicy or of mixed genre, my coercion into Indian Pizza addiction has changed my entire outlook on food...nay, life!

the gentlemen behind the counter are pretty legit as well (always handy with a free beer or extra slice for my price, know what i mean?) though it might just be my incredibly adorable face... har har har
author: Jaei P.

description: Praying for death the morning after eating here. Only thing worse than the hygiene is the service. AVOID!
author: Dr. O.

description: Indian Pizza...need I say more. Awesome and wonderful combination of Indian spices on a naan like dough. It's as if an Indian genius took over an Italian Pizzeria.
author: Jenny S.

description: I agree, you shouldn't really be writing a review about Indian pizza if you didn't try the Indian pizza.  However, I did and, I can honestly say it was pretty terrible.  My family is from India, I know Indian food really well and I'm a huge fan of fusion cuisine.  This however, was just wrong.  If you want food that looks like pizza but tastes like a hodgepodge of uncooked spices, try Zante's.
author: Tash P.

description: This is so sad, but, since I wrote that review the food has gone downhill by A LOT! Everytime I've had it in the last 6 months or so it either has 1) made me ill or 2) lacked any flavor whatsoever! When I ordered spicy chicken tikka, I imagined it would taste a little bit spicy, and not just like orange butter sauce! I found a much better Indian place already, so I'm not going back to Zante's ever.
author: Jessica R.

description: Indian. Pizza.  Curry paste on spiced pizza dough.  Seriously good veggie pizza, good cheese, good toppings, it was just so good.  We also got the chili-cheese nan with some sexy tasting dipping sauces.  I'm crrraaavving it.  Plus the waiters are so cute, shy, and quiet, you just want to pinch their little cheeks.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
Zante delivers piping hot indian food (and indian pizza) quickly, and is frankly the best Indian I've had in the area... The Rogan Josh and the Chicken Makanwalla are personal faves, Indian Pizza is a refeshing change from Pepperoni.  You can also order online.  The restaurant is not beautiful, but they are able to deal with large parties.

They have noticed their popularity though and jacked their prices up, so it's not the steal it once was.
author: Fiid W.

description:
The Indian pizza makes me dance. As dumb as that sounds, you know when you ate something that you liked as a kid, you did the same damn thing. Everything is pretty good. Chicken Tikka Masala--- comfort food. The only problem I have with this place is the phone orders for delivery. A little communication gap and orders can get messed up and resolved.  
The Indian pizza has such an intense flavor of ginger and saffron, but not overwhelming. Prices are VERY good too! Don't be scared
author: Ashley J.

description:
About to move into a house in the Outer Mission and was stuck waiting for Comcast to install the cable until 8pm last night.  We were hungry, but had no food in the house and had to stay for the cable guy.  We checked-out YELP and found this restaurant.  Having lived in the San Mateo area for the past 10 years, I forgot how awesome it was to live in the city and have just about any kind of food you could dream of delivered!   This place has a great website that you can actually see what you are odering before you pick it!  Which is great because I love Indian food, but I can never remember what the name of anything is.  So ordering by site is great!

We ordered a large pizza and 2 Indian dishes.  The food came hot and tasted oh so good!  They delviered with in 30 or so minutes and the delivery guy was super nice.  We look forward to trying more of their cuisine!  (Oh, and they put on the toppings on their pizza.  This is no skimpy pizza. Can't wait to eat the left overs for lunch today!)
author: Kathleen F.

description:
I like this place a lot.  It is a bit more expensive than the nan & curries of town, and very rich - as in probably full of butter - but it still gets 4 stars for good veggie curries and wonderful Indian pizzas.  I don't order meat here, so don't know how that is.  But the veggie curries tend to be chunky and fresh - which is refreshingly different.

The back room is a little messy?  I've seen much worse.  The food here has never made me sick.  AND they deliver all over town.  Even to the foggy Sunset.
author: Carlos V.

description: Haven't been here physically, I've only ever ordered online. I like the option of ordering Indian food or pizza from the same vendor. The food I would give 3-4 stars, but I'm giving it a two because of the delivery service. If you live at the edge of the delivery zone, expect to wait almost two hours for your food to arrive. Worse, the drivers don't seem to be able to count street numbers. They almost always call me to ask where my house is, saying "I found address this or that, but I can't find your house" which is usually the house just before or just after my house, even though I'm the only house on our street with the front porch light on. It amazes me in the age of ubiquitous mobile GPS that someone can't manage to locate an address; just enter it in Google, it will give you a route straight to the front door with turn-by-turn voice directions. Even $30 GoPhones have this capability nowadays. I called Eat 24 to check the status of my latest order at 1 hour 20 minutes and they told me, "The order is out and will arrive in 10 minutes." 20 minutes later, I checked again and they said the same thing. I called the restaurant 1:45 in and they said, "5 more minutes." It arrived at 1:52. Then, despite having paid online via Yelp, they asked for my signature.
author: Steve S.

description: I had the Vandeloo it was amazing, they don't play around if they say HOT they mean business. It was delicious and there Mint sauce just that Mint! Super friendly people too.
author: LJ E.

description: My son has a play group a block or so down from this place so we stop in to grab a quick lunch once in a while.  A little dark in there even during the day but the pizza is great. Sure, the owners have an accent, but so do I.  I find it hard to believe that a self respecting Yelper would even comment on this.  Its a pizza place!  To me the diversity is what draws me to this place.  They definitely use different cheeses than your "chain" pizza place. Give it a try.  Nice guys in there and great pizza. I've only had their cheese pizza but the others look great too.
author: LeftCoast Y.

description: This is my go-to Indian delivery. I've never had any trouble, but today was especially easy -- received my order 35 minutes after placing my order, delivery guy was especially friendly and feisty, and my chicken korma and pizza were especially tasty. Bravo, Zante!
author: MB T.

description: This is my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco!!!  Yum.... it's the kind of dinner you are still thinking about the next day and can't wait to open the leftovers.  I think by the name and from the outside, you'd never know that the best Indian food in the city awaits inside.  I think for the price and quality, I wouldn't go anywhere else for Indian food.  I haven't yet tried the pizzas, but I'm so stuck on my usual favorties that I'm not sure I ever will.  All the dishes I've tried have been excellent, even if it's not something that I would order, I still think it's delicious.
author: Alexandra P.

description:
I joined yelp just to give this horrible restaurant a review.  

I had tried this pizza before and thought it was rather mediocre, but my housemates were all gungho to order it in so I gave in..

After waiting over an hour and a half and calling 4 times, being told over the span of 30 minutes that it was "on its way" each time (we live 3 blocks away), speaking with a manager several times, and being finally promised a free pizza, the driver arrived.

The driver was one of the most rude members of the service industry I've ever encountered.  He was actually angry at US for their tardiness.  He spat at us that we could have a $5 discount, take it or leave it.  Well we left it and he squealed off in his car leaving us hungry and very upset.  After all was said and done we had waited 2 hours for a pizza that never arrived and we will never patronize this establishment again.  

I would encourage everyone to think twice about this restaurant as everyone we dealt with, from the manager down to the driver was incredibly rude.
author: Dylan R.

description:
Indian Pizza, what? 

I often get blank, unenthusiastic stares when pairing those two words together. Indian and Pizza. Oh my LORD, this is the best! I freak most of my 'out of town' visitors with a meal at Zante but they never return to SF without wanting to go back.
author: Sarah B.

description:
The Zante Pizza experience is best when their Indian pizza is delivered right to your dinner table. Eating at their Mission Street place does not really do it for me as I really don't dig that stretch of the Boulevard.

Indian pizza - genius. Eat it and you will reach pizza nirvana.

Shanti Shanti
author: Jack K.

description:
Another gem I have discovered in the fair city of San Francisco I tasted their Chicken curry (Chicken Sagwala) and their small Indian Pizza. 

Not completely overrun by hipsters of course! 

I recommended the place to my friends such as Captain, and Rastrillo

Great service! Raj is one of the servers who has photographic memory so he actually remembered one of my friends and me.

Since then I've been to this place on separate occasions with friends, definitely a great place for a first date.

Love this place!
author: Alberto L.

description: Please don't misunderstand.  The Indian pizza Zante serves is amazing.  Their delivery times are usually reasonable.  I've been ordering from them for a few years but on 11/11/11 they seriously screwed up.  Some colleagues of mine and I decided we wanted their pizza for lunch, so I placed the order online about ten minutes before they opened.  25 minutes later, I called to confirm.  The man who answered put me on hold and left me there.  I called back, again, to confirm the order using the confirmation number I had.  He angrily told me they had no orders and hung up.  Wha-wha-what?  So I called back and asked for the manager.  He claimed TO BE the maanager!  This atrocious customer service is the giant screw up I speak of.  He had insisted that I place the order again, after my bank had sent me a text message that my debit card had been charged.  It took two of my colleagues three more calls to sort it out - a total of 5 phone calls to sort out a minor error that should've taken 1 call, if any.  The pizza we ordered at 10:50am arrived at 12:41pm, leaving me 19 minutes to "enjoy" it before a meeting.  How disappointing, especially given how much I truly enjoy their food.
author: Phillip H.

description:
6:24pm:  I called in to order two medium pizzas for delivery, the veggie Indian pizza and a regular onion and peppers pizza.  The guy took my order but didn't even ask for my phone number.  He told me it would be 45 minutes, perfect.

7:11pm:  I call back to check in at the 45 minute mark, he takes my phone number and says it's on its way.

8:29pm: our pizza FINALLY arrives.  At this point, we're seething, and asked the delivery guy if he could give us some sort of discount since we've been waiting for two hours.  He calls his boss... willing to give us $5 off, claiming it's not late or says he'll just take the pizza back with him.

We'd been waiting forever and wanted our pizza.  Open them up and it's completely cold, had to put our freshly delivered pizza in the oven and then it wasn't even that good.

Literally will never ever go to this place again.  They were rude, unaccommodating and delivered mediocre cold pizza two hours late.
author: Elina K.

description:
1. Do not eat the Indian food. Trust me. Much much better indian food awaits you in the city. this is a strictly Indian Pizza place

2. Do not get delivery. You will wait. And then you wait so more. And then you, if you I mean me, will be like I live five minutes away so you will just walk over and eat. And then when you finished you will come back to your house and THEN  you food will actually show up. 

3. That being said it still gets four because the Indian pizza itself is awesome, the prices are great, and the service itself kick-ass. Best Indian pizza in the city.
author: Vasile S.

description:
Have you ever had Indian pizza!?  OMG I thought it would be really wierd, but it's not!  It's basically Naan for the crust, and whatever Indian food you like for the toppings.  Don't be scared, try it!  

Everything was delicious. Only downfall was that there was something gritty in the veggie slices. 

Also, please note that if you order enough Indian beers, you will get to witness the waiter man clear your table by putting a bottle on the end of each finger tip.  I tried to snap a picture of that, but didn't.  So, I hope you do.
author: Alyssa T.

description: Ummmm... Mediocre Indian food at gourmet prices.  I had malai kofta which was the most runny Indian food I've ever had... and I've eaten A LOT of Indian food.  The taste was OK but oily to the extreme, I still feel a little off hours later.... I asked for Indian spicy and it wasn't even gringo spicy.  The veg curry was $10 and the garlic naan was $3 and was just dry, crusty flatbread with a little garlic and butter.  I would not have been happy but merely content had I paid the deserving $7 for this instead of almost $15.
author: Bigfrog W.

description: Is that the taste of a new obsession gracing my mouth? I believe so. Love Indian food; love pizza. The two combined: dreamy. I was skeptical, but the vegetarian Indian pizza was amazing - even the dough was curried, if I'm not mistaken. Consider me a convert.
author: Shelly L.

description: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in SF. I love Raj he is so friendly and remembers people's order. The indian pizza is amazing. I love their food.
author: Star l.

description:
the pizza here is actually pretty good. our workplace orders lunch from here every so often.

so why the two stars? the delivery guy had trouble finding our location, and loses his cool with my co-worker who was doing everything she could to ameliorate the situation. really, if you are working a service job, losing your cool and shouting at your customer is NOT the way to go. i understand that maybe a delivery job is not that much fun and potentially full of stress, but you should NOT lose your cool and take it out on the customer.
author: Della Q.

description: I ordered online through grub hub and after literally 1 hour 15 minutes called.. They answered and immediately put me on hold.. for 3 minutes.. doesn't sound like long, unless you are on hold.  I asked about the pizza, they said it was coming soon.  Mind you, I live 3 blocks away (just got home from trip, was lazy, plus I live on a hill, they're at the bottom).  At 1.5 hrs. I called to cancel the order and they said they guy was on his way.  I told them if it arrived in 2 minutes I would accept.  At 2 minutes on the nose the bell rang.  The box felt cold and I asked the delivery person (after I gave him $3) to wait b/c it felt cold.  He said that it was not cold as he hurried away.  Ouch.  Then I opened the brown paper bag that contained the samosas and the red dipping sauce had opened up and spilled all over the bag and when I pulled out the samosas it dripped all over my white rug.  Ouch.  I called the manager and told him the account of what transpired and asked that my money be refunded - he said he would call grub hub immediately to generate the refund.  One week later no refund notice so now I have to email grub hub, write a yelp review, yada yada.  Ouch.
author: Bret W.

description:
Oh Zante. You know you're awesome, don't you? You can show up an hour late, but who cares? Am I gonna call that OTHER Indian pizza joint? Nooooo. So, all four stars are for the food, not the service. In-house service could be great for all I know, but the delivery service is truly awe inspiring. Which dishes will show up? Which won't? Will I even get my food before they close? ("Our driver couldn't find your place and he went home cuz we're closing. If you get here in 5 minutes you can pick it up...") As for that food, "The World's Most Fantastical Indian Pizza" or whatever they call it is in fact just that. Not that I've had any other Indian pizzas to compare it to but still. Damn good. The chicken tikka masala is dangerous. I caught myself licking the sauce off the weeny little piece aluminum foil they use to protect the rest of the world from the cardboard Chinese take-out tikka masala BOMB they send you. Seriously guys, can't you spring for plastic containers? Maybe even... with lids? But that's part of Zante's charm. Half-ass containers, incidental deliveries. And if they actually get their act together and feed us Indian pizza as regularly as we want, San Francisco will be sinking into the bay even more than it already is. Better leave well enough alone.

UPDATE:
So, they forget my pizza one evening. Guess who's ringing my doorbell the next morning? That's right. The delivery guy. In the same clothes. With my pizza. That was in his car overnight. 

Is there any other pizza place that delivers breakfast? I think not. Way to be, Zante. Way to be.
author: Marie A.

description: Indian food + pizza is a match made in heaven... I just wish this place was closer to where I live!
author: P A U L.

description: I love the way the pizza tastes but let's just say that my stomach and Zante's Pizza don't get along....we never have and never will.
author: Natalie H.

description: Whoaaa....time out, time out...indian pizza?  Hell yeah!  It was awesome.  We got the 'best indian pizza'.  It came with shrimp and curry and veggies.  It was mind bending.  Who knew?  It was a little soggy, but I'm convinced that it was partially because we had it delievered to a locale apprx. 12 hrs away.  -and they took extra long getting it to us.  My solution is to bring back an old Chicago trick, ask them not to cut the pizza.  It'll stay more a little more crispy.  When you're 420 eroded onto the couch, get this pizza!
author: Jake H.

description: It takes a while to figure it out, but drive to Zante's and pick up the damn pie.  It's ready in 20 minutes!
author: Krissy M.

description:
Zante used to be my go-to place for Indian and my wife still likes it for the bengan bartha, but I just can't recommend them anymore.  The food is not spicy (at best, one can hope for a mild tang that hints at peppers being somewhere in the restaurant), more Indian places are now delivering, and, in my last (as in, final) order from Zante, the manager repeatedly lied to me about when the food would arrive.  It was a dark and stormy night, and my wife and I were taking refuge in the solace of an evening at home with some tasty Indian takeout.  The manager at Zante told us that the food would be about forty-five minutes.  An hour later, I called and was told that the order would be another fifteen minutes.  No problem, I thought, the weather is terrible, and lots of people are probably ordering from Zante.  Half an hour later, I called back and was told that it would be another fifteen minutes, which turned out to be true, and our lukewarm, bland Indian food finally arrived.

As a former pizza delivery driver, I can certainly attest to the misfortune which can befall one's food, but the job of the manager is to ensure customer satisfaction, and part of that job is setting expectations appropriately.  If I had been told the truth initially about when my food would arrive, yes, I probably would have ordered from another place, but I might have ordered from Zante again later.  As it is, I think I'll pass.
author: Bitter J.

description: the pizza was 2 hours late, i tipped the driver a dollar which i figured he was lucky to get and he hands it back to me and flips me off as he leaves. whaddafuh??!!!
author: Julienne G.

description:
A solid 3 stars. I was trying to figure out a place that a small group of friends could go to for dinner.  We all wanted a place that was near us, no crowds or a scene, no need to yell to hear each other, no paying crazy prices, and most importantly, good food. We decided Zante's would be the place. I've never actually sat down in this place to eat. I've often ordered pizzas for delivery(and have had no issues with them) or pick up and have consistently loved their pizzas. 
So we arrive on a Friday night, and it's very quiet, maybe two or three other tables. We all decided on a large Indian pizza, half veggie, half tandoori chicken. And saag paneer, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan and rice. Yum! I never had Indian pizza in conjunction with Indian food. It was great! dipping the pizza in some saag paneer was perfect! 
The pizza was perfect too! All the veggies, cheese, and Indian spices. 
The service was fine, nothing spectacular, but they got nothing wrong and were pretty prompt with the food. No frills, no nonsense. I like that. 
So for an evening of catching up with friends on our latest travels, this place was perfect. We went home feeling full, caught up and didn't have to break the bank! 
Large pizza, inidan food, wine, beer, tax and tip: $70 for 4 people.
author: Caroline C.

description: Theoretically, Indian pizza sounds like the BEST IDEA EVER. And maybe that's part of the problem--I built it up in my mind, spending hours fantasizing about how mind-blowingly delicious it would be. It didn't quite live up to that hype, unfortunately. I can't quite put my finger on it, but something was less than optimal for my tastebuds. Not that I didn't enjoy it--I did--just not as much as I thought I would.
author: Rachel J.

description:
eating zante's pizza is like getting a blowjob from god.  it's that good!

(note: if you were offended by that last comment, get off the internet and return your computer to whatever compusa store you bought it from)

I was once a naysayer, doubting the supreme tastiness that is the indian pizza.  I mean, seriously, indian food on pizza sounds ridiculous!  you might as well eat poop on a stick!

But once you get your grubby, little yellow teeth around this puppy, you won't regret it.   Note: do not try if you do not enjoy indian food or pizza!  if you like neither of these items, i can recommend a local olive garden.
author: Huyness D.

description: Amazing thing to try. Smells funny but that does not stop me. If your sensitive just be aware.
author: Sam D.

description: I'm giving it five stars because it was actually that good! I got the mushroom mattar, yogurt, garlic naan and basmati rice. They were super attentive (although I was the only customer, not surprising) and everything tasted great. I didn't have the pizza, but I definitely got enough food. :) I like the kinda fancy setup they have with the napkins, candle etc. I honestly wasn't expecting it from the outside but you get in there and it has potential! Next time... pizza. (Mmm, indian pizza.)
author: Ash G.

description: I hate to beat the same drum as everyone else, but HOLY MOTHER OF GOD THE INDIAN PIZZA IS GOOD. and I get it sans cheese, because I'm lactose intolerant like that. Also, lots of Indian beer choices, and super nice guys.
author: Amy K.

description: Let's just say that there are those foods in life that you crave...you know, like bacon, ice cream, turkey/cranberry sauce sandwiches...and then there are the things that you want so bad it hurts...like crack and INDIAN PIZZA! I personally love the vegetarian pizza with bubbling cheese perfect crust, and itsy bitsy pieces of veggies smothered in indian spiced-sauce that is spicy yet curiously sweet. order a side of raita and drizzle the cool yogurt sauce over the piping hot slice on your plate and prepare to swoon. The only reason it doesn' get that final star is it's VERY poor delivery service (i have waited over two hours...nearly put me in a straight-jacket) and the fact that a waiter spilled beer all over our pizza. instead of making a new one, they just threw the beer-soaked one back in the oven. Actually, when i think about it, it might have been the best pizza ever.
author: Jessa B.

description: i'm not convinced indian food and pizza belong together.  not quite a believer yet
author: Anna V.

description:
this place serves indian food. on a PIZZA.  

how do they not have a five star rating? every time i order from here it makes me want to move to bernal all the more. the tandoori pizza is perfection. carbo-load here before a night of sweaty dancing (to nineties hits) at the knockout.
author: Jane P.

description:
I must have seriously lucked out, because Ive been a Zante's customer for years, and they've always delivered within a reasonable amount of time. (Maybe it's because I live in the Mission.) But anyway.. the Indian pizza... THAT is what you order here. Although the naan is also quite good. (If you haven't had enough carbs with the pizza) Im kind of a fan of their Marsala dishes as well, but they do repeat on me a bit.

I got my wife hooked on this stuff. I wish I could order from them more often than I do, but I lost 50lbs and I don't plan on gaining it back.
author: Jonny P.

description: Um maybe it was an off day? We got it delivered - it took about an hour and a half and it was so sloppily made with some seriously lacking toppings compared to what was promised. Too expensive to feel this way. Disappointment made it not taste as good - but the concept and potential is there.
author: Sari G.

description: Some of my two favorite things: Pizza and Indian food! The food was incredible, however the service..not so much. The waiter seemed a bit absent minded and kept forgetting to bring our drinks/ curries that we had also order with our pizza. But the food made up for the service. This place has become a new "must go" whenever I am in the bay area.
author: Chelsea S.

description: We dined in early on a Sunday evening thinking that Indian Pizza would be quick. Turned out we were the ONLY people in the entire restaurant and it still took the server about 20 minutes to come by and take our order. The Indian Pizza was tasty and unique but I agree with the other guy who said the crust was soggy. I'm open to giving it a second chance on another night. and hopefully become as converted as the other lovers of Indian pizza.
author: Kelly S.

description: Oh, Indian Pizza, you sound so wrong, but taste soooooo right. I might pack up and move to Bernal just to be closer to you!
author: Michelle D.

description:
we order from Zante's a couple times a week and dine-in once or twice a month.  the guy who answers the phone can never understand our order or our street name, so we have the same conversation every week:

"one extra large indian pizza, half no meat, half no meat and no cheese... half vegetarian, half vegan."
"half meat?"
"no meat, half cheese.  and two orders of samosas."
"samosas?"
"no meat."
...

"hampshire street."
"hampster?"
"no, hampshire, like new hampshire"
"oh, hampshire!"
"right.  when will it be here?"
...

nevertheless, this pizza will change your life.  kate pocrass mentions zante's in her first mundane journeys book that a friend claims that this restaurant makes it "impossible to move" away from the bay area.  this statement brought me to zante's the first time.  i've come to learn that this statement is completely true.
author: Katherine R.

description: You know the food doesn't taste bad at all.....in fact it's rather tastey!  But Zante's kept making me very sick every single time I ate their food.  Until one night.... my dinner companion went to the bathroom and came back to the table and reported some disturbing news.  There were metal cafeteria containers with food on the dirty kitchen floor.  UNCOVERED.....RIGHT BY THE BACKDOOR THAT WAS WIDE OPEN!!!  The backdoor led to more grossness. As if the cafeteria containers placed on the dirty floor filled with the food you just consumed wasn't gross enough.  He came back with a camera, took pics.  Check out the photo...click on photos of this place to see.  Enough said.
author: Suzanne C.

description:
Why can't you choose NO FUCKING STARS!!!
Ordered online for a fucking business meeting. 
Called 2x to check on order @ 20 minutes intevals (keep in mind this was 1/2 hr AFTER it was supposed to be here) - they said it was in transit both times.
On the 3rd phone call...said they didn't receive our online order.
We will NEVER order from them again.
I have 14 people who did not get lunch because of their general ineptitude, shitpisspoor customer service and stupidity in general. 
I could give two shits if they have great pizza or not at this point. 
They can dangle and I'll go to Arinell's or Little Star for the office luncheon pizza fix.  Fuck 'em.
author: Mea A.

description:
Got to be one of the worst pizzas (and worst Indian food) we have had in recent times. What we had was called "indian pizza" on the menu, but should have been called "pizza-with-a-soggy-crust-and-day-old-tandoori-chicken-bits-on-top".

Never Again.
author: bong b.

description:
These reviews are part of a series where my Vancouverite friend wanted to try a bunch of food carts all weekend.  We ended up deviating to some other cheap eats.

The contestants:  Lers Ros Thai, Fritzj, Adobo Hobo, Pizza Hacker, Gumbo Cart, Lumpia Cart, Bi-Rite Creamery, El Farolito, Bacon Dog Cart, Pho Garden, Zante's Indian Pizza

This review is about Zante's Indian Pizza.  It was somewhat interesting how we got to eating at this restaurant.  When we were talking with all the food cart guys and swapping good eats, one guy mentioned that a place called Zante's was incredible for Indian pizza.  Of course this piqued my interest as I love Indian food AND pizza so I made a mental note of it.  Then towards the end of our weekend of cheap eats, we were going to finish off the night at a place called the Limon Rotisserie but apparently it was too far out of the way for a friend so she recommended a place called the Front Porch in case we didn't have enough grease.  When I called in to make a reservation for 8pm, they weren't able to accommodate us right away so I hunkered down for the wait.  That's when a completely different friend mentioned that there was a supposedly great Indian pizza restaurant nearby called Zante's!  Apparently this place always had a wait but we figured we might as well wait for it and if our rezos at Front Porch came along first, we could just walk over.  Well, lucky us the manager was willing to seat us right away!  

We ordered an extra large Indian pizza, some curry that was supposed to be just like chicken tikka masala, chicken tandoori, samosas, naan, chicken and vegetable Pakora.  The Pakoras were a hit!  The samosas and chicken tandoori were only okay unfortunately because I LOVE samosas but by far the most disappointing item was the chicken tikka-like curry.  It was pretty darn bad is all I can say.  That teaches us to order curry when the restaurant is famous for its pizza.  Now for the pizza.  The first words to fly out of my mouth were that is was interestingly GREAT!  I don't even know what was all in the pizza because there were so many toppings but it was great and all the ingredients all worked well together.  I remembered the shopped shrimp being a delightful surprise.  Well worth all the other obstacles (bad curry) to get there.  One thing to note was that I did not feel too great when I got home.  One of the girls I spoke with later told me that when she went to the bathroom during dinner she saw mouse droppings all over the staircase!  I personally didn't see it but that would explain my queasiness.  That being said, what I didn't see didn't really hurt me so I would still go back to try out the pizza again and see if it is still as good as I remembered!
author: Susan L.

description: Run, do not walk, away from this place. The pizza is terrible: soft, doughy crust and miserable sauce. The Indian food is worse, if that's possible. And the service is unbelievably bad.
author: Cameron C.

description: I've only had the Indian pizza - the veggie and the meat.  Both are delicious.  I highly recommend them.  What a great idea!
author: Joey C.

description: slather chicken tikka masala all over garlic naan, add deliciously seasoned & slow roasted vege Moussakaa (eggplant, chickpeas, onions, tomatoes, chard, and a cauliflower garlic melange), PRESTO,  "PIZZA" PERFECTION!  always been easy to order & accurate, quick delivery.  I dunno after 9 years what else they serve, i've never had a reason to stray.  Last time I ate @ Tasty Bite on the other Cortland corner, all i could do was compare & stare sadly across the street @ the Zante's awning.  If I was a kid in the city, I'd stay home "sick" just to get this order all to myself!
author: Heiress K.

description: My first taste of Indian pizza was elsewhere in the city a few years back and I didn't see what the big deal was.  I mean, why would I possibly want Indian food ON pizza?  are these not two separate cravings?  thanks to Zante, I now have an additional craving.  It really is surprisingly good.
author: Nat K.

description:
Indian veggy pizza, brilliant!!  Their small pizza is plenty for two people maybe even three.  the sauce is a spinach curry w/ really finely diced veggies and the green onions and garlic really give it an extra kick.  T  

the indian food here is also pretty tasty, but it tends to be very oily sometimes and they use some inferior ingredients like canned peas, ugh! 

Everyone should try the indian pizza!
author: Carla K.

description: Mmmmmmmnnn, love my Indian pizza!  Can't believe no one thought of combining my two favorite cuisines sooner, also can't believe it hasn't caught on more.  I mean, it's such a good idea!  The only thing is, it's pretty expensive and they take their sweet time.  Still worth it though!
author: Jen S.

description: I want to give them another star but my a$$ won't let me. I love Indian food. I love pizza. I love Indian pizza... my butt does not. This is one of those places that while yer scarfing down the food you swear allegiance and tell everyone with you that you could eat this everyday of yer life. Fast forward to the next morning and you got POMA (piss out my a$$) and yer cursing yerself as you clutch the seat for being such a bold faced LIAR. Zantes is great when your eating it but it seems to me they have an extended release lower g.i. bomb in their pizza. That doesn't mean you shouldn't eat it, it just means you're giving your stomach the equivalent of TJ street hot dogs with all the unpleasant after effects. I suggest getting nice and drunk while or before you eat there so you can blame the next morning on the alcohol and not the pizza.
author: santiago g.

description: Indian food on pizza!?  Whoa, this stuff is addictive.  Get it delivered, though.  The atmosphere in the restaurant is a little dingy and depressing, I thought.  But get it to go or delivered and you'll become an addict too.
author: Ryan L.

description: Blech!  Service was almost non-existant.  The chana masala was bland.  And I've gotten larger servings for less money at other Indian restaurants.  Its only saving grace was that the vegan pizza was alright; still, not worth travelling across town for.
author: Marsha Z.

description: I just love this place.  Just thinking about it makes me crave it.  The whingers about long waits for delivery need to realize its 1) Free, and 2) CITYWIDE -- such delivery means just that - some little dude in his windbreaker is driving his 1987 Gremlin literally from the Mission to Seacliff to Coit Tower and back over and over with pizzas - the fact that it turns up hot even after two hours is sort of amazing to me (not clear how that is possible but it is generally true).  Got to love that they are willing to do it and we all just need to plan ahead ;-)  I do think the Tandori chicken is the grooviest of the toppings.  The pizzas are big and thin-crusted.  Don't knock it until you've tried - you'll definitely go back.
author: Kirsten M.

description: If Dahli and Fellini had gotten together and opened a pizza joint, the result would be something like a Zante pizza delivery experience.  Surreal colors, ingredients, and service all challenge your fundamental assumptions of pizza reality in strange and unexpected ways.  Not for the timid.
author: Hugh B.

description:
well let's see... i ordered the pizza online for delivery at 7:10pm.  very excited about my first taste of zante's pizza.  being aware that as a normal practice the restaurant would call my cellular device to confirm the order, i  proceeded to make my phone easily accessible.  within seconds realizing that my phone had been misplaced and not in my home.  next step was to use my roommate's phone to call zante's to be proactive and make the first move since they couldn't call me either way.  i was told, "we don't call or confirm. don't need your number."  great! now the wait begins.

1 1/2 hours later (i am a fairly patient person and i was mentally occupied during the wait time), i contacted zante's again.  i was told there was no order for my address or number or name or pizza.  i explained my ealier phone call that informed me that they didn't confirm orders. if i would have been given  the correct information and was allowed to confirm my order, i would be eating a pizza at that point.  the gentleman on the phone explained that they always confirm online orders and , "I don't know why someone would tell you that."  "sorry."  i accepted defeat and ate some sunflower seeds and drank a sammy smith nut brown ale.   

i was a bit perturbed that he didn't offer to fill my order.  i still wanted the pizza, but was hesitant to wait another hour for it.  since he  was apathetic, i moved on and decided that i would write my first review on yelp.  lastly, i am coming to terms with the fact that i live in bernal heights and haven't had zante's in the 2 years that i've been here.  now i know i won't have it for the next 2 years.  i tend to hold grudges and yes i know i'm the only one suffering.  i don't care- i like it.
author: Julie B.

description:
dear zante driver,

while i do appreciate that you showed up an hour and 15 minutes after i ordered (i am not being sarcastic, as this is actually a decent time for zante), please do not hit on me while i am paying for my pizza.  don't call me "baby."  don't tell me i'm beautiful when i sure as hell haven't showered or brushed my teeth and i am in my sweats.  don't ask  me what what country i'm from (AMERICA, BITCH).  rather than charming, i find this creepy and offensive, and i tend to tip less when i am creeped out/offended.
author: Katherine K.

description: Order the "Best Indian Pizza".  If you like indian food and you like naan, you won't be disappointed.  Make sure you tell the server what you *don't* want on it.  By default, it comes with everything.  But they're happy to make it vegan, vegetarian, whatever you like.  Great for groups.  Friendly servers.  Hard to find parking, but not as bad as the mission.  It will be worth it!
author: Annie R.

description: Pizza that takes 3 hours to come is not worth my time. My stomach started eating itself. I called twice while waiting to find out how long, and they said each time: "Ten minutes" ...And they gave me attitude when I finally called to cancel after the three hour mark had passed.
author: Jessica K.

description: Food is okay. Delivery was slow. Customer service was average.
author: Mr. Honest Y.

description: It's all about the veggie pizza with the mango chutney sauce people!! Who cares what your breath smells like afterwards, some things are worth it and this is one of them. It's so good that once you've had your fill you have to have just one more slice. Then, you sneakily unbutton your pant button and have another slice on top of that......it's that good.
author: Sandy P.

description: Zante's is such a cool combo, pizza and Indian together. It is the favorite of many of my vegetarian friends, but also has some good pizzas including meat. Don't ever (maybe I just had a horrible experience) order delivery. It took two and a half hours to get our pizza and we could have walked there in 20 minutes, but they kept saying that they were on their way every time we called. :(
author: Cyrelle D.

description: Good indian, good pizza, good indian pizza. Win, win, win.
author: patrick g.

description: Slow service but anywhere where my 10-year-old likes the Chicken Tika Masala, ya gotta love it.  We usually order extra to take home.  Again, SLOOOOOOOOOOOW service to be prepared for an evening of hangin' out.
author: Bruce R.

description: Pretty good pizza but it wasn't the orgasm on nan that I expected after I reading the other reviews.  I ordered a vegetarian pizza add lamb and a side of raita for dipping.  The dough is great, no doubt, and the curry sauce is really good too.  Something felt off about the cheese though and there were barely any veggies or lamb except for lots of green onions.  I liked being able to order online though and they delivered in around 30 min.  I think its hit and miss with this place but its always good to try new flavor combinations.
author: Stacy R.

description: This is the BEST indian restaurant in the city. Frankly, I tried most of them. My favorite order there: Veggie Samosa, Chicken Makanwala, Prawn Vindaloo and Bhinde Masala, plus a glass of Mango Lassi. - Oh my lord, I have to go there tonight!
author: Yina M.

description: This is one of my new favorite places to eat.  I love pizza, and I love indian food.  Combine the two and what do you get?  Delicious indian pizza, that's what.  When I walked into the restaurant and smelled the indian pizza cooking I knew I wasn't going to be disappointed.  The pizza we got had chicken tandoori and prawns on it, but I'll probably get it vegetarian style next time and it'll be just as yummy.  It took awhile for us to get our food, but at least the waiters were nice and the food is reasonably priced.  If only I lived in San Francisco, then I could eat here all the time!  It makes me sad knowing that this restaurant does not exist in Los Angeles.
author: Maria F.

description:
people, i'm here to tell you about the soup.  not the daal.  the mulligawaty soup.   anyone know how to spell that?  help a girl out here.  

giant chunks of ginger, ever spoonful is heaping with tandoori chicken.  $3 and the bowl is almost as big as my head.  not for the weak of heart or wary of spice, but after eating the whole bowl i had to double think the pizza.  

i'm taking off a star because while i love love love zantes its always so damn cold in there.  why?  its freezing out right now and pouring and the only reason i got the soup was because i couldn't feel my fingers and you weren't helping me out any.   and i've waited as long as 2 hours for delivery.  and thats just rude.
author: Nora B.

description: First of all, Zante delivers. Second of all, it IS the BEST INDIAN pizza in the whole wide world. When I first moved to San Francisco a couple of years ago, I ended up conspiring with a housemate to order in at least once a week. Yes, we ate indian pizza for dinner - no we INHALED indian pizza for dinner. And in the morning, when I woke up, I would walk to the fridge and eat cold indian pizza for breakfast. Yes, that is how good the tandoori chicken, lamb, cauliflower and other secret spices are. Oh, and it's a breeze to order online so I'd go that route instead of phoning it in. And if you happen to be in the vicinity and do not feel like eating, get yourself a mango lassi - perfect refreshment for a hectic day.
author: ray e.

description:
this place is delicious. if you've never had indian pizza then you SERIOUSLY need to try this. 
i used to be a total pizza-terian. its all i ate. ever. so i was excited/hesitant to try a pizza with indian food on it but man oh man im glad i did. 
the owner is really nice and if this place wasnt so far away from my house i would go there on a regular basis.
author: EM F.

description: Lamb, Beef, and shrimp sitting on top of a thick, gooey curry paste?  What kind of "Indian" pizza is that?  Gag me with a frickin' spoon.  After my negative encounter with the pizza that this establishment is touted for, I didn't even touch the Chicken Tikka that our party ordered.  If you want good Indian pizza, go to Mirchi's in Fremont.  If you want better Indian food, go to just about any other Indian restaurant.
author: Momo R.

description: If I didn't have a little bitch for a stomach, I'd eat their Indian pizza at least once a week.  Whoda thunk?  Truly savory, but hurty on tummy.  Be there!
author: Skeptical Spee ..

description: As a connoisseur of pizza, believe me, I was skeptical.  But that pizza won me over with its damn tastiness and ingenuity.  Whoever thought of putting Indian spices on a pizza should be knighted, sainted, all that shit.  Oh, and yeah, the other food here is really really good and I've never had any problems with the online ordering system.  Actually I quite like it.
author: Rhea S.

description: This place is fantastic! I consider myself quite the pizza lover (I have no problem with having it any and everyday of the week) and let me tell you, this is a great way to mix it up. I was apprehensive for a second, but after diving in I assure you, it was like a whole new cuisine to explore. Truly great food, never waited inside for longer than 3 minutes, reasonably priced, fresh ingredients, delivery has never been longer than an hour (typical, but I do live across the city, so points for that.). Please try it! You won't be sorry.
author: Karen D.
