description: Pizza is pretty lame everywhere in San Francisco, but I am a fan of Zante's, especially the Indian Pizza. The regular pizzas are also good. Definitely the best place to order pizza from in Bernal Heights.
author: teddy w.

description:
As for the "regular" pizzas, they are great. In fact, they are the best I've had in the Bay Area so far! 

Everything else on the menu, however, should be skipped. The Indian pizzas are topped with fatty pieces of sugar-coated chicken and watery vegetables. The naan is hard and the lassis are syrupy. 

So, Five stars for the regular pizzas and one star for the Indian pizzas and food= 3 stars
author: V R.

description:
after reading the toppings (tandoori chicken, shrimp, mozarrella, cilantro, to name just a few) for the indian pizza, i was a tad wary, but it was surprisingly a tasty combination!  

it's not the cheapest pizza around, but the pies are of decent size (8 good-sixed slices for about $18)

service isn't the best, but it's worth a trip to bernal heights, i say!
author: Jill k.

description:
the indian pizza is amazing and unique and worth going all the way to 30th and mission for. it's also fun to take visitors there. they will thank you for introducing them to this ingenious culinary mash-up.

even for non-vegetarians/vegans, i highly recommend the vegan pizza. i've had it with cheese and meat too and it's great, but unnecessary in my opinion. 

i also really like their bengan bharta and chole and naan. the bigger the group you go with, the more you can order! and it means you can have some pizza and other stuff and not be wayyyy too full of pizza crust and naan.
author: Molly T.

description: The indian pizza was pretty good.  The sauce had a little too much spinach for me.  The tandoori chicken was hilarously pink.  I'm not sure where the lamb and prawns went.  But HEY, it's Indian fricking pizza!  The crust was delicious.
author: Shyam P.

description: Just get the indian pizza. That's the only good thing on the menu, and it's pretty good. I just wish the meat was bigger hunks. Other than that, it's pretty yummers. Spicy, too!
author: Jessica O.

description: The veggie Indian pizza was great but it showed up almost two HOURS after we ordered it and that is just unacceptable. The other vegetarian Indian dishes we ordered were good but overpriced.  Overall I think the service is terrible and the food is so-so; if it weren't for their signature Indian pizza I would never go back but alas, it is delish so we will probably give them one more try.
author: Lauren K.

description: I've ordered from here tons of times, and still havn't tried the pizza.  Hmm.  The chicken korma, aloo gobi, and garlic naan are pretty scrumtious though.  And they will deliver anywhere in the city.
author: Melissa G.

description: The concept of Indian pizza has always seemed a bit of a joke to me - usually consisting of a regular pizza with some chicken or paneer tikka thrown in. But Zante's actually makes this into something delicious, and now that I'm far away, something I crave. They take the concept all the way - with a naan crust, palak sauce substituting the regular marinara, and a combination of fantastic Indian toppings - ranging from roasted eggplant or cauliflower, cilantro, ginger, or chicken, shrimp and the rest. Just one bite, and you're a convert. Now if only they could straighten out the dine-in experience a little. As of now, this is strictly a take out joint, with poor service and turnaround times to boot. But the pizza makes you forget most of your complaints.
author: Purnima M.

description:
their indian pizza with meat is the bomb. 

nicely warming on the palate.  wonderful curry flavor.
and cheese! 

their regular pizza's pretty good too.  i've been ordering takeout from this place every since i could remember growing up out here.
author: Kimby T.

description: Zante is one of the city's hidden pizza gems.  It offers pizza with an Indian twist, among other staple Indian dishes.  Make sure to take a test drive of the special pizza, as it is unique to most pizza parlors.  Pizza toppings include a mix of eggplant, cauliflour, and even paneer (cheese), if requested, among other toppings.  Pizza dough is of naan-like consistency, which adds to its unique flavor.  Ambience is very laid back, and service is great and accommodating to one's needs.  The bathroom could be cleaner, but overall, a great place to unwind after work with some pizza and chai.
author: Megha S.

description: Ordered from here last night. Delivery to the Haight was slow (they said an hour and it took an hour and a half) but that's my only complaint.  The tandoori chicken pizza was AMAZING and even had a nice crust.  It cost about $25 for a large pizza, which fed 4 hungry people.  I will definitely be hitting up this place again and again and again ...
author: Cassandra W.

description: Amazing Indian Pizza!  They seem to have improved their delivery service.  They were quick the last time I ordered delivery and their service seems to have improved overall.  This is great news because I absolutely love their pizza.   Keep it up, Zante's!
author: Roy J.

description: yummy delicous and flavorful pizza! the dough is soft and id even eat the crust! i usually get delivery and one time they said they dont deliver, other times they would say after a certain time. Its pretty random on when they deliever but i love there pizza!
author: M A.

description: I've eaten from Zantes three or four times.  It's inexpensive, it's a fabulous idea, it's great food, and, I just found out recently, they DELIVER.  I love indian food and I like pizza, so I think this is wonderful.  And, in response to another reviewers complaint about the delivery time:  pizza takes a while to make anyway, plus, they deliver anywhere in the city, and coming from the mission, that could take a while with traffic, etc.  We ordered from them for delivery once and they said 1 hour and it got here within 50 minutes.  Just like normal busy pizza joints during the evening hours.  Anyway, good place.  Check it out.
author: Christine G.

description: Your baby daughter wants indian food, and your old italian butler Luigi wants pizza. What to do? Only go to a FULL SERVICE ITALIAN RESTURANT that is also a FULL SERVICE INDIAN RESTAURANT that is also a FULL SERVICE INDIAN/ITALIAN RESTAURANT. The indian pizza is an insane proposition - lamb, tandoori chicken and prawns all blended well and dumped on top. And don't make me mention the cauliflower. This is a SF superstar, plain and simple.
author: Devin S.

description: I must've walked past this place 100 times before I tried. "Pizza and Indian Food" may sound like a strange combination, but the Indian pizza is delicious. We almost always order our pizza from Zante now.
author: James C.

description: I enjoy coming back here time and time again for their Indian pizza. Their other dishes are nice. The service is OK, I usually have problems calling to make an order. The online system is best. They accomidate a large group easily, and the price is right. I think the best thing on the menue is the meat Indian pizza. Meat eaters will definitely go ga-ga for this.
author: Benjamin T.

description: I have yet to go wrong the vegetarian pizza. I didn't even feel the urge to pull the cauliflower off. Last night a friend and I ordered in.  Their veggie samosas are probably my favorite around town. I was really impressed by the Prawn Sagwala. The prawns were tender not chewy and the spinach sauce was spot on.  The Chicken Tikka Masala  was memorable as well. The entree portions were a bit small for the prices but over all another good experience at Zantes.
author: Mingus R.

description:
just for being creative having an indian essence on a pie, they deserve a distinctive three and 1/2 stars!

so, yesterday we decided to have an early dinner and off we go at bernal heights at 5:30pm. the place was empty and we were the only ones sitting in their unfortunately outdated dining area.

for starter we had the CHICKEN PAKORA, which is basically a spicy curried chunks/cubes of chicken, breaded and deep fried and it came with two kinds of dipping sauce. (one green, one red...i wasn't able to care what the name of the sauces were!) it was fairly done, for the chicken was kind of on a tough side, though the taste was amazingly delectable!

the wait for the well-known indian pizza was bordering to forever! i really don't know what it took them so long to make a small pie, albeit we were the only customers in the room!!!

after an extensive waiting, came the most glorious, exotic pizza in the bay area. the toppings were consist of: SPINACH, CHICKEN TANDOORI, GARLIC, GREEN ONIONS, MOZARELLA CHEESE, & their SPECIAL INDIAN SAUCE!! sans the lamb, caulifower and prawns. it was bursting with "just right" spices and the thin crust pie was done golden brown, piping hot and crispy! i don't know if it is bad or good, but the tandoori chicken was very, very, very red, looking like dried cranberries (making the pie attractive) and the texture was ground.

overall, it was average and they sure are a bunch of innovational, artistic crew!
author: Nelle A.

description: Just got 20 pizzas & 2 party salads delivered for office anniversary party. Thanks Zantes, everyone loved it.
author: Matt T.

description: 5 stars just because where else can you get Indian pizza? And it's bomb azz Indian pizza too... More than just a gimmick, they really do it up right, with ground lamb and pieces of shrimp, shredded tandoori chicken, eggplant and pieces of cauliflower... I'm getting hungry just thinking about it... I keep going back to this place and it's consistently good. The regular Indian food is pretty legit too. Maybe a little over-priced but I haven't had anything bad here... The atmosphere is kinda funky but the food is always fresh and tasty.
author: Brian H.

description: Ok Ok so admittedly I'm a bit biased because my introduction to Indian food was Naan N' Curry and Star of India. And according to my Indian friends those places don't count as indian food, but I love them so there. But as for me Zante's is no comparison.  The food was alright, the pizza was pretty good with some veggie curry on top but other than that I was rather unimpressed.  Service came from a nice man but he charged for food we didn't order and paying the bill was a big old hassle. So I say if your in the neighborhood sure go check it out, but don't go out of your way to try this place it ain't that great and i've tasted much better Chicken Tikka Masala, even at the indian slash chinese slash burger joint down the street from me.
author: Marie B.

description: Their pizza is the only way to go...stay away from everything else.  I love Indian food, but that was probably the least favorite meal I've been served.  Their customer service is reasonable because they tried to remedy the situation, but over cooked chicken and mealy lamb were beyond inedible.  I give one star for the good experience with their pizza.
author: Art W.

description: Everyone recommended this place, so I finally went there. The 'Indian' pizza was tasty. It pretty much tasted like curry and vegetables that were somehow fashioned into a pizza form with added cheese...I guess that is what Indian pizza would be though...Either way, it tasted good. I would go there again. I haven't tried the other dishes though.
author: Prasant R.

description: Solely based on 3 trips here to get carry out vegetarian pizza, but I enjoyed the food for being different and tasty.  Sure a little oily... but it's pizza.  No surprise.  The service to walk in was fine and not slow any of the times that I've been.  You should try it once if you're in the neighborhood and have a little delicious something different.
author: Surf R.

description: OH MAN. The Vegan Pizza at Zante's is AMAZING. It's just the tastiest thing I had all week. And no, I'm not vegan; this stuff is just great. Perfect blend of garlic and spices and veggies. It took almost exactly 45 minutes to deliver, as they said it would, and every minute was worth it.
author: Ashley M.

description: I was really looking forward to trying this indian pizza everyone was raving about, but when we got it delivered for dinner at one of our work meetings, it was terrible. Really bland, in that singular bland spiciness type of way. I don't know which tasted worse-the tandoori chicken or vegetarian pizza. Everyone had the meeting was disappointed because it usually tastes better I heard. I'll give it the benefit of the doubt and give it two stars and try it again.
author: Jenny W.

description: Shame on you Zante's for telling me my delivery would take 20 minutes ... each of the 3 times I called to find out where it was.  2 hours later and ready to go to sleep, my pizza finally arrived.  Let's just say my guest and myself had already watched our movie, ate our candy and were pretty 'not hungry' by the time dinner showed up.  The food was okay, and I would have given you 3 stars, but the uber late delivery sinks that one all together.  I won't be getting food here again unless I pick it up (not likely).
author: erin c.

description: NOT worth the 2 hour wait for delivery.  I was told 45 minutes and it took over 2 hours.  Food was marginal and extremely oily.  Also, way too expensive.  We didn't get the pizza so maybe that's better.  I will never order from them again.
author: Shalini H.

description: Stick with the pizza and appetizer/finger foods; those are tasty.  The regular Indian food is pretty bad.  They're very skimpy with the meat in the curry/sauce dishes; I've ordered curry chicken or chicken mackenwalla, and it's nothing but sauce, with a few pieces of meat in it.  Very cheap!  You definitely get what you pay for here.
author: Ramon C.

description: Wow.  I never realized that two of my favorite foods could come together in such a unique and delicious marriage of deliciousness.  Indian pizza???  With chutney to dip the crust in??  Incredible.  Now that I've had it, I don't know how I lived without it.  Side note:  I'm not usually a huge eggplant person, but I couldn't even tell that it was on the pizza because things were chopped tiny enough and the flavors mixed together so well.  So I'd recommend leaving it on there - for nutritional value that you can't tell is there (and that is probably countered by the cheese ... but hey, you're eating pizza here, not a salad).
author: Kristen H.

description:
Tasty crust is a damn good must. I love you. And only you can make me wait a whole f-ing hour and still feel obliged by your presence. 

Also, online ordering is bank.
author: ascheras g.

description: my wife and I love this place, but we went there the other night and we had to battle gnats all thru dinner...then I noticed like 6 dead gnats smashed on the wall next to our table. Then I went to the bathroom and nearly gagged at the stankity of it all, and I'm not a bathroom-o-phobe by any means! plus it's really really hard to get more green sauce which is key and must be drizzled on the naan and the pizza. But when that Zante's jones hits you, nothing else will do.
author: slapaham s.

description: I was somewhat underwhelmed with this place. I had heard about the legendary "Best Indian Pizza" and it wasn't bad by any means. But the crust was kind of doughy and the "special sauce" a little blander than I had hoped... I did appreciate being able to order online.
author: Jennifer W.

description: We ordered one of their specialty pizzas based on the rave review of many friends. Whateva. The pizza was slimy and of the same caliber as mr. pizzaman, the only thing that said it apart was the brown curry slathered all over this thing. As though they're sitting on a gem they had the audacity to charge over forty bucks for this diaper pizza. Generally speaking I dig SF's fusion flare. French/Vietnamese, German/California and of course Chinese/donut but somethings should never be fused garlic and ice cream for example and never curried pizza.
author: Emma G.

description:
How could you go wrong with a pillowy pizza dough, curry, and cheese? I dream of this every night...I might move to SF just so I can get it delivered to my house once a week!...maybe more! Yeah I should weigh 300 lbs

P.S. Get enough so you can have leftovers. Cold indian pizza is the greatest thing for drunk munchies late at night!!
author: Betty W.

description: I like the Indian pizza, but the standard Indian fare is nothing special.  You get only about two pieces of chicken in the chicken tikka masala - pretty chintzy.
author: Linda G.

description: failure pile in a sadness bowl. ordered via grub hub - how these guys have more than one star i dont know. avoid unless u want cold nasty garbage food and chicken that tastes of eggs.
author: Robert P.

description:
This is the WORST place ever ! I just created an account just or them !!
I called to place an order for 2 pizzas. I waited for 1h45 (although at every phonecall, they told me it was coming) and they still wanted me to pay full price !
Another world, i'm telling you.
Plus the delivery guy was a very rude angry man...incredible !

DO NOT GO THERE !
author: Lewis G.

description: Yum, yum, yum!  We got the Indian Meat pizza delivered and I must say...I am hooked.  What an interesting concept-Indian Pizza!  My only minor complaint was that it seemed a bit greasy and the pizza had a little more of a kick than I would have liked...but I survived!  We will definitely order Zante's again!
author: Lisa M.

description: Cheap pitchers of beer and spicy indian food.  Need I say more?
author: Cali Party Bus S.

description: This place leaves me so conflicted! First of all, I've only had the pizza which CAN be fabulous. Secondly, I've never actually been inside- I've only had my pizza delivered. Here's the deal: If you actually want what you ordered, don't order from here. For some strange reason, they always seem to screw up the order. But, like I said, the Indian Pizza CAN be really good. I guess what it comes down to is, if you're in the mood for some Indian Pizza(I mean really, who wouldn't be), have patience and don't have any expectations of perfection. Oh, and if they fail to deliver something you ordered and paid for, don't expect them to come back anytime soon.
author: Robert L.

description: We ate inside (no delivery to worry about). The indian Pizza was good, the cheese pizza was awesome. Place is a little tired looking but the food was good and the service was great.
author: Tiffany S.

description: We witnessed a HUGE RAT living in the restaurant behind the painting in the SW corner of the dining room.  Luckily we were finishing our pizza which tasted great but made my stomach feel horrible.  I don't know if I can go back know that a New York size rat is living in the dining room, pretty gross.
author: Tbone J.

description: i love their lamb samosas and dipping condiments!!!
author: Puteri H.

description:
This was the WORST customer service I have EVER had.
We ordered a pizza and were told it would be an hour in the delivery, OK we can do that.
One hour and ten minutes later - "Hi I was calling to make sure everything's Ok with my pizza?... (Give address) Oh, it's on it's way? OK"
One hour and twenty minutes later - " Hi, this is (insert address) and we ordered our pizza over and hour and 15 minutes ago and we live THREE blocks away and it still isn't here..... You're sure it's on it's way this time because we were told that 10 minutes ago.... Yeah, OK"
One hour and thirty minutes later - "Can we talk to a manager please? (repeat story and address) He's leaving right now you say? We really feel this should be comped for the extreme wait, great thanks."
One hour and forty five minutes later - Pizza FINALLY shows and  IS NOT COMPED, but we are offered a FIVE dollar discount for having to wait almost two hours for a pizza from THREE blocks away. We refused the discount and asked for what we were promised and the driver slammed the door and took the pizza back.

We will NEVER order from here again the service is HORRID.
author: nikki r.

description: Ok so these dudes have been total dicks to me over the phone but WHO  CARES. Pizza!!! I love pizza, Indian food, I love Indian food!!! put em together ho ho ho holy CRAP is it good. Slice or 2 on your way to anything is the best but sitting down is alright too. Be warned though the regular pizza sucks ass. The regular Indian food is pretty good, but the Indian pizza, its like god pooped heaven all over your toilet and then gave you a swirly.  That is some people think it sounds gross, but then you have it and who the hell cares its AWESOME!
author: Gabe L.

description: so yummy! my favorite san francisco treat. it taste perfect.
author: Jankie And Pete S.

description: I never had Indian pizza before and I'm a HUGE pizza fan. Zante's take on pizza is creative and interesting. I enjoyed it a lot. Btw, the corkage fee is like $5.
author: Marko G.

description: The thing you learn from Yelp is that every restaurant is great, horrible and everything in between. For 5 years I lived a block away from Zante's. I rarely ordered pizza and always had good Indian food. I never had anything here I didn't enjoy. Our standard order was Saag Paneer and Tandoori Chicken, but we sometimes had other things. It was certainly a bargain.
author: Scott R. D.

description: The Vegetarian Indian Pizza is off the hook... Worth the money.  Free delivery too. It sounds bizarre I know but if you love indian food and you love pizza you just can't go wrong with this place.
author: Maryanne R.

description: I'd never had Indian pizza before going to Zante's. Delicious! Walking in, I was kinda confused because I'm used to pizza restaurants not having nice tableclothed tables. Kinda classy looking for a pizza place.
author: Jessica B.

description: HOLY %$#^!!! Most AMAZING pizza ever. We had the vegan pizza-- cilantro, green onion, curried cauliflower, eggplant, spinach. Amy Z. is right-- it tastes better when watching TV :) Delivery is free.
author: Kelly N Z R.

description:
when the man-friend gets a craving for food (and lately it's been jelly donuts - i just don't even ask), that's what we eat. whether or not i want it, whether or not i'm hungry, whether or not we've already eaten dinner once in an evening. 

the man-friend is fond of getting cravings for indian pizza. 

i'd never eaten there until a couple months ago, and you know what? it's really yummy. i'm not going to go out a limb and say this is an improvement on pizza (because um, really, pizza is just fine on its own, thank you very much), but it's a pretty tasty spin on it. and oh man when it's hot, so good. 

good enough that you'll leave a free birthday party show because it's waiting in the car. good enough that yes, please, you'll have another slice even though you did already eat dinner once tonight. good enough that you really wish you had brought some of it for lunch today, cos it's good the next day, too.
author: Irene S.

description: I know what you're thinking.  Indian pizza? Five stars? Is she crazy?  But trust me on this, Zante's indian pizza is simply scrumptious.  They start off with a regular old pizza crust, and then instead of tomato sauce, Zante uses a spicy masala- laden garlicky curry paste.  To that they add tandoori-esque toppings of your choice and (of  course) cheese.  It adds up to an uncommonly delightful nap-inducing treat.
author: shoba d.

description: I used to live up the street from this place. It's cheap, tasty, and it gives off that old school pizza parlor stench. I love it. What can I say? I blew my allowance on this place and I credit it to my childhood obesity. Thanks Zante Pizza.
author: Anne Julia B.

description:
I heard rave reviews from a friend about the Indian Pizza here.
I'd never had Indian Pizza before, in fact I'd never even heard of Indian Pizza.
When the pizza came out, we had vegetarian but not vegan pizza, it looked an awful lot like regular pizza with a few untraditional Indian toppings. I'm not sure why, but I was expecting something really crazy.
As far as the pizza went, though, I liked it very much. It was tasty and the Indian toppings fit very nicely. 

The service was decent, but not exceptional. Our waiter gave us twenty full minutes to look at the menu. Now, the menu is large and has a lot of interesting offerings but it certainly doesn't require twenty-minutes to look through. Beside that, our water was never refilled unless we asked for it. Each time I've been there it has been half-empty. Zante's has free city-wide delivery, so this may have something to do with it. 

I've eaten at Zante's since then and have ordered other things on the menu. I find that the Indian food is completely decent. It is not, as it touts itself, "The Best Indian Food and Pizza" in the city, but it is definitely worth checking out and the prices are very fine.
author: David V.

description: This is why I live in San Francisco. My few friends in the Midwest would recoil at the idea of Indian pizza.  I say it's genius- they've already mixed all the other types of ethnic food together and called it "California Cuisine." Why not this? An absolute must-try.
author: Ann F.

description: Who can complain about a HUGE $4.00 slice of Indian Pizza at 11pm when you get off the bus at Mission and Courtland to walk home after class?  I sure can't and it beats eating burritos all the time...
author: Joy C.

description: There were no Indian people eating at Zante Pizza.  Normally, I don't even go into "ethnic" restaurants that only serve crackers, and that method has been pretty accurate from what I hear.  But if you eat Indian food fusion, I guarantee you'll love the Indian pizza.  Just don't overdo it, or you'll be feeling hyderabad the next day.  The mango lassi was pretty thick and chunky -- and a radioactive orange color -- and the saag paneer was pretty standard, with a huge chunk of paneer in the middle.  Huge samosas too!
author: Josh E.

description: Ok, I don't know about their delivery because we've usually done take out and without any problems.  I just went to Zante on Saturday night for a sit down late dinner and we were served the freshest and most amazing "best Indian pizza."  Title's no lie, it was superb.  I loved the sweet and spicy chutney they serve with.  I swallowed three slices in less than 2 minutes, it was IN-CRED-IBLE!  I am sooo looking forward to going back.  Yum!
author: Swetha G.

description:
Mmm, indian vegetarian pizza slice!!  Very innovative, it hasn't been done before I don't think.  The dough was nice and fluffy, the curry flavors blended together very well - I loved the curry on top!  I was surprised at how well cheese went with the cumin, green onions, potatoes, etc...

The only thing is... $3.00 for a slice of pizza?  Really?  Is that how much it costs these days?  I think I'd rather duplicate their recipe from home.
author: Yvea E.

description: My boyfriend loves this place. I'm okay with it. It's an interesting concept. On nights of my choosing, though, we go down the street to Mi Lindo Peru. Service isn't stellar from what I remember.
author: Allison L.

description: Just had this for the first time yesterday.  I tried the vegetarian Indian pizza.  It was pretty good, but I prefer the Indian pizza from Golden Gate Pizza.  I would have possibly given them 4 stars, but the service was terrible.  I tried calling in my pizza for delivery.  They put me on "hold" for 5 minutes (I could hear them talking in the background, and I don't believe it was with a customer).  I hang up and decide to try and order online.  After I waited for over an hour I decided to give them a call.  "Hey, I was wondering if you guys got my order"..."Your address"..."I'm sorry"..."Your address, what is your address"..."Oh, its..."..."It's on it's way" *Click.  20 minutes later a cold pizza shows up.  Luckily, the pizza was pretty good.  Though, it would have been nice if they spread the toppings evenly.  Once slice didn't even have any cheese on it.
author: Paul W.

description: Good idea, Indian pizza... hahaha.  The pizza was okay but you can't have more then a few slices b/c the spice smell is overwhelming and will make you sick.  However, the *pakoras* are excellent!!!!!
author: F K.

description: Get The Best Indian Pizza. Do it. Get the hot sauce with it. Listen to the excellent Indian music. Drink some Kingfisher beer too. Do it.
author: Melinda K.

description: Pizza was good. Had the Best Indian Pizza. A nice flavour. Tasted like Indian food less the sauces. We also had a regular pizza with pepperoni, mushroom, garlic and olives. Nice garlic flavour. My problem with thisis that the toppings stopped too far from the crust. We also got some Indian food.This is where the food takes a turn. The chicken tikka masala, not that good. The naan not that good that good as well. A little dry. Not flaky. Oh well, not going to make the trip back here.
author: Andrew Y.

description: This is not Indian Oven, and it's more expensive than you're Pakwan&Naan'nCurry style places BUT it does have the Indian Pizza which is a uniquely SF-thing which, if you're sentimental like me, and you want to kick back and wax about dot.com, Indian Pizza is the perfect gnosh.  Don't expect too much of the meat version-- they sprinkle bits of tandoori about the same size of cilantro leaves-- but it is good, greasy pizza.  The regular Indian fair is average; lots of lamb specialties, the lamb tastes fresher than "fast food" curry places and there's tons more variety-- any of the specialties you can think of, they have at Zante's but expect to pay a higher price-point.  Buen Provecho!  Buon Apetito!  One of the only Indians in the Mission that delivers.
author: E L.

description: I love their pizza here.  I was lucky enough to first try the pizza when my coworker had some left over and was generous enough to let me have it.  Was i glad that she insisted!  The pizza here is delicious!  I have eaten the indian food here before too which was okay, but you can't pass up the pizza.
author: Ree-och G.

description: i had to find out if what every other reviewer said was true, and it was: no one called to confirm my online order, delivery took an hour and 15 minutes, and the toppings were totally unevenly distributed (there was only spinach on one slice, and i don't know where the eggplant was).  the toppings were all pureed or something; you could probably eat it without any teeth.  and they didn't give me a straw for my lassi.  BUT the pizza was huge (i got a small), and it was cheap (~20$ for a pizza + lassi + tip).  and it was pretty good.  not what i expected--or hoped--it would taste like, but i'm glad i tried it out.  though i probably wouldn't get it again.
author: Janice C.

description: I say skip the pizza--it's def. not the standout item, contrary to popular belief. DO try the chicken tikka masala, and the veggie pakora. Oh, and the word on the street is that you can order paneer tikka masala, too, even though it doesn't appear on the menu. If you go the paneer route, though, be very explicit about wanting to sub paneer for chicken, because I've encountered some pretty heavy language barriers with the Zantes folks before, as nice as they are. My overall theory is that Indian pizza places have great regular Indian food, too, since I also happen to love Raja in the lower haight. But Zante can definitely throw together some SERIOUS tikka masala sauce every now and then, so just a little something to consider as a "side" to your pizza...
author: Shannon R.

description: Im hungry!  Being so close to my work, I should be going here more often.  I dont recall what I had last time I went, but it was pretty good.
author: andrew l.

description: Ordered a pizza at 10:30AM knowing full well they don't open until 11.  I figured that way the pizza would go in the oven ASAP and get out the door quickly.  I called at about 11:10 to confirm my order and was told it takes 40 minutes to get the pizza- so 30 more.  I called back at 12:00 and asked where my pizza was.  I was told it would be 2-3 minutes.  At 12:25 the pizza finally showed up, luke-warm.  And frankly, it isn't that great.  I won't be making the mistake of ordering from here again.
author: Jesse E.

description: You can't go wrong for cheap eats that satisfy your craving for pizza and indian than by going to Zante's and ordering a slice of Indian pizza and samosas to go!  You might be doubtful that indian pizza isn't something that wasn't created by the same people who brought you the platipus, but it's damn delicious!
author: M. Ryan M.

description: The Indian pizza was delicious.  I don't know about the ambiance.  One funny thing I noticed: the tables are laid out in a grid and there are letters and numbers on the walls to indicate the row and column.  We sat in B3.
author: Dave M.

description: Eh, I'm not as impressed as my friends are with this place.  I dunno.  Maybe its the fact that the onion smell permeating from the kitchen was so strong on one of my visits that it actually made my eyes water.  On the other hand, they seem to have created a niche for themselves, which I respect.  Indian pizza.
author: Igor N.

description: Good vegetable dishes! I love their ocra dish with rice! Yummy! Definitely try their pizza because it's great! Try it you might like it!
author: Mel P.

description: Awesome, definitely will order delivery here again.  we ordered (by phone) veggie pakoras, sag lamb, okra, half order of tandoori chicken, onion and garlic naan.  the tandoori chicken was tasty and a good value for how much you get.  the onion naan was my favorite, as was the mint chutney.   food arrived in 45 mins, as promised.  yay.
author: Erick A.

description: Dining at Zante's was a treat to my taste buds--and my wallet. Ate there was 4 other folks; we order starters: samosas and chicken pakora (these  were the only disappointing thing we had--very plain); then we ordered a large veggie pizza and a couple large Taj Majals. It was awesome and the bill was $50 for 5 hungry souls. Not bad. Wait...I am off to eat the leftovers...
author: Deborah S.

description: As soon as I heard the words "indian pizza," I knew that I immediately had to check it out. Now, my parents used to own a pizza place, so I can confidently say that I know a thing or two about good pizza. Having had the pizza at the restaurant, fresh out of the oven, and not take out or delivery, I can say that their crust is perfect (snappy with a little bit of give) and the flavor combination is awesome.  Also, their indian dishes, though not stellar, are pretty tasty. I guess the only thing that turned me off were the digs -- it was stuffy and hot the day I went, not good when you're eating food equally steamy and hot.
author: Tuyet N.

description: Very rarely do I dream of food - but somehow I find myself dreaming of Zante's tandoori chicken pizza with alarming regularity.  And since some of those dreams shouldn't be repeated in mixed company, I'll spare you the dirty details.
author: Jason C.

description: Probably the most authentic Indian pizza I've had in the Bay Area. Intense flavors of korma, aloo gobi left a wonderful taste in my mouth ( although smelly). The only adjustment I would make is have a regular pizza crust  and not naan ( just because I'm not a naan girl)
author: Amruta G.

description: After some thought, I've decided that an Indian pizza from this place is my favorite food item in San Francisco.
author: Amy Z.

description: Yes pretty good, and natasha you are right about the feeling nauseated. I ate 3 and feeling it as I write this review. GTG use the bathroom now...
author: mrhustler h.

description: I love, love this pizza! I hadn't been in many years since I had lived in the neighborhood. I made it back this summer and the Indian pizza is still fantastic. We dined in, the restaurant is basic and not so fancy but it gets the job done. Staff is always kind and friendly. Thanks!
author: Mike S.

description:
yep it's all about the indian pizza... the regular indian food is merely adequate (including a totally wack neon orange biryani rice), but man, that tasty pizza really kicks my heiny. 

as stated by others, do NOT order for delivery, unless you are under house arrest and can't pry off the electronic tracker anklet. Phone your order, and send one of your loser friends (or in my case, my wife sends me, the loser husband) to pick it up, 'cause it's best when it's still pipin' hot. zaaaaannnteeeee...mmmmmmmm...
author: Jeremy H.

description:
I like pizza. I love Indian food. So when a friend suggested we ordered Indian pizza, I was doubtful. It sounded like an opportunity to ruin 2 completely great food groups. But I was wrong!

Zante's Indian Pizza is one of the most unique and genuinely delicious "new" foods I've had in San Francisco--and it's now on my list of foods I'd crave if I had to be away from the city for too long.

The Indian food is very good (Tandoori, naan, Chicken Tikki Masala, Saag Paneer, raita), but the restaurant is a bit short on atmosphere, so get it to go--or even better--have it delivered for free!
author: Jackie C.

description: The Indian pizza is the best. This place is great. All the food that I have had from here has been really good. It's not bad on price, and the service is pretty good too. The only thing slightly negative I have to say is that the dinning room could use an update, but it's not bad. Go there or get delivery, you'll like it I promise.
author: Garrett H.

description: Ok this is going to have to be a new craving all on its own.  I was curious and skeptical about the prospect of Indian pizza, but WOW.  It was like a super good cheesy garlic bread with Indian food.  You have to try this place!
author: angela k.

description:
i have to say it's totally true. this stuff is dope. i got the veggie with shrimp and really there is some delicious flavor of sorts going on that i can't put a finger on, but is sure as heck can put my mouth on it. on nearly 3 pieces of it.  regular pizza isn't even comparable. neither is regular indian food. it's the perfect combo of both.

yum mothergrabbin yum.


7/1: have to take it down a star. last night i ordered and the pizza (which had SEAFOOD on it) came pretty much lukewarm. like the cheese was congealed. Like, i needed to put it in the oven if i wanted to pretend it was fresh. it really had that texture of cheese/pizza that had been sitting around for at least 45 minutes. seriously.

i called to tell them and they said, just ask for a 1/2 discount next time you call. didn't ask for my name, number, no apologies, nothing. so there you go peeps- ask for the discount, ask for me :)
author: ms.kiki g.

description:
pizza was really good. called in for a pick up, told us it would be twenty minutes. got there in 15 and it was already sitting on top of the oven. so by the time we got back to eat the pizza back to our house ithad cooled and the cheese had coagulated. sort of annoying to have the pizza done that far ahead of time. if it only takes 10 minutes say so don't give yourself such a big cushion cause if you had said 10 i would have asked for 20 to give us some time to get there. there go the stars...

on the plus side the pizza was well worth it and a nice change of pace from both regular pizza and indian food.
author: Chris G.

description: Blech...I don't know what to say. The Indian pizza is novel, but I feel nasty after I eat it. There's enough garlic in it to keep your friends at a distance for days. That said, great place to chow on $2 when you're broke.
author: elsa m.

description: This is one of the best pizzas I have ever had! Thanks to my Sister, we ordered from them last night. It was a long wait but the pizza was great. The crust was tasty and done perfectly and the sauce and topping were first-rate I can only eat pizza every now and then, but i wish I hadn't left the remaining slices. Anyway, I sure they will be enjoyed!  My sister suggested this place so that she could have saag paneer, (which is great too! I will be ordering some soon from one of my local places-or Zante if I get back over there!) Check it out, y'all!!!
author: Aaron B.

description: Zante Pizza is another example of food that can surprise your taste buds and your senses. I rarely order the same item from any eatery, but Zante's Indian pizza consistently serenades me. There are options for vegetarians and carnivores alike. They even deliver! In fact, I've never set foot in Zante's, but if I did, I'd be sure to give Zante (or whoever makes the pizzas) a thankful hug. Why aren't you ordering a pizza right now? They have a website too, ya know?!
author: Tim B.

description: Ok seriously - have you ever been just a tad to tipsy...ok loaded... and really needed something to give you that second wind to get you home? Well this is IT!  It's been years since i've had Zantes - i think they moved since i've been.  I miss my San Francisco haunts - this is a great memory.  San Diego has nothing on Indian Pizza.  it's spicy it's greasy it's just what you need at 2am after tying one on.  Or it's just what you need when you want pizza but are also craving something spicy.  You have to try this at least once - then I'm sure you'll go back for more.
author: Daniela E.

description:
I love this place.  The curries are good and spicy. Sometimes a little greasy.  Never had the pizza.
I actually like that when you order "hot", it is actually hot.
Go, it's good!
author: Alulubeth O.

description:
a friend of mine had introduced me to zantes pizza over 5 years ago. 

i can honestly say that the tandoori pizza is among the best pizza i've EVER had! i love both indian food and pizza so this works out perfect for me. 
i usually order the tandoori with the lamb and shrimp. 

i don't recall it being too spicy but i'm sure you can make a request to have it milder. if you haven't eaten here before, you should definitely give it a shot!

one last comment- i had only eaten in once but have ordered for delivery multiple times and i plan on the delivery times being close to an hour. i can only imagine it's because they are usually quite busy. i don't let that influence the way i feel about the food though.

enjoy!
author: Sally Q.

description: Don't let the title fool you, the food here is great. The Indian pizza is a pleasant, refreshing taste to all the traditional pizza flavors. Located very conveniently.
author: Nick S.

description: As a change from Spicy Bite, my husband and I dined here on a Tuesday night. It was very quiet, so the service was attentive and the food came out in good time. We both enjoyed our meals. You could believe that the sauces were  freshly cooked, on the premises and not just ladled out from a huge stock sauce vat, with the meat of your choice added!
author: Rachel P.

description:
I so wanted to love this place. I mean, Indian, Pizza, Vegan and they Deliver! What could possibly be bad!?

Well, they took over an hour to deliver for starters. Maybe they were busy, not sure, but it's definitely a reason to knock off a star. I ordered a small vegan pizza, and an order of chana masala. The pizza was stone cold, the crust soggy with condensation. Not dripping wet mind you, but enough to make (what I think was supposed to be) a normally slightly crunchy crust become chewy. No worries, I just stuck a couple pieces in the toaster oven, it happens right? The chana masala was still warm, as they covered the paper container in foil to keep the heat in. However, the paper container was completely soaked through with sauce. The normally white box, was now red. I was surprised that the entire thing didn't just dissolve. Anyhow, I poured it out of the container into a bowl, so at least it was salvageable. 

My pizza slices were done in the toaster oven and they've actually toasted up nicely. I dished up my chana masala, and sat down to enjoy. Well, I would've enjoyed had there of been any flavor at all. I was expecting a flavor *explosion*! All it tasted like was they put un-seasoned saag all over some bread. I had to put salt on it, and I rarely use salt especially on my pizza. I also had to cover it in cock sauce (sriracha) to give it some sort of flavor. I thought that I might be able just to dip it in to the chana masala, but alas that was almost just as flavorless. I asked for medium, and it was as mild as it could get. I had to add chile to it as well. I wasn't impressed  by their selection of vegetarian curries either. 

The service, aside from them taking forever to deliver, was ok. The delivery man was nice and cheerful. I did have to call and confirm that the order went through on line though, after not hearing back from them 1/2 an hour after I placed the order, but the guy on the phone was nice.

I would maybe go back if I was in the area (I rarely am though) to try it there. I wouldn't order delivery again. There's better places to go for curries, and the pizza just wasn't good enough.
author: Jazmin C.

description:
the pizza is so funking tasty!!! do you need me to tell you much else.... it is amazing! that's all there is to it. go eat it.

but if you can... take it and eat it far far away. the service is mind boggling. never has it been so hard to order a slice of pizza and get what you want. so just go in, order a slice to go. pay for it, leave and then proceed to ENJOY!

upsides: yummy pizza
downsides: weird service, whole pies are pricey, inconvient location [but keeps pizza an unsual treat]

fact remains: pizza slice is worth it!

*edit: 02/19/2008  Do not eat the "vegan" version of this pizza. besides the fact that it is supposedly not vegan, it also tastes very dissapointing!!!  i was so sad...
author: Tara A.

description:
like many, the thought of indian pizza was a bit stretched since the first thought i had was... 

"ummm... why not pour your curry on top of the naan and call that an indian pizza?"

but this place is really really good! I've had it twice now by delivery (i know, i know, i need to dine there and really see what its like) but so far i'm loving this new hybrid dish of indian and italian.
author: Annie L.

description: Indian Pizza, Kingfisher Beer and great Indian dance music, what more can you ask for.  We didn't have to wait to long and the kids loved the Hawaiian pizza. We would have given it 5 stars, but we had Mango lassi's that I'm sure were made from powder mix with a really bizarre orange food coloring.
author: Art-Suzanne R.

description:
Three stars is the median score given the following:
1. The Indian pizza is delicious! Both the meat and the vegan. Four stars!
2. Delivery service sucks really bad and the delivery guy just sort of shoves the pizza at you and grunts the price. Last night was the last time I'll try to get delivery. We ordered the pizzas at 7:30pm. Around 10:15pm, starving and delirious from drinking beer on empty stomachs, we staggered out to a taqueria desperate for sustenance. The PIZZA delivery guy calls my friend's cell phone at almost 11pm! to say he has our pizza. She says, we don't want your 3 and a half hour old pizza any more. You can keep it. (She called three times before and they kept saying, he'll be there in 20 minutes.) His response: oh, ok. WTF? --  0 stars!
3. Eating in the actual restaurant is pretty OK and there's never any wait. I like the mango drink. Forgot what it's called. 3-4 stars..
author: Dorothy W.

description: after a failed attempt to eat at yo's sushi down the street, we ended up here after walking up and down this corridor of mission street.  i believe this is one of the original indian pizza restaurants, and it did not disappoint.  the indian veggie pizza came out fast, and it was delicious.  we also had the channa masala and saag aloo, which were lighter than those at other restaurants.  the highlight however was definitely the pizza.
author: Helen T.

description: Order the indian pizza and an order of saag paneer. Spread the saag on the pizza = heaven!
author: Bete S.

description: It's all about the Indian pizza!!!! I never thought I'd like tandoori chicken on a pizza, but it totally rocks! And the vegetarian option is equally wonderful. I've only eaten in-house once - atmosphere is nothing spectacular, but it's generally quiet and low-key. On the other hand, the pizza is a perfect take-out dish. Mmmm, my mouth waters as I think of the possibility ...
author: Shauna S.

description: I thought I was going to be blown away by Indian pizza. I wasn't. Tasty for sure and the third star is for the unique taste. But it was quite the oily mess. A few paper towels took care of that, but nowhere near as impressive as I was expecting. Granted I only went with a slice, perhaps a more custom full pie off the menu is the way to go.
author: Jason B.

description: Last night, I had japanese pizza at On the Bridge and it was great!  Today as I was training for my half marathon, I came across the blue awning which read, Zante's Pizza, Indian Restaurant.  I laughed and continued to hike up to Bernal Heights, but on the way back down, I was a little curious, so I stopped in and got a slice of Indian vegetable pizza.  It was delicious and just the right size too for $2.99 a slice, unlike pesto pizza from Escape from New York Pizza.  (I hate that place, but I'll refrain from writing a review, that's not worth my time.)  Getting back to the Indian Pizza, it had a spinach sauce with cheese and cauliflower and garlic on top, the perfect combination.  I can't wait to order take out from them!  And who would have thought Zante's Indian Pizza would satisfy a New Yorker?
author: Diane L.

description: I actually think that Zante's pizza is delicious 5-star pizza.  However, after waiting for delivery an hour and a quarter in one case and an hour an a half in another case, I was so ravenously hungry I probably would have eaten the box and given it 5 stars.  Reason and judgement go out the window at that point.  I tend not to order pizza that often, and when I do it's because I'm hungry, have no food in the house, and am too lazy to leave the house.  These are not good circumstances in which to order Zante's.  In the future I will only order Zante's when I anticipate that there's a vague possibility that I'll be feeling peckish in two hours, and in the meantime am well supplied with tasty snacks.
author: Annette K.

description: The Indian Pizza I had was pretty good.  I will say, it is the first Indian pizza I have ever had, so I really have nothing to compare it too.  The toppings were fresh, the lamb was juicy, the prawns were a little scarce, but overall, the pizza tasted very good and a small pizza was just the right amount for 2 moderately hungry people.  The vegetable samosa was a little too doughy,  but still ok, I definitely ate it as quickly as its temperature would allow.  The place was really warm inside (really really) but it had been a very hot day, so I can only hope on a pleasant day it would stay a little cooler in there.  Also, they were playing what seemed to be Indian dance music louder than should be played in a restaurant with tablecloths.  That said, if you want to avoid the simmering disco of a dining room, order take out and I think you will be satisfied
author: Garrett C.

description:
I LOVE Zantes!
I have been going there for the last 17 years and it always blows my taste buds!  My favorite is to order the dinner thali. best, best, best.
author: A. L.

description: good pizza but took 90 mins to get it and it was cold when we got it.
author: neil c.

description:
I love their Indian pizza - since I live down the block, its my default lazy take out dinner/lunch/and even brunch on desperate occasion. 

Unfortunately, their Indian food is not up to par. I have been told I have higher than average standards for Indian food - being Indian myself. Nevertheless, stick to the Indian pizza and you'll be happy.

Zante's has a very easy online ordering system for take out or delivery. They will often call to confirm the take out order.
author: Nors P.

description:
I'm living in New York right now, and Zantes pizza may be the single thing that I miss most about the bay area.  I have introduced countless friends to this magical creation.  There is no one who has not been impressed.

One of the friends who I introduced to Zantes now calls herself the pizza prophet because she has brought so many other people into the Zantes cult.
author: J B.

description:
A couple of years ago, we ordered an Indian pizza from Zante, and after almost 2 hours, it arrived cold and lifeless. When we complained (mildly --we were hungry) to the driver, he was extremely rude - practically yelled "everybody loves our pizza!" and offered us a whopping $1 off. We just wanted to get rid of him, so took it, vowing never to order again.

Fast forward to this past Friday, and a couple of friends and us wanted to geek out over Battlestar Galactica and Indian food (one of my friends made homemade samosas). I didn't really feel like making the trek over to Chutney (we live in Outer Mission) to get add'l food, so thought we'd give Zante another try. They told us our pizza would be delivered in 45 minutes. One hour and 45 minutes after we ordered, it FINALLY arrived - again, cold and lifeless. Nobody went for seconds, and half of the pizza ended up in the garbage. 

When we first moved to Outer Mission 5 years ago, we ordered their Indian pizzas a couple of times, and they were delicious (never on time though). But we finally woke up and realized how many other places truly are better. We'll give a place a couple of chances to get it right, but not a third - we'll never order from here again.

If you're out in the Bernal area and want some great delivery, try Little Nepal on Cortland - not pizza of course, but great food, good service, and on-time!
author: Nick M.

description: Indian pizza = SO good.  I've only ever gotten delivery, so can't comment on the premises.  But the pizza is AMAZING (bit of an acquired taste -- give it half a slice before you decide you don't like it).  One star off because the delivery guy has gotten lost every time I've ordered (from at least two different addresses).
author: Sarah B.

description: Indian and Pizza together?  Why not?  Just had to give it a try out of novelty value, but the slices are legitimately good.  This is now my default pizza place.
author: Jason L.

description:
so good. so so so good.

the indian pizza... is beyond tasty.
perfect solution to a long week-- grab some indian beer, some indian pizza, and an appetizer or something and you're set.

haven't had a delivery yet... so i can't say anything about the slow waiting times.

but... damn.

also, the staff is extremely nice and catering. props.
author: Solomon C.

description: My buddy told me to order here and try their pizza. So I did. Their food is good but the delivery is slow...but at least the food was still hot. Just wish they were a little bit faster.
author: Eric R.

description: Who'd a thunk Indian Food + Pizza? Weird. But it's yummy. We walked in one day for a slice. Nothing but Indian Pizza...it looked nasty, but it was GoOOOOood.
author: Jennifer C.

description: The only place I know of with Indian Pizza! Serves up a great samosa as well!
author: Emily C.

description:
I hear the Indian pizza is great.  How wonderful, except that I never got to EAT it once I ordered it.
The driver couldn't find the address, called and got directions, still couldn't find it and returned the restaurant and then went home for the night (and the restaurant failed to notify of this decision).
2 hours after I ordered, we called the restaurant (after 3 times before) and they told me I could come pick it up.....
author: L R.

description: my girlfriends and I had zante's indian pizza and an order of sag paneer and rice, very good. At first I thought this sounded gross and when it arrived it looked very strange but please don't let this stop you, it is great!
author: julie q.

description: The Indian pizza is a fun alternative pizza to have delivered. I've never had anything else there.
author: Emmy B.

description:
this place is the best. 
the posters are the wall are usually hilarious.
& the waiters are smiley and funny.

get the vegetarian indian pizza with an order of the navataam korma. 
put lots of the tasty sauces on there too.  i wouldn't suggest meat.  or any additions/subtractions.  just get the goods. vegan or veggie.  with a taj mahal.

** don't order zantes for delivery.  it's notoriously slow. go there. sit down. eat!
author: Susan R.

description:
Their Sag Paneer wasn't quite what I'm used to, but it was OK. 

No silverware or napkins with my delivery was a little frustrating, but I'll write that off as their attempt to be green.
author: K. K.

description: I love the vegan indian pizza with a side of mango chutney, but WHY does Zante hate it's customers??? the staff who answer the phone are always rude and get the order wrong.  Delivery takes FOREVER and the order often has to be returned because it is wrong (which means another frustrating conversation with the rude phone staff).  The last time we ordered, my friend started vomiting a couple hours after consuming her shrimp tikka masala.  Does Zante have a plan to kill their customers? 2 stars only because of my addiction to the indian pizza.
author: elena t.

description:
I used to love this place before the prices went up and the delivery started taking over 1.5 hrs&I live a few blocks away. They kept saying 10 more minutes....I think they didn't even make my order for 1 hr. I have gotten the wrong food before,too

They suck, forget it.

Try Al-Hamra, they deliver too-all around better place
author: Rayona S.

description:
What can I say, my wife and I are addicted to Zante's pizza. 

We're kind of pizza snobs and had pretty much tried every pizza pie in San Francisco, but we had never experienced anything quite like Indian pizza until a heated pizza debate during a recent cabin trip lead to the subject of Zante's. As soon as we returned from the snowy cold to our humble apartment, we gave them a call. Since then, we've ordered it 3 times in the past month and every time it has been excellent!

We order through their website, call to make sure they receive the order if they don't call us back in 5 minutes, and the pizza almost always takes exactly one hour and 5 minutes to arrive at our doorstep. We simply plan for the wait and order before we're starving and then we still have a little time to quiver with anticipation just before it arrives. 

We've had both the meat and veggie pizzas and both are superb (although we always ask for no prawns on the meat pizza, so I can't vouch for it with prawns, personally). They always get our order right and the delivery man is very nice.

Three cheers for Zante's!
author: Matthew A.

description:
Good food, pretty cheap, and maybe we got lucky with the delivery.

I just ordered 6 pizzas for our office lunch and was a nervous wreck because of the mixed reviews. But it was too late to change course.

I ordered online at 11:15 and pizzas arrived exactly on time, at 12:30. Our staff liked them, especially the Indian vegetarian.

Usually we spend about $250 to get lunch for about 25 people, but this time we spent well under $200.
author: SD C.

description: Great pizza.  Although a few days after I ordered a lamb dish and a rice dish and paid 25 for the meal.  The lamb dish tasted like jar spaghetti sauce (you know that tangy tomato taste that comes from a jar) with spices and lamb added to it.  I was a bit disappointed, but hey the pizza is next to none. I guess some places have a star item on the menu and there are others that are ok.
author: Robert P.

description: yum!  indian pizza is delicious and unique.  this place does it fast and well.  highly recommended!
author: Matt E.

description: Delivery is a bit of a nightmare as noted elsewhere.  Be careful with ordering, they get things confused alot.  It helps to keep calling every 10 minutes to make sure your order is actually being sent.  Just because they say sent, don't believe them.  Also, good to ask to hold the MSG.  They will if you remember to ask.
author: Trecker J.

description: Indian Pizza - so yummy.  One slice is enough to fill me up and at $3 bucks a slice (for the veg, $4 for meat) it's the cheapest dinner out I've found. Plus, they are super nice every time I go in. Only one thing bugs me- $1 for a tiny container of mango chutney! I love me some mango chutney, so if I've got to pay for it separately, at least give me enough so I don't have to ration it for each bite.
author: Meg K.

description: I ordered a chicken vidaloo, it's was not as good as i thought. It was just spicy and that's all I could taste.
author: Max C.

description: indian pizza-- who would'a thunk it? it's way tastier than it sounds. i had indian pizza as well as more traditional indian fare like ghost vindaloo. the pizza was definitely the star of the show.
author: Brett W.

description: good stuff. the large pizzas are definitely large, so if you order that size- bring a big group. the sauce is flavorful and really tastes like you are eating indian food.  the staff are friendly and when going to pay the meter, they tipped us off that they have a free parking lot in the back. probably would not go there on a regular basis, but it is good to know that it's around in case i'm craving some indian pizza.
author: Lisa A.

description: I get the indian pizza without lamb or prawns every time.  It's amazing.  The five stars is for the pizza only and not for the atmosphere or the indian food, because that's terrible.  Just order an indian pizza for pick-up - that's what's five star about this place.  If you try to eat there or get some dry chicken tikka masala, you only have yourself to blame.
author: S S.

description: I thought this was a good place to order from until they kept me waiting for two hours, brought a cold pizza, and offered no excuse whatsoever. We had to call a few times to -indifferently- be told that it would only be a few minutes. Pizza ok after reheating, service sucks.
author: Cat A.

description: I have only had one entree from Zante's --the vegan Indian pizza --but it is SO good. As many others have noted, the combination of classic Indian food on a naan-like crust is genius. I am definitely adding Zante's to my growing list of neighborhood favorites!
author: Stella B.

description: i've never ordered delivery, and never will.  and i've never expected speedy service.  i always go with good people and the time just passes by until ... the most amazing of vegan indian food pizzas arrives.  yummm.
author: Anya L.

description: Zante has the best naan in the city- order the onion kulcha, which is buttery, lightly crispy, and has a dusting of green onions on the top. Also, the chicken tikka masala is significantly less greasy and heavy and more delicious than at many Indian restaurants in the city- notably, Naan and Curry. The chicken pekora does vary depending I guess if they just deep-fried it for you, but if they did, it's one of the best things ever, particularly with the spicy mint green and sweet tamarind dipping sauce. Perhaps the pizza isn't that great, and the atmosphere could be classed up, but the people are very nice and the Indian food, for the money, is consistently very good. It has a nice, homey vibe and it's usually not hard to get a table. Plus the delivery has gotten a LOT faster lately. I've been to a lot of Indian restaurants in the city, and I always go back to Zante for an tasty, affordable and dependable meal. For dinner, main entrees usually run about $10.
author: aunt t.

description: the pizza is good....especially the Indian pizza...but the service is slow and their prices have really shot up....don't know if it's quite worth it anymore!
author: A P.

description: i love their indian styled pizzas!  i'm drooling thinking about them now!  as for their indian food, it's quite standard fare, nothing really stood out as wow this is great but it wasn't bad at all.  i like the restaurant itself too which is very spacious for large parties.  the staff is, well, as good as it gets when it comes to indian restaurants.
author: Swarup B.

description: i've only had the indian pizza and unfortunately, always to go, so i haven't experienced the amazing chutney-ness that is the dipping sauce for the crust.  and like everyone else here, probably, i can't believe no one thought of this sooner. or why I never thought of making pizzas this way
author: Amanda C.

description:
i wanted to like this place so bad. i'm lactose intolerant but bought some of those dairy pills just so i could try some indian pizza.

we ordered delivery and it took just under 2 hours. that's a little absurd, even if it is a good 3 miles away. they were also rude to my gf on the phone when she called to confirm the order as they instructed on the website.

our order:
- lamb samosas
beyond bland. absolutely not recommended.

- small zantes specialty indian pizza
mediocre and not as advertised. they say tons of vegetables, chicken, prawns, lamb. we got nothing but some spinach, a couple pieces of cauliflower, and a couple shreds of chicken. a complete ripoff. however, it did taste pretty good and the dough is great. (hence the 2 stars) i could have just eaten that. they should look into making breadsticks with some curry dipping sauce.

i think we will go again though, but eat at the restaurant. they might take a little more pride in the pizza if they know they will have to deal with your complaints face to face. you can't really return delivery food.
author: Saikat P.

description: Zante and I have a sado- masochistic relationship. Zante, with it's horrendous delivery service, is my sadist. No matter how many times I order a pizza for delivery, I am always faced with the 2+ hour wait in which I repeatedly call them and beg them to bring my food. I believe that Zante experiences a high level of pleasure during the infliction of pain and suffering. There have been times when I have caved, and I actually left my house to go pick up the pizza that I ordered because I couldn't wait any longer, but I realize this isn't helping the system. Pizza delivery by definition must include delivery. Swear as I may, I always return to the handy online ordering tool and get that tasty, vegetarian Indian pizza again. Why don't I just smash myself over the head with a brick and call it a day? Because their pizza is THAT good. Are you ready to be dominated? Will you submit? Pick up the phone!
author: Stumbalina b.

description: I will say that I like the indian dishes better than the pizza.  Actually spicy (unlike mild versions of "spicy" elsewhere)  More on the saucy side then with chunks of veggies.  All delicious!  Great deal
author: Maya C.

description: indian + pizza = indian PIZZA! who woulda thunk! genius. dude. get a taj mahal and an indian pizza and your taste buds will be orgasming all night.
author: Marla W.

description: The Indian Pizza is unique and delicious but the Indian food is oily and average. I regret they have failed to include ingredients that were listed in the dish. This includes the farmer's cheese (mmm) that I specifically craved and ordered, but did not get.
author: Geoff P.

description: Besides the Cheeseboard and Arizmendis, both worker owned collectives, this is my favorite pizza. Especially the Indian Pizza. It's to die for.
author: Maggie Baggie H.

description: EAT HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK.  They let PIGEONS, flies and other animals pick at their parsley out back off of Cortland.  I guess they were letting it dry?  If I had a picture of this on 4/27/2010 I would post it.  AGAIN EAT HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!!  How could anyone let such GODLY UNSANITARY ACT HAPPEN
author: Altaeb s.

description: before i moved to san francisco i had no idea such a thing as indian pizza existed.  but...it does, thank jebus!  even though it takes nearly 2 hours to be delivered to your house, it's pretty much worth the wait.  i have heard the crust is not vegan but until i get valid confirmation of this i will continue to live in ignorant bliss.  the rest of the indian food is pretty good too--order some to dip the crust of the pizza in and you won't be sorry!  really friendly service too if you eat in the restaurant.  why does the mission have all the good food?
author: kate s.

description: I have been eating here for more than ten years and I love it. I even bought a bunch of pizzas for my elementary class I taught long ago and the kids loved it. My boyfriend and I had our first date eating lunch here over 8 years ago. I just ordered a pie a few minutes ago.
author: Thomas K.

description: good food unbelievably incompetent delivery service. Still waiting after  2 1/2 hours. 3rd time this has happened, you'd think I'd learn my lesson by now. Go to the restaurant, but don't order.
author: Frank S.

description: I'm Indian and I like pizza.  So I thought Indian pizza would be right up my alley.  Wrong!  First of all, the crust sucks.  It's closer to pita bread than a pizza crust.  Also, I ordered the Best Indian Pizza and there was not a prawn to be found anywhere.  In general, they were pretty stingy with the meat toppings.  The sauce was decent, and just about the only good thing about the pizza.  On another occasion, I ordered the Chef's Special Thali.  The idea is better than the execution.  It's cool to be able to sample so many dishes in one meal, but not when half of them suck.  Free delivery is nice and all, but both times I ordered from here, it must have taken over an hour to get my food.  Additionally, a lot of stuff was spilling and the cartons were smushed.  I'm never ordering from here again.  And it sounds like the place is kind of a dump, so I'll probably never eat there in person either.  One of the delivery guys was also pretty rude to my door-person.
author: Saw T.

description: zante is by far my favorite indian food in the city. their indian pizza will knock your socks off, and the prices are right if you're sharing. the atmosphere is a little lacking, but the food makes up for it.
author: Kerri B.

description: I am giving this place one star, but I should say that if the food hadn't arrived late and cold it probably would have been better than one star. The Indian pizza was the best of what I ordered. The nan was rubbery, the saag paneer was bland and watery, the food did not come with rice, and was definitely too expensive for the quality. I will never order from there again, especially since there is way better Indian food in the neighborhood (e.g. Udupi Palace).
author: Laura S.

description: The pizza is decent, but the drivers I have come into contact with for delivery have been some of the meanest. One guy actually yelled at me after I only tipped him $5 for delivering. How much does this guy expect for a pizza delivered? Totally turned me off to this place. It is ultra greasy as well, so be in the mood for some unhealthy food when ordering.
author: K D.

description: Good Pizza but not worth 2 hour delivery.  They really do not have delivery service.
author: meehyun k.

description:
zante's pizza is my husband. more than once i have called them from the train on the way home. "honey, can you whip up something nice for dinner tonight?" "why, yes."

the food here is good - the saag paneer, samosas and pakora especially. i notice others have commented on problems with delivery - i've always had a good experience with their delivery, but i live two blocks away (i know, i should get my lazy booty up and walk over...). 

i highly recommend this place as a good, solid choice for indian food. i've never had a bad experience here.
author: J. D.

description: the indian pizza is amazing. vegetarian or meat. unique and amazing. i heard that delivery can take hours or will even no-show, and based solely on that rumor i have always picked up, which is really quick. and so delicious.
author: j k.

description: i *heart* this place! my boyfriend and i have literally eaten here once a week since we discovered its glory. the vegan pizza is the best thing ever! my  boyfriend loves it too (so you don't even have to be vegan)! don't know about delivery cause even when we are tempted to be lazy we can't justify making them get in a car to drive 3 blocks! just thinking about it makes me hungry!
author: alexis s.

description: i eat a slice of the indian vegetarian pizza at least four times a week for lunch. every single time when i'm about halfway through, i look down and think "hmm, this brown paste sure looks like diarrhea". then i continue eating. this is a testament to how truly great this shit is.
author: Sushi K.

description: this pizza is totally TDF. i usually don't like deep dish, but throw savory spices, cauliflower, onion, cilantro, garlic, and tomotoes on dough that is deliciously fluffy on the inside and perfectly crispy on the outside and i will dive into the deep end. meat eaters should love that their definition of "best" includes lamb, chicken, and shrimp. and the taj majal beer goes swimmingly well.
author: julia r.

description: i went here again and tried the indian pizza, as well as had the same ol-same ol thing i always get.  i'd never had indian pizza before, and it was damn good.  i dunno if it's a mood thing or if the food was better, but i give it 4 stars now, and look forward to going back soon.
author: Kate W.

description: to die for indian pizza.. move to illinois for i miss you :(
author: Helen H.

description:
impressive, if not amazing, execution.
i've not seen a solid, yet soft, golden crust hold up so well under so many (wet) ingredients. the pizza was well-layered - with eggplant, spinach, cheese, garlic, green onion, cilantro, small niblets of tandoori chicken, and cauliflower.
how often can you hold a slice of pizza and not have the tip start wilting immediately, succumbing to gravity? and how often can you eat a slice with your hand? this was well-made pizza.
this was the initial wow factor - pizza that wasn't a wet, slopping mess that required fork and knife. second was the fact that it all tasted deliciously. because the flavors work together in a subtle manner, i found myself savoring each bite, waiting for the flavors to slowly surface. i can only liken the experience to eating a few of your favorite indian dishes all at once, on a delicious crusty, doughy base. the eggplant, which tasted like bengan bartha, was like the tomato sauce equivalent. slightly sweet. admittedly, something was lacking. something acidic or tart. we compensated for this with mint chutney. of course, i also could've used more chicken. 
this was a specific and satisfying taste. hearty and lusty. i'll be going back.
author: jennifer y.

description: Everyone had been raving about this place both online and off, so I finally decided to make my way into the end of the Mission for some Indian pizza.  I'm a big fan of Indian food so the idea of Indian pizza sounded absolutely delicious.  Arriving at Zante, the place is pretty shoddy and poorly-lit, but I found the off-kilter decor and 'ambiance' (if you want to call it that) kind of charming.  I went on a Thursday night and ordered a medium-sized Indian pizza, and waited almost half an hour for it to arrive.  The service could've been better, I had trouble flagging down the waiter even though the place was only halfway full.  About the pizza:  pretty tasty, but maybe I had been expecting too much.  The tandoori chicken and indian spices went with the pizza crust great, but for some reason the pizza still tasted a slight bit bland, as if it needed some salt.  The place was definitely worth a try, but I won't be going out of my way to eat there on a regular basis.
author: Jack G.

description: i agree with other reviewers who said the crust was soggy. interesting idea, but execution was not so great. i'd definitely give it another try...maybe i went on an off day.
author: eve l.

description: Indian place with supposedly delicious Indian pizza --- pizza with Indian vegetables and spices and stuff.  I've never gotten this because I don't like pizza too much but the chicken tikka marsala is great and the other Indian dishes are authentic and cheap.  Drawback?  The interior is dark and unappealing and the peeps there aren't the friendliest --- not a place to impress a date, that is for sure.
author: David M.

description: the vegetarian pizza is better than the meat - more pure in taste and less busy. the indian food is average. the staff is nice if a bit slow.
author: hunter w.

description: i have been here 4 times in the last 3 months. all for indian pizza. it's a great concept, and it works. it's not the best pizza in the world and sometimes i leave wishing i got pepperoni from pizza hut instead or something, but it's a crowd-pleaser and like i said before, it works. go for it.
author: Adam S.

description: Veggie indian pizza. Amazing. Some animal traits come to the surface when you're eating this pizza. I don't know what it is.
author: Sarah J.

description: Everything was great!  I went there with a large group recently.  The food was delicious, we had pizza as well as the traditional indian food, and both were fantastic!  Unfortunately, there weren't many other people there.  This place should be packed it is so good!
author: Elizabeth L.

description: The Indian pizza here is fantastic. Just make sure you eat in. If you order pizza for home delivery, it will take 2 hours to arrive, by which time it will not be so tasty.
author: A. T.

description: Like what most other yelpers have said, the indian veggie pizza is awesome.  The only thing i have to add is that they charge an outrageous amount for a pizza.  Guess that's what a monopoly will do for you.
author: Sanjay C.

description:
So, Zante's has completely delicious indian pizza (seriously the best I have ever had), but one of the worst delivery services ever.  I am completely addicted to the awesome flavor, especially of the veggie indian pizza, and about 1/10th of the time it arrives to my door within an hour (my house is about a 15 minute drive from the restaurant) but the other 80% of the time it can take over 2 hours.  I often call after an hour, and the pizza will always be there "in 5 minutes" -- though a few times the person on the phone admitted they couldn't get a hold of the driver.  When it takes this long, the pizza is always cold, so I would assume it is the fault of the delivery driver, and not the restaurant itself.  I have occasionally not tipped or tipped a small amount when the food is like this (it took 2.5 hours once!) and have actually had the drivers get into a major argument with me.  A lot of times the driver will then promise that next time, i'll get some amount of money off, but, of course, that never happens.
5 star food, 0 star delivery.
author: Leslie C.

description: This place has the best pizza in the city!  It's the second best pizza I've ever had (Giodanos in Chicago is number one)!  It was so crispy yet soft at the same time!  And $5 pitchers?  You can't beat that!  I didn't think the inside decor was as bad as other yelpers have reported.  I'm going to be a neighborhood regular!
author: Jo M.

description: really good indian pizza, really really poor service.  i've ordered from them repeatedly and they've screwed up the order repeatedly: chicken pizza instead of vegetarian, forgotten sodas, etc.  most recently i ordered online at 10:35pm (they close at 11) and when the driver arrived he chewed me out for ordering at that time, and made sure to let me know that the cook (or whatever) had grumbled about it, too.  i guess they'd rather not have my money.  happy to oblige...
author: Andrew B.

description: most delicious and original pizza i've ever had. the indian pizza, with or without meat and cheese is a hit. i tried the sit-down regular indian food once, and wasn't impressed. however, it still gets five stars as a pizza joint.
author: Ben H.

description: bad customer service, I ordered a pizza and they delivered the wrong one, then told me I had to come and pick up my pizza! - that I had already paid for! ... It took 3 hours, they are very rude.
author: C H.

description: ok, first off, they deliver.  anywhere in the city.  which is pretty fabulous in itself.  second, this isn't your yuppy friend's Tandoori Chicken style California Pizza Kitchen... this is what happens when an Indian guy marries an Italian girl and actually makes the fusion thing work!  The sauce is spicy and the toppings are things I *never* expected to see on a pizza (things like saag and chana masala!) but at least with this pizza you don't have to add your own dried red peppers!
author: Anjali K.

description: they forgot my naan, and the tikka masala sauce just tasted like sour yogurt to me..i mean i know it's made with it, but i've never tasted it that sour and overbearing before
author: Krystal S.

description: Zante Pizza is the best! First of all, the service is fantastic, especially Raz! I feel like a neighborhood regular, even though I've only been in there a few times.... So, I've only eaten the Indian vegan (no cheese) and Indian vegetarian (with cheese), but I love them both. The vegan pizza is almost like eating Indian food smeared all over the Naan bread, which is fun and crispy. The vegetarian pizza is lighter on the veggies and really gives you the sensation of expecting normal pizza toppings and then getting something else, which is cool. Basically, I love the concept and the execution is solid. I will say that one time I was with someone who ordered channa (not in the pizza form) and it wasn't my favorite of all time. Not sure you can generalize from this, but I might stick to the pizza, which I know is good and is what makes the place fun. Also, you can get a glass of cabernet for 3.50 which is pretty cheap.
author: Luke E.
